<font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=-1>&lt;DOCUMENT></font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=-1>&lt;TYPE> EX-10.30</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=-1>&lt;TEXT></font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=-1>&lt;HTML></font></font><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0></font></font>
<div align=right>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Exhibit 10.30</font></font></div>

<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0></font></font>&nbsp;
<div align=right><b><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>1.36
Schedule 5.10(ii)-Class Sam</font></font></b>
<br><b><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Preferred Stock
Stockholders</font>Agreement</font></b></div>

<br>&nbsp;
<center>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>CLASS SAM PREFERRED
STOCKHOLDERS' AGREEMENT</font></font></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>This Agreement (the
"Agreement") has been made and entered into as of this 12th day of July,
1994, by and among UAL Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the "Company"),
Joseph V. Vittoria (the "Designated Nominee") and Paul G. George (the "Designated
Stockholder").</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>WHEREAS, pursuant to
the terms of and schedules to the Agreement and Plan of Recapitalization,
dated as of March 25, 1994, by and among the Company, the Air Line Pilots
Association, International ("ALPA") and the International Association of
Machinists and Aerospace Workers ("IAM") (as amended, the "Recapitalization
Agreement"), including the terms of the restated certificate of incorporation
of the Company to be effective as of the Effective Time (as defined in
the Recapitalization Agreement) (the "Restated Certificate") and the restated
By-Laws of the Company to be effective as of the Effective Time (the "Restated
By-Laws") (the Recapitalization Agreement, the<b> </b>Restated Certificate
and the Restated By-Laws, collectively, the "Governance Documents"), the
board of directors of the Company (the "Board") shall, until the Termination
Date (as defined in the Restated Certificate), consist of twelve (12) directors
(subject to adjustment in certain circumstances), one (1) of whom shall
be the designated representative (the "Salaried/Management Director") of
the salaried and management employees of United Airlines, Inc. ("United"),
nominated and elected and/or appointed as provided in the Governance Documents
and in this Agreement;</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>WHEREAS, the Governance
Documents contemplate that at the Effective Time, the Company shall issue
to the Designated Nominee and the Designated Stockholder, and each of them
shall be the registered holder of, two shares and one share, respectively,
of the Class SAM Junior Preferred Stock, par value $.O1 per share, of the
Company (the "Class SAM Preferred Stock"), each such share of Class SAM
Preferred Stock having the relative rights, privileges and powers as set
forth in the Restated Certificate (the holders of the Class SAM Preferred
Stock from time to time are referred to individually herein as a "Class
SAM Preferred Stockholder" and are collectively referred to herein as the
"Class SAM Preferred Stockholders");</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>WHEREAS, the Governance
Documents contemplate that Class SAM Preferred Stock may be held only by
the Salaried/Management Employee Director and by a designated additional
shareholder, each of whom shall be a Class SAM Preferred Stockholder;</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>WHEREAS, pursuant to
the Class SAM Preferred Stock Subscription Agreement dated July 12, 1994,
by and among the Company, the Designated Nominee and the Designated Stockholder,
the Company is selling to the Designated Nominee and the Designated Stockholder,
and the Designated Nominee and the Designated Stockholder are each purchasing
from the Company, two shares and one share, respectively, of Class SAM
Preferred Stock; and</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>WHEREAS, the parties
hereto have entered into this Agreement in order to effectuate the terms
and intent of the Governance Documents regarding the issuance of the Class
SAM Preferred Stock.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>NOW, THEREFORE, in
consideration of the foregoing premises, the mutual covenants herein contained
and other good and valuable consideration the receipt of which is hereby
acknowledged, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>1.&nbsp; <u>Effective
Date; Term</u>. This Agreement shall become effective simultaneous with
the Effective Time and shall remain in effect in accordance with the terms
hereof until the earlier of (i) the tenth anniversary of the Effective
Time or such later date to which the duration of this Agreement shall be
permitted under the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware (the
"GCL"), as the same may hereafter from time to time be amended, it being
the express intention of the parties hereto that this Agreement shall remain
in effect (subject to clause (ii) of this Section 1) for more than ten
(10) years if permitted under, and for as long as permitted under, the
GCL, as amended from time to time, and (ii) the first to occur of the ALPA
Termination Date and the IAM Termination Date (each as defined in Article
FIFTH of the Restated Certificate).</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>2.&nbsp; <u>Voting
for Election of the Salaried,/Management Employee Director; Filling of
Vacancies</u>. At all elections for the Salaried/Management Employee Director,
whether at a meeting of shareholders or pursuant to action by written consent
without a meeting, each Class SAM Preferred Stockholder shall vote, or
act by written consent with respect to, each share of Class SAM Preferred
Stock held by such Class SAM Preferred Stockholder in favor of the candidate
for Salaried/Management Employee Director nominated pursuant to Section
8 of this Agreement. In the event of a vacancy of the seat of the Salaried/Management
Employee Director, other than upon the scheduled expiration of the term
on the Hoard of the Salaried/Management Employee Director, it is agreed
that such vacancy shall be filled with a candidate nominated pursuant to
Section 8 of this Agreement.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>3.&nbsp; <u>Grant of
Proxy</u>. Each Class SAM Preferred Stockholder does hereby constitute
and appoint each of the other parties hereto (including the other class
SAM Preferred Stockholder), other than the Company, as his or her proxy
to vote and/or to act by written consent with respect to all of the shares
of Class SAM Preferred Stock owned by such Class SAM Preferred Stockholder
in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement in the event<b> </b>that
such Class SAM Preferred Stockholder shall fail to do so, to the same extent
and with the same effect as such Class SAM Preferred Stockholder could
do so. The proxy hereby granted by each Class SAM Preferred Stockholder
is given in consideration of the proxy hereby granted by each other Class
SAM Preferred Stockholder and in consideration of the other mutual covenants
herein contained, and as such the proxy granted hereby by each Class SAM
Preferred Stockholder is coupled with an interest and shall be irrevocable
for so long as such Class SAM Preferred Stockholder remains a holder of
Class SAM Preferred Stock.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>4.&nbsp; <u>Restrictions
on Transfer of the Class SAM Preferred Stock</u>. Except as provided in
Sections 5 and 8(c) hereof, a Class SAM Preferred Stockholder may not sell,
transfer, pledge, assign, hypothecate or otherwise dispose of any interest
in (each, a "Disposition") any share of Class SAM Preferred Stock, including,
without limitation, by operation of law or otherwise. Any purported Disposition
of any share of Class SAM Preferred Stock in violation of this Section
4 shall be null and void and of no force and effect as to the proposed
transferee and, upon any such purported Disposition, such share of Class
SAM Preferred Stock shall be automatically redeemed by the Company as provided
in, and subject to, Article FOURTH, Part IX, Sections 1.2 and 9 of the
Restated Certificate (the "Automatic Redemption"). The certificates evidencing
the shares of Class SAM Preferred Stock shall bear a legend describing
the transfer and voting restrictions and Automatic Redemption set forth
in this Agreement, as well as any other restrictions imposed by the Restated
Certificate of the Restated By-Laws.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>5. <u>Return of the
Shares of Class SAM Preferred Stock; Resignation of any Non-Nominated Director</u>.
Notwithstanding anything contained in Section 4 of this Agreement to the
contrary, the Designated Nominee, immediately upon (i) the expiration of
his or her term of office as the Salaried/Management Employee Director
(unless concurrently therewith such individual is reelected for an additional
term as the Salaried/Management Employee Director), (ii) his or her removal
as the Salaried/Management Employee Director pursuant to Article FIFTH,
Section 2.8 of the Restated Certificate or pursuant to the penultimate
sentence of this section 5, (iii) his or her resignation as<i> </i>the
Salaried/Management Employee Director, (iv) his or her ceasing to serve
as the Salaried/Management Employee Director for any reason whatsoever,
(v) his or her disqualification pursuant to Section 8(d) of this Agreement,
or (vi) his or her failure to be re-nominated to continue to serve as the
Salaried/Management Employee Director pursuant to Section 8 of this Agreement
(in any such case, the "Terminated Director"), shall deliver or cause to
be delivered, in exchange for the payment of the par value of each share
so delivered, the stock certificate representing such Class SAM Preferred
Stockholder's shares of Class SAM Preferred Stock, duly endorsed for transfer,
to (a) such individual's elected or appointed successor as the Salaried/Management
Employee Director, upon such successor executing and delivering an agreement
in the form of Exhibit B hereto, or (b) in the case where no such successor
Salaried/Management Employee Director has been elected or appointed concurrently
with such individual's removal, resignation, disqualification pursuant
to Section 8(d) of this Agreement or failure to be re-nominated or otherwise
ceasing to serve as the Salaried/Management Employee Director, to the Company,
to be held in escrow to be delivered to the successor of such Terminated
Director when such successor (x) is duly elected or appointed, as the case
may be, and (y) executes and delivers an agreement in the form of Exhibit
B hereto.</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>The Company shall
immediately effect an Automatic Redemption with respect to, or if such
Automatic Redemption is not applicable, the Terminated Director shall sell
and the Company, subject to legally available funds therefor, shall purchase,
all shares of Class SAM Preferred Stock of any Terminated Director who
fails to comply with the transfer requirements of this Section 5 and shall
(subject to the following sentence) transfer or re-issue such redeemed
or purchased shares to such Terminated Director's successor upon such successor
executing and delivering an agreement in the form of Exhibit B annexed
hereto. If such Terminated Director's successor is elected or appointed
and executes and delivers an agreement in the form of Exhibit B annexed
hereto prior to such Automatic Redemption or purchase by the Company, the
Company shall issue to such successor two shares of Class SAM Preferred
Stock upon the payment of the par value thereof. In addition, if the Designated
Nominee fails to be re-nominated as the salaried/Management Employee Director
pursuant to section 8 of this Agreement, such individual shall immediately
resign from the Board and if such individual fails to so immediately resign
from the Board, each of the Class SAM<b> </b>Preferred Stockholders (including
the Class SAM Preferred Stockholder who has failed to so immediately resign
from the Board) shall promptly vote (or act by written consent with respect
to) their shares of Class SAM Preferred Stock to immediately remove such
individual from the Board, without cause. A Terminated Director who resigns
from, is removed from or otherwise ceases to be a member of the Board and
otherwise complies with the provisions of this Section 5 shall no longer
be deemed to be a party to this Agreement.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>6.&nbsp; <u>Replacement
Salaried/Management Employee Director</u>. Immediately upon the election
or appointment (as the case may be) of an individual to replace or succeed
any Terminated Director, such individual shall execute and deliver to the
Company and the remaining parties hereto an agreement (in the form of Exhibit
B annexed hereto) agreeing to be bound by each of the terms of this Agreement,
and from and after the execution and delivery of such agreement, such individual
shall be deemed to be a party to this Agreement. Should any individual
who has been elected or appointed, as the case may be, as the Salaried/Management
Employee Director fail either (i) to become a Class SAM Preferred Stockholder
or (ii) to execute and deliver an agreement in the form of Exhibit B annexed
hereto, each of the Class SAM Preferred</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Stockholders shall
vote (or act by written consent with respect to) their shares of Class
SAM Preferred Stock to remove such person as the Salaried/Management Employee
Director, without cause.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>7.&nbsp; <u>Mandatory
Extensions</u>. Not later than two years prior to the date, if any, on
which this Agreement would otherwise expire pursuant to clause (i) of Section
1 of this Agreement, the Company and the Class SAM Preferred Stockholders
shall execute and deliver to each other an extension of this Agreement
for a period of time equal to the longest period then permitted by law,
but in no event beyond the first to occur of the ALPA Termination Date
and the IAM Termination Date. Should any Class SAM Preferred Stockholder
fail to execute and deliver the extension of this Agreement required by
this Section 7 (a "Non-Extending Stockholder"), each Class SAM Preferred
Stockholder, including each Non-Extending Stockholder, shall vote (or act
by written consent with respect to) their shares of Class SAM Preferred
Stock to remove such Non-Extending Stockholder from the Board, without
cause, if such Non-Extending Stockholder is the Salaried/Management Employee
Director.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>8.&nbsp; <u>Nomination
and Election of the Salaried/Management Employee Director.</u>&nbsp; (a)
The Designated Nominee named herein shall be the initial Designated Nominee
hereunder, and the Designated Stockholder named herein shall be the initial
Designated Stockholder hereunder, each of whom shall serve in such capacity
until a replacement is named pursuant to this Section 8.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>(b)&nbsp; The Designated
Nominee shall be the initial candidate for election as the Salaried/Management
Employee Director and shall serve in such capacity until another candidate
is elected or appointed to be the replacement Designated Nominee (the "Replacement
Designated Nominee") in accordance with the procedures identified in Exhibit
A hereto. Upon such election or appointment, the Designated Nominee shall
transfer the share of Class SAM Preferred Stock held by him or her to the
Replacement Designated Nominee for a purchase price equal to the par value
thereof, and the Replacement Designated Nominee shall purchase such share
and shall execute and deliver a copy of an agreement in the form of Exhibit
B hereto, as provided elsewhere herein. Thereupon, the Replacement Designated
Nominee shall become the "Designated Nominee" hereunder for all purposes,
and the Designated Nominee</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>and the Designated
Stockholder, as Class SAM Preferred Stockholders, shall vote to elect such
Designated Nominee as the Salaried/Management Employee Director, as provided
elsewhere herein. In the case of a vacancy of the Board seat for the Salaried/Management
Employee Director, a candidate for election shall be identified in accordance
with the procedures in Exhibit A as the Salaried/ Management Employee Director,
and such person shall become the Replacement Designated Nominee hereunder.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The Designated Stockholder shall serve in such capacity until another candidate
is nominated to be the replacement Designated Stockholder (the "Replacement
Designated<b> </b>Stockholder") in accordance with the procedure identified
in Exhibit A hereto. Upon such nomination, the Designated Stockholder shall
transfer the share of Class SAM Preferred Stock held by him or her to the
Replacement Designated Stockholder for a purchase price equal to the par
value thereof, and the Replacement Designated Stockholder shall purchase
such share and shall execute and deliver a copy of an agreement in the
form of Exhibit B hereto<b>,</b> as provided elsewhere<b> </b>herein. Thereupon,
the Replacement Designated Stockholder shall become the "Designated Stockholder"
hereunder for all purposes. The Designated Stockholder agrees to sell and
the Company agrees to purchase (which may be by redemption) all shares
of Class SAM Preferred Stock of any Designated Stockholder who fails to
comply with the transfer requirements of this Section 8(c) by paying the
par value of each share being purchased to such Designated Stockholder
and shall (subject to the following sentence) transfer or re-issue such
purchased shares to the Replacement Designated Stockholder upon such Replacement
Designated Stockholder executing and delivering an agreement in the form
of Exhibit B annexed hereto. If such Replacement Designated Stockholder
executes and delivers an agreement in the form of Exhibit B annexed hereto
prior to such purchase by the Company, the Company shall issue to such
successor one share of Class SAM Preferred Stock upon the payment of the
par value thereof.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>(d)&nbsp; Any person
who is otherwise not disqualified pursuant to the terms of this Agreement
shall be qualified to become the Designated Nominee or the Designated Stockholder
hereunder. Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing portion of this paragraph
(d) to the contrary, any person who, as a Class SAM Preferred Stockholder,
has failed to vote the share or shares of Class</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>SAM Preferred Stock
for the candidate for election as the Salaried/Management Employee Director
nominated by the System Roundtable shall be disqualified hereunder from
serving as either a Designated Nominee or a Designated Stockholder thereafter
unless such disqualification is thereafter lifted by the System Roundtable.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>(e)&nbsp; The System
Roundtable shall communicate its actions by written notice (or communicated
orally and confirmed in writing), given in person, sent by facsimile transmission
or other electronic medium or sent by overnight express service to the
addresses that the parties hereto shall provide in writing to the System
Roundtable from time to time.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>(f)&nbsp; The System
Roundtable is the intended third-party beneficiary of this Agreement, and
the parties hereto agree for the benefit of the System Roundtable, however
constituted, that they shall perform their respective agreements hereunder.
The System Roundtable and the members thereof shall not be liable to any
person on account of any action it or they may take pursuant to the terms
of this Agreement.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>9.&nbsp; <u>Waiver
of Claims</u>. Except as provided in Section 13, each Class SAM Preferred
Stockholder hereby waives any and all claims, whether for damages or otherwise,
which such individual may otherwise have against any person or entity in
connection with such person or entity performing the terms of, or otherwise
acting in accordance with, this Agreement.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>10.&nbsp; <u>Binding
Effect</u>. The provisions of this Agreement shall be binding upon and
inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors
and assigns (and, in the case of a deceased Class SAM Preferred Stockholder,
such individual's estate and heirs), provided that no party may assign,
delegate or otherwise transfer any of its rights or obligations under this
Agreement except as provided herein.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>11.&nbsp; <u>Governing
</u></font><u><font size=+1>Law.</font></u><font size=+0>This
Agreement shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws
of the State of Delaware, without regard to the conflicts of laws principles
thereof.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>12.&nbsp; <u>Counterparts</u>.
This Agreement may be signed in any number of counterparts, each of which
shall be an original, with the same effect as if the signature thereto
and hereto were upon the same instrument.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>13.&nbsp; <u>Specific
Performance</u>. The parties hereto agree that if any of the provisions
of this Agreement were not performed in accordance with their specific
terms or were otherwise breached, irreparable damage would occur, no adequate
remedy of law would exist and damages would be difficult to determine,
and that the parties shall be entitled to specific performance of the terms
hereof, in addition to any other remedy at law or equity.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>14.&nbsp; <u>Amendments</u>.
This Agreement may not be amended or modified unless such amendment or
modification (i) is approved in writing by the Company and each then existing
Class SAM Preferred Stockholder and (ii) is consented to by the Independent
Directors and the Outside Public Directors (each as defined in the Restated
Certificate).</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>15.&nbsp; <u>Entire
Agreement</u>. This Agreement, together with the Class SAM Preferred Stock
Subscription Agre<b>e</b>ment, constitutes the entire agreement between
the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and, except
as otherwise contemplated hereby, supersedes all other prior agreements
and understandings, both written and oral, between the parties hereto with
respect to the subject matter hereof.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,
the parties hereto have executed this Agreement as of the date first above
written.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>
<dir>

<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>By:<u> /s/ Joseph R.O'Gorman</u></font></font>
<dir><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Name: Joseph R. O'Gorman,
Jr.</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Title: Executive Vice
President</font></font></dir>
<font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Joseph V. Vittoria</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Designated Nominee</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Paul G. George</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Designated Stockholder</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;

</dir>
</dir>
<font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the
parties hereto have executed this Agreement as of the date first above
written.</font></font>

<blockquote>
<blockquote>
<blockquote>
<blockquote>
<blockquote><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>UAL CORPORATION</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>By:</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Name:</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Title:</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Joseph V. Vittoria</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Designated Nominee</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>/s/ Paul G. George</font></font></u>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Paul G. George</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Designated Stockholder</font></font></blockquote>
</blockquote>
</blockquote>
</blockquote>
</blockquote>
</blockquote>

<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<center>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>EXHIBIT A TO THE</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>CLASS SAM PREFERRED</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>STOCKHOLDERS' AGREEMENT</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><b><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>SALARIED/MANAGEMENT
EMPLOYEES</font></font></b>
<br><b><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>DIRECTOR AND DESIGNATED
STOCKHOLDER</font></font></b>
<br><b><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>SELECTION PROCESS</font></font></b></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>The Salaried/Management
EmployeesDirector shall be nominated by the System Roundtable.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>The Designated Stockholder
shall be the senior executive of United who has primary responsibility
for human resources (the "Executive") unless and until the Company has
purchased (which may be by redemption) all shares of Class SAM Preferred
stock of any Designated Stockholder in accordance the fourth sentence of
Section 8(c) of the Agreement. In the event of such purchase, the Replacement
Designated Stockholder shall be as identified by the System Roundtable
until such Executive is no longer the senior executive of United who has
primary responsibility for human resources.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>The System Roundtable
shall establish a committee (the "Selection committee") of four employees
to select the nominee for Salaried/Management Employees Director and the
Replacement Designated Stockholder in accordance with the immediately preceding
paragraph, which selection must be approved by a majority of the System
Roundtable.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>The Selection Committee
or the System Roundtable may engage executive search firms and other consultants
to assist in the selection of a nominee and may consult with legal counsel
and the Company's management in making the selections.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<center>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>EXHIBIT B TO THE</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>CLASS SAM PREFERRED</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>STOCKHOLDERS' AGREEMENT</font></font></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>In consideration of
the receipt of the [one/two] share[s] of Class SAM Preferred Stock of the
Company and other good and valuable consideration the receipt of which
is hereby acknowledged, the undersigned hereby agrees to be bound by and
perform each of the terms of the Class SAM Preferred Stockholders' Agreement,
made as of the 12th day<b> </b>of July, 1994, by and among UAL Corporation
and certain individualswho were named to serve as the initial Designated
Nominee and the initial Designated Stockholder (the "Agreement"), as if
the undersigned were the original [Designated Stockholder/ Designated Nominee]
under the Agreement. Capitalized terms not defined herein shall have the
meanings ascribed to them in the Agreement and Plan of Recapitalization,
dated as of March 25, 1994, as amended from time to time, by and among
the Company, the ALPA and the IAM.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,
the undersigned has executed this Agreement to be bound by the Class SAM
Preferred Stockholders' Agreement as of the date set forth below.</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>Dated:</font></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<center>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>EXHIBIT B TO THE</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>CLASS SAM PREFERRED</font></font>
<br><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>STOCKHOLDERS' AGREEMENT</font></font></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><font face="Times New Roman,Times"><font size=+0>In consideration of
the receipt of the [one) shares[s] of Class SAM Preferred Stock of the
Company and other good and valuable consideration the receipt of which
is hereby acknowledged, the undersigned hereby agrees to be bound by and
perform each of the terms of the Class SAM Preferred Stockholders' Agreement,
made as of the 12th day of July, 1994, by and among UAL Corporation and
certain individuals who were named to serve as the initial Designated Nominee
and the initial Designated Stockholder (the "Agreement"), as if the undersigned
were the original (Designated Stockholder] under the Agreement. Capitalized

<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;

the undersigned has executed this Agreement to be bound by the Class SAM
Prefered Stockholders' Agreement as of the date set forth below.</font></font>

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in
the service of</P>

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
represented by</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2000 Agreement</P>

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in
the service of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
represented by</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
PREAMBLE</P>
<P>The pilots of United Airlines, as represented by the Air Line Pilots Association, </P>
<P>International and the Management of United Airlines share a mutual interest that </P>
<P>our Company continue to be the world's premier air carrier. To this end, the </P>
<P>United Pilots and Management recognize their joint role in promoting safety in </P>
<P>flight operations, providing a superior product to our customers, promoting career </P>
<P>security, creating growth in United's flight operations, and maintaining</P>
<P>industry-leading levels of pilot compensation, benefits and working conditions.</P>
<P>The United Pilots and Management, both as owners of the Company and as </P>
<P>participants in a traditional employee/management relationship, seek to build and </P>
<P>maintain open communications and mutual professional respect.</P>
<P>In support of this objective, United and the Association enter into this Industry </P>
<P>Leading Contract 2000.</P>
<P>THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with the provisions </P>
<P>of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED AIRLINES, </P>
<P>INC., (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIRLINE PILOTS in the </P>
<P>service of UNITED AIRLINES, INC., as represented by the AIRLINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WITNESSETH:</P>
<P>It is hereby mutually agreed:</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TABLE OF CONTENTS</P>
<U><P>SECTION</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>PAGE</P>
</U><P>1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recognition, Scope and Career Security&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1</P>
<P>2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;31</P>
<P>3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;37</P>
<P>4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expenses, Lodging and Transportation&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;57</P>
<P>5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hours of Service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;65</P>
<P>6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seniority&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;93</P>
<P>7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reduction in Personnel&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;97</P>
<P>8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Filling of Vacancies&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;101</P>
<P>9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Training&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;127</P>
<P>10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Moving Expenses&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;143</P>
<P>11&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vacations&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of a Closing Domicile&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 1-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 1</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 1</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Recognition, Scope and Career Security</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>1-A- Recognition</P>
</B><P>The Air Line Pilots Association, International (the</P>
<P>"Association"), has furnished the Company evidence that a</P>
<P>majority of the airline pilots employed by the Company have</P>
<P>designated the Association to represent them and in their</P>
<P>behalf negotiate and conclude an agreement with the</P>
<P>Company as to hours of labor, wages and other employment</P>
<P>conditions covering the pilots in the employ of the Company</P>
<P>in accordance with the provisions of Title II of the Railway</P>
<P>Labor Act, as amended and the certification issued by the</P>
<P>National Mediation Board in Case No. R-3463.</P>
<B><P>1-B- Scope</P>
</B><P>The pilots on the Pilots' System Seniority List and/or Second</P>
<P>Officer Eligibility Seniority List (the "United Pilots") shall have</P>
<P>the sole and exclusive right to perform and be trained to</P>
<P>perform Company Flying and operate Company Aircraft in</P>
<P>accordance with the terms and conditions of this agreement</P>
<P>or any other applicable agreement or agreements between</P>
<P>the Company and the Association (together, the</P>
<P>"Agreement").</P>
<B><P>1-B-1- Company Flying</P>
</B><P>Except as provided in paragraph 1-B-2, ''Company Flying''</P>
<P>includes without limitation all commercial flight operations of</P>
<P>any sort whatsoever, whether revenue, nonrevenue,</P>
<P>scheduled or unscheduled, conducted (i) by the Company or</P>
<P>a Company Affiliate, or (ii) by the Company or a Company</P>
<P>Affiliate for other air carriers, or (iii) by an Entity managed by</P>
<P>or under the Control of the Company or a Company Affiliate,</P>
<P>or (iv) by an Entity in which the Company or a Company</P>
<P>affiliate owns any Equity.</P>
<B><P>1-B-2- Exceptions to Company Flying</P>
</B><P>Company Flying does not include flight operations that are (i)</P>
<P>normally performed by the Company's engineering and test</P>
<P>pilots (other than ferry flights that are not diagnostic test</P>
<P>flights), or (ii) conducted by a Feeder Carrier pursuant to</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-B-3</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-1 below, or (iii) conducted by a Domestic Air</P>
<P>Carrier pursuant to paragraph 1-C-2 below, or (iv) conducted</P>
<P>by a Foreign Air Carrier pursuant to paragraph 1-C-3 below</P>
<P>(including Foreign Air Carriers that are subject to paragraph</P>
<P>1-C-3-f below), or (v) conducted by an Air Carrier Purchaser</P>
<P>during the operations following a Successorship Transaction</P>
<P>but before an Operational Merger that are subject to</P>
<P>paragraph 1-F below, or (vi) conducted by any other air</P>
<P>carrier in accordance with an Industry Standard Interline</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-B-3- Pilot Training Center</P>
<P>1-B-3-a- </B>Neither the Company nor a Company Affiliate shall</P>
<P>enter into any sale, lease, transfer or disposition of (i) the</P>
<P>Denver pilot training center or any successor training</P>
<P>facility (the "Pilot Training Center") or (ii) pilot training</P>
<P>equipment that prevents the Company from accomplishing</P>
<P>the Company's normal training requirements for United</P>
<P>pilots in the Pilot Training Center, provided that:</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-a-(1) </B>The Company may enter into a sale-leaseback</P>
<P>transaction for financing purposes in which</P>
<P>the Company maintains operational control and</P>
<P>continues to utilize only employees of the Company or</P>
<P>the persons identified in paragraph 1-B-3-b-(1) and 1-</P>
<P>B-3-b-(2) below to conduct United Pilot training;</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-a-(2) </B>The Company may sell, lease, transfer or</P>
<P>otherwise dispose of excess training center facilities to</P>
<P>the extent they are not reasonably necessary to</P>
<P>accomplish the Company's normal training</P>
<P>requirements for United Pilots within the Pilot Training</P>
<P>Center; and</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-a-(3) </B>The Pilot Training Center may be sold to a</P>
<P>Successor in connection with a Successorship</P>
<P>Transaction (as defined in paragraph 1-D-1, below).</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-b- </B>Neither the Company nor a Company Affiliate</P>
<P>shall enter into any agreement, or arrangement with any</P>
<P>person who is not employed by the Company to conduct or</P>
<P>supervise United pilot training or to utilize United training</P>
<P>facilities to train other pilots, including without limitation</P>
<P>all United pilot training historically performed at the Pilot</P>
<P>Training Center, except that the Company may continue to</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-b-(1) </B>Use retired or disability retired United</P>
<P>pilots who perform the present duties of a flight</P>
<P>technical instructor in the Pilot Training Center as</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-B-3-c&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 3</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>consultants to the Company while under the</P>
<P>Company's supervision; and</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-b-(2) </B>Permit aircraft manufacturers or other</P>
<P>qualified organizations to conduct initial training of</P>
<P>United flight training personnel on new aircraft</P>
<P>equipment types.</P>
<B><P>1-B-3-c- </B>If the Company is in compliance with paragraph</P>
<P>1-B-3-a above, then the Company may from time to time</P>
<P>utilize United training personnel to train United pilots at</P>
<P>training facilities other than the Pilot Training Center, and</P>
<P>may continue to permit employees of another air carrier to</P>
<P>utilize United training facilities to train pilots of that carrier.</P>
<B><P>1-B-4- Disposition of Aircraft or International Routes</P>
<P>1-B-4-a- </B>Neither the Company nor a Company Affiliate</P>
<P>shall conclude a sale, lease, transfer or other disposition,</P>
<P>whether directly or indirectly, of Company Aircraft to an</P>
<P>Entity (the ''Purchaser'') that uses such aircraft to provide</P>
<P>or receive passenger feed to or from the Company</P>
<P>pursuant to an agreement or an arrangement with the</P>
<P>Company or a Company Affiliate other than (i) as provided</P>
<P>in paragraph 1-C-1 below, or (ii) pursuant to an Industry</P>
<P>Standard Interline Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-B-4-b- </B>Neither the Company nor a Company Affiliate</P>
<P>shall conclude a sale, lease, transfer or other disposition,</P>
<P>whether directly or indirectly, of international routes</P>
<P>owned by the Company or a Company Affiliate to an Entity</P>
<P>(other than a Company Affiliate) that uses such</P>
<P>international routes to provide or receive passenger feed</P>
<P>to or from the Company pursuant to an agreement or an</P>
<P>arrangement with the Company or a Company Affiliate</P>
<P>other than pursuant to an Industry Standard Interline</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-C- Permitted Code Sharing, Marketing, Ownership and</P>
<P>Other Arrangements</P>
<P>1-C-1- Feeder Flying</P>
</B><P>The Company or a Company Affiliate may enter into code</P>
<P>sharing with Feeder Carriers in conformance with the</P>
<P>provisions of this paragraph C-1. The Company or a</P>
<P>Company Affiliate may create, acquire, Control, manage,</P>
<P>take an Equity interest in, enter into code sharing</P>
<P>arrangements with, or sell, lease or transfer aircraft to</P>
<P>Feeder Carriers that comply with the provisions of this</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-C-1</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>paragraph C-1 below, without the flight operations of such air</P>
<P>carrier being considered Company Flying or the aircraft of</P>
<P>such air carrier being considered Company Aircraft.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-a- Key Cities and Domicile Routes</P>
<P>1-C-1-a-(1) </B>A Feeder Carrier shall not operate any</P>
<P>Feeder Flying Non-Stops between current or future</P>
<P>Company Key Cities without the prior written consent</P>
<P>of the Association.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-a-(2) </B>Without limiting paragraph a-(1), a Feeder</P>
<P>Carrier shall not operate Feeder Flying Round Trips</P>
<P>between current or future Company pilot domiciles or</P>
<P>between a current or future Company Key City and a</P>
<P>current or future Company pilot domicile unless the</P>
<P>Company demonstrates that a Company Round Trip</P>
<P>operating in that Market instead of the Feeder Carrier</P>
<P>Round Trip would not pass the Base Internal Rate of</P>
<P>Return Test ("BIRR Test").</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-a-(3) </B>As an exception to the foregoing, Feeder</P>
<P>Carriers may operate in the IAD-LGA, IAD-EWR, and</P>
<P>IAD-JFK Markets provided that, in order to operate</P>
<P>Small Jets in such Markets, the Feeder Carriers do not</P>
<P>operate in excess of 38,200 actual block hours in those</P>
<P>Markets in any period of twelve consecutive months.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-b- Connecting Operations</P>
</B><P>Feeder Carriers as a group shall schedule at least ninety</P>
<P>percent (90%) of their Feeder Flying Non-Stops into or out</P>
<P>of the following airports: IAD, DCA, MIA, LGA, EWR, JFK,</P>
<P>ORD, DEN, LAX, SFO, SEA, BOS, PDX, PHX, LAS, SJC,</P>
<P>SAN and any other airport that the parties later agree to</P>
<P>add to this list. Up to five percent (5%) of Feeder Flying</P>
<P>flights may be applied toward satisfying this requirement</P>
<P>even if such flights include multiple stops, as long as such</P>
<P>flights (i) originate or terminate at one of the foregoing</P>
<P>airports, (ii) maintain a single flight number on a single</P>
<P>aircraft for all the legs of such flight to or from such</P>
<P>airport, and (iii) operate with scheduled intermediate stops</P>
<P>of less than two (2) hours.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-c- Feeder Flying Permitted Range</P>
</B><P>At least 80% of the Feeder Flying Non-Stops in any month</P>
<P>shall take place on routes of 850 nautical miles or less.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-d- Feeder Carrier Ratio</P>
</B><P>In each calendar quarter Feeder Flying shall not exceed</P>
<P>the Feeder Carrier Ratio.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-C-1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 5</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-C-1-e- Feeder Flying on Company Routes</P>
<P>1-C-1-e-(1) </B>A Feeder Carrier shall not initiate a new</P>
<P>scheduled Feeder Flying Round Trip in any Market</P>
<P>operated by the Company at any time in the preceding</P>
<P>twenty-four (24) months, unless the Company</P>
<P>demonstrates that a Company Round Trip that may be</P>
<P>initiated in the Market instead of the Feeder Flying</P>
<P>Round Trip would not pass the BIRR Test.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-e-(2) </B>The Company shall not remove a</P>
<P>scheduled Company Round Trip from any Market</P>
<P>served by Feeder Flying unless the Company</P>
<P>demonstrates that the Round Trip to be removed would</P>
<P>not pass the BIRR Test in the absence of a Feeder</P>
<P>Flying Round Trip scheduled to depart within thirty (30)</P>
<P>minutes of the Company Round Trip.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f- Number of Small Jets in Feeder Flying</P>
<P>1-C-1-f-(1) </B>In order to permit the operation of up to</P>
<P>sixty-five (65) Small Jets in Feeder Flying, the</P>
<P>Company will maintain in its Active Fleet no fewer than</P>
<P>four hundred fifty-one (451) Large-Gauge Narrowbody</P>
<P>Aircraft. For increases over the number sixty-five (65),</P>
<P>the base numbers will be four hundred and fifty-one</P>
<P>(451) Large-Gauge Narrowbody Aircraft and one</P>
<P>hundred forty-one (141) Widebody Aircraft.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(2) </B>When the Company permits the operation</P>
<P>of Small Jets in Feeder Flying over the base number of</P>
<P>sixty-five (65), it will, at its option, either:</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(2)-(a) </B>Where the Active Large-Gauge</P>
<P>Narrowbody Fleet is at least four hundred fifty-one</P>
<P>(451), add to the Active Fleet one (1) Small-Gauge</P>
<P>Narrowbody for each net addition of one (1) such</P>
<P>Small Jets; or</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(2)-(b) </B>Increase the base Active Large-Gauge</P>
<P>Narrowbody Fleet of four hundred fifty-one</P>
<P>(451) by one (1) Large-Gauge Narrowbody Aircraft</P>
<P>for each net addition of three (3) such Small Jets; or</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(2)-(c) </B>Increase the base Active Widebody</P>
<P>Fleet of one hundred forty-one (141) by one (1)</P>
<P>Widebody Aircraft for each net addition of five (5)</P>
<P>such Small Jets.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(3) </B>In addition to the Small Jets provided for in</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-1-f-(1) and paragraph 1-C-1-f-(2)</P>
<P>above, the Company may permit an increase in Small</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section1-C-1</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Jets operated in Feeder Flying, without increasing</P>
<P>Active Fleet numbers by:</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(3)-(a) </B>Permitting Feeder Carriers to replace</P>
<P>on a one for one basis up to one hundred and fifty</P>
<P>(150) Turbo/Prop Aircraft in Feeder Flying service</P>
<P>on [DOS] and that are thereafter retired from Feeder</P>
<P>Flying; or</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(3)-(b) </B>Permitting the replacement of BAe-146</P>
<P>aircraft as provided in subparagraph (4) below.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(4) </B>In addition to the Small Jets provided for in</P>
<P>paragraphs 1-C-1-f-(1) through (3) above, Feeder</P>
<P>Carrier Air Wisconsin Airlines Corp. ("AWAC") may</P>
<P>operate up to eighteen (18) aircraft with seating</P>
<P>capacity in excess of fifty (50) seats (the "AWAC</P>
<P>Quota"). Currently, the AWAC Quota is filled by BAe-146</P>
<P>aircraft with the following tail numbers: N463AP,</P>
<P>N179US, N181US, N183US, N606AW, N607AW,</P>
<P>N608AW, N609AW, N610AW, N611AW, N612AW,</P>
<P>N614AW, N615AW, N616AW, N290UE, N291UE,</P>
<P>N292UE, and N156TR. As needed, AWAC may replace</P>
<P>any aircraft within the AWAC Quota with: (i) any other</P>
<P>BAe-146 or AVRO 85 aircraft each with no more</P>
<P>passenger seats than were carried in the actual</P>
<P>operation of the replaced aircraft, or (ii) any other</P>
<P>aircraft with a maximum certificated seating capacity in</P>
<P>the United States of eighty-five (85) seats and a</P>
<P>maximum certificated gross takeoff weight in the United</P>
<P>States of up to ninety thousand (90,000) pounds, or (iii)</P>
<P>up to two Small Jets.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-f-(5) </B>In order to satisfy the requirements set forth</P>
<P>in this paragraph 1-C-1-f, including sub-paragraphs 1-</P>
<P>C-1-f-(1) through (3) above, the Narrowbody and</P>
<P>Widebody Aircraft in the Company's Active Fleet must</P>
<P>maintain the Average Utilization Rate.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-g- Numbers of Pilots</P>
</B><P>The absolute number of captains plus first officers</P>
<P>employed by the Company shall not be reduced below</P>
<P>9592 captains plus first officers employed on Date of</P>
<P>Signing as a result of Feeder Flying under the terms of</P>
<P>this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-h- Feeder Carriers Conducting Operations for</P>
<P>Themselves and Other Carriers</P>
<P>1-C-1-h-(1) </B>An air carrier that is acting as a Feeder</P>
<P>Carrier (other than a Company Affiliate) may also</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-C-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 7</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>operate jet aircraft with a maximum certificated seating</P>
<P>capacity in the United States of up to seventy (70)</P>
<P>seats and a maximum certificated gross takeoff weight</P>
<P>in the United States of up to eighty thousand (80,000)</P>
<P>pounds on its own behalf or pursuant to agreements</P>
<P>with air carriers other than the Company or Company</P>
<P>Affiliate;</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-h-(2) </B>An Affiliate of a Feeder Carrier (other than</P>
<P>a Company Affiliate) may operate any size and weight</P>
<P>aircraft on its own behalf and pursuant to agreements</P>
<P>with other carriers.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-i- Feeder Carrier Branding</P>
<P>1-C-1-i-(1) </B>Feeder Carriers may not conduct</P>
<P>commercial flight operations under the name United</P>
<P>Airlines, United Shuttle, or other names used by the</P>
<P>Company except as provided in subparagraph (2)</P>
<P>below.</P>
<B><P>1-C-1-i-(2) </B>Aircraft operated in Feeder Flying may bear</P>
<P>the Company's logo or aircraft livery only if such</P>
<P>aircraft bear the name United Express or similar name</P>
<P>connoting a connection with United Airlines (other than</P>
<P>the names United Airlines, United Shuttle or other</P>
<P>name used by the Company).</P>
<B><P>1-C-2- Other Domestic Code Sharing Agreements</P>
<P>1-C-2-a- </B>The Company may enter into or maintain code</P>
<P>sharing with Domestic Air Carriers ("Domestic Code</P>
<P>Sharing Agreements") that permit such carriers to apply</P>
<P>the Company's designator code to their operations as long</P>
<P>as:</P>
<B><P>1-C-2-a-(1) </B>The number of quarterly block hours</P>
<P>scheduled to be operated by such carriers utilizing the</P>
<P>Company's designator code does not exceed one</P>
<P>percent (1%) of the Company's total scheduled block</P>
<P>hours for the same quarter within the United States and</P>
<P>Territories; and</P>
<B><P>1-C-2-a-(2) </B>Domestic Code Sharing Agreements do not</P>
<P>take place in any operations between any current or</P>
<P>future Company Key Cities or Company gateway</P>
<P>airports.</P>
<B><P>1-C-2-a-(3) </B>Except as provided in paragraphs C-2-a-(1)</P>
<P>and (2) above and C-2-b below, the Company will not</P>
<P>enter into schedule coordination agreements with other</P>
<P>Domestic Air Carriers for the purpose of creating</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-C-2-b</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>greater schedule connectivity. Notwithstanding the</P>
<P>foregoing, the Company shall not be prevented from</P>
<P>participating in IATA Scheduling or Slot Conferences</P>
<P>nor from engaging in slot exchanges with Domestic Air</P>
<P>Carriers.</P>
<B><P>1-C-2-b- </B>The restrictions contained in paragraph C-2-a</P>
<P>above shall not apply to (i) Feeder Flying, (ii) code-share</P>
<P>flying operated by Aloha Airlines, Inc. in the Hawaiian</P>
<P>Islands under the current United-Aloha agreement and</P>
<P>renewals thereof or (iii) code share flying operated by a</P>
<P>Domestic Air Carrier that replaces Aloha Airlines under a</P>
<P>similar agreement limited to the Hawaiian Islands,</P>
<P>provided that the replacement air carrier and any major</P>
<P>Domestic Air Carrier Parent it may have maintain their</P>
<P>headquarters, executive offices, and offices for senior</P>
<P>flight operations personnel within the State of Hawaii.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3- International Code Sharing Agreements</P>
</B><P>The Company may enter into or maintain code sharing</P>
<P>agreements with Foreign Air Carriers (''International Code</P>
<P>Sharing Agreements'') that permit such carriers to utilize the</P>
<P>Company's designator code with the Company on such</P>
<P>carriers' flight operations between the United States and</P>
<P>Territories and foreign points or between two foreign points</P>
<P>("International Flying") under the following terms and</P>
<P>conditions:</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-a- Protection for Company International Flying</P>
</B><P>Unless the Company obtains the approval of the</P>
<P>Association, it must demonstrate that implementation of</P>
<P>all International Code Sharing Agreements and renewals</P>
<P>thereof, does not cause a reduction in the then-current</P>
<P>total number of block hours of International Flying</P>
<P>performed by the Company. Such block hours will be</P>
<P>measured at the conclusion of the calendar quarter</P>
<P>following implementation of the International Code</P>
<P>Sharing Agreement and renewals thereafter.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-b- Minimum Company International Flying</P>
</B><P>The Company shall schedule at least the following block</P>
<P>hours of Company International Flying in the following</P>
<P>years: 2000: 511,538; 2001: 542,373; 2002: 559,515;</P>
<P>2003 and thereafter: 576,300.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-b-(1) </B>If, in any rolling twelve (12) month period,</P>
<P>the Company operates fewer than ninety-five percent</P>
<P>(95%) of the total number of block hours required by</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-C-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 9</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-3-b above, (measured by the monthly</P>
<P>averages determined by the annual requirements),</P>
<P>then the Company shall not expand total number of</P>
<P>block hours operated by other carriers pursuant to</P>
<P>International Code Sharing Agreements until the</P>
<P>Company maintains ninety-five percent (95%) of the</P>
<P>required number of scheduled block hours (measured</P>
<P>by the monthly averages determined by the annual</P>
<P>requirements) for the twelve (12) month period prior to</P>
<P>any such expansion.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-b-(2) </B>If, in any rolling twelve-month period the</P>
<P>Company operates fewer than ninety-five percent</P>
<P>(95%) of the total number of block hours required by</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-3-b above, (measured by the monthly</P>
<P>averages determined by the annual requirements),</P>
<P>then the Company will review the ASM growth of the</P>
<P>Company and its international code sharing partners in</P>
<P>each Joint International Non-Stop Market contained</P>
<P>within an International Code Sharing Agreement. If the</P>
<P>ASM growth of the international code sharing partner in</P>
<P>the Joint International Non-Stop Market since the later</P>
<P>of the inception of the International Code Sharing</P>
<P>Agreement or the [DOS] is two or more times greater</P>
<P>than the Company's ASM growth in the same Joint</P>
<P>International Non-Stop Market, the Company will</P>
<P>further evaluate the Joint International Non-Stop</P>
<P>Market to determine if the addition of one or more</P>
<P>Company Round Trips instead of an existing</P>
<P>international code share partner flight in such Joint</P>
<P>International Market would pass the BIRR Test. If the</P>
<P>evaluation determines that the addition of one or more</P>
<P>Company Round Trips passes the BIRR Test, the</P>
<P>Company will add such Round Trip(s) as soon as</P>
<P>practical. Notwithstanding this paragraph, the</P>
<P>Company is not required to add a Round Trip to a Joint</P>
<P>International Market that it is barred from adding</P>
<P>unilaterally by virtue of an agreement that satisfies</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-3-d below.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-c- Protection Against Reduction of Company</P>
<P>Flights</P>
</B><P>Except as provided in paragraph 1-C-3-d below, the</P>
<P>Company shall not remove a scheduled Company Non-Stop</P>
<P>from a Joint International Non-Stop Market unless</P>
<P>the Company demonstrates that the Company Non-Stop to</P>
<P>be removed does not pass the BIRR Test.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-C-3-d</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-C-3-d- </B>Revenue Sharing With Foreign Air Carriers</P>
<P>The Company may enter into and maintain agreements with</P>
<P>Foreign Air Carriers where the Company has antitrust</P>
<P>immunity with such carriers, providing for a sharing of profits</P>
<P>and losses, if the Company will maintain, throughout the</P>
<P>agreement, the ASM ratio no less favorable to the Company</P>
<P>than the one that exists among participating carriers at the</P>
<P>inception of the agreement, of scheduled ASMs generated by</P>
<P>Round Trips in Markets covered by the agreement in which</P>
<P>all participating carriers have rights to fly (the "Covered</P>
<P>Markets"). The ratio shall be the number of scheduled ASMs</P>
<P>generated by Company Round Trips in the Covered Markets</P>
<P>at the inception of the agreement divided by the total number</P>
<P>of scheduled ASMs generated by all Round Trips in the</P>
<P>Covered Markets operated by all parties to the agreement</P>
<P>(the "Company's ASM Share"). The manner in which the</P>
<P>Company Share is maintained shall be as follows:</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(1) </B>The Company's ASM Share at the</P>
<P>inception of the agreement shall be the base line ratio</P>
<P>(the "Base Line Ratio" or "BLR") for the duration of the</P>
<P>agreement. However, if the Company's ASM Share is</P>
<P>less than sixty-five percent (65%) divided by the</P>
<P>number of carriers in the agreement (the "Target BLR"),</P>
<P>it shall operate all new Round Trips in Covered Markets</P>
<P>until such time as the Company's Share equals or</P>
<P>exceeds the Target BLR.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(2) </B>Annually, the Company will audit the total</P>
<P>number of scheduled ASMs generated by Round Trips</P>
<P>in Covered Markets.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(3) </B>If, at the time of the annual audit, the</P>
<P>Company's ASM Share has fallen below the Target</P>
<P>BLR, it will take the necessary steps to return the</P>
<P>Company's Share to the Target BLR by the date of the</P>
<P>next annual audit.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(4) </B>For determining all profits and losses</P>
<P>under the agreement:</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(4)-(a) </B>Total costs for all parties to the</P>
<P>agreement shall not include employment costs as</P>
<P>defined under DOT Form 41;</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-d-(4)-(b) </B>Profits and losses that are subject to</P>
<P>sharing shall be those that are incremental to the</P>
<P>profits and losses prior to the applicable agreement.</P>
<P>On an annual basis, the Company's share of</P>
<P>incremental profits from flight operations under the</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-C-3-d&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 11</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>agreement shall not exceed the Company's ASM</P>
<P>Share.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-e- Prohibition on Cabotage</P>
</B><P>Regardless of any future modification in legal rules</P>
<P>governing cabotage, Foreign Air Carriers that are parties</P>
<P>to International Code Sharing Agreements may not</P>
<P>operate any flights where the Foreign Air Carrier picks up</P>
<P>for hire at any point in the United States and Territories</P>
<P>passengers, property or mail destined for any other point</P>
<P>in the United States and Territories ("U.S. Flight") if the</P>
<P>U.S. Flight operates under the designator code of the</P>
<P>Company or a Company Affiliate. Further, such Foreign</P>
<P>Air Carrier shall be prohibited from placing its code on</P>
<P>Company Aircraft in any domestic market where the</P>
<P>Foreign Air Carrier operates a U.S. Flight.</P>
<B><P>1-C-3-f- Acquisition of Equity of Foreign Air Carriers</P>
</B><P>The Company or a Company Affiliate may acquire (i) up to</P>
<P>twenty percent (20%) of the total Equity in the form of</P>
<P>Common Equity and (ii) up to twenty percent (20%) of the</P>
<P>total Equity in a form or forms which are not Common</P>
<P>Equity, in each case, of any Foreign Air Carrier that is a</P>
<P>member of the Star Alliance or any successor multi-airline</P>
<P>network (the "Network") or of any other Foreign Air Carrier</P>
<P>that, as a condition of such investment, commits within six</P>
<P>months of the investment to become a member of the</P>
<P>Network, without such investment by itself causing the</P>
<P>flight operations of such air carrier to be considered</P>
<P>Company Flying, the aircraft of such air carrier to be</P>
<P>considered Company Aircraft or such Entity to be</P>
<P>considered a Company Affiliate. However, the Company or</P>
<P>its Affiliate, as the case may be, shall sell its Equity in a</P>
<P>Foreign Air Carrier as soon as practicable if that Foreign</P>
<P>Air Carrier ceases to be a member of the Network, or fails</P>
<P>to become a member of the Network within eighteen</P>
<P>months of the commitment to do so. In the event the</P>
<P>Company or a Company Affiliate acquires any Equity</P>
<P>pursuant to clause (ii) above, it will ensure that under no</P>
<P>circumstances, except in connection with the sale or other</P>
<P>transfer of such Equity other than to a Company Affiliate,</P>
<P>shall such non-Common Equity be exchanged or</P>
<P>exercised for, or converted into Common Equity whether</P>
<P>at the election of the Company or such Company Affiliate</P>
<P>or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the</P>
<P>Association.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 12&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-C-4</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-C-4- Code Sharing Agreements - General</P>
<P>1-C-4-a- </B>Except as provided in paragraph 1-C-1, 1-C-2,</P>
<P>and 1-C-3 above, neither the Company nor a Company</P>
<P>Affiliate shall enter into any agreement or arrangement</P>
<P>that permits any other air carrier to conduct commercial</P>
<P>flight operations:</P>
<B><P>1-C-4-a-(1) </B>Under any designator code currently or in</P>
<P>the future used by the Company or a Company Affiliate,</P>
<P>or</P>
<B><P>1-C-4-a-(2) </B>In any aircraft which bear the name, trade</P>
<P>name, logo, aircraft livery, trademarks or service marks</P>
<P>("Brand") currently or in the future used by the</P>
<P>Company or a Company Affiliate other than (i) a Brand</P>
<P>of Star Alliance (which may include the Company's</P>
<P>Brand) placed in an inferior position to the Brand of the</P>
<P>operating carrier so as to indicate that the flying under</P>
<P>that Brand is not being performed by the Company, or</P>
<P>(iii) a Brand of United Express or similar Feeder Carrier</P>
<P>Brand; or</P>
<B><P>1-C-4-a-(3) </B>That utilize the Brand used by the</P>
<P>Company in a manner that holds out to the public that</P>
<P>such carrier's flying is being conducted by the</P>
<P>Company.</P>
<B><P>1-C-4-b- </B>The Company and Company Affiliates may</P>
<P>enter into and maintain marketing agreements, revenue</P>
<P>sharing agreements and schedule coordination</P>
<P>agreements with other air carriers that do not contravene</P>
<P>the provisions of this Section 1-C. Notwithstanding the</P>
<P>foregoing sentence, agreements that provide for sharing</P>
<P>of profits and/or of profits and losses may only be entered</P>
<P>into with air carriers pursuant to and in accordance with</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-3-d.</P>
<B><P>1-C-4-c- </B>Nothing herein shall prevent the Company from</P>
<P>entering into, maintaining or implementing International</P>
<P>Code Sharing Agreements covering a route or routes that</P>
<P>the Company is unable to operate due to the loss of</P>
<P>operating authority (including but not limited to slots)</P>
<P>provided that the Company has made a good-faith effort to</P>
<P>retain the lost operating authority or slots. Further, the</P>
<P>Company shall not be required to add a Round Trip that it</P>
<P>is unable to operate due to the lack of operating authority</P>
<P>(including but not limited to slots) provided that the</P>
<P>Company has made a good-faith effort to obtain the</P>
<P>applicable operating authority or slots.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-C-5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 13</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-C-5- Block Space</P>
</B><P>The Company may enter into block space arrangements with</P>
<P>other carriers (i.e., the advance purchase or reservation of</P>
<P>blocks of seats on other carriers for resale by the Company)</P>
<P>only</P>
<B><P>1-C-5-a- </B>On flights which carry the Company's</P>
<P>designator code pursuant to paragraph 1-C-1, 1-C-2 and</P>
<P>1-C-3 above, provided that the Company may not enter</P>
<P>into a block space arrangement with a Foreign Air Carrier</P>
<P>for more than one hundred and seventy-five (175) seats</P>
