<P>on any aircraft on which the space is blocked (seventy</P>
<P>(70) seats for operations to or from Mexico, Canada, the</P>
<P>Caribbean or Central America).</P>
<B><P>1-C-5-b- </B>On a limited number of occasions where United</P>
<P>Vacations or Mileage Plus from time to time purchases</P>
<P>block seats in order to provide connecting service as part</P>
<P>of group vacation packages where such service or seats</P>
<P>on such service are not available from the Company; or</P>
<B><P>1-C-5-c- </B>On other occasions, limited in number and</P>
<P>consistent with the Company's limited practices as of the</P>
<P>date of this Agreement, where the Company from time to</P>
<P>time purchases seats for connecting passengers over</P>
<P>routes on which the Company does not maintain operating</P>
<P>authority.</P>
<B><P>1-C-6- Cargo</P>
</B><P>When the Company ships cargo for hire, whether</P>
<P>independently or as part of a cooperative agreement with</P>
<P>other Entities, it shall endeavor to maximize the carriage of</P>
<P>such cargo on Company Aircraft as opposed to on other</P>
<P>carriers. Further, when shipped by air between two points</P>
<P>served by the Company on a Non-Stop basis, the cargo will</P>
<P>be scheduled to be shipped on Company Aircraft. Further,</P>
<P>the Company and its Affiliates shall not share profits from</P>
<P>shipment of cargo by other Domestic Air Carriers except</P>
<P>Feeder Carriers.</P>
<B><P>1-D- Successorship</P>
<P>1-D-1- Successorship Transactions</P>
</B><P>The Company and its Affiliates shall require any successor,</P>
<P>assign, assignee, transferee, administrator, executor and/or</P>
<P>trustee of the Company or of a Parent (a "Successor")</P>
<P>resulting from the transfer (in a single transaction or in multi-</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 14&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-D-1-a</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>step transactions) to the Successor of the ownership and/or</P>
<P>control of fifty (50%) percent or more of the Equity of the</P>
<P>Company or Parent or fifty percent (50%) of the value of the</P>
<P>assets of the Company (a "Successorship Transaction") to</P>
<P>employ or cause the Company to continue to employ the</P>
<P>United Pilots in accordance with the provisions of the</P>
<P>Agreement and to assume and be bound by the Agreement,</P>
<P>provided:</P>
<B><P>1-D-1-a- </B>In order for a Successor to be required to</P>
<P>employ or to cause the Company to continue to employ</P>
<P>any of the United Pilots in accordance with the provisions</P>
<P>of the Agreement at any air carrier other than the</P>
<P>Company, the Successor must be engaged in the</P>
<P>operation of an air carrier; however, if the Successorship</P>
<P>Transaction is for less than all or substantially all of the</P>
<P>Equity of the Company or a Parent, or assets of the</P>
<P>Company, the sections of the Agreement providing for</P>
<P>minimum numbers of pilots, aircraft, and flying shall be</P>
<P>modified and/or prorated to correspond to the size of the</P>
<P>Company airline operations disposed of to the Successor,</P>
<P>and</P>
<B><P>1-D-1-b- </B>A Successor shall not include an Entity that is</P>
<P>(a) an IRS-qualified employee benefit plan of the</P>
<P>Company or a Parent or a trustee or other fiduciary of</P>
<P>such plan acting in its capacity as such, provided that the</P>
<P>plan is one in which (i) all United Pilots who meet the</P>
<P>general service requirements applicable to all participants</P>
<P>are entitled to participate; (ii) stock of the Company or</P>
<P>Company Affiliate allocated to accounts of participants is</P>
<P>voted (subject to the ERISA obligations of the trustees) in</P>
<P>accordance with the instructions of the participants if any</P>
<P>are given; and (iii) the trustee voting unallocated stock is a</P>
<P>nationally recognized bank or financial institution or (b)</P>
<P>any similar plan or arrangement involving broad-based</P>
<P>participation by the Company's pilots. If stock in the plan</P>
<P>which is required to be voted in accordance with directions</P>
<P>of the participants is tendered to and purchased by an</P>
<P>Entity outside the plan (other than a plan that satisfies the</P>
<P>foregoing sentence), such stock shall be deemed to be no</P>
<P>longer owned by the plan for purposes of this exemption.</P>
<B><P>1-D-2- Successorship Agreements</P>
</B><P>The Company and its Affiliates shall not conclude any</P>
<P>agreement for a Successorship Transaction unless the</P>
<P>Successor agrees in writing, as an irrevocable condition of</P>
<P>the Successorship Transaction, to assume and be bound by</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-D-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 15</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>the Agreement, to recognize the Association as the</P>
<P>representative of the Successor's pilots, and to guarantee</P>
<P>that the pilots on the United Pilots' System Seniority List will</P>
<P>be employed by the Successor in accordance with the</P>
<P>provisions of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-D-3- Air Carrier Successors</P>
</B><P>In the event of a Successorship Transaction in which the</P>
<P>Successor is an air carrier or Entity that Controls or is under</P>
<P>the Control of an air carrier, the Successor shall provide the</P>
<P>Company's pilots with the seniority integration rights</P>
<P>provided in Sections 2, 3, and 13 of the Labor Protective</P>
<P>Provisions specified by the Civil Aeronautics Merger Board in</P>
<P>the Allegheny-Mohawk merger ("Allegheny-Mohawk LPPs"),</P>
<P>except that the integration of the seniority lists of the</P>
<P>respective pilot groups shall be governed by Association</P>
<P>Merger Policy if both pre-transaction pilot groups are</P>
<P>represented by the Association.</P>
<B><P>1-E- Change of Control</P>
<P>1-E-1- Rights Agreement</P>
</B><P>In addition to all other rights, the Association shall be</P>
<P>provided protection as follows at the same time protection is</P>
<P>provided to shareholders pursuant to any shareholder</P>
<P>agreement adopted by UAL Corporation that is substantially</P>
<P>similar to the Rights Agreement dated December 11, 1986, as</P>
<P>amended, between UAL Corporation and Morgan</P>
<P>Shareholder Services Trust Company (any such agreement</P>
<P>as the same may be amended, supplemented or otherwise</P>
<P>modified from time to time, a "Rights Agreement"). The</P>
<P>Association shall have the right, during the period described</P>
<P>in this paragraph E-1, to serve a Section 6 notice to reopen</P>
<P>the Agreement. For purposes hereof, the Association's right</P>
<P>to serve a Section 6 notice under this provision shall be</P>
<P>effective only during the time period the registered holders of</P>
<P>then outstanding rights certificates issued pursuant to a</P>
<P>Rights Agreement may exercise rights to purchase shares of</P>
<P>stock of the Company or UAL Corporation pursuant to such</P>
<P>Rights Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-E-2- Additional Rights</P>
</B><P>In the event of a Successorship Transaction, the Association</P>
<P>shall, in addition to all other rights, thereupon have the right</P>
<P>in its sole discretion, upon written notice to the Company</P>
<P>within 60 days of written notice following the closing of such</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 16&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-E-3</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>transaction, (a) to extend the duration of this Agreement for</P>
<P>one, two or three years at the Association's option, past its</P>
<P>amendable date with across-the-board wage increases of five</P>
<P>percent (5%) on the amendable date (i.e. September 1, 2004)</P>
<P>and each annual anniversary of the amendable date</P>
<P>thereafter (i.e., on September 1 as applicable); (b) to serve</P>
<P>notice under Section 6 of the Railway Labor Act, as</P>
<P>amended, to reopen the Agreement without regard to Section</P>
<P>22 (Duration) of the Agreement; or (c) to exercise any</P>
<P>combination of the rights specified in this paragraph.</P>
<B><P>1-E-3- Competing Proposal</P>
</B><P>In the event the Company or its Parent receives a proposal (a</P>
<P>''Proposal'') for a transaction which would result in a</P>
<P>Successor if completed, and the Company or its Parent</P>
<P>determines to pursue or facilitate the Proposal, the Company</P>
<P>or its Parent will in good faith seek to provide the Association</P>
<P>with the opportunity to make a competing Proposal at such</P>
<P>time and under such circumstances as the Board of Directors</P>
<P>of UAL or the Company reasonably determines to be</P>
<P>consistent with its or their fiduciary duties.</P>
<B><P>1-F- Operations Following Successorship Transaction</P>
</B><P>If the acquiring Entity in a Successorship Transaction is an</P>
<P>air carrier or Affiliate of an air carrier ("Air Carrier</P>
<P>Purchaser"):</P>
<B><P>1-F-1- </B>The flight operations of the Company and Air Carrier</P>
<P>Purchaser shall remain separate until the implementation of</P>
<P>an integrated seniority list pursuant to paragraph 1-D-3</P>
<P>above and a single collective bargaining agreement (the</P>
<P>"Operational Merger Date"); and</P>
<B><P>1-F-2- </B>All aircraft in the Company's Active Fleet and all</P>
<P>aircraft on firm order by the Company that are delivered to</P>
<P>the Company or the Air Carrier Purchaser shall be operated</P>
<P>by the United Pilots under the terms and conditions provided</P>
<P>in the Agreement until the Operational Merger Date; and</P>
<B><P>1-F-3- </B>Until the Operational Merger Date, in each month</P>
<P>following the Successorship Transaction the ratio of block</P>
<P>hours of Company Flying to block hours of flying by the Air</P>
<P>Carrier Purchaser shall equal or exceed the same ratio</P>
<P>determined for the twelve calendar months prior to the</P>
<P>Successorship Transaction.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-G&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 17</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-G- Other Labor Protective Provisions</P>
</B><P>If the Company transfers to an Entity (the "Transferee") (by</P>
<P>sale, lease or other transaction) or disposes of aircraft or</P>
<P>route authority which produced fifteen percent (15%) or more</P>
<P>of the Company's operating revenues, block hours, or ASMs</P>
<P>during the twelve (12) months immediately prior to the date of</P>
<P>the agreement to transfer such aircraft or route authority (the</P>
<P>"Transaction Date"), net of revenues, block hours or ASMs</P>
<P>that are produced by aircraft or route authority that were</P>
<P>placed into service during the same period (any such</P>
<P>transfer, a ''Substantial Asset Sale''), then:</P>
<B><P>1-G-1- Offer of Employment to United Pilots</P>
</B><P>The Company shall require the Transferee to offer pilot</P>
<P>employment to eligible United Pilots. The eligibility criteria</P>
<P>shall be determined by agreement between the Company and</P>
<P>the Association and shall be reasonably related to the assets</P>
<P>transferred, the interests of the United Pilots and the</P>
<P>Company, and the nature and timing of the transaction</P>
<P>among other issues. If the Association and the Company are</P>
<P>unable to agree upon eligibility criteria that are consistent</P>
<P>with the foregoing considerations, the System Board of</P>
<P>Adjustment shall determine such eligibility criteria pursuant</P>
<P>to the expedited procedures set forth in paragraph 1-L-1</P>
<P>below (the ''Transferring Pilots''). The number of pilot</P>
<P>employment opportunities for Transferring Pilots shall be, as</P>
<P>measured in the twelve (12) months prior to the Transaction</P>
<P>Date, the sum of (i) the average monthly pilot staffing actually</P>
<P>utilized in the operation of the aircraft transferred to the</P>
<P>Transferee in connection with the Substantial Asset Sale plus</P>
<P>(ii) the average monthly pilot staffing actually utilized in the</P>
<P>operation of the route authority transferred to the Transferee</P>
<P>in connection with the Substantial Asset Sale to the extent</P>
<P>such pilot staffing is not included in the calculation of clause</P>
<P>(i) above. Offers of employment that are rejected by a United</P>
<P>Pilot shall in turn be offered to other United Pilots under the</P>
<P>eligibility criteria determined under the first sentence of this</P>
<P>subparagraph 1, until such opportunities have been</P>
<P>exhausted.</P>
<B><P>1-G-2- Seniority Integration</P>
</B><P>The Company shall require the Transferee to provide the</P>
<P>Transferring Pilots with the seniority integration rights</P>
<P>provided in Sections 2, 3, and 13 of the Allegheny-Mohawk</P>
<P>LPPs except that the integration of the Transferring Pilots</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 18&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-H</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>into the Transferee's seniority list shall be governed by</P>
<P>Association Merger Policy if both pre-transaction pilot groups</P>
<P>are represented by the Association. The Company shall</P>
<P>require each Transferee to agree, and such Transferee shall</P>
<P>agree, to provide the seniority integration rights specified in</P>
<P>the preceding sentence in connection with a Substantial</P>
<P>Asset Sale in a written document enforceable against the</P>
<P>Transferee by the Association and/or the Transferring Pilots.</P>
<B><P>1-H- General Furlough and Job Security Protection</P>
<P>1-H-1- Furlough Protection</P>
</B><P>United Pilots who have completed their probationary period</P>
<P>will not be furloughed. Regardless of any other provision of</P>
<P>the Agreement, the Company may require a United Pilot who</P>
<P>would have been furloughed but for this paragraph to utilize</P>
<P>his accrued unused vacation.</P>
<B><P>1-H-2- Active Status Protection</P>
</B><P>The total number of Captains, First Officers and Management</P>
<P>Pilots in active status under the Agreement (i.e., excluding</P>
<P>United Pilots on long-term sick leave or leave of absence) will</P>
<P>not be reduced below 9458.</P>
<B><P>1-H-3- Fleet Size Guarantee</P>
</B><P>The Active Fleet of Large-Gauge Narrowbody Aircraft and of</P>
<P>Widebody Aircraft shall be no fewer than the following as of</P>
<P>yearend for each of the following years: 2000: 571; 2001:</P>
<P>608; 2002: 625; 2003 and thereafter: 633.</P>
<B><P>1-H-4- Block Hours Guarantee</P>
</B><P>The Company shall schedule no fewer than the following</P>
<P>specified number of block hours of Company Flying in Large-Gauge</P>
<P>Narrowbody Aircraft and Widebody Aircraft in each of</P>
<P>the following calendar years: 2000: 2,188,166; 2001:</P>
<P>2,337,557; 2002: 2,418,125; 2003 and thereafter: 2,449,077.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5- Changed Circumstances</P>
</B><P>The following will govern the Company's obligations under</P>
<P>this Section 1-H in the event the Company experiences</P>
<P>changed economic circumstances beyond the Company's</P>
<P>control:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a- Substantial Economic Downturn</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 1-H-5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 19</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>Although the Company is fully committed to maintaining the</P>
<P>Active Fleet and the minimum block hours guarantees</P>
<P>established in paragraph 1-H-3 (Fleet Size Guarantee) and 1-</P>
<P>H-4 (Block Hours Guarantee) above, the parties recognize</P>
<P>that a substantial economic downturn beyond the control of</P>
<P>the Company may require a reduction in its planned level of</P>
<P>flight operations as a matter of prudent business judgment in</P>
<P>order to avoid a substantial decline in profitability (a</P>
<P>"Reduction"). Accordingly, the Company shall be permitted to</P>
<P>reduce flight operations from the levels established in</P>
<P>paragraph 1-H-3 and 1-H-4 if it fully complies with each</P>
<P>element of the following review and approval process:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1) </B>The Company rationally projects, in an</P>
<P>exercise of the Company's rational business judgment</P>
<P>and customary forecasting practices, that the Company</P>
<P>will suffer a year-over-year reduction of at least thirty-three</P>
<P>and one-third percent (33 1/3%) in its reported</P>
<P>pre-tax earnings (excluding extraordinary debits and</P>
<P>credits in accordance with GAAP) over the next twelve</P>
<P>(12) months if it does not initiate a Reduction (such</P>
<P>projection being referred to as the "Downturn</P>
<P>Projection"). The factors that might warrant a</P>
<P>Reduction include without limitation:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1)-(a) </B>Significant declines in the</P>
<P>Company's advance bookings or current ticketing;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1)-(b) </B>Significant declines in current or</P>
<P>forecast Company or industry revenues;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1)-(c) </B>Significant increases in current or</P>
<P>forecast unit costs;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1)-(d) </B>Significant current or forecast</P>
<P>competitive capacity changes; or</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(1)-(e) </B>Any other factor or combination of</P>
<P>factors that in the Company's rational business</P>
<P>judgment justifies the substantial year-over-year</P>
<P>projected decline in profitability described above.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(2) </B>The Company presents its Downturn</P>
<P>Projection and supporting information and</P>
<P>documentation to the Association as early as</P>
<P>practicable in the Company's planning process but at</P>
<P>least forty-five (45) days before a Reduction. The</P>
<P>Company will provide the Association with every</P>
<P>reasonable opportunity to review the Downturn</P>
<P>Projection and to suggest ways of avoiding a</P>
<P>substantial decrease in profitability without a</P>
<P>Reduction. The Association will provide any comments</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-H-5</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>it may have on the Company's Downturn Projection</P>
<P>within 10 business days of the date it receives the</P>
<P>Downturn Projection and supporting information and</P>
<P>documentation from the Company.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(3) </B>The Board of Directors of the Company's</P>
<P>Parent (the "Board") determines, at least 30 days</P>
<P>before a Reduction and through a formal resolution</P>
<P>following full review and debate that the Company must</P>
<P>initiate a Reduction in order to avoid the substantial</P>
<P>decrease in profitability described above.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(4) </B>The Company and the Association jointly</P>
<P>select and brief a recognized expert of national</P>
<P>standing (the "Neutral Professional") in connection with</P>
<P>the following review process:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(4)-(a) </B>If the Association disputes that the</P>
<P>Downturn Projection is based upon a rational</P>
<P>business judgment, the Association shall so inform</P>
<P>the Company within two business days of the</P>
<P>Board's determination. In that event, the Company</P>
<P>and the Association will immediately submit their</P>
<P>dispute to the Neutral Professional.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(4)-(b) </B>The Neutral Professional will</P>
<P>determine within three days of submission whether</P>
<P>the Company failed to base the Downturn Projection</P>
<P>on a rational business judgment and shall inform</P>
<P>both the Company and the Association of the basis</P>
<P>for any determination that the Company failed to</P>
<P>base the Downtown Projection on an rational</P>
<P>business judgment (a "Downturn Rejection</P>
<P>Decision").</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(4)-(c) </B>If the Neutral Professional makes a</P>
<P>Downturn Rejection Decision, the Company may not</P>
<P>initiate a Reduction until the Board reconsiders and</P>
<P>takes a new vote on whether, in light of the Neutral</P>
<P>Professional's report, the Company must initiate a</P>
<P>Reduction in order to avoid the substantial decrease</P>
<P>in profitability described above.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(5) </B>- While a Reduction remains in effect:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(5)-(a) </B>The Company will provide the</P>
<P>Association any financial and operational</P>
<P>information that the Association reasonably</P>
<P>requests to monitor the Company's performance</P>
<P>and projections;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(5)-(b) </B>The Company will meet with the</P>
<P>Association on a monthly basis to review the</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-H-5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 21</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Company's operational results, financial</P>
<P>performance, business plans and future projections</P>
<P>in order to discuss whether the Company would</P>
<P>continue to experience the substantial decrease in</P>
<P>profitability described above in the absence of the</P>
<P>Reduction; and</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-a-(5)-(c) </B>The Board will review and re-evaluate</P>
<P>the reduction resolution at least every six</P>
<P>months in light of the Company's then-current</P>
<P>operational and financial performance and</P>
<P>projections.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b- Reduction Limits</P>
</B><P>If the Company fully complies with the review and</P>
<P>approval process described in paragraph 1-H-5-a above, it</P>
<P>may initiate a Reduction in accordance with the following:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(1) </B>The Company may initiate the Reduction to</P>
<P>the extent necessary to eliminate flight operations that,</P>
<P>according to the Company's reasonable projections,</P>
<P>produce negative cash flow for the Company over the</P>
<P>projected period of reduced flight operations. As a</P>
<P>general rule, the Company will project cash flow based</P>
<P>on the difference between (i) the net forgone revenues</P>
<P>for the applicable flight operations (including segment</P>
<P>and beyond revenues and after adjusting for revenue</P>
<P>recapture on other Company operations, the resale of</P>
<P>beyond seats, competitive capacity adjustments and</P>
<P>pricing adjustments) and (ii) the actual system-wide</P>
<P>(both segment and beyond) flight operating expenses,</P>
<P>traffic related expenses, aircraft ownership costs</P>
<P>(excluding depreciation), infrastructure and overhead</P>
<P>costs, and cost of capital that are reasonably allocated</P>
<P>to the applicable flight operations.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(2) </B>It is the intent of the Company that a</P>
<P>Reduction will be temporary in nature. At the</P>
<P>conclusion of the Reduction, the Company will resume</P>
<P>the levels set forth in paragraph 1-H-3 and 1-H-4 above</P>
<P>as soon as circumstances warrant; and</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(3) </B>During a Reduction, the Company will not</P>
<P>permit Feeder Carriers to:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(3)-(a) </B>Operate more Small Jets in Feeder</P>
<P>Carrier Operations than were operated in the period</P>
<P>sixty to ninety (60-90) days before the Reduction</P>
<P>except for replacement aircraft permitted by</P>
<P>paragraph 1-C-1-f-(3) above and a maximum of six</P>
<P>(6) Small Jets that (i) are subject to firm and binding</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 22&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-H-5</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>orders at the commencement of the Reduction and</P>
<P>(ii) are placed into active service within twelve (12)</P>
<P>months of the commencement of the Reduction;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(3)-(b) </B>Initiate a scheduled Small Jet</P>
<P>Round Trips in any Market operated by the</P>
<P>Company at any time during the twenty-four (24)</P>
<P>months preceding the Reduction unless the</P>
<P>Company demonstrates that increased Round Trips</P>
<P>initiated in the Market instead of the Small Jet</P>
<P>Round Trip would not pass the BIRR Test; or</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-b-(3)-(c) </B>Increase the number of Small Jet</P>
<P>frequencies, Small Jet block hours or Small Jet</P>
<P>ASMs on any Route operated by the Company at</P>
<P>any time in the twenty-four (24) months preceding</P>
<P>the Reduction, unless the Feeder Carrier provided</P>
<P>Feeder Carrier Small Jet service on the Route for at</P>
<P>least six (6) months immediately prior to the</P>
<P>Reduction and the Company did not serve the Route</P>
<P>during that six-month period.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-c- Pilot Protection during a Reduction</P>
</B><P>Any pilot who is surplussed pursuant to Section 8-K of the</P>
<P>Agreement during a Pay Protection Period who lacks the</P>
<P>seniority to hold an assignment in the same or a higher-paying</P>
<P>pilot position (status and equipment) that he held</P>
<P>prior to the surplus notice, and who bumps into a lower-paying</P>
<P>pilot assignment pursuant to Section 8-K of the</P>
<P>Agreement, will continue to be paid at the hourly pay rate</P>
<P>applicable to his pre-surplus assignment for all work</P>
<P>performed each month in his post-surplus assignment</P>
<P>until the earlier of:</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-c-(1) </B>The date he is activated in an assignment</P>
<P>with an equal or greater hourly pay rate than his pre-surplus</P>
<P>assignment;</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-c-(2) </B>The date he passes up an opportunity to</P>
<P>bid for an available vacancy that his seniority would</P>
<P>permit him to be awarded with an hourly pay rate equal</P>
<P>to or greater than his pre-surplus assignment (in which</P>
<P>case pay protection will be discontinued on the first of</P>
<P>the month following the publication of the award which</P>
<P>caused him to lose his pay protection);</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-c-(3) </B>The first of the month following the date he</P>
<P>retires, provided a pilot who reaches age sixty (60) and</P>
<P>bumps to a Second Officer Position will be pay</P>
<P>protected at the Second Officer rate; or</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-H-5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 23</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-H-5-c-(4) </B>Eighteen (18) months following the date he</P>
<P>is activated into a lower-paying pilot position in</P>
<P>connection with Section 8-K of the Agreement.</P>
<P>A Pay Protection Period means and includes any</P>
<P>period between (i) the first day of a month in which the</P>
<P>Company has failed to reach the minimum block hour</P>
<P>guarantee described in paragraph 1-H-4 and (ii) the</P>
<P>last day of the next occurring month by which the</P>
<P>Company has met the minimum block hour guarantee</P>
<P>described in paragraph 1-H-4 each month for the</P>
<P>preceding twelve (12) consecutive months.</P>
<B><P>1-H-5-d- Circumstances beyond the Company's</P>
<P>Control</P>
</B><P>In addition to the Company's ability to reduce flight</P>
<P>operations under the terms and conditions described in</P>
<P>paragraph 1-H-5-a (Substantial Economic Downturn) and</P>
<P>1-H-5-b (Reduction Limits) above, the commitments and</P>
<P>protections described in paragraph 1-H-1 (Furlough</P>
<P>Protection), 1-H-2 (Active Status Protection), 1-H-3 (Fleet</P>
<P>Size Guarantee), 1-H-4 (Block Hours Guarantee) and 1-H-5-</P>
<P>c (Pay Protection) above may be modified if and only to</P>
<P>the extent that the Company demonstrates that any such</P>
<P>modification is a direct result of a circumstance beyond</P>
<P>the Company's control. The phrase "circumstance beyond</P>
<P>the Company's control" means only a natural disaster, a</P>
<P>labor dispute within the Company involving a cessation of</P>
<P>work, the grounding of a substantial number of Company</P>
<P>Aircraft by a government agency, a reduction in flight</P>
<P>operations directly caused by a supplier's inability to</P>
<P>provide sufficient aircraft, fuel or other critical materials</P>
<P>for the Company's operations, revocation of the</P>
<P>Company's operating certificate(s), a declared or</P>
<P>undeclared war emergency that causes the Company to</P>
<P>cease conducting a substantial portion of its flight</P>
<P>operations, compulsion by a domestic or foreign</P>
<P>government agency, or court or legislative action. For</P>
<P>purposes of clarification, the phrase "circumstance</P>
<P>beyond the Company's control" does not include any</P>
<P>economic or financial considerations including, but not</P>
<P>limited to, the price of fuel, aircraft or other supplies, the</P>
<P>cost of labor, the level of revenues, the state of the</P>
<P>economy, the financial state of the Company, or the</P>
<P>relative profitability or unprofitability of the Company's</P>
<P>then-current operations in the absence of the</P>
<P>circumstances described in the preceding sentence.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 24&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-I</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-I- Labor Disputes</P>
<P>1-I-1- </B>The Agreement contains no contractual prohibition</P>
<P>whatsoever on the ability of ALPA and the United Pilots to</P>
<P>honor lawful picket lines.</P>
<B><P>1-I-2- </B>ALPA and/or the United Pilots are not prohibited from:</P>
<B><P>1-I-2-a- </B>Refusing to layover at a struck hotel or other</P>
<P>struck facility;</P>
<B><P>1-I-2-b- </B>Refusing to deadhead on carriers whose</P>
<P>employees are engaged in a lawful strike, as long as</P>
<P>alternatives are reasonably available; and</P>
<B><P>1-I-2-c- </B>Engaging in a concerted refusal, called by the</P>
<P>Association, to perform pilot work or services on flights</P>
<P>where the Company, pursuant to an agreement or</P>
<P>arrangement with another air carrier, is performing that air</P>
<P>carrier's flying in response to a labor dispute and that air</P>
<P>carrier's employees are engaged in a lawful strike.</P>
<B><P>1-J- Foreign Ownership and Domiciles</P>
<P>1-J-1- </B>The Company shall continue to be a Domestic Air</P>
<P>Carrier subject to the Railway Labor Act, as amended.</P>
<B><P>1-J-2- </B>The Company shall maintain its world headquarters,</P>
<P>executive offices, and offices for senior Flight Operations</P>
<P>personnel in the fifty United States.</P>
<B><P>1-J-3- </B>Neither the Company nor any Affiliate (other than a</P>
<P>Feeder Carrier) shall open, establish or maintain any</P>
<P>additional pilot domicile other than a TDY domicile, outside</P>
<P>the fifty United States without the consent of the Association.</P>
<B><P>1-K- Review Committee</P>
<P>1-K-1- </B>A standing committee, consisting of two (2)</P>
<P>Association representatives and two (2) Company</P>
<P>representatives (plus additional representatives if deemed</P>
<P>appropriate by the Association and the Company) (the</P>
<P>"Related Carrier Review Committee" or "RCRC") shall be</P>
<P>maintained by the parties. The RCRC may establish such</P>
<P>subcommittees as it deems appropriate. The RCRC and its</P>
<P>subcommittees will meet as often as they deem necessary,</P>
<P>but no less than quarterly, in order to implement and monitor</P>
<P>compliance with this Section 1.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-K-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 25</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-K-2- </B>The Company shall provide the RCRC, on a monthly</P>
<P>basis, all information necessary to monitor and enforce the</P>
<P>terms and conditions established in Section 1 of the</P>
<P>Agreement. When this information involves proprietary,</P>
<P>sensitive or confidential information concerning either the</P>
<P>Company or any other carrier, the RCRC will review such</P>
<P>information under a confidentiality agreement with the same</P>
<P>terms as the confidentiality agreement currently in effect</P>
<P>between the Company and the Association with such</P>
<P>modifications, if any, as are acceptable to the Association</P>
<P>and Company.</P>
<B><P>1-K-3- </B>The RCRC shall review all new and modified</P>
<P>agreements concerning the Company's relationships with</P>
<P>other air carriers as governed by this Section 1 in order to</P>
<P>ensure compliance with the terms of this Section 1. In</P>
<P>reviewing agreements with Feeder Carriers, the RCRC shall</P>
<P>make such recommendations to the Company as the RCRC</P>
<P>deems appropriate for the purpose of strengthening the</P>
<P>Company's contractual relationships with Feeder Carriers</P>
<P>and protecting the Company's feed.</P>
<B><P>1-K-4- </B>The parties will utilize appropriate aspects of the</P>
<P>NPDM procedures currently utilized by the System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee in connection with a review of the Feeder Carriers</P>
<P>aimed at ensuring that all Feeder Carriers maintain the</P>
<P>highest possible quality assurance and flight safety programs</P>
<P>and provide a product that meets the Company's high quality</P>
<P>standards.</P>
<B><P>1-L- Remedies</P>
<P>1-L-1- </B>A grievance filed by the Association alleging a</P>
<P>violation of Section 1 of the Agreement, shall, at the request</P>
<P>of either party, bypass the initial steps of the grievance</P>
<P>process and shall be submitted and heard on an expedited</P>
<P>basis directly before the System Board of Adjustment sitting</P>
<P>with a neutral arbitrator. The dispute shall be heard by the</P>
<P>System Board of Adjustment no later than fifteen (15) days</P>
<P>following the submission of the grievance to the System</P>
<P>Board and decided no later than twenty-one (21) days after</P>
<P>such submission, unless the parties agree otherwise in</P>
<P>writing.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 26&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-L-2</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-L-2- </B>If the System Board decides that the Company has</P>
<P>violated any part of Section 1, the System Board will direct</P>
<P>the Company to comply with the Agreement and will fashion</P>
<P>an appropriate remedy for the harm caused by the</P>
<P>Company's failure to comply with the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1-M- Definitions</P>
</B><P>The following definitions shall apply to the capitalized terms</P>
<P>in Section 1 of the Agreement:</P>
<B><P>1-M-1- </B>"Active Fleet" means the Narrowbody and Widebody</P>
<P>aircraft owned or leased by the Company or its Parent (other</P>
<P>than aircraft carried on the Company's books as retired in</P>
<P>accordance with generally accepted accounting principles or</P>
<P>leased to a third party for more than thirty (30) days) and</P>
<P>reported as the Company's system fleet in the Company's</P>
<P>internal fleet planning documents, annual reports and public</P>
<P>filings under the securities laws. For purposes of clarification,</P>
<P>the Company's Active Fleet in any month will be limited to the</P>
<P>Company's in-schedule aircraft plus, in accordance with the</P>
<P>Company's normal and historical practice as of the Effective</P>
<P>Date, a reasonable number of spare aircraft, aircraft</P>
<P>undergoing maintenance, aircraft undergoing reconfiguration,</P>
<P>and aircraft out of service on a short-term basis.</P>
<B><P>1-M-2- </B>" Affiliate" of Entity A means, any other Entity which</P>
<P>directly or indirectly Controls, is Controlled by or is under</P>
<P>common Control with Entity A.</P>
<B><P>1-M-3- </B>"Average Utilization Rate" means on average ten</P>
<P>(10) block hours per each Active Fleet Aircraft per day.</P>
<B><P>1-M-4- </B>"Base Internal Rate of Return" or "BIRR" means the</P>
<P>discount rate at which the net present value of the stream of</P>
<P>Cash Flows generated by the Capital Resources measured</P>
<P>by the Company's customary methods and time periods,</P>
<P>equals zero:</P>
<B><P>1-M-4-a- </B>"Cash Flow" means the after-tax difference</P>
<P>between:</P>
<B><P>1-M-4-a-(1) </B>The actual or reasonably projected</P>
<P>revenues generated by operating the applicable Round</P>
<P>Trip (including the point to point segment revenues and</P>
<P>all beyond revenues not otherwise carried by the</P>
<P>Company's flight operations); and</P>
<B><P>1-M-4-a-(2) </B>The fully allocated expenses incurred to</P>
<P>produce those revenues (including the actual or</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-M-4-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 27</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>reasonably projected cost of operating the Round Trip</P>
<P>and a reasonably allocated portion of the beyond</P>
<P>expenses attributable to the applicable Round Trip</P>
<P>including flight variable, overhead, ownership and</P>
<P>variable beyond traffic costs).</P>
<B><P>1-M-4-b- </B>"Capital Resources" means the assets</P>
<P>necessary to operate the Round Trip consisting of the cost</P>
<P>of the aircraft and all supporting infrastructure such as</P>
<P>gates, slots, ground equipment, spare parts and spare</P>
<P>aircraft that are reasonably allocated to the Round Trip.</P>
<B><P>1-M-4-c- </B>When measuring the rate of return of a Round</P>
<P>Trip, revenues and costs associated with connecting</P>
<P>traffic will be allocated to the Company Round Trip using</P>
<P>the established Company prorate method. Further, where</P>
<P>appropriate the revenues and costs for operating the</P>
<P>aircraft used in the Round Trip over the course of the</P>
<P>aircraft day or international flight cycle as applicable may</P>
<P>be utilized as part of determining the Cash Flow for that</P>
<P>Round Trip. This would include applying the BIRR Test to</P>
<P>a Non-Stop where no Round Trip exists for the operation</P>
<P>to be measured.</P>
<B><P>1-M-5- </B>"Base Internal Rate of Return Test" or "BIRR Test"</P>
<P>means a comparison of the BIRR to the Hurdle Rate. If the</P>
<P>BIRR is less than the Hurdle Rate on the operation to be</P>
<P>measured, the BIRR Test is failed.</P>
<B><P>1-M-6- </B>"Company" means United Air Lines, Inc.</P>
<B><P>1-M-7- </B>"Company Aircraft" includes all aircraft owned or</P>
<P>leased by the Company or a Company Affiliate. Company</P>
<P>Aircraft do not include aircraft that have been sold, leased or</P>
<P>transferred in accordance with Section 1-B-4-a above.</P>
<B><P>1-M-8- </B>"Control": Entity A shall be deemed to ''Control''</P>
<P>Entity B if Entity A, whether directly or indirectly,</P>
<B><P>1-M-8-a- </B>owns securities that constitute, are exercisable</P>
<P>for or are exchangeable into thirty (30%) or more of (i)</P>
<P>Entity B's outstanding common stock or (ii) securities</P>
<P>entitled to vote on the election of directors of Entity B; or</P>
<P>otherwise owns thirty percent (30%) or more of the Equity</P>
<P>of Entity B; or</P>
<B><P>1-M-8-b- </B>maintains the power, right, or authority--by</P>
<P>contract or otherwise--to direct, manage or direct the</P>
<P>management of all or substantially all of Entity B's</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 28&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-M-8-c</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>operations or provides all or substantially all of the</P>
<P>controlling management personnel of Entity B; or</P>
<B><P>1-M-8-c- </B>maintains the power, right or authority to</P>
<P>appoint or prevent the appointment of a majority of Entity</P>
<P>B's Board of Directors or similar governing body; or</P>
<B><P>1-M-8-d- </B>maintains the power, right or authority to</P>
<P>appoint a minority of Entity B's Board of Directors or</P>
<P>similar governing body, if such minority maintains the</P>
<P>power, right or authority to appoint or remove any of Entity</P>
<P>B's executive officers or any committee of Entity B's Board</P>
<P>of Directors or similar governing body, to approve a</P>
<P>material part of Entity B's business or operating plans or</P>
<P>to approve a substantial part of Entity B's debt or equity</P>
<P>offerings.</P>
<B><P>1-M-9- </B>"Domestic Air Carrier" means an Air Carrier as</P>
<P>defined in 49 U.S.C. Section 40102(a)(2).</P>
<B><P>1-M-10- </B>"Entity" means any business form of any kind</P>
<P>including without limitation any natural person, corporation,</P>
<P>company, unincorporated association, division, partnership,</P>
<P>group of Affiliated Entities acting in concert, trustee, trust,</P>
<P>receivership, debtor-in-possession, administrator or</P>
<P>executor.</P>
<B><P>1-M-11- </B>"Equity" means: (i) common stock or other</P>
<P>securities that carry the right to vote for one or more</P>
<P>members of a board of directors or similar governing body, or</P>
<P>shares or interests in a partnership or limited partnership</P>
<P>which shares or interests have general voting rights (all of</P>
<P>the foregoing being collectively referred to as "Common</P>
<P>Equity") and (ii) securities that are then currently or in the</P>
<P>future exchangeable into, exercisable for, or convertible into</P>
<P>Common Equity.</P>
<B><P>1-M-12- </B>"Feeder Carrier" means a Domestic Air Carrier that,</P>
<P>when engaged in code sharing with the Company:</P>
<B><P>1-M-12-a- </B>Does not operate any aircraft that utilizes an</P>
<P>engine with an external propeller ("Turbo/Prop Aircraft")</P>
<P>other than Turbo/Prop Aircraft that are certificated for</P>
<P>seventy-eight (78) or fewer seats and have a maximum</P>
<P>permitted gross takeoff weight of less than seventy-five</P>
<P>thousand (75,000) pounds; and</P>
<B><P>1-M-12-b- </B>Does not operate any aircraft that utilizes a</P>
<P>turbine-driven engine without an external propeller ("Jet</P>
<P>Aircraft"), other than Small Jets.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 1-M-13&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 29</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-M-13- </B>"Feeder Flying" means flight operations conducted</P>
<P>by a Feeder Carrier pursuant to paragraph 1-C-1 and flight</P>
<P>operations conducted by AWAC under paragraph 1-C-1-f-(4).</P>
<B><P>1-M-14- </B>"Feeder Carrier Ratio" means a relationship in any</P>
<P>calendar quarter between ASMs scheduled in Feeder Flying</P>
<P>and ASMs scheduled in the Company's Large-Gauge</P>
<P>Narrowbody flying, equal to 7.7 + (.09 x (SJ-21)), expressed</P>
<P>as a percentage and rounded to the nearest one tenth of a</P>
<P>percent, where "SJ" is the average number of Small Jets</P>
<P>operated in Feeder Flying by Feeder Carriers as a group in</P>
<P>that calendar quarter.</P>
<B><P>1-M-15- </B>"Foreign Air Carrier" means an air carrier that is not</P>
<P>a Domestic Air Carrier.</P>
<B><P>1-M-16- </B>"Gateway" (used with or without capitalization)</P>
<P>means an airport in the United States from which the</P>
<P>Company engages in non-stop flights to and from foreign</P>
<P>points.</P>
<B><P>1-M-17- </B>"Key City" means DCA, MIA, LGA, EWR, JFK, and</P>
<P>SEA and any other city that is identified as a hub (currently</P>
<P>IAD, ORD, DEN, SFO and LAX) in the Company's Annual</P>
<P>Report on Form 10-K.</P>
<B><P>1-M-18- </B>"Hurdle Rate" means the internal rate of return</P>
<P>established by the Company for allocating capital resources</P>
<P>for airline related expenditures.</P>
<B><P>1-M-19- </B>"Industry Standard Interline Agreement" means an</P>
<P>agreement or other arrangement between two carriers or</P>
<P>among three or more carriers, such as the International Air</P>
<P>Transport Association's "Multilateral Interline Traffic</P>
<P>Agreements," establishing rights and obligations relating to</P>
<P>the transportation of through passengers and/or through</P>
<P>shipments by the party carriers.</P>
<B><P>1-M-20- </B>"Joint International Non-Stop Market" means a</P>
<P>Non-Stop Market in which parties to an International Code</P>
<P>Share Agreement may apply their respective designator</P>
<P>codes to each other's flight(s).</P>
<B><P>1-M-21- </B>"Large-Gauge Narrowbody Aircraft" means solely</P>
<P>for the purposes of Section 1, the Company's B-737, A-319,</P>
<P>A-320, B-727 and B-757 aircraft plus any future aircraft with</P>
<P>single aisle configuration and a certificated seating capacity</P>
<P>in the United States of at least one hundred (100) seats.</P>
<B><P>1-M-22- </B>"Market" means a pair of airports, e.g., ORD-MSP.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 30&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1-M-23</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1-M-23- </B>"Narrowbody Aircraft" means solely for the</P>
<P>purposes of Section 1 the Company's Small-Gauge and</P>
<P>Large-Gauge Narrowbody Aircraft.</P>
<B><P>1-M-24- </B>"Non-Stop" means a flight in a Market that does not</P>
<P>include a scheduled intervening take off and landing.</P>
<B><P>1-M-25- </B>''Parent'' refers to UAL Corp. (''UAL'') or any other</P>
<P>Entity that has majority control of the Company, whether</P>
<P>directly or indirectly through the majority control of other</P>
<P>Entities that have majority control the Company.</P>
<B><P>1-M-26- </B>"Round Trip" means a pair of flights to and from one</P>
<P>city in a Market to the other, e.g. ORD-STL-ORD.</P>
<B><P>1-M-27- </B>"Small-Gauge Narrowbody" means solely for the</P>
<P>purpose of Section 1 aircraft with seventy (70) to ninety-nine</P>
<P>(99) seats.</P>
<B><P>1-M-28- </B>"Small Jets" means Jet Aircraft that are certificated</P>
<P>in the United States of America for fifty (50) or fewer seats</P>
<P>and a maximum permitted gross takeoff weight of less than</P>
<P>sixty thousand (60,000) pounds. If an FAA-certificated small</P>
<P>jet aircraft type (e.g., an RJ-50-100) meets the requirements</P>
<P>of this definition when first placed into operation by a Feeder</P>
<P>Carrier but is subsequently certificated for operation in the</P>
<P>United States with a maximum seating capacity in excess of</P>
<P>50 seats, the Small Jet aircraft type may continue to be</P>
<P>operated by any Feeder Carrier as long as all Feeder</P>
<P>Carriers operate such aircraft type with no more than 50</P>
<P>seats at all times.</P>
<B><P>1-M-29- </B>"United States" when referring to geographical</P>
<P>extent means only the States of the United States of America</P>
<P>and the District of Columbia.</P>
<B><P>1-M-30- </B>"United States and Territories" means the United</P>
<P>States and its territories and possessions including but not</P>
<P>limited to the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico.</P>
<B><P>1-M-31- </B>"Widebody Aircraft" means, solely for the purpose</P>
<P>of Section 1, the Company's B-767, DC-10, B-777, B-747 and</P>
<P>B-747-400 aircraft and any future aircraft with a multiple-aisle</P>
<P>seating configuration and with a maximum certificated gross</P>
<P>takeoff weight in the United States of no less than three</P>
<P>hundred twenty thousand pounds.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 2-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 31</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 2</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Definitions</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2-A- Pilot</P>
</B><P>"Pilot" means Captain, First Officer, International Relief Pilot</P>
<P>and Second Officer on the United Air Lines Second Officer</P>
<P>Eligibility Seniority List, whether or not the pilot is assigned</P>
<P>to the Company's Shuttle operation, and including those</P>
<P>Second Officers unable to perform pilot duties under FAR 121</P>
<P>who will also be referred to as "pilot" for purpose of this</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>2-B- Captain</P>
</B><P>"Captain" means a pilot who is in command of the aircraft and</P>
<P>its crew members while on duty and who is responsible for</P>
<P>the manipulation of or who manipulates the controls of an</P>
<P>aircraft including take-off and landing of such aircraft, and</P>
<P>who is properly qualified to serve as and holds a currently</P>
<P>effective airman's certificate authorizing him to serve as such</P>
<P>pilot.</P>
<B><P>2-C- First Officer</P>
</B><P>"First Officer" means a pilot who is second in command and</P>
<P>any part of whose duty is to assist or relieve the Captain in</P>
<P>the manipulation of the controls of an aircraft including take-off</P>
<P>and landing of such aircraft, and who is properly qualified</P>
<P>to serve as and holds a currently effective airman's certificate</P>
<P>authorizing him to serve as such First Officer. On aircraft</P>
<P>operated with a Captain and First Officer only, the First</P>
<P>Officer shall inspect the aircraft before flight.</P>
<B><P>2-D- International Relief Pilot</P>
</B><P>An "International Relief Pilot" is a pilot who shall be qualified</P>
<P>to provide relief, on those flights on which he is required, at</P>
<P>the Captain, First Officer and Second Officer stations. Such</P>
<P>qualifications shall be established by the Company to permit</P>
<P>him to accomplish:</P>
<B><P>2-D-1- </B>Pre-flight, post-flight and en route First Officer</P>
<P>duties, not including take-off or landing of the aircraft.</P>
<B><P>2-D-2- </B>All Second Officer duties.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 32&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 2-D-3</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2-D-3- </B>Any other duties assigned to him by the Company or</P>
<P>the pilot in command.</P>
<B><P>2-D-4- </B>An International Relief Pilot will be third in command</P>
<P>on a flight on which he serves.</P>
<B><P>2-E- Second Officer</P>
</B><P>"Second Officer" means a pilot who is third in command (or</P>
<P>fourth in command in 4-man crew) whose duties as a member</P>
<P>of the flight crew are to assist the Captain, First Officer and</P>
<P>International Relief Pilot in the analysis, operation and</P>
<P>monitoring of the mechanical and electrical systems of the</P>
<P>aircraft, to relieve other flight crew members and to inspect</P>
<P>the aircraft before flight and who is properly qualified to serve</P>
<P>as and holds currently effective airman's certificates</P>
<P>authorizing him to serve as such Second Officer, including a</P>
<P>Commercial Pilot's License and Instrument Rating and Flight</P>
<P>Engineers certificate.</P>
<B><P>2-F- Lineholder</P>
</B><P>"Lineholder" means a Captain, First Officer, International</P>
<P>Relief Pilot or Second Officer who is assigned to a line of</P>
<P>flying (not including a secondary line) in his assigned status</P>
<P>and equipment type for the month as a result of the</P>
<P>"Schedule Selection Procedure."</P>
<B><P>2-G- Reserve</P>
</B><P>"Reserve" means a Captain, First Officer, International Relief</P>
<P>Pilot or Second Officer who is not a lineholder.</P>
<B><P>2-H- Line of Flying</P>
</B><P>"Line of Flying" means a planned pattern of trip sequences</P>
<P>and intervening days off constructed so as to not exceed</P>
<P>eighty-one (81) hours of credited flight time.</P>
<B><P>2-I- Secondary Line</P>
</B><P>A "Secondary Line" is composed of flying which is</P>
<P>unassigned after the assignment of lines of flying for a month</P>
<P>and which is then combined into a month's schedule for</P>
<P>assignment to reserve pilots.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 2-J&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 33</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2-J- Allocation of Flying</P>
</B><P>"Allocation of Flying" means the establishment of hours of</P>
<P>flying in an equipment type at a domicile.</P>
<B><P>2-K- Assignment of Flying</P>
</B><P>'Assignment of Flying" means the designation of specific trips</P>
<P>to be flown in an equipment type from a domicile.</P>
<B><P>2-L- Pilot Status</P>
</B><P>"Status" means a pilot's assigned classification as either</P>
<P>Captain, First Officer, International Relief Pilot or Second</P>
<P>Officer.</P>
<B><P>2-M- Open Flying</P>
</B><P>"Open Flying" means trips and portions of trips which, after</P>
<P>the schedule selection process, remain unassigned or</P>
<P>become unassigned due to any pilot absence.</P>
<B><P>2-N- Flight Time</P>
</B><P>"Flight Time" (block-to-block) means the time from the</P>
<P>moment an aircraft moves from the blocks, under its own</P>
<P>power or under tow, for the purpose of flight until the time the</P>
<P>aircraft comes to rest at the unloading point at the next point</P>
<P>of landing.</P>
<B><P>2-O- Month</P>
</B><P>"Month" means that for pilot scheduling and pay purposes the</P>
<P>period from the first day of, to and including the last day of</P>
<P>each of twelve (12) 30 or 31 day periods.</P>
<P>Prior to December 31, 2000, the Company will publish the</P>
<P>schedule of calendar months which will remain in effect for</P>
<P>the term of the Agreement. In leap year, the Company may</P>
<P>modify one (1) 30 day month to a 31 day month.</P>
<B><P>2-P- Domicile</P>
</B><P>"Domicile" means a geographical location designated by the</P>
<P>Company where pilots are based.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 34&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 2-Q</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2-Q- Pilot's Schedule</P>
</B><P>"Pilot's Schedule" means a monthly work assignment and</P>
<P>associated trip information which is published by the</P>
<P>Company and assigned to a pilot.</P>
<B><P>2-R- Trip or Trip Sequence</P>
</B><P>"Trip or Trip Sequence" is a series of flight segments, starting</P>
<P>with the initial departure from the pilot's domicile and ending</P>
<P>with the final arrival at the pilot's domicile, which are</P>
<P>combined as a package for preparation of pilot schedules or</P>
<P>for assignment to a pilot.</P>
<B><P>2-S- Hours Flown</P>
</B><P>"Hours Flown" means the actual flight time from block-to-block</P>
<P>recorded cumulatively on a stop-to-stop basis.</P>
<B><P>2-T- Geographical Relocation of Assignments</P>
</B><P>"Geographical Relocation of Assignments" is that process</P>
<P>whereby pilot assignments at a domicile, associated with</P>
<P>flying which have been and can (based on available entries of</P>
<P>the equipment at the domicile) continue to be flown by pilots</P>
<P>at that domicile, are relocated to another domicile(s) from</P>
<P>which the flying can also be accomplished.</P>
<B><P>2-U-</P>
</B><P>"He", "Him", "His" - The masculine pronouns used herein</P>
<P>shall include the feminine unless specifically excluded.</P>
<B><P>2-V- Pilot Concurrence</P>
</B><P>In any assignment where the Agreement requires pilot</P>
<P>concurrence, pilot concurrence will be construed to mean</P>
<P>that the pilot will be advised his concurrence is required and</P>
<P>he will accept or reject any offered options prior to being</P>
<P>scheduled for such assignment. The Company may request a</P>
<P>pilot, and the pilot may concur, to waive only those specific</P>
<P>provisions of the Agreement which specify a waiver is</P>
<P>permissible.</P>
<B><P>2-W- Equipment Domicile</P>
</B><P>A domicile wherein pilots hold assignments in a designated</P>
<P>equipment type.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 2-X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 35</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2-X- Student Pilot</P>
</B><P>A "Student Pilot" is an individual who reports to United</P>
<P>Airlines for initial training as a United Airlines flight officer in</P>
<P>contemplation of continuing employment as a United Airlines</P>
<P>pilot. Student Pilots shall be employees and pilot seniority</P>
<P>shall commence as of the first day of training per Section 6 of</P>
<P>this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>2-Y- Only Reserve Available</P>
</B><P>A reserve pilot will be considered to be the only reserve</P>
<P>available if he falls within either of the following situations:</P>
<B><P>2-Y-1- </B>Time-critical departure. A reserve can be assigned to</P>
<P>an open flight as the only reserve available if (1) that</P>
<P>assignment can be made within his applicable duty and flight</P>
<P>time limitations and (2) assigning another reserve would</P>
<P>cause the operation in question to be delayed, further</P>
<P>delayed or canceled.</P>
<B><P>2-Y-2- </B>Planned coverage. A reserve can be assigned to an</P>
<P>open flight as only reserve available in order to avoid junior</P>
<P>manning.</P>
<B><P>2-Y-3- </B>In the event that it becomes necessary to use an</P>
<P>inbound reserve to cover an open trip and there is more than</P>
<P>one reserve legal and available per a. above for coverage of</P>
<P>the open trip, the reserve whose arrival time is closest to the</P>
<P>report time but not less than thirty (30) minutes before the</P>
<P>departure of the open trip will be considered the only reserve</P>
<P>available for the assignment.</P>
<B><P>2-Z- Mainline</P>
</B><P>All of the Company's operations other than the Shuttle</P>
<P>operation as defined in Letter 00-XX.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 36&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 2-Z</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Page Intentionally Left Blank</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Section 3-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 37</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 3</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Compensation</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>3-A- Longevity For Pay Purposes</P>
<P>3-A-1- </B>Longevity as a pilot with the Company shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Commencement</P>
</I><P>commence to accrue as of the date on which a pilot is first&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of Longevity</P>
</I><P>released from technical training at DENTK (excluding IOE</P>
<P>preparation or any similar training) and shall continue to</P>
<P>accrue except as otherwise provided in sub-paragraphs 2</P>
<P>and 3 of this Paragraph. Longevity increases will be paid on</P>
<P>the first of that month for longevity dates from the first</P>
<P>through the twentieth of the month, and on the first of the</P>
<P>following month for the longevity dates after the twentieth.</P>
<B><P>3-A-2- </B>Pilots shall not accrue longevity as a pilot during any</P>
<P>period that seniority ceases to accrue. Once longevity</P>
<P>commences, as provided by 3-A-1, above, pilots shall accrue</P>
<P>longevity as a pilot during any period that seniority accrues,</P>
<P>except that longevity shall not accrue during any period of</P>
<P>furlough according to the provisions of Section 7-E.</P>
<B><P>3-A-3- </B>Any pilot who resigns from the service of the</P>
<P>Company or is discharged for just cause or loses seniority as</P>
<P>provided in Paragraph 7-D of Section 7 shall forfeit all</P>
<P>longevity accrued to the date of such resignation or</P>
<P>discharge.</P>
<B><P>3-B- Hourly Rates</P>
<P>3-B-1- </B>The hourly rates for Captains, First Officers,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hourly Rates</P>
</I><P>International Relief Pilots and Second Officers who are on</P>
<P>the Second Officers Seniority Eligibility List shall be as</P>
<P>follows. The hourly rates, overrides, and incentive pay</P>
<P>established in this Section 3 shall govern all aspects of pilot</P>
<P>compensation.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 38&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 3-B-1-a</P>

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3-B-1-b-
First Officers</P>
<P>3-B-1-b-(1) </B>The following First Officer rates will apply</P>
<P>to individuals employed as a First Officer at any time</P>
<P>during the period April 13, 2000 up to, and including,</P>
<P>the date upon which this Agreement is signed (DOS).</P>
<P>These rates will apply for all retroactive pay</P>
<P>calculations, and a First Officer will continue to receive</P>
<P>pay after the DOS according to this table until he</P>
<P>receives his next longevity increase. (All First Officers</P>
<P>being paid according to the "12th yr" rates listed below</P>
<P>on DOS will continue to receive this hourly rate until</P>
<P>May 1, 2001). Upon reaching his next longevity date</P>
<P>after the DOS, the First Officer will be entitled to the</P>
<P>rates listed in 3-B-1-b-(2). If, however, the pilot's next</P>
<P>longevity date after DOS is on or after May 1, 2001, he</P>
<P>will receive pay according to the rates in effect as of</P>
<P>May 1, 2001. Additionally, if a pilot becomes eligible for</P>
<P>the rates listed in 3-B-1-b-(2), but such rate is less than</P>
<P>the rate he received prior to reaching his longevity</P>
<P>date, he will continue to be paid at the hourly rate he</P>
<P>received on the DOS:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 3-B-1-a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 39</P>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DC-10-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;767/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A319/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<B><P>3-B-1-d- </B>The following International Overrides will be</P>
<P>paid for actual flight hours flown in the international</P>
<P>operation and will be in addition to any other hourly and/or</P>
<P>incentive pay. First Officers who have been activated into</P>
<P>their assignments on or before date of signing (DOS) will</P>
<P>be paid the First Officer Monthly International Override or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Incumbent First</P>
</I><P>the International Hourly Override for actual hours flown in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Officer receives</P>
</I><P>the international operation, whichever is greater. A First&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>greater of hourly</P>
</I><P>Officer who has been activated into his assignment on or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>or monthly</P>
</I><P>before the DOS will also continue to receive the greater of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>International</P>
</I><P>the First Officer Monthly International Override or the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Override</P>
</I><P>International Hourly Override for actual hours flown in the</P>
<P>international operation if his next assignment after the</P>
<P>DOS is First Officer in the same equipment type at a</P>
<P>different domicile (lateral award). First Officers activated</P>
<P>into their assignments after DOS will be paid the</P>
<P>International Hourly Override for actual hours flown in the</P>
<P>international operation.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 41</P>

<P>Effective May 1, 2002 the hourly rates for Captains, First</P>
<P>Officers, International Relief Pilots and Second Officers who</P>
<P>are on the Second Officers Seniority Eligibility List shall be</P>

<P>SECOND OFFICERS</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B747&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DC10-F&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DC10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B727</P>
</B><P>1yr&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;54.35&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;54.35&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;54.35&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;54.35</P>
<P>2yr&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;95.79&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;92.68&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;84.28&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;70.30</P>
