</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>3-B-3- </B>The rates stipulated in Section 3-B-1 and 3-B-2</P>
<P>include the terrain pay differential heretofore paid by the</P>
<P>Company and as set forth in Decision 83 and such composite</P>
<P>rates shall be paid for all flying whether such flying is over</P>
<P>flat or mountainous terrain, on or off the Company's air</P>
<P>routes and recognizes the application of the traditional base,</P>
<P>hourly, mileage and gross weight pay factors.</P>
<B><P>3-B-4- Minimum Guarantee</P>
<P>3-B-4-a- </B>Each pilot shall be paid for not less than&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Minimum</P>
</I><P>seventy-five (75) hours of pay credit each month (seventy-seven&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Guarantee 75</P>
</I><P>(77) hours in a flex month), unless he has an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
hours (77 in a flex</P>
</I><P>unpaid absence during that month. Further, any pay credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month) for all</P>
</I><P>which exceeds eighty-five (85) hours in any month shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilots with a</P>
</I><P>not be paid, but shall be placed in a "bank", as provided in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>maximum of 85</P>
</I><P>3-I, below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours pay per</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;month</P>
</I><B><P>3-B-4-b- </B>A lineholder's salary each month shall be</P>
<P>determined as follows:</P>
<P>The Pay Credit Value of each pilot's assigned line shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Determination of</P>
</I><P>determined as provided in Section 5-G-3, after taking into&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;L/H's pay credit</P>
<P>consideration the effect of any carry-over trip from the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;value for the</P>
<P>prior month, including any reassignment accomplished&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;month</P>
<P>under the provisions of Section 5-B-1-b. This pay credit</P>
<P>value may be increased and/or decreased due to (1)</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 48&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section3-B-4-c</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>operational loss of flying, (2) reassignment, (3) voluntary</P>
<P>open flying and (4) credit produced by the Minimum</P>
<P>Schedule Provisions, Actual Credit Provisions or Actual</P>
<P>Flight Time Provisions of Section 5-G-3-e.</P>
<B><P>3-B-4-c- </B>Lineholders assigned to a line of flying with a</P>
<P>flight time credit projection of less than seventy-five (75)</P>
<P>hours (seventy-seven (77) hours in a flex month) who trip</P>
<P>trade into a trip, or drop and subsequently pick up a trip,</P>
<P>the value of which is equal to or greater than the value of</P>
<P>the original trip shall not have his guarantee reduced</P>
<P>below seventy-five (75) hours (seventy-seven (77) hours</P>
<P>in a flex month).</P>
<B><P>3-B-4-d- </B>Each reserve shall be paid for the greater of the</P>
<P>following:</P>
<B><P>3-B-4-d-(1) </B>Seventy-five (75) pay credit hours, as</P>
<P>provided by "a" above, or</P>
<B><P>3-B-4-d-(2) </B>The pay credit value of all trips flown in the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Determination of</P>
</I><P>month as computed under the "Minimum Schedule&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserve pay credit</P>
</I><P>Provisions, Actual Credit Provisions or Actual Flight&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>value for the</P>
</I><P>Time Provisions'' of Section 5-G-3-e. Any pay credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month. Bank for</P>
</I><P>produced over eighty-five (85) hours shall not be paid&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserves</P>
</I><P>in that month, but shall be placed in a ''bank'', as</P>
<P>described in ''3-I'', below.</P>
<B><P>3-B-4-d-(3) </B>In a flex month, the seventy-five (75) pay&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve minimum</P>
</I><P>credit hour minimum in Section 3-B-4-d-(1) above shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>guarantee 77</P>
</I><P>be increased to seventy-seven (77) pay credit hours for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours in flex</P>
</I><P>all reserves in the fleet(s) that are designated for the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month</P>
</I><P>flex month.</P>
<B><P>3-B-5- </B>Monthly Line Guarantee</P>
<B><P>3-B-5-a- </B>A lineholder shall be paid for the greater of the</P>
<P>following:</P>
<B><P>3-B-5-a-(1) </B>Seventy-five (75) pay credit hours&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
Lineholder</P>
</I><P>(seventy-seven (77) hours in a flex month),&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minimum</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B><I>guarantee 77</P>
</I><B><P>3-B-5-a-(2) </B>the Pay Credit Value of his schedule, as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours in flex</P>
</I><P>determined by 3-B-4 above, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month</P>
</I><B><P>3-B-5-a-(3) </B>the Pay Credit Value of his schedule as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pay protection for</P>
</I><P>determined by 3-B-4 above, substituting the scheduled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>trips that depart</P>
</I><P>pay credit value of any trip pairing(s) in his line for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>on or after the
</P>
</I><P>which he is available that is scheduled to depart on or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>20th</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 3-B-5-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 49</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>after the 20th day of the calendar month. This</P>
<P>projected line value is determined by adding the pay</P>
<P>credit already earned prior to the 20th day of the</P>
<P>calendar month to the scheduled Pay Credit Value of</P>
<P>the remaining trip pairing(s). The ''scheduled Pay</P>
<P>Credit Value'' of the remaining trip(s), for the purpose</P>
<P>of this provision is the Pay Credit Value of the trip(s) as</P>
<P>it existed prior to the 20th day of the calendar month.</P>
<B><P>3-B-5-b- </B>In the event that a trip pairing is scheduled to</P>
<P>operate over the month end, the Pay Credit Value</P>
<P>protected under this provision is limited to that credit</P>
<P>which is scheduled to occur in the current month.</P>
<B><P>3-B-6- </B>Any pay credit produced by the application of Section&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>One hour pay for</P>
</I><P>3-J of the International Supplement shall be in addition to all&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>fuel stops over</P>
</I><P>pay credit produced by the application of this Section 3-B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and above the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;guarantee</P>
</I><B><P>3-B-7- Incentive Pay</P>
</B><P>In addition to the Monthly Pay Credit Value determined under</P>
<P>the provisions of this Section 3, each lineholder and reserve</P>
<P>will receive incentive pay over and above his Pay Credit</P>
<P>Value for the month under the following provisions:</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-a- </B>Late Night Flying - Domestic trips that are</P>
<P>operated under the provisions of Section 5-G-1-f will</P>
<P>produce incentive pay in accordance with the following:</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-a-(1) </B>Incentive pay for late night trips will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilots will receive</P>
</I><P>calculated based on the scheduled flight time of the trip&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>incentive pay fo</I>r</P>
<P>between the hours of 2300 and 0659 home domicile&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled flight</P>
</I><P>time.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>time between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;2300 and 0659</P>
</I><B><P>3-B-7-a-(2) </B>Incentive pay will be credited to the pilot at&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actually flown</P>
</I><P>the time the trip departs on the initial segment of the</P>
<P>pairing. However, this incentive will not be paid if the</P>
<P>pilot subsequently removes himself from the trip prior</P>
<P>to departing on the Late Night Flight as defined in</P>
<P>Section 5-G-1-f-(1)-(b).</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-a-(3) </B>The amount of incentive pay will be $15.00</P>
<P>for Captains, $10.00 for First Officers, and $5.00 for</P>
<P>Second Officers for each qualifying hour.</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-b- Operational Integrity</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 50&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 3-B-7-d</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>When a pilot reports for a trip under the provisions of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>If crew agrees to</P>
</I><P>Section 5-G-2-d, he shall receive five (5) hours of<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;minimum rest at</P>
</I><P>incentive pay at his hourly rate, provided he reports for<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;layover in order to</P>
</I><P>duty for the first segment following his rest period under<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;make an on time</P>
</I><P>Section 5-G-2-d. In addition to this incentive pay, the pilot<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;departure they will</P>
</I><P>shall receive pay and credit for the value of the original<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;receive 5 hours of</P>
</I><P>scheduled ID or the pay and credit for the flying actually<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;incentive pay</P>
</I><P>performed, whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-c- Senior/Junior Man</P>
</B><P>A pilot who accepts an assignment under the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 20-H-14 shall receive incentive pay as follows:</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-c-(1) </B>The pilot will be credited with incentive pay<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pilot who accepts</P>
</I><P>equal to 50% of the pay credit value of the assigned<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assignment under</P>
</I><P>trip. However, the incentive pay will be reduced by the<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;senior/junior man</P>
</I><P>difference in the value of the trip(s) dropped, if any,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>provision shall</P>
</I><P>compared to the value of the trip assigned. If incentive<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;receive incentive</P>
</I><P>pay is reduced in accordance with the foregoing the<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pay up to 50% of</P>
</I><P>pilot's guarantee will be increased by the amount the<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the pay credit</P>
</I><P>incentive pay is reduced, not to exceed the pilot's flight<I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;value of the</P>
</I><P>pay credit projection before the assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assigned trip</P>

</I><B><P>3-B-7-c-(2) </B>The flight pay credit projection of a pilot's</P>
<P>line of flying who accepts an assignment under Section</P>
<P>20-H-14 will be the value of his line immediately before</P>
<P>or immediately following the trip assignment and repair</P>
<P>of his line, if any, whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-c-(3) </B>The 50% incentive, adjusted for the</P>
<P>difference in trip value, if any, will be credited to the</P>
<P>pilot when he departs on the first segment of the trip</P>
<P>assigned to him under this provision.</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-d- </B>Incentive pay will be separate and apart from</P>
<P>any other flight time credit and will not be subject to</P>
<P>reductions or offsets as provided for in any other section</P>
<P>of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>3-B-7-e- </B>Accrued incentive pay will be paid as a separate</P>
<P>line item on the pilot's monthly paycheck for the month in</P>
<P>which it is earned.</P>
<B><P>3-C- Unpaid absences</P>
</B><P>Unpaid absences shall reduce a pilot's salary as follows:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 3-C-1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 51</P>
<P>3-C-1- Lineholders</P>
<P>3-C-1-a- </B>Pay credit hours which are reduced from those&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Unpaid absences</P>
</I><P>credited hours in excess of seventy-five (75) (seventy-seven&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for hours in</P>
</I><P>(77) hours in a flex month) shall be reduced on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>excess of
the</P>
</I><P>one-for-one basis; i.e., one (1) hour dropped shall reduce&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minimum</P>
</I><P>pay by one (1) hour.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>guarantee</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reduced on an</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hour for hour</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;basis</P>
</I><B><P>3-C-1-b- </B>A pilot who is scheduled for fewer than seventy-five&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Formula for</P>
</I><P>(75) credit hours (seventy-seven (77) hours in a flex&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduction of pay</P>
</I><P>month), whose pay is based on the seventy-five (75) hour&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for unpaid</P>
</I><P>guarantee (seventy-seven (77) hours in a flex month),&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>absences for</P>
</I><P>shall have his pay reduced by the amount produced by&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours less than</P>
</I><P>dividing the number of credit hours dropped by the number&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>the minimum</P>
</I><P>of credit hours in the line before the drop and then&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>guarantee</P>
</I><P>multiplying by his guarantee salary, e.g., a five (5) hour</P>
<P>drop from a seventy (70) hour line would reduce a</P>
<P>$5,000.00 salary by $357.00.</P>
<B><P>3-C-2- Reserves</P>
</B><P>Each standby day shall be worth four hours and ten minutes&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve standby</P>
</I><P>(4:10) of pay credit, not to exceed seventy-five (75) hours&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>day worth 4:10</P>
</I><P>(seventy-seven (77) hours in a flex month) in any one (1)</P>
<P>month.</P>
<B><P>3-C-3- Prorating Pay</P>
</B><P>When it is necessary to adjust salary due to a rate change in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Mid-month hourly</P>
</I><P>mid-month, the value of each hour shall be determined as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rate change</P>
</I><P>above and the pilot's salary shall be the composite produced</P>
<P>by the number of hours at each rate..</P>
<B><P>3-D-</P>
</B><P>Pilots who are permitted to trade trip sequences shall have</P>
<P>their salaries adjusted by recalculating each pilot's salary to</P>
<P>include the effect of the trade.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 52&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 3-E</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>3-E-</P>
<P>3-E-1- </B>A pilot who is permitted to drop a trip shall have his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>ANP salary</P>
</I><P>salary reduced as in 3-C above. If he subsequently picks up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>adjustment and</P>
</I><P>open flying, his salary will be restored on an hour for hour&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restoration</P>
</I><P>basis calculated on the same basis as the reduction.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;procedures</P>
<B><P>3-E-2- </B>In addition to the pick-up of open time, a pilot may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Restore ANP by</P>
</I><P>restore his salary by agreeing to stand by as a reserve on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>standing reserve</P>
</I><P>day suggested by the Company. The number of days of</P>
<P>availability will be declared by the pilot at the time he accepts</P>
<P>the offer to standby and he shall be restored salary at the</P>
<P>rate of four hours and ten minutes (4:10) per standby day or</P>
<P>the number of credit hours actually performed, if greater.</P>
<P>Pilots under this provision will be placed on the reserve list</P>
<P>as number one.</P>
<B><P>3-F-</P>
</B><P>The monthly guarantee provided in this Section 3 shall not</P>
<P>apply to those pilots who are unable to fly because all or part</P>
<P>of the Company's airplanes are not available for flight for</P>
<P>reasons other than those normally encountered in regular</P>
<P>scheduled operations, for such time that the affected pilots</P>
<P>are unable to fly and the provisions of Section 3-C-1 and 3-C-2</P>
<P>shall apply.</P>
<B><P>3-G-</P>
</B><P>When in line operations a Captain, with his concurrence, is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Captain flying As</P>
</I><P>assigned to serve as a First Officer, his monthly salary shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>First Officer</P>
</I><P>continue to be paid at the rates applicable to his awarded</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>3-H- Displacement</P>
</B><P>When Company officials whose names appear on the Pilot's&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Partial trip</P>
</I><P>System Seniority List or pilots acting in a supervisory&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>displacement</P>
</I><P>capacity or any pilot not actually assigned to airline flying, fly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>requires 24-hour</P>
</I><P>any trip for which compensation is paid, the scheduled pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>notification</P>
</I><P>shall not have his salary reduced. Further, the Company may</P>
<P>displace a pilot for an entire trip. If the Company desires to</P>
<P>displace a pilot for a partial trip, the pilot must be given</P>
<P>twenty-four (24) hour notification of the intended</P>
<P>displacement. If the pilot is not given a twenty-four (24) hour</P>
<P>notification of the intended displacement he will not be</P>
<P>displaced without his concurrence. Additionally, an</P>
<P>augmenting First Officer who is displaced for any reason will</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 3-I&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 53</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>not be assigned to another First Officer position on the trip</P>
<P>from which he was displaced without his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>3-I- Bank</P>
</B><P>If, in any given month, a pilot acquires pay credit in excess of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hours in excess</P>
</I><P>eight-five (85) pay credit hours, that excess shall be held in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of 85 put in bank</P>
</I><P>his ''bank'' and administered according to the following&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for pilots</P>
</I><P>provisions (for the application of this paragraph, the value of</P>
<P>a "reserve availability day" shall be four hours and ten</P>
<P>minutes (4:10)):</P>
<B><P>3-I-1- </B>The accounting for bank credits shall be in dollars.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bank balance</P>
</I><P>When entered into the bank, the hours and minutes earned&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>maintained in</P>
</I><P>shall be converted to dollars and cents at the pilot's current&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>dollars</P>
</I><P>rate of pay. Whenever bank credit is paid out or used for a</P>
<P>trip drop, the bank balance will be converted back to hours</P>
<P>and minutes at the pay rate applicable to the pilot at the time</P>
<P>of the pay out.</P>
<B><P>3-I-2- </B>A pilot's bank balance will be updated once each</P>
<P>month, showing his balance as of the first day of the pilot</P>
<P>schedule month, after his pay for the prior month has been</P>
<P>finalized. That balance shall be used in the computation</P>
<P>required by 3-I-4, below, to determine eligibility for bank</P>
<P>drops.</P>
<B><P>3-I-3- </B>At the end of each month, if a pilot's earned pay credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Available bank</P>
</I><P>in that month does not produce eighty-five (85) hours of pay,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>trip used to cap</P>
</I><P>any bank balance available as of the last day of that month&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pay to 85 hours</P>
</I><P>will be used to increase the pilot's pay up to eighty-five (85)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for lineholders</P>
</I><P>hours. Bank time paid in this manner will not be used as an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and reserves</P>
</I><P>offset for the monthly minimum guarantees.</P>
<B><P>3-I-4- </B>Pilots will be required to reduce excess bank time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bank trip drop and</P>
</I><P>accumulation by dropping trips, or reserve availability days,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduction of</P>
</I><P>from their schedules. The pilot will receive pay for and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserve</P>
</I><P>accrued bank time will be reduced by the pay value of the trip&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>availability day</P>
</I><P>or reserve availability day(s) dropped, not including any pay&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>procedure</P>
</I><P>credit which would normally be credited to the following</P>
<P>month.</P>
<B><P>3-I-5- </B>A pilot will be considered to be eligible for a bank drop&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bank trip drop and</P>
</I><P>in any month in which his bank balance is high enough to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduction of</P>
</I><P>satisfy the following conditions: After month-end schedule&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserve day</P>
</I><P>adjustments are completed for the transition from the current&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;availability</P>
<P>month to the following month, the projected Pay Credit Value&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;eligibility</P>
<P>of the pilots schedules in both months will be examined and</P>
<P>the amount of bank time necessary to provide the pilot with</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 54&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 3-I -6</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>eight-five (85) hours of pay in both months will be forecast.</P>
<P>Next, that bank time needed to increase the pilot's pay to</P>
<P>eighty-five (85) hours in both months will be subtracted from</P>
<P>the pilot's official bank balance as of the first of the current</P>
<P>month. If there is sufficient bank time left to cover the entire</P>
<P>Pay Credit Value of any complete trip pairing, or reserve</P>
<P>availability day, originating in the following month's schedule,</P>
<P>the pilot is eligible for a bank drop in that following month.</P>
<B><P>3-I-6- </B>Once a trip, or reserve availability day, is dropped for</P>
<P>bank time, it will no longer be considered part of the pilot's</P>
<P>schedule (except as provided in 3-I-6-a and 3-I-6-b, below)</P>
<P>and the pay credit value of the dropped trip, or reserve</P>
<P>availability day, shall be removed from his bank balance.</P>
<B><P>3-I-6-a- </B>For the purpose of qualifying the pilot for open</P>
<P>flying under 20-H-3 and 20-H-5, the scheduled flight time</P>
<P>of the dropped trip will remain in the pilot's projection for</P>
<P>the month in which the dropped trip originated.</P>
<B><P>3-I-6-b- </B>For the application of Section 3-C-1, above, Pay</P>
<P>Credit Value of the dropped trip, or reserve availability</P>
<P>day, will be considered to remain in the pilot's line.</P>
<B><P>3-I-7- </B>It is recognized that, due to the operational events</P>
<P>which may occur after a trip is dropped for bank time, a pilot</P>
<P>may not have sufficient time in his bank to provide a full</P>
<P>eighty-five (85) hours of pay in any month.</P>
<B><P>3-I-8- </B>In any month in which a pilot is eligible for a bank&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Trip drops and</P>
</I><P>drop, he will be required to drop a trip, or reserve availability&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduction of</P>
</I><P>day, unless the Company defers the drop due to manpower&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserve day</P>
</I><P>considerations. The Company may defer bank drops for two&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>availability may be</P>
</I><P>consecutive months. A bank drop may not be deferred and is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>deferred until the</P>
</I><P>required no later than the third consecutive month in which&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>third month of</P>
</I><P>the pilot is eligible for a drop. If the Company defers the drop&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;eligibility</P>
<P>in the first month that the pilot is eligible and the pilot is not</P>
<P>eligible for a drop in the following month, or if the drop is</P>
<P>deferred for two consecutive months and the pilot is not</P>
<P>eligible for a drop in the third month, then the next month in</P>
<P>which the pilot is eligible will be considered the ''first month''</P>
<P>in which he is eligible for the purposes of this deferral</P>
<P>process and the pilot is again subject to a Company deferral,</P>
<P>as above.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 3-I-9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 55</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>3-I-9- </B>The Company shall determine which trip sequence, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot may make</P>
</I><P>reserve availability day, will be dropped; however, in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>his desire for trip</P>
</I><P>anticipation of becoming eligible for a bank drop, a pilot may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>or reserve</P>
</I><P>request in advance the trip, or reserve availability day, which&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>availability day</P>
</I><P>he wants to drop or the days off which he wants to acquire.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>drop known to</P>
</I><P>The pilot's request must be received by the Company within&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company. Final</P>
</I><P>48 hours after the publication of lineholder schedules for the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>determination</P>
</I><P>month in which the drop is requested. (This procedure will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>made by</P>
</I><P>similar to that used to protect specific days off from a PC&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company</P>
</I><P>assignment.) The Company will accommodate the pilot's</P>
<P>request within the constraints of available manpower,</P>
<P>however the Company will make the final determination</P>
<P>regarding the selection of trip, or reserve availability day, to</P>
<P>be dropped.</P>
<B><P>3-I-10- </B>Any remaining bank balance which a pilot has on the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bank balance</P>
</I><P>date his pay begins for another assignment (excluding&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>paid out on</P>
</I><P>activations which change only the pilot's domicile) will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>December 16 or</P>
</I><P>paid to the pilot within 45 days of his activation. Further, all&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>when pilot</P>
</I><P>pilots' bank balances which exist as of the first of December&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>changes status or</P>
</I><P>each year will be paid to the pilots on the 16th of December.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>equipment type</P>
</I><B><P>3-J- Call out</P>
</B><P>When a pilot at his home domicile is called to the airport to fly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot receives 2</P>
</I><P>a scheduled flight or to deadhead to protect a scheduled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours pay credit </P>
</I><P>flight, and he does not fly or the pay credit value of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>added to his</P>
</I><P>assignment, as performed, is less than two (2) hours, he shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>projection when</P>
</I><P>nonetheless be credited with 2 hours of pay credit. This sub-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>called to airport</P>
</I><P>paragraph does not apply to training or instruction flights,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and he does not</P>
</I><P>familiarization and route qualifying flights. Further, it does not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>fly</P>
</I><P>apply to a pilot's completing his interrupted trip or to a pilot</P>
<P>who flies a trip scheduled within two (2) hours of the time</P>
<P>called for such flying. In the case of a reserve pilot, the two</P>
<P>(2) hours credit shall have the same pay application as two</P>
<P>(2) hours of actual flying time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 56&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 3-J</P>

</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Section 4-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 57</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 4</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Expenses, Lodging, and Transportation</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>4-A- Expenses</P>
<P>4-A-1- </B>Effective April 12, 2000, pilots when on duty or on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hourly Expense</P>
</I><P>flight assignment including qualifying flight duty shall receive&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Allowance</P>
</I><P>Two Dollars ($2.00) per hour, prorated from the time he is</P>
<P>scheduled to report for duty or actually reports for duty,</P>
<P>whichever is later and shall continue until termination of duty</P>
<P>or flight assignment upon return to his home domicile. This</P>
<P>$2.00 rate will be increased by ten (10) cents on May 1,</P>
<P>2001, May 1, 2002, May 1, 2003 and May 1, 2004.</P>
<B><P>4-A-2- </B>It is understood that a meal will be boarded for each</P>
<P>crew member on all flight segments scheduled for over four</P>
<P>(4) hours non-stop or when any portion of the on duty period,</P>
<P>exclusive of report and debrief exceeds five (5) consecutive</P>
<P>hours with the scheduled time on the ground at any point,</P>
<P>one and one half (1-1/2) hours or less. A crew breakfast</P>
<P>always will be provided on the first scheduled segment</P>
<P>whenever the crew has a duty period scheduled to originate</P>
<P>between 0001 and 0800. A snack will be boarded in addition</P>
<P>to other required crew meals on any flight scheduled for five</P>
<P>(5) or more hours of flight time. Other than the crew meal</P>
<P>provided in this sub-paragraph, crew meals will not be</P>
<P>boarded on any flight unless requested by the System</P>
<P>Schedule Committee or Hotel Committee for all crews</P>
<P>assigned that trip sequence for the entire month.</P>
<P>When the Company boards meals at the request of the</P>
<P>System Schedule Committee or Hotel Committee, the</P>
<P>payment provided in sub-paragraph 1 above, will be reduced</P>
<P>by the cost of such meal to the Company. For the purpose of</P>
<P>this provision, the cost to the pilots when requesting a meal</P>
<P>shall be as follows:</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Breakfast&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$2.00</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lunch&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$4.25</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dinner&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$4.25</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Snack&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$3.50</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 58&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 4-A-3</P>
<P>4-A-3- </B>In addition to the standard allowances set forth in</P>
<P>sub-paragraph 4-A-1 above, a pilot deadheading on</P>
<P>Company business in the cabin will be provided with the</P>
<P>normal meal service aboard such aircraft.</P>
<B><P>4-A-4- </B>The Company will provide a supply of "energy" food</P>
<P>to be available for the pilot at his request on all flights. The</P>
<P>type and location of this food will be reviewed with the</P>
<P>Association on a periodic basis.</P>
<B><P>4-B-</P>
<P>4-B-1-</P>
<P>4-B-1-a- </B>Pilots when scheduled for layovers in excess of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hotel rooms</P>
</I><P>four (4) hours shall be furnished suitable single occupancy&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>provided for</P>
</I><P>lodging in a quiet room in a suitable location. Rooms will&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>layovers of 4</P>
</I><P>be located within fifteen (15) minutes normal driving time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours or more</P>
</I><P>from the airport and transportation will be provided within&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>will be within 15</P>
</I><P>fifteen (15) minutes of the crew's scheduled or planned&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minutes driving</P>
</I><P>arrival time whichever is later.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>time</P>
</I><B><P>4-B-1-a-(1) </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph B-1-a above,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hotel rooms may</P>
</I><P>whenever a pilot (including a reserve) is scheduled for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>be waived by the</P>
</I><P>any layover (block to block) in excess of four (4) hours,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilot for layovers</P>
</I><P>but no more than five (5) hours, the crew desk may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>between 4 and 5</P>
</I><P>contact the pilot prior to departure of the trip sequence&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours</P>
</I><P>and request his waiver of the layover hotel room.</P>
<P>Lineholders may advise the crew desk of their</P>
<P>requirements on a monthly basis. If the room is not</P>
<P>available upon arrival for those pilots who have not</P>
<P>agreed to waive the room, the pilot may arrange for his</P>
<P>own room and be reimbursed as per Section 4-B-1-c-(</P>
<P>1) and 4-B-1-c-(2).</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-a-(2) </B>Pilots when on layover of less than four (4)</P>
<P>hours shall be furnished suitable lounge facilities as</P>
<P>necessary to minimize fatigue. Such facilities shall be</P>
<P>reviewed periodically with the Association.</P>
<P>In the event the Company is unable to provide the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hotel room may</P>
</I><P>above lounge facilities at non-domicile airports, the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>be used in lieu of</P>
</I><P>Association may request and the Company will provide&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>lounge at non-</P>
</I><P>mutually acceptable off airport facilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>domicile locations</P>
</I><B><P>4-B-1-b- </B>A Hotel/Transportation Representative(s) of the</P>
<P>pilots shall meet quarterly with representatives of the</P>
<P>Company or more frequently, if needed, to review the</P>
<P>suitability of layover and training lodging accommodations</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 4-B-1-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 59</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>and/or rest facilities and transportation for pilots. The</P>
<P>parties shall be guided by the current Hotel Protocol and</P>
<P>this Protocol may only be modified by the mutual</P>
<P>agreement of the Parties. It is the intent of the parties to</P>
<P>this Agreement that the Hotel/Transportation</P>
<P>representative shall be given the opportunity to consult</P>
<P>with and make recommendations to the Company on the</P>
<P>suitability of accommodations and/or transportation within</P>
<P>the following limitations:</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-b-(1) </B>Guidelines for the selection of hotels/</P>
<P>motels shall be established by agreement between the</P>
<P>Company and the Association Representatives. The</P>
<P>agreed upon guidelines and evaluation form will be</P>
<P>used as a criteria for determining hotels or motels used</P>
<P>for layovers. If changes or modifications are desired by</P>
<P>either party, conferences will be held between the</P>
<P>Company and Association Representatives, for the</P>
<P>purpose of concluding what these changes or</P>
<P>modifications shall be. If changes or modifications in</P>
<P>the criteria or evaluation form are mutually agreed</P>
<P>upon, these changes will be put into effect. Copies of</P>
<P>the evaluation form will be retained by the Company</P>
<P>and Association as long as the hotel/motel is used as a</P>
<P>layover facility.</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-b-(2) </B>If a change in hotel/motel facilities is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
Hotel change</P>
</I><P>requested, the Company and the Association&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
request</P>
</I><P>Representative or their designees will within thirty (30)</P>
<P>days jointly inspect other available facilities before</P>
<P>making the change. Nothing herein would prevent prior</P>
<P>agreement on acceptable facilities or deleting from</P>
<P>such list at any time. Once a mutually acceptable</P>
<P>facility is located, the Company will change to that</P>
<P>facility within 60 days if the hotel is located within the</P>
<P>United States and within 90 days if the hotel is located</P>
<P>outside of the United States. If changes are made at</P>
<P>the request of the Association Representative, no</P>
<P>further changes from that hotel will be requested for a</P>
<P>minimum of one (1) year, except by mutual agreement.</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-b-(3) </B>The selection by the Company of the hotel/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hotel dispute</P>
</I><P>motel and/or the transportation used to and from such&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>resolution</P>
</I><P>facility will be from the list of available facilities which</P>
<P>have been jointly approved. If no joint approval can be</P>
<P>reached, the Senior Vice President of Flight Operations</P>
<P>and the UAL-MEC Chairman shall meet to attempt to</P>
<P>reconcile such differences. If the Senior Vice President</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 60&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 4-B-1-c</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>of Flight Operations and the UAL-MEC Chairman</P>
<P>cannot reach agreement, the Company will make the</P>
<P>final determination.</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-b-(4) </B>Prompt investigation will be made and</P>
<P>appropriate action taken by the Company to correct</P>
<P>any deterioration of service or facilities within thirty</P>
<P>(30) days of being reported by the Hotel/Motel</P>
<P>Transportation Representative.</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-b-(5) </B>A Downtown Hotel shall be defined as a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Definition of</P>
</I><P>hotel located within a city's core business district. The&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Downtown</P>
</I><P>Parties may choose to select a hotel outside a city's&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Location</P>
</I><P>core business district, but the Association reserves the</P>
<P>right to return to that city's core business district in</P>
<P>accordance with paragraph 4-B-1-b-(2) above</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-c-</P>
<P>4-B-1-c-(1) </B>If the rooms provided by the Company are</P>
<P>not available, the pilot may obtain lodging and claim</P>
<P>reasonable actual lodging expense on the regular</P>
<P>Company expense account form supported by the hotel</P>
<P>receipt.</P>
<B><P>4-B-1-c-(2) </B>Pilots when at other than their regular</P>
<P>layover station shall receive reasonable actual</P>
<P>expenses for lodging when supported by a receipt</P>
<P>unless suitable lodging as provided in Paragraph 4-B-1-</P>
<P>a of this Section is furnished by the Company.</P>
<B><P>4-B-2-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B><I>Hotel workers on</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;strike</P>
</I><B><P>4-B-2-a- </B>If an employee work stoppage is encountered at</P>
<P>any layover facility, the Company will consult with the</P>
<P>hotel/motel transportation representative and, if</P>
<P>requested, attempt to relocate layover crews at another</P>
<P>mutually acceptable facility.</P>
<B><P>4-C-</P>
<P>4-C-1- </B>Standard allowances provided in Paragraph 4-A of</P>
<P>this Section will be allowed automatically and lodging, as</P>
<P>provided in Paragraph 4-B of this Section, will be allowed</P>
<P>when a pilot lays over at any layover point in connection with</P>
<P>flight duties other than qualifying flight duty. In applying this</P>
<P>Paragraph to reserve pilots, they shall be considered as</P>
<P>standing in the same place as the pilot in whose schedule the</P>
<P>trip appears.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 4-C-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 61</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>4-C-2- </B>When a pilot is required to layover away from his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Qualifying</P>
</I><P>domicile in connection with qualifying flight duty, and the cost&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>expenses</P>
</I><P>of the lodging and/or necessary transportation is not billed</P>
<P>directly to the Company, he will be entitled to claim</P>
<P>reasonable actual lodging and/or transportation expenses on</P>
<P>a regular Company expense account form.</P>
<B><P>4-D- Transportation</P>
<P>4-D-1- </B>When transportation provided by the Company at a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Layover</P>
</I><P>layover point does not leave within thirty (30) minutes after&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>transportation</P>
</I><P>actual block arrival, pilots may use any other available means&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pick-up at airport</P>
</I><P>of ground transportation to their place of lodging and may</P>
<P>claim reimbursement for expenses for such transportation on</P>
<P>the regular Company expense account form and pilots shall</P>
<P>be reimbursed therefor.</P>
<B><P>4-D-2- </B>Hotel pick up times will be arranged to have the pilots&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hotel pick-up</P>
</I><P>arrive at the airport in sufficient time to report for duty at their&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>times</P>
</I><P>assigned report time. Pick-up times will be adjusted with</P>
<P>regard to the time of day and day of week of planned travel</P>
<P>so that the pilot is not required to arrive excessively early for</P>
<P>his scheduled report time.</P>
<B><P>4-D-3- </B>In the event a pilot's trip sequence originates at one&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Crosstown</P>
<P>airport and terminates at another airport at his home&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;transportation</P>
<P>domicile, the pilot shall be furnished transportation one way</P>
<P>between one airport and the other at his option. A pilot</P>
<P>assigned to a schedule involving this type of operation shall</P>
<P>advise the Company prior to the start of the schedule, the</P>
<P>one direction he desires such transportation during the</P>
<P>period he is assigned to that schedule. When transportation</P>
<P>does not leave within (30) minutes of actual block arrival</P>
<P>such pilot may use any other available means of ground</P>
<P>transportation between one airport and the other and may</P>
<P>claim reimbursement for expenses for such transportation on</P>
<P>the regular Company expense account form and said pilot</P>
<P>shall be reimbursed therefor.</P>
<B><P>4-D-4- </B>When a pilot is scheduled to originate and terminate&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Doubletown</P>
</I><P>a trip sequence at an airport serving his domicile other than&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>mileage</P>
</I><P>the domicile airport, as defined in Section 5-G-1-a-(2), he&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>allowance</P>
</I><P>shall receive for the actual performance of the scheduled trip</P>
<P>a mileage allowance of twenty-nine cents (29) per mile or</P>
<P>Company policy, whichever is greater, for the round trip</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 62&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 4-D-5</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>driving distance between the domicile airport and the airport</P>
<P>at which the trip originates and terminates. Further, he shall</P>
<P>receive Fifteen Dollars ($15.00) per hour and the meal</P>
<P>allowance set forth in Paragraph 4-A-1, prorated, based on</P>
<P>the applicable time listed in Section 5-G-1-b-(3).</P>
<B><P>4-D-5- </B>If transportation provided by the Company is reported&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Unacceptable</P>
</I><P>to be unacceptable by the Hotel/Transportation Committee,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>layover</P>
</I><P>the Company and the Association representative or their&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>transportation</P>
</I><P>designees will within thirty (30) days jointly inspect other</P>
<P>available transportation before making the change. Once a</P>
<P>mutually acceptable mode of transportation is located, the</P>
<P>Company will change to that mode at the earliest possible</P>
<P>time. Nothing herein would prevent prior agreement on</P>
<P>acceptable transportation. If no joint approval can be</P>
<P>reached, the Senior Vice President of Flight Operations and</P>
<P>the UAL-MEC Chairman shall meet to attempt to reconcile</P>
<P>such differences. If the Senior Vice President of Flight</P>
<P>Operations and the UAL-MEC Chairman cannot reach</P>
<P>agreement, the Company will make the final determination.</P>
<B><P>4-E- Miscellaneous Assignments</P>
<P>4-E-1- </B>When a pilot is away from his home domicile at&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>TDY per diem</P>
</I><P>Company request for temporary flight duty, he will receive the</P>
<P>standard allowances provided in Paragraph 4-A of this</P>
<P>Section from the time of the departure of the trip on which he</P>
<P>deadheads to begin the assignment until the time of the</P>
<P>arrival of the trip on which he returns to his home domicile at</P>
<P>the completion of the assignment, except that such expenses</P>
<P>will be discontinued during any period of days off during</P>
<P>which he returns to his home domicile or residence.</P>
<P>Additionally, the pilot will receive twenty-five dollars ($25.00)</P>
<P>per day for the entire duration of the TDY assignment. For</P>
<P>purposes of this paragraph, a TDY assignment begins one</P>
<P>day prior to the pilot's first required day on duty and ends one</P>
<P>day after the completion of his last duty period. The pilot will</P>
<P>be provided suitable single lodging accommodations paid for</P>
<P>by the Company or be reimbursed for reasonable actual hotel</P>
<P>expenses if he is required to secure his own</P>
<P>accommodations. The pilot shall also be furnished</P>
<P>transportation to and from his temporary domicile, plus</P>
<P>transportation between the lodgings and the airport or</P>
<P>expenses therefor if such transportation is not furnished by</P>
<P>the Company. Such expenses shall be claimed on a regular</P>
<P>Company expense account form and must be submitted</P>
<P>within ten (10) days after incurring the expenses. The</P>
<P>Company will allow actual and necessary laundry and</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 4-E-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 63</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>cleaning expenses when temporary duty is for more than five</P>
<P>(5) consecutive days.</P>
<B><P>4-E-2- </B>When pilots are away from their home domicile on</P>
<P>special assignment for the Company other than those</P>
<P>provided for in Paragraph 4-E-1 above, reasonable actual</P>
<P>expenses will be allowed for meals, transportation, laundry</P>
<P>and lodging when not provided by the Company. All such</P>
<P>expenses will be claimed on regular Company expense</P>
<P>account forms and must be submitted within ten (10) days</P>
<P>after incurring the expenses. Upon application, a pilot will be</P>
<P>given an advance by the Company to cover such expense</P>
<P>while on special assignment and within five (5) days after</P>
<P>returning to his domicile or at the close of each week in the</P>
<P>event a pilot is away for a period longer than one (1) week,</P>
<P>he shall submit an expense account for such advance in</P>
<P>accordance with Company regulations and if he has returned</P>
<P>to his domicile, such expense account shall be accompanied</P>
<P>by the balance of any money advanced and not accounted for</P>
<P>on such expense accounts.</P>
<B><P>4-E-3- </B>When pilots perform special assignments at their</P>
<P>domiciles not directly associated with their duties at the</P>
<P>Company's request, they shall receive reasonable actual</P>
<P>expenses for transportation and/or meals. Such expense</P>
<P>shall be claimed in accordance with Company regulations on</P>
<P>Company expense account forms within ten (10) days after</P>
<P>incurring the expenses.</P>
<B><P>4-F-</P>
</B><P>In those cases wherein pilots are entitled to claim actual</P>
<P>reasonable expenses for meals and/or transportation, they</P>
<P>may claim up to fifteen per cent (15%) of such expenses to</P>
<P>cover gratuities.</P>
<B><P>4-G-</P>
</B><P>Expenses for the Charter Operation will be as provided in this</P>
<P>Section, except that pilots assigned to the International</P>
<P>Charter Operation shall receive, in addition to the expenses</P>
<P>provided in this Section, Fifty Cents ($0.50) for each hour</P>
<P>away from home.</P>
<B><P>4-G-1- </B>Should isolated cases of unusual expenses be</P>
<P>encountered by a pilot which the expense allowance will not</P>
<P>normally cover, the Company will reimburse the pilot for such</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 64&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 4-H</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>expenses upon receipt of a documented Company expense</P>
<P>form.</P>
<B><P>4-H-</P>
</B><P>Pilots shall be allowed actual reasonable cleaning expenses,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reimbursement of</P>
</I><P>when supported by a receipt from a commercial cleaner for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>cleaning</P>
</I><P>the cleaning of the following uniform items: jacket, vest,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>expenses</P>
</I><P>trousers, necktie, shirt and outer coat.</P>
<B><P>4-I-</P>
<P>4-I-1- </B>In the event the Company makes a change to the pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Replacement</P>
</I><P>uniform and requires pilots to wear such new uniform item(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>uniforms at</P>
</I><P>(and disallows the wearing of the old item(s), if a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company cost</P>

</I><P>replacement), the purchase cost of these new uniform item(s)</P>
<P>will be borne by the Company. This provision does not cover</P>
<P>the acquisition costs of routine replacements required by age</P>
<P>and wear.</P>
<B><P>4-I-2- </B>The cost of a new hire pilot's standard initial uniform</P>
<P>issue will be borne by the Company. Contract Admin Home</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 5-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 65</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 5</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Hours of Service</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>5-A-</P>
</B><P>This Agreement contemplates that pilots shall devote their</P>
<P>entire professional flying service to the Company provided</P>
<P>that nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to prevent</P>
<P>any pilot from affiliating or assuming duties with the military</P>
<P>services of the United States.</P>
<B><P>5-B- Flight Time Limitations and Flexible Months</P>
</B><P>The Company may, at its option, designate any month as a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company may</P>
</I><P>flexible month (flex month) for which the normal monthly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>designate four</P>
</I><P>schedule and actual limits stated in this Section 5-B, and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>flex months per</P>
</I><P>where referenced throughout this Agreement, may be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>year</P>
</I><P>increased for any fleet by up to two (2) hours. The Company</P>
<P>may designate such flex months in no more than four (4)</P>
<P>months in any calendar year. The Company will notify ALPA</P>
<P>and the pilots of its intention to increase the monthly</P>
<P>schedule and actual limits in any fleet prior to the SSC</P>
<P>meeting at which the affected month's schedules are to be</P>
<P>reviewed. The Company may not increase the normal</P>
<P>monthly schedule and actual limits under this Section 5-B</P>
<P>when any pilot is on furlough.</P>
<B><P>5-B-1- Scheduling Provisions</P>
