<P>5-B-1-a- </B>Schedules published for preferencing shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Monthly schedule</P>
</I><P>contain no more than eighty-one (81) flight credit hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limit 81 credit</P>
</I><P>Should the last trip in a prior month require adjustment to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours. With</P>
</I><P>an awarded schedule, the adjusted schedule shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>monthly SSC</P>
</I><P>limited to eighty-one (81) actual flight hours. The Local&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>concurrence lines</P>
</I><P>Schedule Committee, with the concurrence of the SSC&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>may exceed</P>
</I><P>and the Company, may authorize the construction of lines&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>schedule limit by</P>
</I><P>of flying in any equipment domicile to exceed the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>up to 30 minutes</P>
</I><P>applicable monthly schedule limit by up to thirty (30)</P>
<P>minutes, provided the extended monthly schedule limit</P>
<P>improves the quality of the affected lines.</P>
<B><P>5-B-1-b- </B>If a pilot is scheduled to fly a trip sequence&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Month-end</P>
</I><P>originating in the prior month which is projected to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>conflict repair</P>
</I><P>interfere with or make him illegal for any part of his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>procedure</P>
</I><P>awarded schedule in the new month, he may be</P>
<P>reassigned by the Company to any flying for which he is</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 66 Section&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-B-2</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>legal in the new month. Under this provision, he may be</P>
<P>assigned up to eighty-one (81) actual hours and up to the</P>
<P>same number of calendar days for which he was originally</P>
<P>scheduled. Assignment of the replacement trip(s) shall be</P>
<P>subject to the following:</P>
<B><P>5-B-1-b-(1) </B>Every reasonable effort will be made to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot may</P>
</I><P>comply with a pilot's request to retain certain&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>designate certain</P>
</I><P>designated days off, provided his request is received&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days holy from</P>
</I><P>within forty-eight (48) hours of the publication of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month-end repair</P>
</I><P>lineholder schedules. Additionally, during this forty-eight</P>
<P>(48) hour period, a pilot may indicate a desire for</P>
<P>a repair in the current month if possible, rather than in</P>
<P>the following month. This assignment shall be made</P>
<P>prior to the beginning of the subject month.</P>
<B><P>5-B-1-b-(2) </B>In making repairs under this Paragraph,</P>
<P>consideration will be given to minimizing disruption to</P>
<P>the pilot's line(s), consistent with schedule efficiencies.</P>
<B><P>5-B-1-b-(3) </B>A trip may be inserted into a line under</P>
<P>these provisions only if it does not create another</P>
<P>illegality within that line.</P>
<B><P>5-B-1-b-(4) </B>New trip(s) may be substituted for trip(s) in</P>
<P>the previous month's line, with pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>5-B-2- Actual Performance Limits</P>
<P>5-B-2-a- </B>Eighty-one (81) actual flight hours shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Actual monthly</P>
</I><P>constitute the monthly maximum, including the value of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>flight limitations</P>
</I><P>any inbound time produced by the completion of a trip</P>
<P>sequence which originated in the prior month; unless the</P>
<P>pilot volunteers to eighty-three (83) flight hours as</P>
<P>provided by 5-B-3, below. When a pilot is projected to</P>
<P>exceed eighty-one (81) hours of actual flight time, a trip or</P>
<P>a portion of a trip will be removed from his schedule to</P>
<P>reduce his projected flight time to the actual monthly</P>
<P>maximum or less, or his projection prior to departing his</P>
<P>domicile, whichever is higher. The selection of the trip or</P>
<P>portion of a trip to be dropped will be subject to</P>
<P>concurrence between the pilot and the crew desk unless</P>
<P>concurrence cannot be reached, in which case a Flight</P>
<P>Manager will decide. Further, should the Local Schedule</P>
<P>Committee, with the concurrence of the SSC and the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>With SSC</P>
</I><P>Company, authorize the construction of lines of flying in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>concurrence</P>
</I><P>any equipment domicile to exceed the applicable monthly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual limit may</P>
</I><P>schedule limit by up to thirty (30) minutes, as provided in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>be exceeded by</P>
</I><P>above, the 81/83 hour maximums stated in this paragraph&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>up to 30 minutes</P>
</I><P>shall be increased by an amount equal to the time which</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-B-2-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 67</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>the scheduled lines of flying exceed the monthly schedule</P>
<P>limits.</P>
<B><P>5-B-2-b- </B>A reserve shall be limited to seventy-five (75)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserves limited</P>
</I><P>actual flight hours. A reserve may exceed the monthly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>to 75/81 actual</P>
</I><P>credit limit as long as his actual projection does not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours</P>
</I><P>exceed seventy-five (75) hours. However, a reserve may</P>
<P>fly up to eighty-one (81) actual flight hours provided his</P>
<P>flight pay credit does not exceed eighty-one (81) hours.</P>
<B><P>5-B-2-c- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of 5-B-2-a,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot will fly last</P>
</I><P>above, a lineholder may be required to continue to fly his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>trip of month even</P>
</I><P>schedule even if he becomes projected over 81 hours (or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>if projected over</P>
</I><P>83, if applicable), so long as he was projected at or below&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>81/83 as</P>
</I><P>81 hours (or 83, if applicable) before departing on his next&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>applicable due to</P>
</I><P>to last trip of the month. Further during the performance of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual flying or</P>
</I><P>a pilot's last trip of the month, the limitations of 5-B-2-a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassignment</P>
</I><P>above (with respect to a lineholder) and 5-B-2-b above</P>
<P>(with respect to a reserve) shall not apply and he may be</P>
<P>required to complete his schedule. A reserve pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve may be</P>
</I><P>involved in a reassignment under this provision shall not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassigned over</P>
</I><P>be available to any greater extent than a lineholder and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>75/77 hours if</P>
</I><P>may be assigned to exceed the limits in 5-B-2-b above&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>given the same</P>
</I><P>only when given the same assignment as the other&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment as</P>
</I><P>members of the disrupted crew.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>other crew</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;members</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-B-3- Operational Flexibility</P>
</B><P>Notwithstanding the 81 hour actual monthly flight time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot may opt to</P>
</I><P>limitation of 5-B-1 and 5-B-2, above, a lineholder may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>fly up to 83 actual</P>
</I><P>elect to fly up to 83 actual flight hours. A pilot may make&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours</P>
</I><P>this election at any time including during the line award</P>
<P>process, in which case any adjustment made necessary</P>
<P>by an inbound carry-over conflict can be repaired up to 83</P>
<P>actual flight hours.</P>
<B><P>5-B-3-a- </B>A pilot who has not previously elected to fly over&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot may concur</P>
</I><P>81 hours may, with his concurrence, be reassigned under&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>to be reassigned</P>
</I><P>Section 20-F-1 and 20-F-2 to flying which exceeds 81&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>up to 83 actual</P>
</I><P>flight hours, but in no event more than 83 actual flight&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours</P>
</I><P>hours, unless it is his last trip of the month.</P>
<B><P>5-B-3-b- </B>A pilot who at any time agrees to fly above 81</P>
<P>actual hours shall be considered available up to 83 hours</P>
<P>for the remainder of the relevant month.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 68&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-B-3-c</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>5-B-3-c- </B>This 83 flight hour flexibility provision shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Open time pick up</P>
</I><P>applicable to all monthly flight time limitations; except for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limited to 81</P>
</I><P>the pick up of open flying under the provisions of Section&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual hours</P>
</I><P>20-H-3 and 20-H-5, which are limited to 81 flight hours.</P>
<B><P>5-B-3-d- </B>This flexibility provision shall not be available at</P>
<P>any time that any pilots are on furlough.</P>
<B><P>5-B-4- Reassignment Limitations</P>
<P>5-B-4-a- </B>If a lineholder is assigned or reassigned under&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reassignment</P>
</I><P>the provisions of Section 20-H or 20-I, he shall be limited,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>under 20-H and I</P>
</I><P>at the time of the assignment to eighty-one (81) actual&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>are limited to a</P>
</I><P>flight hours or to his projection just prior to the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<I>pilot's projection</P>
</I><P>reassignment, if higher. Should an assignment be given&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>or 81 actual hours</P>
</I><P>which, at the time of that assignment, projects a pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>which ever is</P>
</I><P>above the applicable limit, he shall have a trip or a portion&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>greater. Any</P>
</I><P>of a trip removed from his schedule upon his return to his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment</P>
</I><P>domicile at the completion of the assignment, in order to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>projecting pilot</P>
</I><P>reduce his projection to or below the applicable limit. The&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>above these limits</P>
</I><P>selection of the trip or portion of a trip to be dropped will&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>must have his</P>
</I><P>be subject to concurrence between the pilot and the crew&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>projection</P>
</I><P>desk unless concurrence cannot be reached, in which&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduced upon</P>
</I><P>case a Flight Manager will decide.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>returning home</P>
</I><B><P>5-B-5- </B>A pilot on reserve part of the month and assigned to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserves with</P>
</I><P>a line of flying under Section 20 for some portion of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>partial line</P>
</I><P>month shall, if such assignment results in a projection higher&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment</P>
</I><P>than the actual monthly maximum at the time he starts flying&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limited to 75</P>
</I><P>the line of flying, have a trip(s) or portion of a trip deleted&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual hours</P>
</I><P>from the line of flying to produce a projection equal to or less</P>
<P>than the actual monthly maximum. The monthly maximum for</P>
<P>this application shall be as provided in 5-B-2-b above.</P>
<B><P>5-B-6- </B>Trips which originate in the current month and project</P>
<P>into the following month shall have only that time scheduled</P>
<P>prior to 2400 home domicile time of the last day of the month</P>
<P>credited to the current month.</P>
<B><P>5-B-7- </B>When a pilot has been on duty aloft in excess of eight&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>8 in 24 requires at</P>
</I><P>(8) hours in any consecutive twenty-four (24) hours, he shall,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>least 12 hours</P>
</I><P>upon completion of his assigned flight or series of flights be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rest</P>
</I><P>given at least twelve (12) hours for rest before being</P>
<P>assigned any further duty with the Company.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-B-8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 69</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-B-8- </B>A pilot shall not be scheduled for duty aloft for more&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>No 2 for 1 rest</P>
</I><P>than eight (8) hours during any duty period. At the completion&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>application</P>
</I><P>of each duty period a pilot shall be scheduled for a rest</P>
<P>period of no less than the applicable minimum provided by</P>
<P>Section 5-G-1-c. In the actual operation, the minimum rest</P>
<P>requirement shall be no less than (a) the actual rest period</P>
<P>provided by Section 5-G-2-c below or (b) the rest period</P>
<P>prescribed by the applicable FAR, whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>5-B-9- </B>A pilot shall not be scheduled for duty aloft if his total&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>30 in 7</P>
</I><P>flight time will exceed thirty (30) hours in any seven (7)</P>
<P>consecutive twenty-four (24) hour period.</P>
<B><P>5-B-10- </B>If a pilot is projected to become illegal, under the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Procedure for</P>
</I><P>provisions of Paragraph 5-B-7, 5-B-8 and/or 5-B-9 above, he&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>correcting 8 in 24</P>
</I><P>shall continue to fly his assigned trip until he is actually&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>problems</P>
</I><P>illegal except as provided below:</P>
<B><P>5-B-10-a- </B>If a pilot is scheduled for a layover at a non-equipment</P>
<P>domicile and is projected to be illegal to fly the</P>
<P>first leg of the next duty period, the Company may</P>
<P>designate any remaining portion of his trip sequence open</P>
<P>under Paragraph 20-H or 20-I and repair accordingly.</P>
<B><P>5-B-10-b- </B>If a pilot is scheduled for a layover at a non-equipment</P>
<P>domicile and is projected to be illegal for some</P>
<P>portion of his remaining trip after the layover, and the</P>
<P>remaining portion of his trip does not pass through an</P>
<P>equipment domicile prior to the point at which he is</P>
<P>projected to become illegal, the Company may designate</P>
<P>any remaining portion of his trip sequence open under</P>
<P>Paragraph 20-H or 20-I and repair accordingly.</P>
<B><P>5-B-10-c- </B>In addition to the repairs provided in 5-B-10-a</P>
<P>and 5-B-10-b above, a pilot projected to become illegal</P>
<P>under this provision may be removed from any portion of</P>
<P>his sequence; or he may be reassigned to another pilot's</P>
<P>pairing (or portion thereof) if that pilot can be assigned the</P>
<P>flying for which the subject pilot is illegal under the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 20-H or 20-I.</P>
<B><P>5-B-10-d- </B>If a pilot becomes illegal, or is expected to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>No DHD between</P>
</I><P>become illegal, under the provisions of sub-paragraph 5-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>flight segments to</P>
</I><P>B-8 and/or 5-B-9 above to fly his entire scheduled trip&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>satisfy 8 in 24</P>
</I><P>sequence, he will not be required to deadhead between&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>legality</P>
</I><P>flight segments which he was scheduled to fly in one (1)</P>
<P>duty period. However, a pilot may be required to deadhead</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 70&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-B-11</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>on either the first or last flight segment(s) of any one (1)</P>
<P>duty period to become legal.</P>
<B><P>5-B-11- </B>No pilot shall be assigned any duty with the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve released</P>
</I><P>Company during any rest period required by this Paragraph&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>unless specifically</P>
</I><P>B. In the application of this sub-paragraph, a reserve pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>advised</P>
</I><P>upon completion of any assignment, will be specifically</P>
<P>advised if he is not released from duty and is not</P>
<P>commencing a rest period.</P>
<B><P>5-B-12- </B>Duty aloft includes the entire period during which a</P>
<P>pilot is assigned as a member of an airplane crew during</P>
<P>flight time.</P>
<B><P>5-B-13- </B>Scheduled for duty aloft means the assignment of a</P>
<P>pilot on the basis of the flight time established in the</P>
<P>applicable Domicile Schedule Letter rather than the actual</P>
<P>flight time.</P>
<B><P>5-B-14- </B>Relief from all duty for not less than twenty-four (24)</P>
<P>consecutive hours shall be provided for and given to a pilot at</P>
<P>his home domicile at least once during any seven (7)</P>
<P>consecutive calendar days.</P>
<B><P>5-C- 8 in 24 Application</P>
<P>5-C-1- </B>For qualifying purposes, a pilot shall not be required</P>
<P>to fly as a pilot or as an observer crew member a combined</P>
<P>total flight time of more than eight (8) hours in any twenty-four</P>
<P>(24) hour period.</P>
<B><P>5-C-2- </B>When the combined total actual flight time of a pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>8 in 24</P>
</I><P>as a pilot and as an observer crew member (deadhead time</P>
<P>as a passenger excluded) is more than eight (8) hours or is</P>
<P>scheduled for over eight (8) hours in any consecutive twenty-four</P>
<P>(24) hour period, such pilot for such combined total</P>
<P>actual flight time shall have a minimum rest period as</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-2-c.</P>
<B><P>5-D- Deadhead</P>
<P>5-D-1- </B>Time spent as a passenger or as an Observer</P>
<P>Member of the Crew (OMC) shall not contribute to flight time</P>
<P>under the provisions of this Agreement.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-D-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 71</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-D-2- </B>When a pilot assigned a line of flying is displaced</P>
<P>from or is required to deadhead or ride as observer on a flight</P>
<P>because he has been displaced from the flight or a part</P>
<P>thereof to which he has previously been designated as a</P>
<P>member of the crew and he is unable to deadhead or ride as</P>
<P>observer member of the crew on the flight from which</P>
<P>displaced, he shall be permitted to deadhead or return as</P>
<P>observer member of the crew on any other flight in order that</P>
<P>he may return to his domicile as soon as possible. This</P>
<P>Paragraph shall not apply when a pilot is removed from his</P>
<P>assigned trip as a result of the operation of the pilot's</P>
<P>schedule selection procedure, equipment substitution,</P>
<P>cancellation due to weather or equipment, moving to another</P>
<P>trip, or being removed from a trip due to the application of</P>
<P>Section 20-F, 20-G, 20-H and 20-I.</P>
<B><P>5-D-3- </B>Pilots when deadheading over the Company's&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>First Class DHD if</P>
</I><P>domestic routes shall be on non-revenue positive space&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;available at time</P>
<P>(NRPS) or OMC at the pilot's option unless OMC provides the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of booking</P>
</I><P>only expedient method of transportation. Pilots will be</P>
<P>booked in first class if space is available at the time of</P>
<P>booking. If first class space is not available at the time of</P>
<P>booking, pilots will be booked in business class. If business</P>
<P>class space is not available at the time of booking, pilots will</P>
<P>be booked in economy class and assigned a seat according</P>
<P>to the following order of preference: aisle seat, window seat,</P>
<P>middle seat.</P>
<B><P>5-D-4- </B>Offline deadheading shall be First Class when</P>
<P>available on all flights scheduled for three (3) hours or more.</P>
<B><P>5-E-</P>
<P>5-E-1-</P>
<P>5-E-1-a- </B>When a pilot assigned to a line of flying is on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Sick leave</P>
</I><P>sick leave, his total allowable monthly flight time shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>adjustment for</P>
</I><P>reduced by the number of actual flight hours which the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>lineholders</P>
</I><P>pilot missed as a result of sick leave.</P>
<B><P>5-E-1-b- </B>When a reserve pilot is on sick leave, his total&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Sick leave</P>
</I><P>allowable monthly flight time shall be reduced by four&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>adjustment for</P>
</I><P>hours and ten minutes (4:10) for each duty day he was on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserves</P>
</I><P>sick leave, except as provided in Section 20-H-3 of this</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-E-2-</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 72&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section5-E-2-a</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-E-2-a- </B>When a pilot assigned a line of flying is on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Vacation</P>
</I><P>vacation, his total allowable monthly flight time shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>adjustment for</P>
</I><P>reduced by the number of actual flight hours which the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>lineholders</P>
</I><P>pilot missed as a result of his vacation.</P>
<B><P>5-E-2-b- </B>When a pilot serving as reserve is on vacation,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Vacation</P>
</I><P>his total allowable monthly flight time shall be reduced by&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>adjustment for</P>
</I><P>four hours and ten minutes (4:10) for each duty day he is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reserves</P>
</I><P>on vacation.</P>
<B><P>5-F-</P>
</B><P>A pilot shall not be required to keep the Company advised of</P>
<P>his whereabouts on his days off.</P>
<B><P>5-G- Duty Time</P>
<P>5-G-1- Preparation of Pilot's Schedule</P>
</B><P>The following on-duty provisions shall apply to the</P>
<P>preparation of pilot schedules and the preparation of initial</P>
<P>pilot, including reserve pilot, assignments (other than trip</P>
<P>pairings appearing in the Pilots' Schedules).</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-</P>
<P>5-G-1-a-(1) </B>A pilot shall not be scheduled to be on duty</P>
<P>in excess of the following limitations, except that with</P>
<P>the concurrence of the System Schedule Committee,</P>
<P>duty periods up to fourteen (14) consecutive hours may</P>
<P>be scheduled:</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(a)</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>For Duty Period</P>
<P>Starting&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Trip Preparation</P>
</B><P>0600-1329&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13 hours</P>
<P>1330-2359&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13 hours, reduced 1 min. for each 3 min.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;beyond 1330</P>
<P>2400-0414&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9 1/2 hours</P>
<P>0415-0559&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9 1/2 hours, increased 2 min. for each 1</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;min. beyond 0415.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(b) </B>When a duty period is scheduled to</P>
<P>end with a deadhead segment, the applicable duty</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 5-G-1-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 73</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>limits shall be one (1) hour greater than the times</P>
<P>indicated above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(c) </B>A pilot shall not be scheduled to be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Duty
period limit</P>
</I><P>on duty for more than ten (10) hours in any duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
after field layover</P>
</I><P>period following a layover scheduled for less than</P>
<P>ten (10) hours and forty-five (45) minutes free from</P>
<P>duty, except that if the duty period begins between</P>
<P>2301 and 0359, the on-duty period shall be</P>
<P>scheduled for not more than nine (9) hours.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(d) </B>Determination of all on-duty periods</P>
<P>shall be based on home domicile time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(e) </B>When a pilot is scheduled into one&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Drive time for</P>
</I><P>airport and out of another airport serving the layover&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>crosstown</P>
</I><P>point, the duty period will have the driving time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
layovers shall be</P>
</I><P>shown in Section 5-G-1-b-(3) included in the duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>included in the</P>
</I><P>time. This provision will not apply to downtown&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>duty
time</P>
</I><P>layovers in New York City, downtown layovers</P>
<P>between IAD and DCA, all downtown layovers</P>
<P>between OAK and SFO when scheduled for a</P>
<P>downtown San Francisco hotel.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-a-(2) </B>The domicile airports are LAX, SFO, SEA,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Domicile airports</P>
</I><P>DEN, ORD, MIA/FLL, JFK/LGA, IAD/DCA, ANC, and</P>
<P>HNL. In the event a trip sequence is scheduled to</P>
<P>originate and terminate at an airport serving the</P>
<P>domicile other than these domicile airports, the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 4-D-4 shall apply.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-b-</P>
<P>5-G-1-b-(1) </B>Duty time on a scheduled basis shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Report and</P>
</I><P>include scheduled flight and ground time and a pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>debrief times</P>
</I><P>shall be considered to be on duty for one (1) hour</P>
<P>before the scheduled departure of his trip until fifteen</P>
<P>(15) minutes after the scheduled termination of the trip.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Debrief increased</P>
</I><P>If the required reporting time exceeds one (1) hour,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>to 30 minutes if</P>
</I><P>such additional time shall be considered as duty time.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>crew must clear</P>
</I><P>If, due to their arrival from an international city, a crew&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>customs</P>
</I><P>is required to clear customs at the completion of a trip</P>
<P>sequence, the 15 minute debriefing time shall be</P>
<P>increased to 30 minutes. This sub-paragraph shall not</P>
<P>apply in the application of Section 5-G-1-b-(3).</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-b-(2) </B>Notwithstanding sub-paragraph 5-G-1-b-(</P>
<P>1) above, a pilot scheduled to fly a cargoliner shall be</P>
<P>considered to be on duty until thirty (30) minutes after</P>
<P>the scheduled termination of the trip. This cargoliner</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 74&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-1-c</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>debrief time shall remain 30 minutes unless the SSC</P>
<P>and the Company agree an increased time is</P>
<P>necessary at a particular airport. If the SSC and the</P>
<P>Company are unable to reach agreement, the issue will</P>
<P>be referred to the UAL-MEC Master Chairman and the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President of Flight Operations for</P>
<P>resolution.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-b-(3) </B>When a pilot's scheduled trip sequence&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Crosstown duty</P>
</I><P>originates out of one airport and terminates at another&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>period extension</P>
</I><P>airport serving his domicile, the following times will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>added to either</P>
</I><P>used to increase either the first or last duty period,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>first or last duty</P>
</I><P>depending on whether the time is provided at the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>period</P>
</I><P>beginning or end of the trip. Such times shall be</P>
<P>considered as scheduled deadhead time at one-half (1/</P>
<P>2) flight time credit for the application of Section 5-G-3-f.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>LGA-JFK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;:45&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LAX-ONT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2:15</P>
<P>EWR-LGA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:30&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LAX-PMD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2:30</P>
<P>JFK-EWR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2:00&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SFO-OAK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:00</P>
<P>MDW-ORD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2:00&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SEA-BFI&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;:45</P>
<P>DCA-IAD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MIA-FLL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:45</P>

<P>DCA-BWI&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PBI-MIA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2:00</P>

<P>IAD-BWI&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:45&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SJC-SFO&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:00</P>

<P>LAX-BUR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:15&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PBI-FLL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1:00</P>

</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>When a pilot is scheduled in accordance with Section</P>
<P>4-D-4 of this Agreement, the above times will be used</P>
<P>with the following exceptions: JFK/LGA-EWR 1:30;</P>
<P>MDW-ORD 1:45; MIA-FLL/PBI 2:00.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c- </B>For the purpose of determining scheduled duty</P>
<P>time, a pilot's on-duty period cannot be broken by an off</P>
<P>duty period of less than:</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c-(1) </B>Nine (9) hours and thirty (30) minutes- in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>1 hour scheduled</P>
</I><P>case of relief from flight duty at a point where sleeping&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>report may be</P>
</I><P>accommodations are provided within fifteen (15)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduced to :30 at</P>
</I><P>minutes normal driving time from the airport and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>non domiciles</P>
</I><P>transportation is provided within fifteen (15) minutes of</P>
<P>the scheduled arrival time of the trip. At non-domicile</P>
<P>locations, the Company may, on a monthly basis with</P>
<P>SSC concurrence, reduce the one (1) hour report time</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>.</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Section 5-G-1-d&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 75</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-1-b-(1) to thirty (30) minutes in</P>
<P>order to provide the required period free of duty. Such</P>
<P>action, however, will not dilute the application or any of</P>
<P>the provisions of this Paragraph. Specifically, it will be</P>
<P>assumed that the pilot reported for duty one (1) hour</P>
<P>before departure.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c-(2) </B>Twelve (12) hours and forty-five (45)</P>
<P>minutes - in case of relief from flight duty at a point</P>
<P>where sleeping accommodations are not provided as</P>
<P>specified in sub-paragraph (1) above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c-(3) </B>Twelve (12) hours and forty-five (45)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot will be</P>
</I><P>minutes - in case of relief from flight duty at the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled for
</P>
</I><P>conclusion of a trip sequence at a scheduled or reserve&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>12:45 rest at his</P>
</I><P>pilot's home domicile regardless of whether sleeping&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>home domicile</P>
</I><P>accommodations are or are not available at the airport.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c-(4) </B>Thirteen (13) hours and forty-five (45)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot will be</P>
</I><P>minutes - in case of relief from flight duty at the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled for</P>
</I><P>conclusion of a trip sequence at a scheduled or reserve&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>13:45 rest at his</P>
</I><P>pilot's home domicile when the pilot is scheduled out of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>home domicile for</P>
</I><P>one airport and into another serving his home domicile&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled</P>
</I><P>if not covered in sub-paragraph 5-G-1-b-(3) above.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>crosstown</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-1-c-(5) </B>Fourteen (14) hours - in case of relief from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilots scheduled</P>
</I><P>flight duty at the first rest following a duty period in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>to exceed 7:30</P>
</I><P>which the pilot is scheduled to exceed seven (7) hours&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>flight time will</P>
</I><P>and thirty (30) minutes flight time in twenty-four (24)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>have 14 hours</P>
</I><P>consecutive hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rest</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-1-c-(6) </B>Notwithstanding the minimum free of duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company and</P>
</I><P>times required in 5-G-1-c-(3) above, the Company and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>SSC may</P>
</I><P>Association System Schedule Committee may select&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>schedule back to</P>
</I><P>specific trip pairings which, on a scheduled basis, may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>back trip pairings</P>
</I><P>be combined into lines of flying while providing thirty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>in lines with 30</P>
</I><P>(30) minutes less time between trips than required&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minutes less rest</P>
</I><P>above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-c-(7) </B>The above off-duty periods may be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Schedule</P>
</I><P>reduced by one (1) hour under this sub-paragraph c&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>preparation time</P>
</I><P>when such off duty period extends to or beyond 0200&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>change</P>
</I><P>Standard Time on the designated day when the change</P>
<P>is made from Standard Time to Daylight Time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-d-</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 76&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-1-e</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-G-1-d-(1) </B>Each schedule line for a full month that is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Lines will have a</P>
</I><P>submitted for the schedule selection procedure, as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minimum of 12</P>
</I><P>provided in Section 20-B and 20-C shall contain a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off in a 30</P>
</I><P>minimum of twelve (12) calendar days free of all duty at&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>day month, 13</P>
</I><P>the home domicile in a thirty (30) day Month and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off in a 31</P>
</I><P>thirteen (13) calendar days free of all duty at the home&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>day month and 14</P>
</I><P>domicile in a thirty-one (31) day Month [fourteen (14)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off for all</P>
</I><P>calendar days in all months for Shuttle pilots]. A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>months for shuttle</P>
</I><P>lineholder may voluntarily reduce the number of days</P>
<P>off in a thirty-one (31) day Month to not less than</P>
<P>twelve (12) calendar days free of all duty at the home&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>L/H may be</P>
</I><P>domicile [thirteen (13) calendar days in all Months for a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled to be</P>
</I><P>Shuttle lineholder] to legally fly an inbound. For the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>released by 0100</P>
</I><P>purpose of this subparagraph d-(1) only, a day shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and that day is</P>
</I><P>a "day free of all duty", if the lineholder is scheduled to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>still considered a</P>
</I><P>be released from duty before 0100 home domicile time.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>day off</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-1-d-(2) </B>Shuttle lines of flying must average no less</P>
<P>than sixteen (16) days off per month for each status on</P>
<P>a systemwide basis.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-</P>
<P>5-G-1-e-(1) </B>Pilots functioning as reserves shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve lines will</P>
</I><P>scheduled for a minimum of twelve (12) calendar days&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>have a minimum</P>
</I><P>free of duty in a thirty (30) day Month and for a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of 12 days off in a</P>
</I><P>minimum of thirteen (13) calendar days free from duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>30 day month, 13</P>
</I><P>in a thirty-one (31) day Month [fourteen (14) calendar&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off in a 31</P>
</I><P>days free of duty in all months for Shuttle pilots] with&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>day month and 14</P>
</I><P>the Company each month in patterns consisting of a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off in all</P>
</I><P>maximum of four (4) periods of not less than two (2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>months for shuttle</P>
</I><P>days off. Reserve lines posted for preferencing shall</P>
<P>include all of those lines which will be awarded,</P>
<P>however, the actual lines awarded may not include all&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Construction and</P>
</I><P>of those posted. Additionally, the same line may be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>awarding of</P>
</I><P>awarded to more that one (1) pilot. The schedules&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>posted reserve</P>
</I><P>posted for preferencing will include a variety of lines&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>lines</P>
</I><P>sufficient to insure that the following specific day-off</P>
<P>patterns are awarded, depending upon the actual</P>
<P>number of pilots awarded reserve lines, to the extent</P>
<P>they are preferenced.</P>
<P>If 7 reserve lines, 1 line with weekends off.</P>
<P>If 14 reserve lines, 2 lines with weekends off.</P>
<P>If 21 reserve lines, 3 lines with weekends off.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-1-e&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 77</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>If more than 21 reserve lines, one additional line with</P>
<P>weekends off for each additional 7 reserve lines;</P>
<P>except that these additional weekend off lines (above</P>
<P>the first 3 weekends off lines) shall have only three</P>
<P>weekends off whenever any part of the fourth weekend</P>
<P>falls within either the first four days or the last four</P>
<P>days of the schedule month.</P>
<P>If 10 reserve lines, 1 line with the first four days off. For</P>
<P>each additional 10 reserve lines, 1 additional line with</P>
<P>the first four days off.</P>
<P>If 10 reserve lines, 1 line with the last four days off. For</P>
<P>each additional 10 reserve lines, 1 additional line with</P>
<P>the last four days off.</P>
<P>These additional reserve lines will not be provided</P>
<P>when any part of a weekend falls on both the first four</P>
<P>days and last four days of the month.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(2) </B>A pilot functioning as a reserve will not be</P>
<P>scheduled into a day(s) off.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(3) </B>If as a result of the pilot's schedule</P>
<P>selection procedure a reserve has not been provided</P>
<P>with one (1) day off in a seven (7) day period, one (1)</P>
<P>day of other than a two (2) day off period may be used</P>
<P>to provide the required one (1) day off in a seven (7)</P>
<P>day period.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(4) </B>The Company may assign a reserve an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Additional day off</P>
</I><P>additional day off to insure legality of the transition into&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for reserves</P>
</I><P>the next month's schedule with the concurrence of the</P>
<P>reserve pilot.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(5) </B>Reserve pilots may be permitted to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
Trade reserve</P>
</I><P>mutually trade day(s) off periods, consistent with the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days off</P>
</I><P>needs of the service so long as such trade does not</P>
<P>result in either pilot being scheduled for less than one</P>
<P>(1) day off in a seven (7) day period. Additionally, a</P>
<P>reserve pilot's scheduled days off may be rescheduled</P>
<P>with pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(6)</P>
<P>5-G-1-e-(6)-(a) </B>A pilot on reserve shall not be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
Reserve early</P>
</I><P>required to report for duty to fly or deadhead on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>release and early</P>
</I><P>trip which is scheduled to depart from his home&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>report</P>
</I><P>domicile prior to 0700 local domicile time on the day</P>
<P>following his day(s) off, provided that the Company</P>
<P>may release a reserve from being available for</P>
<P>assignment at or before 1500 local domicile time on</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 78&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-1-e</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>the day preceding his scheduled day(s) off, and if so</P>
<P>released, the reserve pilot may be required to report</P>
<P>for duty to fly or deadhead on a trip which is</P>
<P>scheduled to depart from his home domicile at or</P>
<P>after 0600 local domicile time on the day following</P>
<P>his day(s) off. With pilot concurrence, the Company</P>
<P>may also assign a reserve pilot who is not released</P>
<P>from duty before 1500 local domicile time to a trip</P>
<P>scheduled to depart at or after 0600 local domicile</P>
<P>time on the day following his day(s) off.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(6)-(b) </B>A reserve on call will be released</P>
<P>from duty at 1500 for purposes of this subparagraph</P>
<P>(6) if he has not been notified of an assignment or</P>
<P>notified to remain on duty by 1500 local domicile</P>
<P>time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(6)-(c) </B>A reserve on a designated rest</P>
<P>period extending beyond 1500 on a day prior to a</P>
<P>reserve day(s) off, if not previously given an</P>
<P>assignment following the designated rest period,</P>
<P>will automatically be released from duty nine (9)</P>
<P>hours prior to the completion of the designated rest</P>
<P>period.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-e-(7) </B>If a reserve pilot is assigned to a line of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Restoration of</P>
</I><P>flying he shall receive the days off in such scheduled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minimum days off</P>
</I><P>line for the period assigned in lieu of the days off&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for
reserve</P>
</I><P>shown in his reserve line for the same period. In no&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assigned to line</P>
</I><P>event shall a reserve pilot assigned to a line of flying</P>
<P>for less than a full month be scheduled for less than</P>
<P>twelve/thirteen (12/13) calendar days off [fourteen (14)</P>
<P>calendar days off for Shuttle pilots]. Whenever a</P>
<P>reserve pilot is scheduled for less than the minimum of</P>
<P>twelve/thirteen (12/13) days off [fourteen (14) days off</P>
<P>for Shuttle pilots] when assigned to a line of flying for</P>
<P>less than a month, a trip(s) may be deleted or replaced</P>
<P>in the line of flying under the provisions of Section 20-F-</P>
<P>1, to provide the required days off. It is understood</P>
<P>that, on a voluntary basis, a Shuttle reserve pilot</P>
<P>assigned to a partial line of flying may require only</P>
<P>twelve (12) days off in the line of flying.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-1-e&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 79</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-1-e-(8) </B>In the application of Section 5-G-1-c-(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve</P>
</I><P>and 5-G-1-c-(4) to the scheduling of reserve pilots, the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled for</P>
</I><P>twelve (12) hours and forty-five (45) minutes or thirteen&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>12:45 rest at</P>
</I><P>(13) hours and forty-five (45) minutes, as applicable,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>home---13:45</P>
</I><P>will be added to the end of the last duty period of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>after crosstown</P>
</I><P>trip sequence at the time of the initial assignment. The&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>operations</P>
</I><P>time so established is considered to be the time at</P>
<P>which the reserve is scheduled to be legal for his next&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Rest will be</P>
</I><P>reserve assignment. However, the provisions of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduced only by</P>
</I><P>Section 5-G-2-c will apply if the trip sequence is not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>the amount of</P>
</I><P>flown as scheduled, but the required rest (12:45 or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>time the reserve</P>
</I><P>13:45) will be reduced only by the amount of time the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>arrived later than</P>
</I><P>reserve arrived later than his scheduled arrival at&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>his scheduled</P>
</I><P>home. The provisions of 5-G-2-c will also apply if the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>arrival at home</P>
</I><P>next assignment is made under the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 20-G-8. In no case will a reserve pilot receive</P>
<P>less rest than provided in Section 5-G-2-c.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f- Late Night and All Night Flying</P>
<P>5-G-1-f-(1) </B>Definitions</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(1)-(a) </B>Window of Circadian Low ("WOCL")&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Late night and all</P>
</I><P>means 0100 through 0459 home domicile time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>night flying</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduling</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-1-f-(1)-(b) </B>Late Night Flight ("LNF") means a &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restrictions</P>
</I><P>flight any portion of which is scheduled to operate</P>
<P>between 0045 and 0600 (inclusive) home domicile</P>
<P>time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(1)-(c) </B>All Night Flight ("ANF") means a LNF</P>
<P>any portion of which is scheduled to operate during</P>
<P>the hours of 0230 and 0329 home domicile time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(2) </B>No pilot may be scheduled for duty in</P>
<P>consecutive WOCL periods.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(3) </B>Within a pairing, a pilot shall have a</P>
<P>minimum of sixteen (16) hours and forty-five (45)</P>
<P>minutes free from duty prior to a duty period that</P>
<P>contains an ANF.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(4) </B>After an ANF a duty break must be</P>
<P>scheduled before the pilot's next scheduled flight</P>
<P>segment.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(5) </B>Any duty period that contains an ANF shall</P>
<P>meet the following requirements:</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(5)-(a) </B>A maximum of two (2) flight</P>
<P>segments, except no more than one (1) segment if</P>
<P>the ANF departs from an equipment domicile, and</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 80&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-2</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-G-1-f-(5)-(b) </B>A maximum duty period of Nine (9)</P>
<P>hours and forty-five (45) minutes unless further</P>
<P>restricted by Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) above, and</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(5)-(c) </B>If the duty period contains two (2)</P>
<P>flight segments, no more than one (1) hour and</P>
<P>forty-five (45) minutes ground time between flight</P>
<P>segments.</P>
<B><P>5-G-1-f-(6) </B>Central and South American trip pairings&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Above night flying</P>
</I><P>that are specifically addressed by the current "doctors&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rules not</P>
</I><P>letter" are exempt from the provisions of this Section 5-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>applicable to</P>
</I><P>G-1-f.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Central and South</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I>America</P>
<B><P>5-G-2- Actual On-Duty Provisions</P>
</B><P>The following on-duty provisions shall apply to scheduled</P>
<P>pilots and reserve pilots in the actual performance of their</P>
<P>duties, including any reassignments made after the pilot has</P>
<P>reported for duty for his initially assigned trip sequence.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-a- </B>A pilot shall not be required to be on duty in</P>
<P>excess of the following limitations, except by agreement</P>
<P>between the pilot and a Flight Manager.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-a-(1) </B>As a result of a reassignment, a duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Actual duty time</P>
</I><P>period may not be planned to exceed the applicable&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limits including</P>
</I><P>schedule maximum in 5-G-1-a-(1) above, by more than&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassignment</P>
</I><P>one (1) hour, without pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>(a) </B>Additionally, a pilot shall not be reassigned to be on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Actual duty time</P>
</I><P>duty for more than eleven (11) hours in any duty period&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limits for</P>
</I><P>following a layover scheduled for less than ten (10)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassignments</P>
</I><P>hours and forty-five (45) minutes free from duty.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>following a field</P>
</I><P>Between 2301 and 0359, the on-duty period shall not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>layover</P>
</I><P>be scheduled to exceed ten (10) hours.</P>
<B><P>(b) </B>Should a pilot become involved in a reassignment&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot reassigned</P>
</I><P>which produces a layover that, had it been scheduled,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>into a short field</P>
