</I><P>would have subjected him to the provisions of 5-G-1-a-(1)-c,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>layover shall have</P>
</I><P>above; such pilot shall be treated in the actual&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>the more</P>
</I><P>operation as if he had been scheduled under 5-G-1-a-(1)-(c).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restrictive duty</P>
</I><P>Conversely, a pilot scheduled under 5-G-1-a-(1)-(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>limits following</P>
</I><P>who is reassigned so as to actually receive a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>the layover, and if</P>
</I><P>longer layover not subject to 5-G-1-a-(1)-(c) that pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassigned into a</P>
</I><P>shall not be limited to the shorter duty period.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>longer layover</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;those duty period</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;restrictions shall</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not apply</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-2-b&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 81</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-a-(2) </B>In the actual operation, a duty period may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Actual duty limits</P>
</I><P>not exceed the applicable schedule limits as provided&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>11/2 hour greater</P>
</I><P>in 5-G-1-a-(1) above by more than one and one-half&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>than scheduled</P>
</I><P>(11/2) hours (or fourteen (14) hours total if less)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>with 14 hours max</P>

</I><P>without pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-a-(3) </B>In the event a pilot is reassigned to</P>
<P>deadhead to a layover point or to his home domicile,</P>
<P>the actual limitations shall apply.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-a-(4) </B>Determination of all on-duty periods shall</P>
<P>be based on home domicile time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-b-</P>
<P>5-G-2-b-(1) </B>Duty time on an actual basis shall include</P>
<P>actual flight and ground time and a pilot shall be</P>
<P>considered to be on duty for one (1) hour before the</P>
<P>scheduled departure of his trip until fifteen (15)</P>
<P>minutes after the termination of the trip. If the required</P>
<P>reporting time exceeds one (1) hour, such additional</P>
<P>time shall be considered as duty time. This</P>
<P>subparagraph shall not apply in the application of</P>
<P>Section 5-G-1-b-(3).</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-b-(2) </B>Notwithstanding sub-paragraph 5-G-2-b-(</P>
<P>1) above, a pilot who flies a cargoliner at the</P>
<P>conclusion of a trip sequence shall be considered to be</P>
<P>on duty until thirty (30) minutes after the termination of</P>
<P>the trip. This cargoliner debrief time shall remain 30</P>
<P>minutes unless the SSC and the Company agree an</P>
<P>increased time is necessary at a particular airport. If</P>
<P>the SSC and the Company are unable to reach</P>
<P>agreement, the issue will be referred to the UAL-MEC</P>
<P>Master Chairman and the Senior Vice President of</P>
<P>Flight Operations for resolution.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-b-(3) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of sub-paragraph</P>
<P>5-G-2-b-(1) above, the one (1) hour</P>
<P>reporting time may be reduced to not less than thirty</P>
<P>(30) minutes before departure of a trip on a daily basis</P>
<P>by request of the crew and with the concurrence of a</P>
<P>Flight Manager. This waiver applies only to reporting</P>
<P>time of one (1) hour which has not previously been</P>
<P>resolved under the provisions of Section 5-G-1-c-(1).</P>
<P>Such action, however, will not dilute the application of</P>
<P>any of the provisions of this Paragraph. Specifically, it</P>
<P>will be assumed that the pilot reported for duty one (1)</P>
<P>hour before departure.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 82&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-2-c</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-G-2-b-(4) </B>When a pilot's return trip terminates at an</P>
<P>airport serving his domicile other than the airport at</P>
<P>which his return trip was scheduled to terminate, the</P>
<P>pilot's on-duty period shall be extended in accordance</P>
<P>with Section 5-G-1-b-(3), based on the actual</P>
<P>termination airport or the scheduled termination airport,</P>
<P>whichever is greater, provided, that if in the actual</P>
<P>operation a pilot returns to the airport from which he</P>
<P>was scheduled to originate, the provisions of this</P>
<P>Paragraph shall not apply.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-b-(5) </B>When a pilot is scheduled into one airport</P>
<P>and out of another airport serving the layover point, the</P>
<P>duty period will have the driving time shown in Section</P>
<P>5-G-1-b-(3) included.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c- </B>For the purpose of determining actual duty time,</P>
<P>a pilot's on-duty period cannot be broken by an actual off-duty</P>
<P>period of less than:</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(1) </B>Nine (9) hours and fifteen (15) minutes -</P>
<P>in case of relief from flight duty at a point where</P>
<P>sleeping accommodations are provided within fifteen</P>
<P>(15) minutes normal driving time from the airport and</P>
<P>transportation is provided within fifteen (15) minutes of</P>
<P>the crews planned arrival time if later than the</P>
<P>scheduled arrival time. At non-domicile locations, the</P>
<P>Company may reduce the one (1) hour report time</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-1-b-(1) to thirty (30) minutes in</P>
<P>order to provide the required period free of duty. Such</P>
<P>action, however, will not dilute the application or any of</P>
<P>the provisions of this Paragraph. Specifically, it will be</P>
<P>assumed that the pilot reported for duty one (1) hour</P>
<P>before departure.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(2) </B>Ten (10) hours and forty-five (45) minutes -In</P>
<P>case of relief from flight duty at a point where</P>
<P>sleeping accommodations are not provided as</P>
<P>specified in sub-paragraph 5-G-2-c-(1) above. At non-domicile</P>
<P>locations the Company may, with pilot</P>
<P>concurrence, reduce the one (1) hour report time</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-1-b-(1) to thirty (30) minutes in</P>
<P>order to provide the required period free of duty. Such</P>
<P>action, however, will not dilute the application or any of</P>
<P>the provisions of this Paragraph. Specifically, it will be</P>
<P>assumed that the pilot reported for duty one (1) hour</P>
<P>before departure.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(3) </B>Ten (10) hours and forty-five (45) minutes-</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-2-c&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 83</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-G-2-c-(3)-(a) </B>In case of relief from flight duty at</P>
<P>the conclusion of an assigned trip sequence at a</P>
<P>scheduled pilot's home domicile regardless of</P>
<P>whether sleeping accommodations are or are not</P>
<P>available at the airport or when a pilot departs from</P>
<P>one airport and arrives at another airport serving his</P>
<P>domicile at the conclusion of an assigned trip</P>
<P>sequence.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(3)-(b) </B>In case of relief from flight duty at</P>
<P>the conclusion of an assigned trip sequence at a</P>
<P>reserve pilot's home domicile regardless of whether</P>
<P>sleeping accommodations are or are not available at</P>
<P>the airport.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(3)-(c) </B>In case of relief from flight duty</P>
<P>under the provisions of Section 20-F-1-a-(2) and</P>
<P>Section 20-F-1-b-(3) and 20-F-1-b-(4).</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(4) </B>Twelve (12) hours - in case of relief from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>12 hours rest after</P>
</I><P>flight duty at the first rest following a duty period in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>8 hours actual in</P>

</I><P>which the pilot exceeds eight (8) hours flight time in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>24</P>
</I><P>any consecutive twenty-four (24) hours.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(5) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of sub-paragraph&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Minimum rest of 9</P>
</I><P>5-G-1-c-(1) and 5-G-1-c-(2) above, an on-duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hours at hotel
</P>
</I><P>period cannot be broken by less than nine (9)</P>
<P>hours at the place where sleeping accommodations are</P>
<P>provided.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-c-(6) </B>The off duty periods required by 5-G-2-c-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Time change</P>
</I><P>(1)-5-G-2-c-(2)-5-G-2-c-(3) above, may be reduced by</P>
<P>one (1) hour, but in no case less than the amount of</P>
<P>time necessary to provide eight (8) hours and thirty</P>
<P>(30) minutes at the place where sleeping</P>
<P>accommodations are provided, under this sub-paragraph</P>
<P>c when such off duty periods extend to or</P>
<P>beyond 0200 Standard Time on the designated day</P>
<P>when the change is made from Standard Time to</P>
<P>Daylight Time. This exception does not apply to the</P>
<P>required rest period for a reserve at his home domicile</P>
<P>as provided in Section 5-G-2-c-(3)-(b).</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-2-c</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-c-(7) </B>Pairings which have been scheduled under&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Actual rest</P>
</I><P>the provisions of Paragraph 5-G-1-c-(6), shall require&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>provisions</P>
</I><P>thirty (30) minutes less time free of duty in the actual&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reduced by :30</P>
</I><P>operation than the times provided in Paragraph 5-G-2-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>when Company</P>
</I><P>c-(3) above.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and SSC agree to</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;schedule back to</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;back pairing in lines.</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-d- Operational Integrity</P>
</B><P>The Company may initiate the following procedures&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company may</P>
</I><P>whenever it is anticipated that a flight crew will be unable&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>request pilot to</P>
</I><P>to depart on-time following a scheduled layover. These&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>waive contractual</P>
</I><P>procedures only apply to a layover at a non-domicile&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rest at non-</P>
</I><P>location where timely replacement of the crew is not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>domicile location</P>
</I><P>possible:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for an ontime</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I>departure</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(1) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Minimum rest</P>
</I><P>5-G-2-c above and with pilot concurrence, the minimum</P>
<P>rest will be the greater of eight (8) hours or the rest</P>
<P>required by the FAR. Provided, however, that:</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(1)-(a) </B>Each pilot is notified prior to, or</P>
<P>immediately upon arrival at the layover station of</P>
<P>the Company's request to implement this provision,</P>
<P>and</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(1)-(b) </B>The layover hotel meets the field&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Field layover</P>
</I><P>layover requirements of Section 5-G-2-c-(1) above,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>required</P>
</I><P>and</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(1)-(c) </B>Transportation to the layover hotel&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Immediate</P>
</I><P>is immediately available upon arrival. If the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>transportation</P>
</I><P>transportation is not immediately available, the pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>required</P>
</I><P>may, at his option and after notifying the Company</P>
<P>upon his arrival at the hotel, revert to the actual</P>
<P>minimum layover under Section 5-G-2-c-(1) above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(2) </B>Prior to agreeing to rest under this Section</P>
<P>5-G-2-d, the pilot will be informed of the anticipated</P>
<P>duty following the rest period.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(3) </B>Following any rest period under this&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Limitations on</P>
</I><P>Section 5-G-2-d, a pilot may fly up to four (4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>duty period
</P>
</I><P>scheduled flight hours and shall be relieved from duty&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>following reduced</P>
</I><P>upon the earliest of:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rest</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-d-(3)-(a) </B>The first arrival at a domicile</P>
<P>location for his equipment type, or</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 85</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-G-2-d-(3)-(b) </B>Completion of two (2) flight</P>
<P>segments, or</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(3)-(c) </B>Completion of six (6) hours on duty</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(4) </B>When a pilot is relieved from duty following&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>After completion</P>
</I><P>a rest period under this Section 5-G-2-d, the pilot will&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of the duty period</P>
</I><P>be either:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>following reduced</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;rest pilot will be</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-d-(4)-(a) </B>Released from the balance of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>released or given</P>
</I><P>trip, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>a minimum 14</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp
;<I>hours rest</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-d-(4)-(b) </B>Given a rest period extending</P>
<P>through 0459 home domicile time following release</P>
<P>from duty, and in no case shall this rest period be</P>
<P>less than fourteen (14) hours.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(5) </B>If the pilot is given a rest under Section 5-</P>
<P>G-2-d-(4)-(b) above, after completing this rest and</P>
<P>provided he is notified prior to 1700 on the day</P>
<P>following the rest, the pilot may be:</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(5)-(a) </B>Assigned to join the balance of his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>If notified by 1700</P>

</I><P>original trip, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>following a 14</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;hour minimum</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-2-d-(5)-(b) </B>Reassigned other flying under&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>
rest a pilot may be</P>
</I><P>Section 20-F for which the pilot is legal, except that&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assigned the</P>
</I><P>such other flying shall be scheduled to return the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>balance of his</P>
</I><P>pilot to his home domicile no later than two (2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>original trip,</P>

</I><P>hours after the scheduled arrival time of his original&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassigned other</P>
</I><P>trip, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>flying under 20-F,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I>or released from</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(5)-(c) </B>Released from further duty, except&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>further duty.</P>
</I><P>deadhead if necessary to return to his home</P>
<P>domicile.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(6) </B>Following any rest period under this</P>
<P>subparagraph d, a reserve will not be available for any</P>
<P>assignment until he receives the required rest under</P>
<P>Section 5-G-2-d-(4)-(b) above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-2-d-(7) </B>A pilot shall receive incentive pay in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>5 hour incentive</P>
</I><P>accordance with Section 3-B-7-b of the Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pay</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-3- Minimum Scheduling and Actual Credit</P>
<P>Provisions</P>
</B><P>The following schedule and actual credit provisions shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Flight time credit</P>
</I><P>apply to the construction of schedules for preferencing and in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>provisions for</P>
</I><P>the actual operation and wherever this Agreement refers to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>schedule and</P>
</I><P>"credit hours" or "pay credit." All duty assignments involving&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual operations</P>
</I><P>line flying duty will be considered as having the minimum</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 86&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-G-3-a</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>flight time credit applications set forth in this sub-paragraph</P>
<P>G-3.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-a- </B>Schedules shall contain a minimum of one (1)</P>
<P>hour's flight time credit for each two (2) hours of duty time</P>
<P>scheduled between 0600 and 2159 and a minimum of one</P>
<P>(1) hour's flight time credit for each one and three-quarter</P>
<P>(1-3/4) hours of duty time scheduled between 2200 and</P>
<P>0559, prorated on a schedule or actual basis whichever is</P>
<P>greater.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-b-</P>
<P>5-G-3-b-(1) </B>For Mainline pilots, schedules shall contain&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>M5H average</P>
</I><P>a minimum of five (5) hours of flight time credit,</P>
<P>averaged, for each on-duty period in multiple duty</P>
<P>period trip sequences or five (5) hours for one (1) duty</P>
<P>period trip sequences. In computing the five (5) hour</P>
<P>minimum, there shall not be included any on-duty</P>
<P>periods which do not involve line flying, and this</P>
<P>provision does not apply to publicity and courtesy</P>
<P>flights. The five (5) hour minimum shall not apply to</P>
<P>any duty period composed solely of deadheading.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-b-(2) </B>For Shuttle pilots, schedules shall contain&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Shuttle M5 1/2H</P>
</I><P>a minimum of five and one-half (5 1/2) hours of flight&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>average</P>
</I><P>time credit, averaged, for each on-duty period in</P>
<P>multiple duty period trip sequences or five and one-half</P>
<P>(5 1/2) hours for one (1) duty period trip sequence. In</P>
<P>computing the five and one-half (5 1/2) hour minimum,</P>
<P>there shall not be included any on-duty periods which</P>
<P>do not involve line flying, and this provision does not</P>
<P>apply to publicity and courtesy flights. The five and</P>
<P>one-half (5 1/2) hour minimum shall not apply to any</P>
<P>duty period composed solely of deadheading.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-c- </B>Schedules shall contain a minimum of one (1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Trip Rig 1 for 31/2</P>
</I><P>hour's flight time credit for each three and one-half (3 1/2)</P>
<P>hours elapsed time away from his domicile, prorated on a</P>
<P>schedule or actual basis whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-d- </B>When a trip pairing does not provide the</P>
<P>minimum credit provided by sub-paragraph 5-G-3-a, 5-G-3-</P>
<P>b and 5-G-3-c above, the following shall apply:</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-d-(1) </B>Credit time accrued as a result of the</P>
<P>application of the one (1) for two (2) and/or the one (1)</P>
<P>for one and three-quarters (1-3/4) on-duty formula</P>
<P>when applicable, shall for purposes of credit be added</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-G-3-f&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 87</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>to the end of the last flight in the on-duty period in</P>
<P>which such credit was accumulated.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-d-(2) </B>Credit time accrued as a result of the</P>
<P>application of the one (1) for three and one-half (3 1/2)</P>
<P>hours away-from-domicile formula and/or the minimum</P>
<P>five (5) hours average per duty period {five and one-half</P>
<P>(5 1/2) hours average per duty period for Shuttle</P>
<P>pilots}, shall, for purposes of credit, be added to the</P>
<P>end of the last flight in the away-from-domicile period</P>
<P>in which such credit was accumulated.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-e- Minimum Schedule Provisions, Minimum</P>
<P>Actual Credit Provisions or Actual Flight Time</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><P>At the completion of each trip pairing, the pay credit value&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>At the completion</P>
</I><P>of the pairing shall be considered to be the pay credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of the ID the pilot</P>
</I><P>value of the pairing as computed above, the pay credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>will be paid the</P>
</I><P>value of the credit provisions applied in the actual&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>greater of the</P>
</I><P>performance of the trip pairing, or the accumulated total&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>credit value in the</P>
</I><P>flight time performed in that pairing, whichever is greater.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>schedule or the</P>
</I><P>A pilot will be entitled to accrue "actual flight time" once&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>value of the duty</P>
</I><P>the flight has left the blocks for the purpose of flight,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>rigs applied in the</P>
</I><P>regardless of whether the segment is cancelled or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>actual operation</P>
</I><P>otherwise terminates at a location other than the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>or the actual flight</P>
</I><P>scheduled destination. The pilot will be entitled to the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>time performed</P>
</I><P>actual flight time accrual on the basis of his actual block to</P>
<P>block time.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-f- </B>On a schedule or actual basis, whichever is</P>
<P>greater, deadheading shall provide full flight time credit</P>
<P>and shall be used to offset the minimum credit and actual</P>
<P>provisions provided above.</P>
<B><P>5-G-3-g- </B>Trip sequences may be scheduled with up to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>4 duty period</P>
</I><P>four (4) duty periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>sequences</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-4- </B>When a pilot assigned to a line of flying is reassigned&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Junior manned or</P>
</I><P>or junior manned, and the assignment interferes with his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reassigned</P>
</I><P>minimum calendar days off, as provided in sub-paragraph 5-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restoration of</P>
</I><P>G-1-d above, he shall be given additional calendar days free&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>minimum days off</P>
</I><P>of duty to restore him to his minimum calendar days free of</P>
<P>all duty at his domicile. Should a trip drop provide more than</P>
<P>the required number of days off to restore the minimum to the</P>
<P>pilot, he may be given a Section 20-F standby or flight</P>
<P>assignment on those "extra" days off. The day(s) on which</P>
<P>the pilot will be given such assignment will be by mutual</P>
<P>agreement; unless agreement cannot be reached, in which</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 88&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;Section 5-G-5</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>case a Flight Manager shall make the determination. A</P>
<P>lineholder pilot who picks up open flying under Section 20-H</P>
<P>shall not reduce scheduled days off below twelve (12) for the</P>
<P>month. If he flies into a day off as a result of an irregular</P>
<P>operation, he is not subject to the provisions of this sub-paragraph.</P>
<P>Trips dropped under this provision will not affect</P>
<P>the pilot's minimum guarantee.</P>
<B><P>5-G-5- Reserve On Standby Status</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-5-a- </B>When a pilot on reserve is called to the airport&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Reserve airport</P>
</I><P>on a standby basis without a specified flight assignment,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>standby</P>
</I><P>his duty time shall begin at the time he is scheduled to</P>
<P>report or actually reports, whichever is later. The time on</P>
<P>standby duty plus the scheduled time of the assigned</P>
<P>flight cannot exceed the schedule maximum set forth in</P>
<P>Paragraph 5-G-1-a.</P>
<B><P>5-G-5-b- </B>A pilot on standby duty will receive five hours&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Flight time credit</P>
</I><P>(5:00) pay credit and have his total allowable monthly&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for reserve</P>
</I><P>flight time reduced by five hours (5:00) for each standby&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>standby</P>
</I><P>assignment which does not result in a flight assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment</P>
</I><B><P>5-G-5-c- </B>A pilot shall not be held on standby duty at the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Time limits on</P>
</I><P>airport in excess of four (4) hours and any assigned flight&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>standby</P>
</I><P>must be scheduled to depart no later than five (5) hours of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment</P>
</I><P>his report time. If a pilot is released from standby duty</P>
<P>without a flight assignment, he shall be entitled to legal</P>
<P>rest and may, at his option, revert to the bottom of the</P>
<P>FIFO list.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-H-</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><P>The following provisions shall apply to trip pairings in which&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Hawaii Special</P>
</I><P>at least two (2) segments involve flying to or from Hawaii:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;P<I>rovisions</P>
</I><B><P>5-H-1- </B>Flying to and from Hawaii may be assigned to any</P>
<P>domicile, provided no trip pairing exceeds four (4) duty</P>
<P>periods.</P>
<B><P>5-H-2- </B>The provisions of Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) and 5-G-2-</P>
<P>a-(1) shall apply to all duty periods except to duty periods</P>
<P>scheduled under sub-paragraph 3 below. When a pilot is</P>
<P>scheduled for duty aloft in excess of eight (8) hours as</P>
<P>provided by sub-paragraph 3, the duty period will not be</P>
<P>scheduled for more than fourteen (14) hours, nor will a pilot</P>
<P>so scheduled be required to remain on duty over sixteen (16)</P>
<P>hours without his concurrence.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 5-H-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 89</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5-H-3- </B>Notwithstanding Section 5-B-8, non-stop flights may</P>
<P>be scheduled which exceed eight (8) hours flight time, but no</P>
<P>more than twelve (12) hours, provided that such flight is the</P>
<P>only flight segment in that duty period.</P>
<B><P>5-H-4- </B>Notwithstanding Section 5-B-8, 5-G-1-c and 5-G-2-c,</P>
<P>trip pairings scheduled under this provision shall provide ten</P>
<P>hours and forty-five minutes (10:45) free from duty after duty</P>
<P>periods which contain eight (8) or fewer hours of flight time.</P>
<P>For duty periods which contain more than eight (8) hours of</P>
<P>flight time, the pilot shall have sixteen (16) hours free from</P>
<P>duty following such period.</P>
<B><P>5-H-5- </B>Notwithstanding Section 5-B-8, Mainland-Hawaii-Mainland&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>West Coast pilots</P>
</I><P>or Hawaii-Mainland-Hawaii flights may be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>only may be</P>
</I><P>scheduled in one (1) duty period only if the first segment is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>scheduled for</P>
</I><P>scheduled to depart between 0759 and 1301 domicile time of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>turn-arounds in a</P>
</I><P>the pilot so assigned. Trip pairings scheduled under this sub-paragraph&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>single duty period</P>
</I><P>may be assigned only to the LAX, SFO, SEA and</P>
<P>HNL domiciles; except coverage may be provided from any</P>
<P>domicile under the provisions of Paragraph 8-L-6.</P>
<B><P>5-H-6- </B>For flying from Hawaii to the Mainland when the first</P>
<P>scheduled Mainland landing is between 0259 and 1159 local</P>
<P>time, only one (1) landing will be scheduled in that duty</P>
<P>period.</P>
<B><P>5-H-7- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 5-B-9, a</P>
<P>pilot involved in flying to or from the Mainland and Hawaii</P>
<P>may be scheduled to exceed thirty (30) hours in seven (7)</P>
<P>days provided that the segment that exceeds thirty (30) hours</P>
<P>in seven (7) days is an overwater segment.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 90&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5-H-7</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Section 6-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Page 91</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 6</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Seniority</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>6-A- General</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
</I><B><P>6-A-1- </B>Pilot seniority shall accrue from the date of hire as a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Establishment of</P>
</I><P>student pilot with the Company, as defined by Section 2-X of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilot seniority date</P>
</I><P>this Agreement, or with other companies whose operations</P>
<P>have been taken over by the Company prior to signing of this</P>
<P>Agreement. Seniority shall continue to accrue from such date</P>
<P>and shall not cease to accrue or be lost except as provided in</P>
<P>this Section and Section 7 and 12 of this Agreement. The</P>
<P>accrual of Pilot seniority is contingent upon the successful</P>
<P>completion of initial training as a student pilot.</P>
<B><P>6-A-2- </B>Seniority shall govern all pilots in the case of</P>
<P>promotion and demotion, their retention in case of reduction</P>
<P>in force, their assignment or reassignment due to expansion</P>
<P>or reduction in schedules, their reemployment after release</P>
<P>due to reduction in force and their choice of vacancies,</P>
<P>provided that the pilot's qualifications are sufficient for the</P>
<P>conduct of the operation. In the event that a pilot is</P>
<P>considered by the Company not to be sufficiently qualified,</P>
<P>the Company shall immediately furnish such pilot written</P>
<P>reasons therefor. This Section shall apply unless otherwise</P>
<P>specifically excepted by some other provision of this</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>6-B- Seniority Lists</P>
</B><P>Two official Flight Officer Seniority Lists shall be published&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Company will</P>
</I><P>annually. One shall be called the Pilot Eligibility Seniority List&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>publish annually 2</P>
</I><P>and shall contain the names of all flight officers who are&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>official lists. S/O</P>
</I><P>eligible to be awarded Captain, First Officer and International&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Eligibility List and</P>
</I><P>Relief Pilot assignments. The second list shall be called the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>the Pilot Eligibility</P>
</I><P>Second Officer Eligibility Seniority List and shall contain the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Seniority List</P>
</I><P>names of all flight officers who are eligible to be awarded</P>
<P>Second Officer assignments. The Second Officers Eligibility</P>
<P>Seniority List shall recognize the special rights of those who</P>
<P>have been designated "Career Second Officers" under the</P>
<P>Letter of Agreement, dated June 11, 1963. Copies of the</P>
<P>United Air Lines Pilot Eligibility Seniority List and the Second</P>
<P>Officer Eligibility Seniority List will be brought up to date as of</P>
<P>July 1 of each year and shall be posted and considered the</P>
<P>official list. Each pilot shall be allowed a maximum period of</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 92&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 6-C</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>sixty (60) days after the date of distribution by the Company</P>
<P>of each list in which to protest any alleged omission or</P>
<P>incorrect listing affecting his seniority. A pilot who does not</P>
<P>protest such alleged omission or incorrect listing within sixty</P>
<P>(60) days after the date of distribution by the Company of the</P>
<P>list in which the alleged omission or incorrect listing initially</P>
<P>appears, shall thereafter be precluded from protesting the</P>
<P>same except that when a pilot is on vacation, leave of</P>
<P>absence or sick leave, he shall protest any alleged omission</P>
<P>or incorrect listing within sixty (60) days after returning to</P>
<P>duty. All seniority protests arising from such revised lists</P>
<P>shall be handled in accordance with the procedures outlined</P>
<P>in Section 17 of this Agreement, and, when so handled, the</P>
<P>result forthcoming therefrom shall be final and binding.</P>
<B><P>6-C- Period of Probation</P>
</B><P>Pilots shall be on probation for the twelve (12) months of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Probation is 12</P>
</I><P>service as a pilot employee of the Company (measured from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>month and 165</P>
</I><P>the pilot's Pilot Longevity Date) and having performed 165&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>days of work</P>
</I><P>days of work for the Company. "Work" in this context, will</P>
<P>include pilot duty, reserve availability, training, instruction,</P>
<P>special assignment and all other flight duties for which</P>
<P>compensation is paid. Nothing in this Agreement shall be</P>
<P>construed to prevent the Company from releasing a pilot</P>
<P>during his period of probation regardless of his position on</P>
<P>the System Seniority List.</P>
<B><P>6-D- Loss of Seniority</P>
</B><P>Any pilot who resigns from the service of the Company as a</P>
<P>pilot or is discharged as a pilot for just cause shall forfeit all</P>
<P>pilot seniority accrued to the date of such resignation or</P>
<P>discharge.</P>
<B><P>6-E- Transfer to Non-Flying, Supervisory Duty or Special</P>
<P>Assignment</P>
<P>6-E-1- </B>A pilot transferred to non-flying, supervisory duties or</P>
<P>special assignment shall retain and continue to accrue</P>
<P>seniority.</P>
<B><P>6-E-2- </B>When a pilot is transferred to non-flying, supervisory</P>
<P>duty or special assignment on account of any physical</P>
<P>incapacity, or becomes sick or injured while on such non-flying,</P>
<P>supervisory duty or special assignment, he shall retain</P>
<P>and continue to accrue seniority during such period of</P>
<P>sickness or injury regardless of whether or not he is able to</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 6-E-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 93</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>maintain his airline pilot's certificate or certificates required</P>
<P>for his pilot's status, until he is able to return to flying duty or</P>
<P>is found to be unfit for such duty for a continuous period of</P>
<P>seven (7) years, provided, however, that such period will be</P>
<P>extended to ten (10) years if in the opinion of the Company's</P>
<P>Medical Director, the medical possibility exists for the pilot's</P>
<P>ability to obtain his airline pilot's certificate or certificates</P>
<P>required for his pilot's status within such extended period.</P>
<P>Any pilot who is not granted an extension to ten (10) years</P>
<P>may, at his option, have a review of such determination under</P>
<P>the provisions of Paragraph 14-B, 14-C and 14-D of Section</P>
<P>14.</P>
<B><P>6-E-3- </B>When a pilot engaged in non-flying, supervisory duty</P>
<P>or special assignments returns to flying duty, he shall assume</P>
<P>his former assignment or, in the event he has bid another</P>
<P>assignment while on such duty, assume such new</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>6-E-4- </B>Any dispute arising hereunder concerning the</P>
<P>physical fitness of such pilot shall be settled in accordance</P>
<P>with Section 14.</P>
<B><P>6-F-</P>
</B><P>A pilot, while assigned to supervisory or management duty, shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Management</P>
</I><P>perform as Captain in line operations only if he holds a Captain bid and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilots flying</P>
</I><P>shall perform as a First Officer in line operations only if he holds a</P>
<P>Captain, First Officer, or IRP bid. Management pilots shall serve in line</P>
<P>operations on an equipment type assigned by the Company.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 94&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 6-F</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Section 7-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 95</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 7</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Reduction In Personnel</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>7-A-</P>
<P>7-A-1- </B>Any reduction in pilot personnel shall be in the</P>
<P>reverse order of system seniority, except as provided in the</P>
<P>Letter of Agreement between the Company and the</P>
<P>Association, signed June 11, 1963. When it becomes</P>
<P>necessary to furlough pilots covered by this Agreement, at</P>
<P>least thirty (30) days, but not more than one hundred and</P>
<P>twenty (120) days, notice of such furlough shall be given all</P>
<P>pilots affected; provided, however, that when there is no work</P>
<P>because of an Act of God, labor dispute, or other</P>
<P>circumstances over which the Company has no control, pilots</P>
<P>covered by this Agreement may be furloughed without</P>
<P>advance notice. Such pilots furloughed due to reduction in</P>
<P>force shall be reemployed in the order of their seniority at the</P>
<P>time of furlough.</P>
<B><P>7-A-2- </B>Pilots returning to active service from furlough shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Recalled pilots</P>
</I><P>be assigned, in accordance with their seniority and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>will receive travel</P>
</I><P>preference, to advertised but unfilled assignment vacancies&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>time</P>
</I><P>on the system as provided in Section 8-F-3-c. If the recalled</P>
<P>pilot is assigned to a domicile other than that from which he</P>
<P>was furloughed, he shall be allowed moving expenses and</P>
<P>travel time in accordance with Section 10 from his former</P>
<P>domicile to the domicile to which recalled. Additionally, pilots</P>
<P>returning from furlough to the domicile from which they were</P>
<P>furloughed will be allowed travel time from their residence</P>
<P>during furlough to their domicile as per Section 10-A-2.</P>
<B><P>7-B-</P>
</B><P>When a probationary pilot is furloughed, he shall be</P>
<P>furloughed in accordance with the provisions of this Section.</P>
<B><P>7-C-</P>
</B><P>A pilot who has been furloughed due to reduction in force</P>
<P>shall file his address in writing with the Personnel</P>
<P>Department of the Company and shall thereafter promptly</P>
<P>advise the Personnel Department in writing of any change in</P>
<P>address.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 96&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 7-D</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>7-D-</P>
</B><P>A pilot shall not be entitled to recall as provided in Paragraph</P>
<P>7-A of this Section and shall forfeit all seniority if he does not</P>
<P>comply with the requirements of Paragraph 7-C of this</P>
<P>Section or if he does not return to the service of the Company</P>
<P>on or before the date specified in the notice offering re-employment,</P>
<P>which date shall be not less than thirty (30)</P>
<P>days, or if such pilot is outside the continental limits of the</P>
<P>United States forty-five (45) days, after notice to return is</P>
<P>sent by registered mail, return receipt requested, or by</P>
<P>telegram to the last address filed with the Personnel</P>
<P>Department. Notice of intent to accept offer of recall from</P>
<P>furlough must be furnished to the Company by telegram or</P>
<P>registered letter within fourteen (14) days from the date of</P>
<P>receipt of recall notice.</P>
<B><P>7-D-1- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph D above, a pilot who</P>
<P>accepts employment while on furlough which requires a</P>
<P>contractual commitment for a period not to exceed two (2)</P>
<P>years, shall be allowed to fulfill such obligation and shall be</P>
<P>considered to be on personal leave of absence commencing</P>
<P>with the date of recall until fulfillment of such employment</P>
<P>obligation, provided such pilot has received Company</P>
<P>concurrence prior to such contractual commitment.</P>
<B><P>7-E-</P>
</B><P>A pilot furloughed due to reduction in force who returns to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Recall from</P>
</I><P>duty as provided in Paragraph 7-D of this Section shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>furlough</P>
</I><P>allowed, for seniority purposes, all time accrued prior to such</P>
<P>furlough as well as all time within the period of furlough. All</P>
<P>furloughs shall expire at the end of seven (7) years from the</P>
<P>effective date of such furloughs and any accrued seniority</P>
<P>shall be forfeited; provided, however, that there shall be no</P>
<P>change in the relative seniority position on the System</P>
<P>Seniority List as the result of any furloughs unless the pilot</P>
<P>fails to exercise the privilege provided for in Paragraph 7-D of</P>
<P>this Section. Reinstatement shall be subject to the furloughed</P>
<P>pilot's passing a satisfactory physical examination and to his</P>
<P>possessing the airman's certificate or certificates required for</P>
<P>his pilot status at the time of reinstatement. After</P>
<P>reinstatement, pilots shall be required to serve any unexpired</P>
<P>portion of their probationary period.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 7-F&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 97</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>7-F-</P>
<P>7-F-1- </B>A pilot who has one (1) or more years of service as a</P>
<P>pilot and who is furloughed shall receive furlough pay</P>
<P>equivalent to the minimum monthly flight pay guarantee</P>
<P>based on the type of equipment flown his last full month prior</P>
<P>to furlough for the period of time specified below, except that</P>
<P>no furlough shall be paid where furloughs are caused by an</P>
<P>Act of God, labor dispute or other circumstances over which</P>
<P>the Company has no control.</P>
<P>If pilot has completed:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Furlough Pay</P>
</I></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>1 yr of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;1/2 month furlough pay</P>
<P>2 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 month furlough pay</P>
<P>3 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 1/2 months furlough pay</P>
<P>4 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 months furlough pay</P>
<P>5 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 1/2 months furlough pay
</P>
<P>6 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 months furlough pay</P>
<P>7 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 1/2 months furlough pay
</P>
<P>8 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 months furlough pay</P>
<P>9 yrs of service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 1/2 months furlough pay</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>7-F-2- </B>A pilot eligible for furlough pay shall receive such pay</P>
<P>starting at the time of furlough and such payments shall be at</P>
<P>regular pay periods and continue until all furlough pay credit</P>
<P>is exhausted, except that in no event shall any such payment</P>
<P>be due after his effective date of recall by the Company.</P>
<B><P>7-F-3- </B>A pilot recalled by the Company who is later&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pay for multiple</P>
</I><P>furloughed shall again be entitled to furlough pay as provided&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>furlough</P>
</I><P>in Paragraph 7-F-1 of this Section.</P>
<B><P>7-F-4- </B>The Company may offer furloughed pilots other jobs</P>
<P>in the Company on a voluntary basis. If a pilot volunteers to</P>
<P>accept such job, he will only be eligible for that portion of his</P>
<P>monthly furlough payment which exceeds the amount of his</P>
<P>monthly salary in the volunteer assignment..</P>
<B><P>7-G-</P>
</B><P>The Accident-Sickness-Dental Insurance of a pilot (and of his&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Accident /</P>
</I><P>eligible dependents) who is furloughed due to a reduction in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>sickness / dental</P>
</I><P>force will be continued while he is on furlough for a period of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>- 90 days</P>
</I><P>ninety (90) days from the date of his furlough.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 98&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 7-H</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>7-H-</P>
</B><P>A pilot who has received notice of furlough shall be exempt from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot with furlough</P>
</I><P>the provisions of Section 8-F-3-a and 8-F-3-b and Section 8-K.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>notice cannot be</P>
</I><P>Pilots who are declared surplus while other junior pilots in the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>bumped</P>
</I><P>same domicile, status and equipment are exempted under this</P>
<P>provision shall be pay protected on a one-for-one basis for the</P>
<P>period of this exemption. During this period those pilots</P>
<P>qualifying for pay protection shall continue to receive the salary</P>
<P>of the equipment from which displaced.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 99</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Section 8</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Filling Of Vacancies</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-A- Classification of Assignments</P>
<P>8-A-1- </B>Pilot assignments at a domicile shall be classified in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Assignments</P>
</I><P>the status of Captain, First Officer, International Relief Pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>classified</P>
</I><P>and Second Officer, as applicable, in each of the following</P>
<P>equipment types: B-747-400, B-747, B-777, DC-10, B-767/B-757,</P>
<P>A-320/A-319, B-727, B-737-300/400/500, B-737 and all</P>
<P>Shuttle equipment.</P>
<B><P>8-A-2- </B>The Company shall each month post on computer, in</P>
<P>Unimatic and in the Pilots' Bulletin Book at all domiciles an</P>
<P>up-to-date list of all pilot assignments.</P>
<B><P>8-B- Manpower Requirements</P>
</B><P>The number of Captain, First Officer, International Relief Pilot&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Minimum</P>
</I><P>and Second Officer assignments in each equipment type,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>manpower</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>requirements</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 100&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-B-1</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>when required, shall be determined by the following</P>
<P>procedure:</P>
<B><P>8-B-1- </B>Scheduled hours</P>
<P>(including MAC) plus flight</P>
<P>time credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>81:00 = pilots</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-B-2- </B>Reserve -</P>
<P>17% of item #1 (Captains)</P>
<P>15% of item #1 (First</P>
<P>Officers)</P>
<P>15% of item #1 (second</P>
<P>Officers)</P>
<P>12% of all Shuttle scheduled</P>
<P>hours and flight time credit&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>= pilots</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-B-3- </B>Charter &amp; extra lift</P>
<P>hours&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>65:00= pilots</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-B-4- </B>Sick leave man</P>
<P>months&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>= pilots</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-B-5- </B>Vacation man months&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>= pilots</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>8-B-6- </B>Training man months</P>
<P>(including PC/PT)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>= pilots</P>
<P>TOTAL SYSTEM PILOT REQUIREMENTS</P>
<P>FOR 60 DAYS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;= pilots</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Nothing herein shall prevent the Company from bidding or</P>
<P>maintaining additional assignments for reserve coverage by</P>
<P>equipment type in excess of the percentage set forth above.</P>
<B><P>8-C- Advertising of Vacancies</P>
<P>8-C-1-</P>
<P>8-C-1-a- </B>Vacancies in Captain, First Officer, International&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Advertise within</P>
</I><P>Relief Pilot and Second Officer assignments shall exist&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>30 days after</P>
</I><P>when, in accordance with Section 8-B, there is a need for&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>vacancy exists</P>
</I><P>additional assignment for an anticipated period of sixty</P>
<P>(60) days or more. Vacancies shall be advertised at all</P>
<P>domiciles as far in advance as possible but not later than</P>
<P>thirty (30) days after such vacancy exists.</P>
<B><P>8-C-1-b- </B>Vacancies which were not expected to exist</P>
<P>more than sixty (60) days, if existing at the end of sixty</P>
<P>(60) days, shall be reviewed with the System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee. Such vacancies shall be advertised within five</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
