</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Section 8-C-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 101</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>(5) days after such review unless it is mutually agreed that</P>
<P>the vacancies will cease to exist within a reasonable</P>
<P>period.</P>
<B><P>8-C-2- </B>All such vacancies shall be open to bid by the pilots</P>
<P>eligible to bid under the provisions of Section 8-D. Vacancy</P>
<P>bulletins shall state the number and status of primary</P>
<P>vacancies to be filled; the anticipated effective date of the</P>
<P>assignment; the anticipated dates training is to start; the</P>
<P>equipment type involved; and the domicile at which the</P>
<P>vacancy exists. All vacancies posted together shall share a</P>
<P>common closing date and a common effective date, except</P>
<P>that DC-10 and B-727 Second Officer vacancies which are</P>
<P>posted at the same time as other vacancies, shall share the</P>
<P>same closing date, but may have an earlier advertised</P>
<P>effective date. If, as a result of this special Second Officer</P>
<P>provision, a pilot has an opportunity to bid a vacancy which</P>
<P>has an earlier effective date than an assignment previously</P>
<P>bid, he shall be eligible for such assignment, notwithstanding</P>
<P>any prior freeze. Vacancy bulletins shall be posted not later</P>
<P>than noon local time on the date of the bulletin and shall</P>
<P>close not sooner than noon local time on the tenth (10th) day</P>
<P>following the date of the bulletin.</P>
<B><P>8-C-3- Bidding on Vacancies</P>
<P>8-C-3-a- </B>During the time when primary vacancies are</P>
<P>posted for bid, bids will be accepted from eligible pilots for</P>
<P>pilot assignments in all domiciles, status and equipment</P>
<P>types active on the airline. A pilot desiring a change in</P>
<P>domicile, status and/or equipment type should submit bids</P>
<P>for all assignments which he desires, in preference order,</P>
<P>at any time any vacancies are advertised.</P>
<B><P>8-C-3-b- </B>In addition to the process described in a above,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot may submit</P>
</I><P>pilots who desire to have their bids remain on file&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>and maintain a</P>
</I><P>indefinitely for consideration in filling future vacancies&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>permanent bid on</P>
</I><P>may submit "permanent bids." Permanent bids may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>file</P>
</I><P>require direct entry by the pilot into the Company's</P>
<P>computer system. A pilot may revise his permanent bid file</P>
<P>at any time, however, the bid on file at the close of each</P>
<P>bidding period shall be the pilot's official bid for those</P>
<P>vacancies.</P>
<B><P>8-C-3-c- </B>The Company will implement within twelve (12)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Conditional</P>
</I><P>months of the date of the signing of the Agreement,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bidding</P>
</I><P>conditional bidding for all new equipment domiciles or for</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 102&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section8-C-3-d</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>the splitting of an existing domicile (e.g. conversion from</P>
<P>Mainline to Shuttle).</P>
<B><P>8-C-3-d- </B>Permanent bids as described above shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Procedure for</P>
</I><P>considered as cancelled by one of the following:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>cancellation of</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>permanent bid</P>
</I><B><P>8-C-3-d-(1) </B>Submission of a request to cancel the</P>
<P>permanent bid.</P>
<B><P>8-C-3-d-(2) </B>Submission of a vacancy bid on any posted</P>
<P>primary vacancies.</P>
<B><P>8-C-3-d-(3) </B>Being awarded a vacancy as a result of a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Including both</P>
</I><P>bid.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>permanent and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alternate</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>passover bids</P>
</I><B><P>8-C-4- Awarding of Vacancies</P>
</B><P>Upon closing of a vacancy bulletin, pilots shall be awarded</P>
<P>the number of assignments needed in each of the advertised</P>
<P>vacancies. At the same time, pilots shall be awarded</P>
<P>assignments, if needed, in domicile, status and equipment</P>
<P>types which have become available due to the assignment of</P>
<P>pilots to fill the advertised primary vacancies. Further, awards</P>
<P>may be made to fill the vacancies resulting from all</P>
<P>subsequent awards. These secondary vacancies will not</P>
<P>have been advertised, but will share the same effective date</P>
<P>as the primary vacancies.</P>
<B><P>8-C-5-</P>
<P>8-C-5-a- </B>The most senior pilot bidding on an assignment</P>
<P>vacancy, unless excepted by Section 8-C-5-b below, shall</P>
<P>be awarded such assignment. The filling of all vacancies</P>
<P>shall be subject to Paragraph 6-A-2 of Section 6 and</P>
<P>Paragraph 8-D of this Section, provided that, for the</P>
<P>purpose of this Paragraph, the phrase "sufficiently</P>
<P>qualified" appearing in Paragraph 6-A-2 of Section 6</P>
<P>means the pilot's qualifications as an airline pilot,</P>
<P>exclusive of route and equipment qualification, provided</P>
<P>that if the pilot has been given the opportunity to so</P>
<P>qualify and has failed, he may be denied the assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-C-5-b- </B>When a vacancy or vacancies occur in a status,</P>
<P>equipment type and domicile from which pilot(s) has been</P>
<P>displaced, under the provisions of Section 8-F and 8-K,</P>
<P>the displaced pilot(s) shall for a period of one hundred and</P>
<P>twenty (120) days beyond the effective date of their</P>
<P>displacement be offered in order of seniority the</P>
<P>assignment(s) prior to the awarding of that assignment(s)</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-C-6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 103</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>under the provisions of 8-C. This 120 day period is</P>
<P>measured from the effective date of the surplus to the</P>
<P>bulletin date of the vacancy.</P>
<B><P>8-C-6-</P>
</B><P>All vacancies will be advertised for bid and awards made not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>6 months</P>
</I><P>more than six (6) months prior to the effective date of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>advertised to</P>
</I><P>vacancy, except the Company may exceed this time limit if&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>effective date</P>
</I><P>necessary to meet training requirements after review with the</P>
<P>System Schedule Committee.</P>
<B><P>8-D- Eligibility To Be Awarded Vacancies</P>
</B><P>In addition to the provisions stated in 8-C above, a pilot's&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bidding</P>
</I><P>eligibility to vacancies shall be subject to the following&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restrictions</P>
</I><P>conditions:</P>
<B><P>8-D-1- </B>A pilot occupying a Second Officer assignment and</P>
<P>any pilot in his first year of service is eligible to be awarded</P>
<P>any other assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-D-2- </B>A pilot occupying an International Relief Pilot</P>
<P>assignment is eligible to be awarded any other International</P>
<P>Relief Pilot assignment and any First Officer and any Captain</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-D-3- </B>A pilot occupying a First Officer assignment is</P>
<P>eligible to be awarded any other First Officer assignment and</P>
<P>any Captain assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-D-4- </B>A pilot occupying a Captain assignment is eligible to</P>
<P>be awarded any other Captain assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-D-5- </B>In addition to the provisions of sub-paragraph 8-D-1,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Downbid in status</P>
</I><P>8-D-2, 8-D-3 and 8-D-4 above, a pilot holding an assignment</P>
<P>as a A-320/319, B-727, B-737-300/400/500, B-737 or Shuttle</P>
<P>B-737-300/400/500 Captain may bid and be awarded a</P>
<P>vacancy in a B-747-400, B-747 or a B777 First Officer</P>
<P>assignment and a pilot holding an assignment as a B-767/</P>
<P>757, A-320/319, B-727, B-737-300/400/500, B-737 or Shuttle</P>
<P>First Officer may bid and be awarded a vacancy in a B-747 or</P>
<P>DC-10 Second Officer assignment or an International Relief</P>
<P>Pilot (IRP) assignment. A pilot awarded an assignment under</P>
<P>the provisions of this sub-paragraph may be required to fill</P>
<P>such assignment for a period of twenty-four (24) months</P>
<P>following the date on which he is activated in the assignment.</P>
<P>Further, a Captain who is awarded a First Officer assignment</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 104&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-D-6</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>under the provisions of this sub-paragraph shall be ineligible</P>
<P>to bid and be awarded any Shuttle, B-737, B-737-300/400/</P>
<P>500, B-727, A-320/319, or B-767/757 Captain assignment</P>
<P>during that twenty-four (24) month bid restriction,</P>
<P>notwithstanding the provisions of 8-D-6-c, below.</P>
<B><P>8-D-6-</P>
<P>8-D-6-a- </B>Notwithstanding the eligibility provisions of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bidding freezes</P>
</I><P>Section 8, Paragraph 8-D-1, 8-D-2, 8-D-3 and 8-D-4, when</P>
<P>a pilot is awarded an assignment through bidding, he may</P>
<P>be ineligible to bid and be awarded any other vacancy with</P>
<P>an effective date earlier than fourteen (14) months</P>
<P>(twenty-four (24) months, if scheduled training includes</P>
<P>more than twelve (12) days which contain training duty)</P>
<P>after the first day of the month following the month he was</P>
<P>awarded his bid. In determining the number of scheduled</P>
<P>training days for this application only, INS, overwater and/</P>
<P>or any other specialized training shall not be counted</P>
<P>when such qualification(s) is not required of all pilots</P>
<P>assigned to that equipment type and status.</P>
<B><P>8-D-6-b- </B>The above bid restriction shall also apply to a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Freeze</P>
</I><P>pilot who requires training upon being hired as a pilot or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>restrictions for</P>
</I><P>upon being recalled from furlough; except that the period&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>recallees and new</P>
</I><P>of restriction shall begin upon the date the pilot is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>hires</P>
</I><P>assigned to training.</P>
<B><P>8-D-6-c- </B>The above provision shall not restrict a pilot</P>
<P>from bidding up in status (i.e., Second Officer to</P>
<P>International Relief Pilot to First Officer to Captain) at any</P>
<P>time; however, a pilot who vacates an awarded</P>
<P>assignment by bidding up in status, may be ineligible to</P>
<P>bid and be awarded any other vacancy with an effective</P>
<P>date earlier than the fourteen (14) (twenty-four (24))</P>
<P>months provided above, plus the amount remaining</P>
<P>unfulfilled from his prior assignment. Notwithstanding the</P>
<P>above bidding restriction, a pilot who is awarded a</P>
<P>vacancy and subsequently receives another award to a</P>
<P>higher status prior to beginning training for the initial</P>
<P>vacancy award shall not incur any bidding restriction as a</P>
<P>result of the initial vacancy award.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-D-6-d&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 105</P>
<P>8-D-6-d- </B>A pilot who is not within a bid restriction period&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot who is not</P>
</I><P>as provided by this sub-paragraph D-6 and who is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>serving a freeze</P>
</I><P>awarded a vacancy in his present status and equipment&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>may be awarded a</P>
</I><P>type at another domicile will be entitled to reimbursement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>lateral with no</P>
</I><P>of moving expenses as provided in Section 8-E-2-b and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>freeze if he elects</P>
</I><P>may incur a fourteen (14) month bid restriction as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>not to take the</P>
</I><P>provided in Section 8-D-6-a. Such a bid restriction,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>paid move</P>
</I><P>however, will not be imposed until the pilot incurs an</P>
<P>expense associated with exercising his paid move</P>
<P>entitlement. Conversely, if the pilot does not seek</P>
<P>reimbursement from the Company for expenses</P>
<P>associated with his relocation, a bid restriction period will</P>
<P>not be imposed. In the event a bid restriction is imposed,</P>
<P>the period of the bid restriction will run fourteen (14)</P>
<P>months from the first day of the schedule month following</P>
<P>the posting of the tentative award, regardless of when the</P>
<P>expense was first incurred. For the purpose of this</P>
<P>provision, the phrase "incurs an expense" shall not</P>
<P>include the moving provisions contained in Section 10-A-2-</P>
<P>a, and 10-A-2-c and the use of the applicable</P>
<P>authorized travel for the purposes of house-hunting.</P>
<B><P>8-D-7- </B>A pilot who is ineligible to be awarded a vacancy in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot serving a</P>
</I><P>his present status and equipment type at another domicile&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>freeze may be</P>
</I><P>because of the bid restrictions of 8-D-6 above, may&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>awarded unlimited</P>
</I><P>nonetheless be awarded such vacancy under the following&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>laterals with no</P>
</I><P>conditions:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>additional freeze</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or paid moves</P>
</I><B><P>8-D-7-a- </B>If awarded, he shall receive no new paid move</P>
<P>nor travel time entitlement as a result of his new</P>
<P>assignments.</P>
<B><P>8-D-7-b- </B>He shall continue to serve out the period of his</P>
<P>bid restriction associated with the assignment held prior to</P>
<P>the lateral award, but shall incur no additional bid</P>
<P>restriction.</P>
<B><P>8-D-7-c- </B>This provision shall be available to a pilot on an</P>
<P>unlimited basis.</P>
<B><P>8-D-8- </B>.Only pilots who have met the basic prerequisite</P>
<P>piloting requirements for Air Line Transport Pilot Certificate,</P>
<P>including successful completion of the written examination</P>
<P>and notification to the Company of this completion, and who</P>
<P>have completed twelve (12) months of service as a United</P>
<P>First Officer shall be eligible to bid or bump to Captain</P>
<P>vacancies.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 106&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-D-9</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-D-9- </B>Only those pilots who are either active Second</P>
<P>Officers or have completed the FAA Flight Engineer turbo-jet</P>
<P>written exam and have so notified the Company, shall be</P>
<P>eligible to bid or bump an International Relief Pilot vacancy.</P>
<B><P>8-D-10- </B>Only those pilots who have successfully completed</P>
<P>the FAA Flight Engineer turbo-jet written exam or who</P>
<P>possess a valid Flight Engineer's certificate and have so</P>
<P>notified the Company may bid or bump to a Second Officer</P>
<P>vacancy.</P>
<B><P>8-E- Awarding of Vacancies</P>
<P>8-E-1- </B>A successful bidder on a vacancy at his domicile</P>
<P>shall take over his new assignment on the date that the flying</P>
<P>supporting such assignment actually begins or when training</P>
<P>is completed for such assignment, whichever is later. If the</P>
<P>new assignment is planned to be activated prior to the first</P>
<P>day of the pilot schedule month, he may exercise his seniority</P>
<P>in his awarded assignment under Section 20-D. If, however,</P>
<P>the new assignment is activated at a time which precludes his</P>
<P>exercising his seniority in his awarded assignment under the</P>
<P>Section 20-D, he will be assigned as a reserve in his awarded</P>
<P>status and equipment type until the commencement of the</P>
<P>next schedule for which he exercises his seniority under the</P>
<P>schedule selection procedure.</P>
<B><P>8-E-2-</P>
<P>8-E-2-a- </B>A successful bidder on a vacancy which</P>
<P>required a change in domicile shall take over his new</P>
<P>assignment on the date that the flying supporting such</P>
<P>assignment actually begins or when training is completed</P>
<P>for such assignment, whichever is later. If the new</P>
<P>assignment is planned to be activated at a time which</P>
<P>permits his exercise of seniority in his awarded</P>
<P>assignment under Section 20-D, he shall be afforded such</P>
<P>opportunity. If, however, the new assignment is activated</P>
<P>at a time which precludes his exercising his seniority in his</P>
<P>awarded assignment under Section 20-D, he will be</P>
<P>assigned as a reserve in his awarded status and</P>
<P>equipment type under the commencement of the next</P>
<P>schedule for which he exercises his seniority until the</P>
<P>schedule selection procedure.</P>
<B><P>8-E-2-b- </B>A pilot who is awarded a vacancy at another&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Paid move</P>
</I><P>domicile shall be entitled to moving expenses upon&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>application</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-E-2-c&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 107</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>activation of that vacancy, under the provisions of Section</P>
<P>10.</P>
<B><P>8-E-2-c- </B>Should a pilot be activated into his new&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Salary proration</P>

</I><P>assignment during a schedule month, his salary shall be</P>
<P>prorated as provided in Section 3-C.</P>
<B><P>8-E-3- </B>A pilot shall not be prevented by the Company from</P>
<P>taking over his awarded assignment in excess of ninety-two</P>
<P>(92) days after the awarded assignment is activated. If a pilot</P>
<P>is prevented by the Company from taking over his new</P>
<P>assignment after it has been activated, he shall be</P>
<P>compensated as follows until he is released by the Company</P>
<P>to take over his new assignment:</P>
<B><P>8-E-3-a- </B>He shall receive for the period involved a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Salary proration</P>
</I><P>monthly salary based on the status and equipment type of</P>
<P>his awarded assignment, or what he actually earned,</P>
<P>whichever is greater; prorated, as provided by Section 3-C,</P>
<P>if the change is mid-month.</P>
<B><P>8-E-3-b- </B>Further, if the successful bidder has been&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Expenses</P>
</I><P>prevented by the Company from taking over his new&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>allowance for</P>
</I><P>assignment as specified in sub-paragraph 8-E-2 above, or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>delayed activation</P>
</I><P>after the awarded vacancy is activated, whichever is later,</P>
<P>in excess of forty-five (45) days, he shall receive an</P>
<P>expense allowance in accordance with Section 4-E-1 of</P>
<P>this Agreement until his awarded assignment is activated.</P>
<B><P>8-E-3-c- </B>An awarded vacancy shall be considered to</P>
<P>have been activated at the domicile, for the application of</P>
<P>this sub-paragraph E-3, on a man-for-man basis if:</P>
<B><P>8-E-3-c-(1) </B>A more junior pilot who was awarded such&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Man-for-man</P>
</I><P>assignment on the same vacancy bulletin as the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>application</P>
</I><P>affected pilot is activated into the same assignment; or</P>
<P>a pilot who was awarded such assignment on a</P>
<P>vacancy bulletin subsequent to the bulletin awarded</P>
<P>the affected pilot is activated into the same</P>
<P>assignment; or</P>
<B><P>8-E-3-c-(2) </B>Subsequent to the advised effective date of</P>
<P>the assignment, temporary duty pilots are assigned to</P>
<P>the domicile in the status and equipment type of the</P>
<P>affected pilot's awarded assignment.</P>
<P>Note: Intent of "man-for-man" in this application:</P>
<P>In the event two assignments are to be activated, if 2nd</P>
<P>and 4th are activated then #2 triggers pay for #1 and</P>
<P>#4 triggers pay for #3.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 108&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section8-E-4</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-E-4- </B>A successful bidder who has been prevented by the</P>
<P>Company from taking over his new assignment under the</P>
<P>provisions of sub-paragraph 8-E-3 and is then released to</P>
<P>take over such assignment at a time which precludes his</P>
<P>exercising his seniority in his awarded vacancy under the</P>
<P>schedule selection procedures (Section 20-B), will be</P>
<P>assigned as a reserve in his awarded status and equipment</P>
<P>type until the first of the month following his release; or, if a</P>
<P>schedule selection procedure occurs as a result of a</P>
<P>schedule change during the month, until the effective date of</P>
<P>such schedule change.</P>
<B><P>8-F- Insufficient Bidders</P>
<P>8-F-1- </B>In the event there are insufficient bids received on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Assignment</P>
</I><P>Captain vacancy, the Company may fill such vacancy by&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>insufficient</P>
</I><P>assigning the junior pilot at the domicile at which the vacancy&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Captain bidders</P>
</I><P>exists who meets the requirements specified in Paragraph 8-</P>
<P>D-8 of this Section. If no junior pilot at the domicile meets</P>
<P>these requirements then the Company may assign the junior</P>
<P>pilot on the system who meets these requirements. Pilots</P>
<P>transferred from one domicile to another under the provisions</P>
<P>of this sub-paragraph shall be transferred in accordance with</P>
<P>Section 8 and receive moving expenses in accordance with</P>
<P>Section 10 and shall be given as much advance notice as</P>
<P>possible but not less than thirty (30) days to assume such</P>
<P>vacancy.</P>
<B><P>8-F-2- </B>In the event there are insufficient bids received on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Assignment</P>
</I><P>First Officer vacancy, the Company may, with not less than&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>insufficient First</P>
</I><P>thirty (30) days notice:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Officer bidders</P>
</I><B><P>8-F-2-a- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning the junior pilot at</P>
<P>the domicile, or</P>
<B><P>8-F-2-b- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning any surplus</P>
<P>pilots who desire to move in order of seniority from the</P>
<P>domicile at which a surplus exists. If no pilots desire to</P>
<P>move, the Company may then move pilots from that</P>
<P>domicile to fill the unfilled vacancy in reverse order of</P>
<P>seniority. Pilots transferred from one domicile to another</P>
<P>under the provisions of this sub-paragraph shall be</P>
<P>transferred in accordance with Section 8 and receive</P>
<P>moving expenses in accordance with Section 10.</P>
<B><P>8-F-3- </B>In the event there are insufficient bids received on an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Assignment</P>
</I><P>International Relief Pilot vacancy, the Company may, with not&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>insufficient IRP</P>
</I><P>less than thirty (30) days notice:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>bidders</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-F-3-a Page 109</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-F-3-a- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning the junior eligible</P>
<P>Second Officer at that domicile.</P>
<B><P>8-F-3-b- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning any surplus</P>
<P>eligible Second Officer who desires to move in order of</P>
<P>seniority from the domicile at which a surplus exists. If no</P>
<P>eligible Second Officer desires to move, the Company</P>
<P>may then move any eligible Second Officer from that</P>
<P>domicile to fill the unfilled vacancy in reverse order of</P>
<P>seniority. Second Officers transferred from one domicile to</P>
<P>an-other under provisions of this sub-paragraph shall be</P>
<P>transferred in accordance with Section 8 and receive</P>
<P>moving expenses in accordance with Section 10.</P>
<B><P>8-F-4- </B>In the event there are insufficient bids received on a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Assignment</P>
</I><P>Second Officer vacancy, the Company may, with not less than&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>insufficient</P>
</I><P>thirty (30) days notice:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Second Officer</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;bidders</P>
</I><B><P>8-F-4-a- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning the most junior&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Exemption for</P>
</I><P>pilot at the domicile who is not exempted by the provisions&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilots with</P>
</I><P>of Section 7-H.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>furlough notice</P>
</I><B><P>8-F-4-b- </B>Fill such vacancy by the following procedure:</P>
<P>Implement the provisions of Section 8-K-1 to surplus</P>
<P>Second Officers in a domicile(s) and equipment type who</P>
<P>are not exempted by the provisions of Section 7-H. At the</P>
<P>same time, the Company may issue a conditional 8-K-1</P>
<P>surplus letter to an equivalent number of pilots, in each</P>
<P>domicile and equipment type, who are junior to the</P>
<P>originally surplused Second Officers and who may become</P>
<P>surplus as a result of their bumps. The Company will then</P>
<P>process all bumps which are necessary to relocate the</P>
<P>junior pilots into assignments where they will no longer be</P>
<P>surplus, according to their seniority and preferences. All</P>
<P>pilots who received conditional surplus notice will be</P>
<P>advised of his bump assignment or that he is not surplus</P>
<P>and his conditional notice is cancelled.</P>
<B><P>8-F-4-c- </B>Fill such vacancy by assigning pilots being</P>
<P>recalled from furlough.</P>
<B><P>8-F-5- </B>In the event a vacancy is not filled within three (3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Cancellation of</P>
</I><P>months of the date of the award bulletin, the vacancy shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>unfilled vacancies</P>
</I><P>cancelled.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 110&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-F-6</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-F-6- </B>A surplus of pilots will be considered to exist at a</P>
<P>domicile when pilots who have been displaced from their</P>
<P>assignment have not exercised a bump or do not have</P>
<P>sufficient seniority to revert to another assignment at their</P>
<P>domicile.</P>
<B><P>8-F-7- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of sub-paragraph 8-F-2,</P>
<P>8-F-3 and 8-F-4 of this Paragraph and Paragraph 8-C-1 of</P>
<P>Section 8, bulletined but unfilled Second Officer, IRP, and</P>
<P>First Officer vacancies and secondary vacancies in Second</P>
<P>Officer, IRP, and First Officer assignments may be used by</P>
<P>the Company for the assignment of newly hired but</P>
<P>unassigned pilots. This paragraph shall not be applicable</P>
<P>while pilots are on furlough.</P>
<B><P>8-G- Cancellation or Delay In Activation Of Assignment</P>
<P>8-G-1- </B>In the event an awarded assignment is cancelled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bumping rights</P>
</I><P>prior to the effective date specified in the bulletin awarding&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>after cancellation</P>
</I><P>the vacancy, the pilot awarded such assignment shall retain&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of awarded</P>
</I><P>his present assignment and, if any pilot junior to him has&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment prior</P>
</I><P>been awarded a vacancy which, he could have bid and been&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>to effective date</P>
</I><P>awarded, had he not been restricted by the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 8-D-5 at the time his cancelled assignment was</P>
<P>awarded or during the period he held such assignment, he</P>
<P>may within twenty (20) days of notification of such</P>
<P>cancellation bump into the assignment status and equipment</P>
<P>type which the junior pilot was awarded. The pilot exercising</P>
<P>such bump will be considered as though he had bid and been</P>
<P>awarded the vacancy awarded the pilot junior to him.</P>
<B><P>8-G-2- </B>If the unactivated assignment is cancelled, on or&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bumping rights</P>
</I><P>after the advertised effective date, the pilot shall have&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>after cancellation</P>
</I><P>bumping rights as established in Paragraph 8-K-2, 8-K-4, 8-K-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of awarded</P>
<P>5, 8-K-6, 8-K-7 and 8-K-8 of this Section, and shall&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment after</P>
</I><P>exercise any bump within twenty (20) days of the date he is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>effective date</P>
</I><P>notified of the cancellation of his awarded assignment. For</P>
<P>the purposes of Paragraph 8-K-4, the date of displacement</P>
<P>shall be the date that the pilot notifies the Company of his</P>
<P>intent to bump. In the event the assignment is cancelled and</P>
<P>the pilot exercises a bump, he shall continue to receive pay</P>
<P>for the cancelled assignment, in accordance with Paragraph</P>
<P>8-E-3-a of this Section until he is activated in the assignment</P>
<P>into which he has bumped.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-G-3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 111</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-G-3- </B>If a pilot is awarded an assignment and such</P>
<P>assignment is not activated by the Company within sixty-two</P>
<P>(62) days (or two (2) schedule months, if earlier), including</P>
<P>the effective date specified in the bulletin advertising the</P>
<P>vacancy, and the assignment has not been cancelled, the</P>
<P>pilot shall be paid the greater salary of his current or awarded</P>
<P>assignment until such time that the assignment is either</P>
<P>activated or cancelled. If the pilot exercises a bump, he shall</P>
<P>continue to receive pay for the cancelled assignment, in</P>
<P>accordance with Paragraph 8-E-3-a of this Section until he is</P>
<P>activated in the assignment into which he has bumped.</P>
<B><P>8-G-4- </B>If at the end of ninety-two (92) days or (three (3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Bumping rights</P>
</I><P>schedule months, if earlier), including the effective date&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>after 92 days</P>
</I><P>specified in the bulletin advertising the vacancy, such</P>
<P>assignment has not been cancelled or activated, a pilot may</P>
<P>at his option exercise bumping rights in accordance with</P>
<P>Paragraph 8-K-2, 8-K-4, 8-K-5, 8-K-6, 8-K-7 and 8-K-8 of this</P>
<P>Section or be eligible to bid any vacancy or continue to</P>
<P>receive compensation as provided in sub-paragraph 3 above.</P>
<P>Should the pilot bid or bump to another assignment under this</P>
<P>provision, he shall continue to receive any delayed activation</P>
<P>pay for which he has previously qualified until his activation</P>
<P>into the new assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-H- Failure To Qualify For Awarded Assignment</P>
</B><P>In the event a pilot bids or bumps into a new assignment and</P>
<P>fails to satisfactorily complete the training required to qualify</P>
<P>him for such assignment, or fails to qualify on his new</P>
<P>assignment after completing the training required, he shall be</P>
<P>considered as not having vacated his previous assignment,</P>
<P>and if his previous assignment no longer exists, he shall have</P>
<P>bumping rights in accordance with Section 8-K unless action</P>
<P>has been taken by the Company under Section 6-A-2.</P>
<B><P>8-I- Order of Activation of Assignments</P>
<P>8-I-1- </B>The order of activation of awarded assignments in a</P>
<P>status and equipment type at a domicile shall be in</P>
<P>chronological order of the award bulletins for such</P>
<P>assignments, notwithstanding the respective bulletined</P>
<P>effective dates of such vacancies or the relative seniority of</P>
<P>the pilots awarded such assignments.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 112&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-I -2</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8-I-2- </B>When awarded assignments are cancelled prior to</P>
<P>their activation, the order of cancellation of such assignments</P>
<P>in a particular status and equipment type at a domicile shall</P>
<P>be in reverse chronological order of the award bulletins for</P>
<P>such assignments, notwithstanding the respective bulletined</P>
<P>effective dates of such vacancies or the relative seniority of</P>
<P>the pilots awarded such assignments.</P>
<B><P>8-I-3- </B>The date of acquiring an assignment shall be</P>
<P>considered that date which appears on the publication of the</P>
<P>award bulletin. The date for pay purposes shall be</P>
<P>considered that date on which the pilot physically assumes</P>
<P>the duties of his new assignment; or, if prevented by the</P>
<P>Company from assuming his new duties, the date on which</P>
<P>he would have assumed the duties of his new assignment</P>
<P>had the Company not prevented him from doing so.</P>
<B><P>8-J- Reduction in Assignments</P>
</B><P>In the event there is a reduction in Captain assignments, the</P>
<P>procedures specified in Section 20-A-2-c of the Agreement</P>
<P>shall be followed to determine at which domicile the</P>
<P>assignments shall be reduced. The number of Captain</P>
<P>assignments for each domicile in the affected equipment</P>
<P>shall be determined by the number of Captains assigned to</P>
<P>lines of flying for the full month at the time of publication of</P>
<P>the pilots' schedules.</P>
<B><P>8-K- Displacement Rights</P>
<P>8-K-1- </B>If the Company determines that an excess of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Surplus</P>
</I><P>Captain, First Officer, International Relief Pilot or Second&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>notification</P>
</I><P>Officer assignments exists in an equipment type at a</P>
<P>domicile, the Company may give notice to the pilots affected</P>
<P>that they are surplus in their assignment, status and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Time limits for</P>
</I><P>equipment type and will be displaced from their assignment&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>bumping</P>
</I><P>on a specified date. Such notice shall be given not less than</P>
<P>thirty (30) days nor more than one hundred twenty-five (125)</P>
<P>days prior to the date of displacement. (Date of displacement</P>
<P>is also known as "surplus" date.) Displacement of pilots will</P>
<P>be made in inverse order of seniority, unless exempted by the</P>
<P>application of Section 7-H. Any pilot who has been notified of</P>
<P>the impending discontinuance of his assignment, must</P>
<P>exercise bumping rights as established in sub-paragraph 8-K-2</P>
<P>of this Paragraph and shall have until twenty (20) days after</P>
<P>notification of specified date of the discontinuance to</P>
<P>exercise such bumping rights. Official notice will be conveyed</P>
<P>through the pilot's Company mail box. If, however, a pilot's</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-K-1-a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 113</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>schedule shows that he does not have any duty scheduled</P>
<P>within seven (7) days following the initiation of the notice, the</P>
<P>Company will make an effort to contact him by telephone. If</P>
<P>this attempt is unsuccessful, a letter will be sent by U.S. Mail</P>
<P>to his home of record. A pilot exercising bumping rights shall</P>
<P>be maintained in his present assignment until he assumes his</P>
<P>new assignment, except as provided for in sub-paragraph 8-</P>
<P>K-4 of this Paragraph.</P>
<B><P>8-K-1-a- </B>A pilot notified of his displacement under the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Surplus</P>
</I><P>provisions of this Paragraph may have that displacement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>cancellation</P>
</I><P>cancelled should the surplus be reduced or cease to exist.</P>
<P>Such cancellations will be in seniority order.</P>
<B><P>8-K-1-b- </B>If a surplus is declared by the Company, any&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilot who bids out</P>
</I><P>pilot who bids out of the surplus situation shall be entitled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>of surplus</P>
</I><P>to a paid move and shall not receive any freeze. The&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>situation paid</P>
</I><P>surplus will be reduced by the number of pilots who bid&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>move no freeze</P>
</I><P>out of the surplus situation.</P>
<B><P>8-K-2-</P>
<P>8-K-2-a- </B>A pilot who has bumping rights under the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Pilots with</P>
</I><P>provisions of this Paragraph may bump into any status on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>bumping rights</P>
</I><P>any equipment at any domicile where a pilot junior to him&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>cannot bump</P>
</I><P>(excluding pilots who remain surplus after the application&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>pilots with</P>
</I><P>of Section 8-K-3 below or pilots exempt from surplus&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>furlough notice</P>
</I><P>under the provisions of Section 7-H) holds an assignment,</P>
<P>including an assignment awaiting activation, in such</P>
<P>status and equipment type. A pilot will exercise any of the</P>
<P>bumps provided for in this Paragraph by notice in writing</P>
<P>to the Company and shall begin his new assignment on</P>
<P>the effective date of his displacement or when training is</P>
<P>completed for such assignment, whichever is later;</P>
<P>however, the Company may utilize the provisions of</P>
<P>Paragraph 8-K-11 below when activating such pilot. If the</P>
<P>new assignment is planned to be activated prior to the first</P>
<P>of the pilot schedule month, he may exercise his seniority</P>
<P>in his new assignment under Section 20-D. If, however,</P>
<P>the new assignment is activated at a time which precludes</P>
<P>his exercising his seniority in his new assignment under</P>
<P>Section 20-D, he will be assigned as a reserve in his new</P>
<P>status and equipment type until the commencement of the</P>
<P>next schedule for which he exercises his seniority under</P>
<P>the schedule selection procedure. If the new assignment</P>
<P>is at other than his present domicile, he shall be granted</P>
<P>time, to be taken at his option, allowed by the Company</P>
<P>Regulations, for traveling from his old domicile to his new</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 114&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-K-2-b</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>domicile. The pilot's applicable monthly salary will not be</P>
<P>reduced for such period of absence from duty.</P>
<B><P>8-K-2-b- </B>Notwithstanding sub-paragraph 8-K-2-a above</P>
<P>and 8-K-4 and 8-K-8 below, when a surplus of pilots is</P>
<P>expected to exist for more than sixty (60) days, such</P>
<P>surplus may be temporarily assigned to another</P>
<P>equipment type in their current status and at their domicile</P>
<P>for a period not to exceed one hundred and eighty-two</P>
<P>(182) days. Such assignments will be made on an "offer</P>
<P>and accept" basis of the qualified pilots and such pilots</P>
<P>shall be pay protected as provided in Paragraph 8-E-3 of</P>
<P>this Section until they are returned to their permanent</P>
<P>equipment or have been declared surplus as provided in</P>
<P>8-K-1 of this Paragraph.</P>
<B><P>8-K-3- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of 8-K-1 and 8-K-2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Voluntary surplus</P>
</I><P>above, any pilot holding an assignment in the same domicile,</P>
<P>status and equipment type as a pilot who has been given</P>
<P>surplus notice may, on a man-for-man basis, volunteer to</P>
<P>accept the surplus for a more junior surplus pilot. When</P>
<P>surplus notices are given, the Company will advertise for</P>
<P>volunteers, indicating the seniority range which will</P>
<P>determine the bumping rights of any volunteer(s). A volunteer</P>
<P>shall submit his request indicating the domicile(s), status(s)</P>
<P>and equipment type(s) to which he wishes to bump and he</P>
<P>shall be accepted as a volunteer only if his bump can be</P>
<P>granted, based upon the seniority of the pilot he replaced on</P>
<P>the surplus notice. Volunteers will be accepted in seniority</P>
<P>order up to the number of the declared surplus notice as</P>
<P>adjusted by the provisions of Section 8-K-9 Such volunteers</P>
<P>will be entitled to a paid move under the provisions of Section</P>
<P>10-C. The number of pilots to be involuntarily surplused shall</P>
<P>be reduced by one for each volunteer accepted.</P>
<B><P>8-K-4- </B>If as a result of exercising bumping rights training is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Salary application</P>
</I><P>required, a pilot will remain in the status and equipment type&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>for bumping pilot</P>
</I><P>of his former assignment until such time as training is</P>
<P>completed or until he reports to his new assignment,</P>
<P>whichever is later. If training for the new assignment has not</P>
<P>begun within thirty (30) days prior to the pilot's displacement</P>
<P>date, as established in Paragraph 8-K-1 above, he shall be</P>
<P>paid, on his displacement date, his current salary or the</P>
<P>salary of the assignment to which he bumped, whichever is&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>TDY or 8-L-6</P>
</I><P>greater. The pilot will not receive such pay, however, if the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>assignment up to</P>
</I><P>delay in training resulted from vacation, sick leave or a leave&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>60 days</P>
</I><P>of absence. If the equipment type from which displaced is no</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Section 8-K-5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 115</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>longer being flown by that domicile, the displaced pilot will be</P>
<P>available for either TDY or 8-L-6 assignments, at his option,</P>
<P>until he begins training for his new assignment or for sixty</P>
<P>(60) days, whichever is less. The pilot may choose either</P>
<P>option on a monthly basis.</P>
<B><P>8-K-5- </B>If a pilot bumps into an assignment awaiting</P>
<P>activation and he cannot be utilized in his old assignment, he</P>
<P>may be required to function in the highest status in any</P>
<P>equipment type for which he has been trained and which he</P>
<P>can be utilized at his present domicile until his new</P>
<P>assignment is activated. If he cannot be utilized at his</P>
<P>present domicile he may, notwithstanding Section 8-L-3, be</P>
<P>assigned to temporary duty in the status and equipment type</P>
<P>from which being displaced until his new assignment is</P>
<P>activated. During such temporary duty assignment, he will be</P>
<P>provided with NRPS and OMC (Priority F) transportation to</P>
<P>and from his present domicile on his scheduled days off.</P>
<B><P>8-K-6- </B>A pilot who bumps into an assignment awaiting</P>
<P>activation shall for the application of Section 8-1, be</P>
<P>considered as though he had bid and been awarded the</P>
<P>vacancy awarded the pilot junior to him.</P>
<B><P>8-K-7- </B>A pilot exercising bumping rights under this&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Paid move for all</P>
</I><P>Paragraph which involve a change in domiciles shall be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>bumps</P>
</I><P>allowed moving expenses in accordance with Section 10.</P>
<B><P>8-K-8- </B>If a pilot is a successful bidder or has exercised</P>
<P>bumping rights as specified in Section 8-K, he shall be given</P>
<P>the opportunity to begin transition training in such equipment</P>
<P>as soon as practicable but in no case later than six (6)</P>
<P>months from the date such pilot qualified under Section 8-E-3.</P>
<B><P>8-K-9- </B>The number of pilots declared surplus in a domicile,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Surplus</P>
</I><P>status and equipment type shall be reduced by the number of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>reductions with</P>
</I><P>pilots awarded vacancies during the twenty (20) day period&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>volunteers</P>
</I><P>after the notification of displacement.</P>
<P>While functioning in either of the above types of assignment,</P>
<P>such pilot shall be paid at the rates applicable to the</P>
<P>assignment from which he was displaced or the rates</P>
<P>applicable to the assignment in which he is functioning,</P>
<P>whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>8-K-6- </B>A pilot who bumps into an assignment awaiting</P>
<P>activation shall for the application of Section 8-I, be</P>
<P>considered as though he had bid and been awarded the</P>
<P>vacancy awarded the pilot junior to him.</P>
<I><P>Paid move for all</P>
<P>bumps</P>
</I><B><P>8-K-7- </B>A pilot exercising bumping rights under this</P>
<P>Paragraph which involve a change in domiciles shall be</P>
<P>allowed moving expenses in accordance with Section 10.</P>
<B><P>8-K-8- </B>If a pilot is a successful bidder or has exercised</P>
<P>bumping rights as specified in Section 8-K, he shall be given</P>
<P>the opportunity to begin transition training in such equipment</P>
<P>as soon as practicable but in no case later than six (6)</P>
<P>months from the date such pilot qualified under Section 8-E-3.</P>
<I><P>Surplus</P>
<P>reductions with</P>
<P>volunteers</P>
</I><B><P>8-K-9- </B>The number of pilots declared surplus in a domicile,</P>
<P>status and equipment type shall be reduced by the number of</P>
<P>pilots awarded vacancies during the twenty (20) day period</P>
<P>after the notification of displacement.</P>
<B><P>Page 116 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-K-10</P>
</B><I><P>Grandfather rights</P>
</I><B><P>8-K-10- </B>Should pilots be declared surplus while junior pilots remain in the same domicile, status and equipment type because of the exemption provided under Section 7-H and should the anticipated furlough subsequently be cancelled, the
pilots declared surplus shall be protected as follows:</P>
<B><P>8-K-10-a- </B>All pilots previously exempted under Section 7-H shall be immediately declared surplus, or</P>
<B><P>8-K-10-b- </B>Those pilots who had involuntarily bumped to</P>
<P>another assignment shall be immediately given the</P>
<P>opportunity in seniority order to return to their prior</P>
<P>assignment, provided further that the number of pilots</P>
<P>exercising this option shall not exceed the number of</P>
<P>pilots previously exempted under Section 7-H at that</P>
<P>domicile, status and equipment type. If the pilot has</P>
<P>moved under the provisions of Section 10 as the result of</P>
<P>his bump assignment and elected to return to his prior</P>
<P>assignment as the result of this sub-paragraph, he shall</P>
<P>again be entitled to a paid move under the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 10 back to the domicile of the prior assignment.</P>
<I><P>Bump activation</P>
<P>and restrictions</P>
</I><B><P>8-K-11- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of this Paragraph K,</P>
<P>the Company may activate a pilot in a bump assignment</P>
<P>earlier or later than specified above provided that:</P>
<B><P>8-K-11-a- </B>No pilot will be activated into his bump</P>
<P>assignment more than fifteen (15) days prior to his date of displacement nor less than thirty (30) days after date of displacement as established in 8-K-1 above.</P>
<B><P>8-K-11-a-(1) </B>When the activation is early into a higher paying assignment the pilot shall receive pay for his new assignment upon activation.</P>
<B><P>8-K-11-a-(2) </B>When the activation is early into a lower paying assignment the pilot so activated shall continue to receive pay at his former rate until the date of his displacement under 8-K-1 above.</P>
<B><P>8-K-11-b- </B>When the activation is delayed into a higher</P>
<P>paying assignment, the pilot so delayed shall begin</P>
<P>receiving pay at the higher rate, if on the effective date of his surplus he is trained for his bump assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-K-11-c- </B>Within a given status, domicile and equipment type, when the activation is delayed into a lower paying assignment, the most senior pilot with the same surplus date who is already activated into a lower paying assignment, shall
continue to receive pay at his former rate so long as the junior pilot does, unless the junior pilot.</P>
<B><P>Page 117 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-L</P>
</B><P>is not trained due to vacation, sick leave or a leave of</P>
<P>absence. This application shall be on a man-for-man</P>
<P>basis.</P>
<B><P>8-L- Temporary Duty Assignments</P>
</B><I><P>Definition of TDY</P>
<P>and hotel</P>
<P>availability</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-1- </B>The Company will provide a hotel room to any pilot</P>
<P>assigned TDY for the entire duration of the TDY assignment.</P>
<P>For purposes of this paragraph, a TDY assignment begins</P>
<P>one (1) day before the pilot's first required day on duty and</P>
<P>ends one day after completion of his last duty period. Should</P>
<P>the pilot return to his home domicile or residence during any</P>
<P>period of days off, the Company may ask the pilot whether</P>
<P>the hotel room should be canceled. However, the Company</P>
<P>may only cancel the hotel room at the TDY location with pilot</P>
<P>concurrence.</P>
<I><P>TDY assignments</P>
<P>pilots may bid</P>
<P>TDY</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-2- </B>Selection of pilots for involuntary temporary duty</P>
<P>assignments shall be from pilots functioning as reserves in</P>
<P>the status and equipment type needed for the temporary duty</P>
<P>assignment. Temporary duty assignments shall not reduce</P>
<P>reserve coverage at a domicile below required levels in any</P>
<P>status or equipment type. Assignment of eligible reserves for</P>
<P>temporary duty shall be in inverse order of their seniority at</P>
<P>the domicile regardless of the reserve days off schedule,</P>
<P>except pilots may volunteer and be assigned temporary duty</P>
<P>in order of their seniority. Any pilot may volunteer for TDY at</P>
<P>any domicile(s) as part of the monthly schedule preferencing</P>
<P>procedure as follows:</P>
<I><P>Voluntary TDY </P>
</I><B><P>8-L-2-a- </B>Pilots volunteering for TDY will preference and</P>
<P>be awarded local schedules, as provided by Section 20. In</P>
<P>addition, they will indicate to which domiciles they desire</P>
<P>to be sent and which reserve days off they prefer.</P>
<I><P>Voluntary TDY </P>
</I><B><P>8-L-2-b- </B>To the extent that TDY is needed from the</P>
<P>domicile, the volunteers who are available for the full</P>
<P>month will be assigned in seniority order to the domiciles</P>
<P>they requested. Volunteer TDY assignments will be made</P>
<P>as early as practical and contact will be attempted at least</P>
<P>three (3) days before the beginning of the TDY</P>
<P>assignment. When possible a volunteer for the full month</P>
<P>shall be assigned to the TDY domicile prior to</P>
<P>preferencing in order to allow the volunteer to exercise his</P>
<P>seniority at the TDY domicile. However, all pilots who</P>
<P>have volunteered for TDY must contact the Company on</P>
<P>the next to the last day of the month prior to the month of.</P>
<B><P>Page 118 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-L-2-c</P>
</B><P>TDY (if not contacted earlier) to determine if he has</P>
<P>received a TDY assignment. Such pilots must be available</P>
<P>to begin TDY on the first of the following month, if there is</P>
<P>no conflict with his prior month's schedule.</P>
<I><P>Voluntary TDY</P>
<P>days off</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-2-c- </B>Volunteer pilots assigned TDY will be assigned</P>
<P>reserve day off lines at the TDY domicile, taking into</P>
<P>consideration any day off request he may have submitted.</P>
<P>Reserve day off requests will be granted so long as the</P>
<P>pilot receives twelve (12) days off in a thirty (30) day</P>
<P>month (13 days off in a 31 day month) or fourteen (14)</P>
<P>days off for Shuttle pilots in the month and reserve</P>
<P>coverage at the TDY domicile is not adversely affected.</P>
<P>Time permitting, such volunteer pilots may also be</P>
<P>assigned any open lines which their seniority would entitle</P>
<P>them to under the provisions of Section 20. These</P>
<P>assignments will be made in seniority order. Reserve</P>
<P>pilots shall not be required to deadhead to or from the</P>
<P>TDY assignment on days off.</P>
<I><P>Reserve mov-up</P>
<P>to cover line</P>
<P>vacated by</P>
<P>volunteer TDY</P>
<P>and cancellation</P>
<P>of TDY </I><B>8-L-2-d- </B>Lines of flying which are opened because the</P>
<P>pilots awarded such lines have been sent TDY, will be</P>
<P>covered by moving up a reserve under the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 20-D-5, however, no further move-ups will be</P>
<P>incurred.</P>
<P>No move-up will be performed if the TDY volunteer is a</P>
<P>reserve at his domicile. Should a TDY assignment be</P>
<P>terminated early, the volunteer shall return to his awarded</P>
<P>line at his domicile.</P>
<I><P>Partial month TDY </I><B>8-L-2-e- </B>TDY assignments required for partial months or</P>
<P>after the beginning of the month shall be given to reserves</P>
<P>only. Such assignments shall be made to reserves who</P>
<P>have volunteered, to the extent available.</P>
<I><P>Assignment of</P>
<P>TDY </I><B>8-L-3- </B>Temporary duty assignments shall be governed by</P>
<P>the following criteria:</P>
<I><P>Travel days count</P>
<P>as TDY </I><B>8-L-3-a- </B>The length of a temporary duty assignment shall</P>
<P>be measured by the number of full calendar days so</P>
<P>assigned, including days spent in traveling to and from the</P>
<P>temporary duty domicile but exclusive of days required for</P>
<P>any necessary qualification.</P>
<B><P>8-L-3-b- </B>A reserve pilot who has accumulated a total of</P>
<P>thirty (30) days of temporary duty during the previous</P>
<P>twelve (12) month period shall not be required to remain</P>
<P>on temporary duty without his consent until all qualified</P>
<P>pilots on reserve duty at his domicile in his status and</P>
<B><P>Page 119&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Section 8-L-3-c</P>
</B><P>equipment type have each accumulated thirty (30) days of</P>
<P>temporary duty during the previous twelve (12) months,</P>
<P>provided that said pilot shall not be assigned more than a</P>
<P>total of forty-five (45) days of temporary duty in such</P>
<P>twelve (12) month period without his consent.</P>
<B><P>8-L-3-c- </B>A pilot may not be required to be on temporary</P>
<P>duty for more than fifteen (15) consecutive days for any</P>
<P>one such assignment, except that a pilot may volunteer to</P>
<P>remain on temporary duty; provided that if a pilot is the</P>
<P>only reserve pilot in his status, equipment type and</P>
<P>domicile who will not have accumulated thirty (30) days of</P>
<P>temporary duty at the conclusion of fifteen (15) day</P>
<P>assignment, he may be required to remain on temporary</P>
<P>duty in excess of thirty (30) days.</P>
<I><P>Assignment of</P>
<P>TDY </I><B>8-L-3-d- </B>In the event a reserve pilot is to be assigned on</P>
<P>temporary duty for a period of ten (10) days or more, he</P>
<P>shall be given notice of such assignment as far in advance</P>
<P>as possible but in no case less than three (3) calendar</P>
<P>days (seven (7) if such assignment commences</P>
<P>subsequent to the tenth (10th) of the month) prior to the</P>
<P>time he is required to depart from his home domicile for</P>
<P>the temporary duty assignment. Such assignment shall be</P>
<P>preferenced if time permits.</P>
<B><P>8-L-4- </B>The term "reserve" as applied to pilots in this</P>
<P>Paragraph will mean a pilot who is not assigned to a</P>
<P>schedule at his home domicile. However, a reserve pilot who</P>
<P>is given a temporary assignment under the provisions of this</P>
<P>Paragraph may be required to complete such temporary</P>
<P>assignment regardless of any change in his status at his</P>
<P>home domicile.</P>
<B><P>8-L-5-</P>
</B><I><P>TDY 1 in 7 </I><B>8-L-5-a- </B>Pilots assigned to temporary duty, if functioning</P>
<P>as a reserve while assigned to temporary duty for fifteen</P>
<P>(15) days or less, shall be provided with one (1) day off in</P>
<P>each seven (7) days during the period of temporary duty.</P>
<I><P>11 to 15 day</P>
<P>assign 1 in 7 not</P>
<P>deducted from 12/</P>
<P>13</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-5-b- </B>A pilot assigned to temporary duty for a period</P>
<P>of eleven (11) to fifteen (15) days shall have his days off</P>
<P>while on temporary duty scheduled so as to provide one</P>
<P>period of two (2) consecutive days off. If necessary, one</P>
<P>(1) additional day off will be granted for this purpose;</P>
<P>however, such additional day off, above the requirement</P>
<P>for one (1) day off in seven (7), will be subtracted from the.</P>
<B><P>Page 120 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-L-5-c</P>
</B><P>days off owed to the pilot and will not be restored as</P>
<P>provided below.</P>
<I><P>Restoration of</P>
<P>days off</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-5-c- </B>Those days off lost by the pilot while on</P>
<P>temporary duty will be restored to the pilot either</P>
<P>immediately before or immediately after the period of</P>
<P>temporary duty, at the option of the Company;</P>
<P>notwithstanding the possibility that such days off may be</P>
<P>restored in the month following the month in which the</P>
<P>temporary duty assignment took place.</P>
<I><P>Restoration of</P>
<P>days off for pilot</P>
<P>who is lineholder</P>
<P>in next month</P>
<P>No offset for 1 in</P>
<P>7</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-5-d- </B>In the event that it is necessary to restore days</P>
<P>off to a pilot during a month when he is a lineholder such</P>
<P>days off will be restored on the first available days of</P>
<P>scheduled duty; provided that trip sequences will not be</P>
<P>split apart as a result of this application. Restoration of</P>
<P>days off will in all cases be deferred if such restoration</P>
<P>would conflict with or cause rescheduling of training. If</P>
<P>restoration of all lost days off cannot be completed within</P>
<P>one month following the month in which the temporary</P>
<P>duty was assigned, the remaining day off owed will be</P>
<P>added to the pilot's vacation. The day(s) off granted to</P>
<P>fulfill the one (1) day off in seven (7) requirement during</P>
<P>the period of temporary duty will not be used to offset the</P>
<P>number of scheduled days off lost during the temporary</P>
<P>duty assignment.</P>
<I><P>Involuntary TDY</P>
<P>pilot maintain</P>
<P>schedule day off.</P>
<P>Reschedule with</P>
<P>concurrence</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-5-e- </B>If involuntarily assigned to temporary duty for</P>
<P>more than fifteen (15) days, the pilot shall retain the days</P>
<P>off schedule assigned to him at his domicile and he shall</P>
<P>not be required to deadhead to or from the temporary duty</P>
<P>assignment on his days off. However, with pilot</P>
<P>concurrence, the pilot's days off may be rescheduled.</P>
<B><P>8-L-6-</P>
</B><I><P>Duty period</P>
<P>limitation for --</P>
<P>6 assignment up</P>
<P>to 5 duty periods</P>
</I><B><P>8-L-6-a- </B>To avoid junior manning for a specific trip, a pilot</P>
<P>available under the provisions of Section 20-F, or a</P>
<P>reserve pilot, may be assigned to cover such open one</P>
<P>way or round trip sequence originating at another point</P>
<P>provided it does not result in junior manning at his home</P>
<P>domicile and such assignment will not be considered as</P>
<P>temporary duty. Initial assignments under this provision</P>
<P>shall not be scheduled to exceed five (5) duty periods,</P>
<P>except for international trip assignments.</P>
<B><P>8-L-6-b- </B>Notwithstanding Section 8-L-6-a above, a</P>
<P>lineholder signed up for open flying under Section 20-H-3</P>
<P>and 20-H-5 at the domicile designated by the Company to.</P>
<B><P>Page 121 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
