&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-M</P>
</B><P>cover the Section 8-L-6 assignment, may at the</P>
<P>Company's option be offered the opportunity to cover such</P>
<P>open flying. Pilots so assigned shall be governed by all of</P>
<P>the provisions of sub-paragraph 8-L-6-a above.</P>
<B><P>8-M- Geographical Relocation of Assignments</P>
</B><P>In the event that the Company desires to geographically</P>
<P>relocate flying from a domicile and to the extent that the</P>
<P>number of assignments are relocated, the Company will offer</P>
<P>to the pilots in the status and equipment type affected at the</P>
<P>domicile in the order of seniority, the opportunity to be</P>
<P>transferred to the new domicile(s). Such pilots shall be</P>
<P>allowed moving expenses in accordance with Section 10 of</P>
<P>this Agreement. The relocated assignments shall be</P>
<P>identified with and flown from the new domicile(s) and the</P>
<P>assignments involved shall not be open for award unless the</P>
<P>number of pilots desiring to transfer provides less than the</P>
<P>total assignments required at the new domicile under the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 8-B. If an insufficient number of pilots</P>
<P>elects to transfer, the balance of the assignments required at</P>
<P>the new domicile in accordance with Section 8-B shall be</P>
<P>awarded systemized. To the extent that the number of</P>
<P>assignments are relocated a like number of assignments</P>
<P>shall be reduced at the old domicile.</P>
<B><P>8-N- Phase-Out of Equipment Type</P>
</B><P>When the Company desires to completely phaseout an</P>
<P>equipment type at a domicile, other than as covered in</P>
<P>Section 8-M, the provisions of Section 8-K shall be utilized</P>
<P>for the displacement of the affected pilots; except that the</P>
<P>opportunity for displacement shall be offered to the affected</P>
<P>pilots in seniority order during each reduction in assignments</P>
<P>associated with the complete phase-out of equipment type. If</P>
<P>insufficient pilots voluntarily accept the displacement, the</P>
<P>remainder of the displacements shall be accomplished under</P>
<P>Section 8-K in inverse order of seniority.</P>
<B><P>8-O- Closing Of A Domicile</P>
<P>8-O-1- </B>In the event the Company desires to close a</P>
<P>domicile, the procedure set forth below shall be followed:</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-a- </B>The Master Executive Council Chairman will be</P>
<P>so advised by the Company and will be afforded the</P>
<P>opportunity to consult with and make recommendations to.</P>
<B><P>Page 122 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-O-1-b</P>
</B><P>the Company regarding the relocation of the affected</P>
<P>pilots.</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-b- </B>At least ninety (90) days notice must be given to</P>
<P>the pilots affected by the move outlining the procedures to</P>
<P>be followed to accomplish the move and indicating the</P>
<P>domicile(s) to which the flying will be moved.</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-c- </B>Pilot vacancies equal to the number of</P>
<P>assignments existing at the old domicile will be</P>
<P>established at the domicile(s) to which the flying is</P>
<P>transferred. During the ninety (90) day period specified in</P>
<P>paragraph b above, the pilots so affected will be given an</P>
<P>opportunity to indicate to which of the designated</P>
<P>domiciles they desire to be transferred or to bid on</P>
<P>vacancies which may be bulletined on the system,</P>
<P>notwithstanding any freezes that otherwise may be</P>
<P>applicable.</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-d- </B>The Company will transfer the pilots to the new</P>
<P>domicile(s) in order of their seniority preference by status</P>
<P>and equipment type.</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-e- </B>The pilots affected shall retain the status and</P>
<P>equipment type held by them at the time of transfer and</P>
<P>such flying shall be identified with and flown from the new</P>
<P>domicile(s) and shall not be open for bidding.</P>
<B><P>8-O-1-f- </B>Each pilot who is subject to the provisions of this</P>
<P>sub-paragraph (O) shall be allowed NRPS transportation</P>
<P>between his former domicile and his new domicile until</P>
<P>such time that he moves his home to the new location</P>
<P>under Section 10, not to exceed one (1) year after the</P>
<P>effective date of the domicile closing. In addition, if such</P>
<P>pilot has not moved his home to the new location within</P>
<P>one (1) year, he shall be allowed NRSA transportation</P>
<P>until he moves, not to exceed an additional one (1) year.</P>
<B><P>8-P- Vacating Assignments</P>
<P>8-P-1- </B>A pilot may vacate an assignment only as provided</P>
<P>by this Section 8, or Section 6-E of this Agreement..</P>
<B><P>Page 123 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-P-2</P>
<P>8-P-2- </B>When a pilot desires to vacate a present or future</P>
<P>assignment, his request to vacate shall be considered jointly</P>
<P>by the Company and the Association and in accordance with</P>
<P>their mutual agreement a decision may be rendered</P>
<P>permitting such pilot to vacate his assignment to take up a</P>
<P>different assignment at his domicile, to take up a like</P>
<P>assignment at a different domicile or to revert to his former</P>
<P>assignment, and moving expenses shall not be allowed.</P>
<B><P>8-P-3- </B>A pilot activated early in an awarded assignment</P>
<P>under the provisions of Paragraph P-2 above shall not trigger</P>
<P>pay under Section 8-E for other pilots awarded a like</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>8-Q- New Equipment Domicile</P>
</B><I><P>Opening a new</P>
<P>equipment</P>
<P>domicile</P>
</I><P>In the event the Company desires to open a new equipment</P>
<P>domicile(s), the procedure set forth below shall be followed:</P>
<B><P>8-Q-1- </B>The Master Executive Council Chairman will be so</P>
<P>advised by the Company and will be afforded the opportunity</P>
<P>to consult with and make recommendations to the Company</P>
<P>regarding the staffing of the new equipment domicile(s).</P>
<I><P>Vacancy at new</P>
<P>equipment</P>
<P>domicile bid</P>
<P>systemwide</P>
</I><B><P>8-Q-2- </B>All vacancies with advertised effective dates during</P>
<P>the first six (6) months after the first revenue trip has been</P>
<P>flown shall be bid system wide unless the parties agree to an</P>
<P>alternate method of staffing the new equipment domicile(s).</P>
<I><P>Pilots serving</P>
<P>freezes will be</P>
<P>eligible to bid</P>
<P>vacancies at new</P>
<P>equipment</P>
<P>domiciles</P>
</I><B><P>8-Q-3- </B>Notwithstanding the fourteen/twenty-four (14/24)</P>
<P>month bidding restrictions of Paragraph 8-D-5 and 8-D-6, all pilots will be eligible to bid on all vacancies with advertised effective dates within six (6) months of the advertised effective date of the first vacancies bid at that new equipment domicile
 .</P>
<I><P>TDY or 8-L-6</P>
<P>assignment up to</P>
<P>60 days</P>
</I><B><P>8-Q-4- </B>A pilot who has completed training and is awaiting</P>
<P>activation into a new equipment domicile will be available for either TDY or 8-L-6 assignments, at his option, for a period of up to 60 days or until revenue flying begins in the new equipment domicile whichever is less. The pilot may choose either
option on a monthly basis.</P>

</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 124 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 8-Q-4</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 125 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-A</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 9</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Training</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>9-A- Classifications</P>
</B><P>The provisions of this Section shall apply to all training in</P>
<P>which pilots are required to participate, by the Company, on a</P>
<P>scheduled basis. This shall include but is not limited to initial,</P>
<P>upgrading and transition training, proficiency training,</P>
<P>proficiency checks, overwater training, navigation training,</P>
<P>requalification training and all training associated with</P>
<P>differences of an aircraft conducted at a local domicile, not</P>
<P>included in transition training. It does not include special or</P>
<P>miscellaneous training such as maintenance of currency on</P>
<P>equipment, audio visual package reviews, airport</P>
<P>qualification films, route qualifying not in connection with</P>
<P>transition training or transfer to another domicile, Company</P>
<P>meetings, seminars, etc. or training requested by the pilot on</P>
<P>a voluntary basis.</P>
<B><P>9-B- Assignment</P>
<P>9-B-1- </B>All training assignments will be made by the</P>
<P>Company in accordance with the following:</P>
<I><P>Notification</P>
<P>Transi t i on</P>
<P>Training</P>
</I><B><P>9-B-1-a- </B>All pilots shall be notified as far in advance as</P>
<P>possible but in no case less than fourteen (14) days prior</P>
<P>to being scheduled to receive transition or extended</P>
<P>training of five (5) days or more. However, if a pilot is</P>
<P>returning to work from an absence and he needs</P>
<P>requalification or transition training, this fourteen (14) day</P>
<P>minimum notification may be reduced to seven (7) days.</P>
<P>These minimum notification requirements may be further</P>
<P>reduced only with pilot concurrence. Official notice of</P>
<P>training assignments will be conveyed through the pilot's</P>
<P>Company mail box and by electronic notification. If,</P>
<P>however, a pilot's schedule shows that he does not have</P>
<P>any duty following the initiation of the notice, or that the</P>
<P>pilot has not checked the electronic notification, the</P>
<P>Company will make an effort to contact him by telephone</P>
<P>within seven (7) days of the original notification. If this</P>
<P>attempt is unsuccessful, a letter will be sent by U.S. Mail</P>
<P>to his home of record. If a pilot volunteers for training with</P>
<P>less than fourteen (14) days notice of a training</P>
<P>assignment of this type and does not have a scheduled.</P>
<B><P>Page 126 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-B-1-b</P>
</B><P>calendar day off between the time of notification and the</P>
<P>time he is required to depart his domicile, he will be</P>
<P>provided with a calendar day off within seven (7) days</P>
<P>from departing his domicile.</P>
<B><P>9-B-1-b-</P>
</B><I><P>Notification of PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT training</P>
</I><B><P>9-B-1-b-(1) </B>Proficiency Checks, Continuing</P>
<P>Qualification Programs and Proficiency Training (PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT), or training for periods of less than five (5)</P>
<P>days will be assigned after the posting of the pilot's</P>
<P>schedule preference awards but no later than nine (9)</P>
<P>days after the posting of the pilot's schedule at the</P>
<P>local domicile. This nine (9) day requirement excludes</P>
<P>secondary and floater lines. Domicile continuity shall</P>
<P>be maintained when assigning PC/CQP/PT's whenever</P>
<P>practicable. A pilot will be electronically notified at</P>
<P>least fifteen (15) days prior to the date he is scheduled</P>
<P>for a PC/CQP/PT assignment except under the</P>
<P>circumstances covered in Paragraph 9-G-3 below.</P>
<P>Within 48 hours after the monthly bid awards are</P>
<P>posted for the affected month, a pilot eligible for a PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT may designate a period of seven (7)</P>
<P>consecutive holy days that he will not be available for a</P>
<P>PC/CQP/PT. In addition, a pilot may not be asked to</P>
<P>deadhead to or from any training during these seven</P>
<P>(7) consecutive holy days. WHQCM may deny this holy</P>
<P>day request if granting the request would result in the</P>
<P>pilot losing his qualification.</P>
<I><P>Minimum 21 day</P>
<P>notice of early</P>
<P>month PC/CQP/</P>
<P>PT</P>
</I><B><P>9-B-1-b-(2) </B>The Company will not assign a pilot to a</P>
<P>PC/CQP/PT in an early month with less than twenty-one</P>
<P>(21) days notice of the PC/CQP/PT without the</P>
<P>pilot's concurrence.</P>
<I><P>Bidding</P>
<P>Procedure for PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT</P>
</I><B><P>9-B-1-b-(3) </B>The Parties are agreeable to develop a</P>
<P>process for bidding PC/CQP/PT slots under the</P>
<P>following conditions:</P>
<B><P>9-B-1-b-(3)-(a) </B>Monthly requests for PC/CQP/PT</P>
<P>slots will close at the end of the 48 hour holy day</P>
<P>window.</P>
<B><P>9-B-1-b-(3)-(b) </B>Bidding requests will be honored in</P>
<P>seniority order.</P>
<B><P>9-B-1-b-(3)-(c) </B>The Company will award PC/CQP/</P>
<P>PT slots consistent with available manpower needs</P>
<P>(i.e., awards can not result in manpower surpluses</P>
<P>or deficits in any given domicile, fleet and seat).</P>
<B><P>Page 127 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-B-1-c</P>
</B><I><P>Pilot subject to</P>
<P>Section 2--1</P>
<P>assignment if</P>
<P>training</P>
<P>assignment is</P>
<P>cancelled</P>
</I><B><P>9-B-1-c- </B>When the Company cancels or terminates a</P>
<P>training assignment earlier than planned, the affected</P>
<P>lineholder pilot may be given a flying or standby</P>
<P>assignment under the provisions of Section 20-F-1 on</P>
<P>those days on which he had trips published in his awarded</P>
<P>schedule. Provided the pilot is not responsible for the</P>
<P>training cancellation, he will be paid for the value of the</P>
<P>trips in his original line or what he actually flies, whichever</P>
<P>is greater. However, the Company will drop duty days as</P>
<P>necessary in order for the pilot to receive his minimum</P>
<P>days off per Section 5-G-1-d.</P>
<B><P>9-C- Compensation and Flight Time Considerations</P>
<P>9-C-1- </B>Training Assignments Of Five (5) Days or More</P>
<B><P>9-C-1-a- </B>When a pilot assigned to a line of flying is</P>
<P>assigned by the Company to training in accordance with</P>
<P>Paragraph 9-B-1-a above, he shall receive his monthly</P>
<P>pay and his total allowable monthly flight time shall be</P>
<P>reduced by the number of actual flight hours which the</P>
<P>pilot missed as a result of this training.</P>
<B><P>9-C-1-b- </B>When a pilot assigned as a reserve is assigned</P>
<P>by the Company to training in accordance with Paragraph</P>
<P>9-B-1-a, he shall receive his monthly guarantee and his</P>
<P>total allowable monthly flight time shall be reduced by four</P>
<P>hours and ten minutes (4:10) for each duty day missed as</P>
<P>shown in his assigned reserve line.</P>
<B><P>9-C-2- </B>Training Assignments Of Less Than Five (5) Days</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-a- </B>A pilot assigned to training in accordance with</P>
<P>Paragraph 9-B-1-b above, shall be paid his monthly pay or</P>
<P>guarantee as applicable as provided in Section 3 in</P>
<P>accordance with the following:</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-a-(1) </B>When a pilot assigned a line of flying</P>
<P>attends training, his total allowable monthly flight time</P>
<P>shall be reduced by the number of actual flight hours</P>
<P>missed as a result of this training.</P>
<I><P>Reserve training</P>
<P>credit</P>
</I><B><P>9-C-2-a-(2) </B>When a pilot functioning as a reserve</P>
<P>attends training, he shall have his total allowable</P>
<P>monthly flight time reduced by four hours and ten</P>
<P>minutes (4:10) for each duty day missed as shown in</P>
<P>his assigned reserve line.</P>
<B><P>Page 128&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Section 9-C-2-b</P>
</B><I><P>Lineholder</P>
<P>minimum days off</P>
</I><B><P>9-C-2-b- </B>When a pilot assigned a line of flying attends</P>
<P>training as specified in Paragraph 9-B-1-b above and such</P>
<P>assignment results in such pilot being scheduled for less</P>
<P>than the required minimum calendar days free of duty at</P>
<P>his home domicile for the month, said pilot shall be given</P>
<P>another day or days off, as the case may be, in lieu of the</P>
<P>scheduled day or days off in which he attended training in</P>
<P>order to bring his scheduled days off to the required</P>
<P>minimum calendar days free of duty at his home domicile</P>
<P>for the month, as provided in Section 5-G-1-d-(1).</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-b-(1) </B>Whenever said pilot must drop a trip or</P>
<P>trips from his schedule to receive a day or days as</P>
<P>provided in sub-paragraph b above, his total allowable</P>
<P>monthly flight time shall be reduced by the number of</P>
<P>actual flight hours in the trip. Should he be required to</P>
<P>stand by on "extra" days as provided in Section 5-G-4,</P>
<P>the reduction above will only be the actual flight hours</P>
<P>in the trip on the days he did not stand by or fly under</P>
<P>Section 20-F.</P>
<I><P>Training credit</P>
<P>days for training</P>
<P>less than 5 days</P>
</I><B><P>9-C-2-c- </B>When a pilot assigned a line of flying attends</P>
<P>training of less than five (5) days including PC/CQP/PT's</P>
<P>on days that he was not scheduled to fly other than</P>
<P>compensated for in Paragraph 9-C-2-b above, said pilot</P>
<P>shall receive a training credit day in accordance with the</P>
<P>following:</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-c-(1) </B>For purposes of this sub-paragraph c, a</P>
<P>training credit day shall consist of any of the following:</P>
<B><P>(a) </B>Any portion of a calendar day deadheading to or</P>
<P>from training;</P>
<B><P>(b) </B>Any portion of a calendar day spent in any of the</P>
<P>applicable required types of training under this sub-paragraph</P>
<P>C-2;</P>
<B><P>(c) </B>Any portion of a calendar day the pilot is available</P>
<P>for the applicable required types of training listed in</P>
<P>Paragraph 9-A above, but he is unable to complete</P>
<P>such training because of inoperative equipment or</P>
<P>because of the cancellation of any portion of the</P>
<P>scheduled training period.</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-c-(2) </B>A pilot shall not receive a training credit</P>
<P>day for any day on which he was scheduled to fly nor</P>
<P>shall a pilot receive more than one (1) training credit</P>
<P>day for any calendar day in which a pilot deadheaded</P>
<P>to or from training on the same day he was scheduled</P>
<P>for training..<B>Section 9-C-2-d Page 129</P>
<P>9-C-2-c-(3) </B>Provided further, in the event that a pilot's</P>
<P>training assignment results in his gaining a day or days</P>
<P>off by reason of having to drop a portion of a round trip</P>
<P>on a day that he was not scheduled for training, such</P>
<P>gained day or days off will be deducted from any</P>
<P>training credit day(s) in the computation of the net</P>
<P>training credit days occasioned by such assignment.</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-c-(4) </B>Provided further, in the event that a pilot</P>
<P>fails the training and requires additional days of</P>
<P>training, such additional days shall not be subject to</P>
<P>the provisions of this sub-paragraph.</P>
<B><P>9-C-2-d- </B>Training days credit accumulated by a pilot in</P>
<P>accordance with sub-paragraph c above during the period</P>
<P>from December 1 to December 1 of each year will be</P>
<P>added to the scheduled vacation due said pilot in</P>
<P>accordance with Section 11, as shown in the Example:</P>
<P>Example:</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>Schedule vacation days due under</P>
<P>Section 11- 16 days</P>
<P>Training days' credit due- 4 days</P>
<P>Adjusted vacation- 20 days.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>9-D- Transportation</P>
<P>9-D-1- </B>A pilot assigned to training shall be furnished</P>
<P>Company non-revenue positive space (NRPS) or OMC</P>
<P>(Priority E) transportation at the option of the pilot, for all</P>
<P>authorized travel to and from his point of residence, duty or</P>
<P>assignment and the training location. OMC may be assigned</P>
<P>only with pilot concurrence. Authorized travel shall be travel</P>
<P>in connection with the beginning, relocation or termination of</P>
<P>a training assignment, travel at Company request, and such</P>
<P>other travel that may from time to time be authorized.</P>
<I><P>Transportation to /</P>
<P>from training</P>
</I><B><P>9-D-2- </B>Non-revenue positive space (NRPS) or OMC (Priority</P>
<P>E) at the option of the pilot will be issued by the Training</P>
<P>Facility Administrative Office for travel to and from his point</P>
<P>of residence, duty or assignment on a pilot's scheduled days</P>
<P>off. It is the responsibility of the pilot to be available for</P>
<P>scheduled training periods.</P>
<B><P>Page 130 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-E</P>
<P>9-E- Expenses</P>
<P>9-E-1- </B>The Company shall furnish suitable, single lodging</P>
<P>accommodations when required and standard allowances, as</P>
<P>provided in Section 4-A-1, from time of departure of the trip</P>
<P>on which he deadheads to the training assignment until the</P>
<P>time of arrival of the trip on which he returns to his domicile.</P>
<P>In the event the Company cannot furnish lodging, reasonable</P>
<P>actual expenses supported by receipts plus standard</P>
<P>allowances will be paid. Transportation shall be furnished</P>
<P>between the lodgings and the training facility or expenses,</P>
<P>therefore, if such transportation is not furnished by the</P>
<P>Company. Such expenses shall be claimed on a regular</P>
<P>Company expense account form and must be submitted</P>
<P>within fourteen (14) days after incurring the expenses. The</P>
<P>Company will allow actual and necessary personal laundry</P>
<P>and cleaning expenses, when training away from the home</P>
<P>domicile is for more than five (5) consecutive days.</P>
<B><P>9-E-2- </B>A pilot assigned to training at his home domicile or a</P>
<P>pilot who elects to live at his home while in training shall be</P>
<P>paid at the rates set forth in Section 4-A-1 from the time he</P>
<P>reports to the Training Center for training until he is released</P>
<P>from the Training Center. This will not apply to a pilot from</P>
<P>the time he is released for days off during the training period,</P>
<P>until reporting for training following a day off period.</P>
<I><P>Expenses for</P>
<P>training at home</P>
<P>domicile</P>
</I><B><P>9-E-3- </B>Pilots in Transition or Requalification Training at their</P>
<P>home domicile may, at their option and in lieu of the lodging</P>
<P>provisions herein, receive an allowance for transportation of</P>
<P>fifteen Dollars ($15.00) per day for each day the pilot is</P>
<P>required to report for training. Such allowance shall be</P>
<P>claimed on a regular expense form and must be submitted</P>
<P>within fourteen (14) days after incurring the expenses.</P>
<B><P>9-F- Training Schedules</P>
<P>9-F-1- </B>To the extent known and projected by DENTK</P>
<P>Planning and Scheduling Section, the training schedule will</P>
<P>be posted for the entire transition period, from the beginning</P>
<P>through completion.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2- </B>A pilot assigned to training shall not be on duty in</P>
<P>excess of the following limitations:</P>
<I><P>Duty period</P>
<P>restriction for</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-2-a- </B>A pilot shall not be on duty for more than eight</P>
<P>(8) hours exclusive of a one (1) hour lunch break, in any</P>
<P>one (1) calendar day during Initial, Upgrading, Transition</P>
<P>Training, Proficiency Training and Checks, in the simulator</P>
<B><P>Page 131&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-F-2-b </P>
</B><P>or aircraft or combination thereof. In addition, a pilot shall</P>
<P>not be scheduled to exceed thirteen and one-half (13 1/2)</P>
<P>hours on duty in a combination of training and</P>
<P>deadheading to or from Denver and will not be required to</P>
<P>exceed fourteen and one-half (14 1/2) hours; except in the</P>
<P>case of a delay in training, he may be required to exceed</P>
<P>fourteen and one-half (14 1/2) hours to deadhead home in</P>
<P>order to be legal for his next scheduled trip.</P>
<I><P>Duty periods for</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-2-b- </B>Formal classroom and crew training sessions</P>
<P>(excluding crew training sessions designed as briefings</P>
<P>immediately prior to simulator or cockpit procedure trainer</P>
<P>periods) shall begin no earlier than 0700 and terminate no</P>
<P>later than 2200.</P>
<I><P>Simulator training</P>
<P>hours</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-2-c- </B>The training periods in the flight simulator or</P>
<P>cockpit procedures trainer, exclusive of brief and debrief,</P>
<P>will be conducted between the hours of 0600 and 2400</P>
<P>local time. These limits may be exceeded with pilot's</P>
<P>concurrence to make up for lost time due to mechanical</P>
<P>failures. Additionally, the above 2400 time may be</P>
<P>extended to 0200 when the scheduled training</P>
<P>requirements in a particular equipment type exceed the</P>
<P>capabilities at DENTK. The Company may only schedule a</P>
<P>pilot for training during the 2400 to 0200 time period</P>
<P>without his concurrence if no other time slots are legally</P>
<P>available. No checking will be done during this extended</P>
<P>training time.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2-d- </B>The training periods in the flight simulator or</P>
<P>cockpit procedures trainer, exclusive of briefing and</P>
<P>debriefings, will be conducted between the hours of 0600</P>
<P>and 2400 local time, provided that with the pilot's</P>
<P>concurrence these limits may be exceeded to make up for</P>
<P>lost time due to mechanical failures. Additionally, the</P>
<P>above 2400 time limits may be extended to 0200 when the</P>
<P>scheduled training requirements in a particular equipment</P>
<P>type exceed the capabilities at DENTK. No checking will</P>
<P>be done during this extended training time.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2-e- </B>Training periods for airplane flight training and</P>
<P>simulator flight training, or any combination thereof, shall</P>
<P>not be scheduled to exceed four (4) hours of actual</P>
<P>aircraft and/or simulator time per day. A pilot scheduled in</P>
<P>the simulator for a period in excess of two hours and thirty</P>
<P>minutes (2:30) shall be permitted a short break for</P>
<P>physiological needs</P>
<B><P>Page 132 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section9-F-2-f</P>
<P>9-F-2-f- </B>A pilot will not be scheduled for more than six (6)</P>
<P>hours of instruction in classroom, crew training sessions,</P>
<P>system procedures trainer or cockpit procedures trainer in</P>
<P>any one day.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2-g- </B>Five (5) training days in any seven (7)</P>
<P>consecutive days shall be the maximum scheduled. With</P>
<P>pilot concurrence, this training may be extended, due to</P>
<P>unexpected circumstances, to six (6) consecutive days to</P>
<P>provide continuity in a particular training assignment. A</P>
<P>pilot will be scheduled for at least one two (2) consecutive</P>
<P>days off period every two (2) weeks.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2-h- </B>On rating or proficiency checks at DENTK, the</P>
<P>initial take-off or the final landing, with all engines normal,</P>
<P>may be accomplished in hours of darkness. When rating</P>
<P>rides or proficiency checks are conducted away from</P>
<P>DENTK, such flights may, by mutual agreement between</P>
<P>the pilot and check airman, be conducted during night</P>
<P>hours.</P>
<B><P>9-F-2-i- </B>When a pilot has been assigned by the Company</P>
<P>to observe as a member of the crew in conjunction with</P>
<P>transition training, such period of time will be considered</P>
<P>an extension of his transition training period.</P>
<I><P>No simulator</P>
<P>checking prior to</P>
<P>0700 home</P>
<P>domicile time</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-2-j- </B>The Company will not schedule a pilot for</P>
<P>simulator checking prior to 0700 pilot's home domicile</P>
<P>time. However, during Daylight Savings Time, the</P>
<P>Company may schedule Honolulu based pilots for</P>
<P>simulator checking beginning at 0600 pilot's home</P>
<P>domicile time.</P>
<B><P>9-F-3- Rest Provisions</P>
<P>9-F-3-a-</P>
<P>9-F-3-a-(1) </B>The minimum rest period between any two</P>
<P>training duty assignments shall be twelve (12) hours off</P>
<P>duty.</P>
<B><P>9-F-3-a-(2) </B>The minimum rest between any line</P>
<P>assignment and any training assignment (including</P>
<P>deadheading to or from training, if required) shall be</P>
<P>eighteen (18) hours free of all duty at the home</P>
<P>domicile.</P>
<I><P>Pilot scheduled</P>
<P>for 1 in 7 during</P>
<P>training of less</P>
<P>than 5 days</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-3-b- </B>A pilot scheduled for training of less than five</P>
<P>(5) days shall be scheduled for not less than one (1)</P>
<P>calendar day off in each seven (7) days; except that, if</P>
<P>such seven (7) days contains a combination of line flying.</P>
<B><P>Page 133 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-F-3-c</P>
</B><P>and training, he may be scheduled for and perform seven</P>
<P>(7) consecutive days of such combined duty, if the seventh</P>
<P>(7th) day of duty is necessary to complete an assignment</P>
<P>in progress.</P>
<I><P>Days off after</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-3-c- </B>Upon completion of scheduled training of more</P>
<P>than seven (7) days, a pilot will be given not less than</P>
<P>three (3) calendar days free of all duty at his home</P>
<P>domicile, provided he is not scheduled for such time off in</P>
<P>his line of flying or as a reserve. Such three (3) days off</P>
<P>may be provided immediately upon completion of formal</P>
<P>training at DENTK or upon completion of IOE, at the pilot's</P>
<P>option. The pilot shall indicate his desire as to the</P>
<P>placement of such three (3) days off within forty-eight (48)</P>
<P>hours of receiving his training schedule. If the pilot makes</P>
<P>no choice, the placement of the days off with respect to</P>
<P>the IOE will be determined by the company.</P>
<I><P>Scheduling of</P>
<P>pilot for IOE</P>
</I><B><P>9-F-3-d- </B>Notwithstanding the four (4) duty period</P>
<P>restriction for scheduling of domestic trip sequences</P>
<P>provided in Section 5-G-3-g, the Company may assign a</P>
<P>pilot to a series of flights exceeding the four (4) duty</P>
<P>period limit to accomplish his Initial Operating Experience</P>
<P>(I.O.E.). This assignment shall be accomplished as a part</P>
<P>of his training assignment under the provisions of Section</P>
<P>9, but I.O.E. shall not be subject to the provisions of 9-F-2</P>
<P>(duty limits while in training) or 9-F-3-a (rest requirements</P>
<P>while in training at DENTK and deadheading to and from</P>
<P>DENTK). Additionally, notwithstanding the limitation of</P>
<P>seventy-five (75) actual flight hours per month for</P>
<P>reserves in Section 5-B-2-b, the Company may assign</P>
<P>additional flying for the purpose of completing I.O.E. up to</P>
<P>eighty-one (81) actual hours in a month (eighty-three (83)</P>
<P>actual hours in a flex month) in the domestic operation</P>
<P>and up to eighty-five (85) actual hours in a month in the</P>
<P>international operation. In this event, the pilot's pay shall</P>
<P>include the amount due him for training, as provided by</P>
<P>the application of Section 9-C-1, plus the value of his</P>
<P>performance thereafter.</P>
<B><P>9-F-3-e- </B>A pilot will not be assigned to training or to</P>
<P>deadhead on December 25th or January 1st.</P>
<B><P>9-G- General</P>
<P>9-G-1-</P>
</B><I><P>Training</P>
<P>Committee</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-1-a- </B>The Company shall establish such training</P>
<P>policies as are necessary to insure compliance with this.</P>
<B><P>Page 134 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-1-b</P>
</B><P>Agreement and to accomplish the necessary training</P>
<P>requirements of the Company. A Training Committee</P>
<P>composed of representatives of the Company and</P>
<P>representatives of the pilots shall be established. The</P>
<P>Training Committee shall meet quarterly unless the parties</P>
<P>agree to meet less frequently, or at any other time the</P>
<P>parties mutually agree. It is the intent of the parties to this</P>
<P>Agreement that this Training Committee shall provide the</P>
<P>pilots with the opportunity to consult with and make</P>
<P>recommendations to the Company on training policies or</P>
<P>changes, training programs or changes, or any other</P>
<P>matters affecting pilot training. In the event that the</P>
<P>Training Committee and the Company are unable to</P>
<P>resolve issues of training, these issues will be referred to</P>
<P>the Vice President of Training, the Senior Vice President</P>
<P>of Flight Operations and the Master Chairman for</P>
<P>resolution.</P>
<I><P>ALPA observer on</P>
<P>check ride</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-1-b- </B>The parties agree that it is in the best interest of</P>
<P>the Company, the Association and the pilot in training for</P>
<P>the ALPA Training Committee to be notified any time an</P>
<P>individual pilot is having training difficulties or is</P>
<P>scheduled for other than a routine check by DENTK. If</P>
<P>requested by the pilot, a UAL pilot representative of ALPA</P>
<P>may be present in the cockpit as an observer on any</P>
<P>check other than a routine check.</P>
<P>Additionally, the Company agrees to handle pilots who</P>
<P>continue to experience training difficulties as per past</P>
<P>practice.</P>
<B><P>9-G-2- </B>The Company will make every reasonable effort to</P>
<P>provide Pilot Instructor continuity throughout simulator and</P>
<P>airplane training. In unusual circumstances, special</P>
<P>consideration shall be given when a pilot requests a specific</P>
<P>Pilot Instructor.</P>
<I><P>PC/PT fil-in time</P>
<P>credit and duty</P>
<P>restrictions</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-3- </B>If a pilot is assigned to a flight simulator period as a</P>
<P>fill-in crew member and such assignment is in addition to his</P>
<P>regularly assigned PC/CQP/PT periods, the Company will not</P>
<P>require that he participate in the oral portion of the</P>
<P>examination. If his performance requires additional training,</P>
<P>such training will be provided to a satisfactory level of</P>
<P>proficiency and no checking events will be scheduled. If the</P>
<P>fill-in crewmember is a reserve, he shall have his total</P>
<P>allowable monthly flight time reduced by four hours and ten</P>
<P>minutes (4:10) for each day assigned as a fill-in. A pilot so</P>
<P>assigned shall not be scheduled to be on duty, including.</P>
<B><P>Page 135&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-3-a </P>
</B><P>deadheading to and from the training location, in excess of</P>
<P>thirteen and one-half (13 1/2) hours; and shall not be</P>
<P>required to remain on duty in excess of fourteen and one-half</P>
<P>(14 1/2) hours without his concurrence except in the case of</P>
<P>a delay in a PC/CQP/PT, he may be required to exceed</P>
<P>fourteen and one-half (14 1/2) hours to deadhead home in</P>
<P>order to be legal for his next scheduled trip.</P>
<I><P>Selection of PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT fill-in</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-3-a- </B>Once the Company has determined that a pilot</P>
<P>is needed as a "fill-in" in order to provide a complete crew</P>
<P>for a PC/CQP/PT, the Company may select a reserve for</P>
<P>the fill-in assignment, according to the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 20-J-1-b-(5); or, at its option, the Company may</P>
<P>elect to make the fill-in assignment available to a</P>
<P>lineholder who is signed up for "open flying".</P>
<I><P>Procedure for</P>
<P>lineholder pickup</P>
<P>of PC/CQP/PT fill-in</P>
<P>assignments</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-3-b- </B>If the Company makes the assignment available</P>
<P>to lineholders, the following will be the domicile</P>
<P>preference order, regardless of each lineholder's own</P>
<P>pick-up priority under Section 20-H:</P>
<B><P>9-G-3-b-(1) </B>Lineholders based at DEN.</P>
<B><P>9-G-3-b-(2) </B>Lineholders based at the same domicile as</P>
<P>either the Captain or the First Officer assigned the PC/</P>
<P>CQP/PT.</P>
<B><P>9-G-3-b-(3) </B>Lineholders based at any other domicile on</P>
<P>the system, at the Company's option.</P>
<B><P>9-G-3-c- </B>Within each domicile, lineholders signed up for</P>
<P>open flying will compete among themselves for fill-in</P>
<P>assignments according to the usual 20-H priority rules.</P>
<I><P>5 hours per duty</P>
<P>period for fill-in</P>
<P>assignments</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-3-d- </B>A lineholder who performs a fill-in assignment</P>
<P>will receive five (5) hours for each duty day that he</P>
<P>performs fill-in duties (not including periods consisting</P>
<P>entirely of deadhead) which will be added to both his</P>
<P>actual monthly projection and to the pay credit value of his</P>
<P>assigned line. The pilot's actual monthly projection</P>
<P>remains limited to the actual monthly limit established by</P>
<P>the Agreement. All pay credit in excess of 85 hours will be</P>
<P>administered in accordance with Section 3-I.</P>
<B><P>9-G-4- </B>A fully qualified crew complement of Captain, First</P>
<P>Officer and Second Officer, where required, whose name</P>
<P>appears on the United Air Lines Pilots Seniority List and/or</P>
<P>Second Officer Seniority Eligibility List shall be utilized in</P>
<P>accordance with United Air Lines' Standard Operating</P>
<P>Procedures during flight simulator proficiency checks. No</P>
<P>pilot will be assigned as a Captain fill-in unless that pilot.</P>
<B><P>Page 136 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-5</P>
</B><P>holds an ATP for that aircraft and has accumulated at least</P>
<P>100 hours of experience in that aircraft since IOE. On those</P>
<P>equipment types where augmentation is required, the use of</P>
<P>two (2) ATP rated First Officers shall fulfill the requirement of</P>
<P>a fully qualified crew complement.</P>
<B><P>9-G-5- </B>No pilot will be required to take a proficiency check in</P>
<P>a simulator that is not functioning so as to simulate the flight</P>
<P>and operating characteristics of the represented aircraft.</P>
<P>Adequate time for a pilot to adapt himself to the particular</P>
<P>flying characteristics of the flight simulator shall be given</P>
<P>before the proficiency check is given in the flight simulator.</P>
<B><P>9-G-6- </B>If a pilot's performance on a proficiency check in the</P>
<P>flight simulator is considered to be unsatisfactory, he shall</P>
<P>always have the opportunity to take a proficiency check,</P>
<P>without prejudice in an aircraft in which he is currently</P>
<P>qualified.</P>
<B><P>9-G-7- </B>No pilot will be evaluated on a maneuver during a</P>
<P>proficiency check that is not prescribed in the United Air</P>
<P>Lines proficiency check as approved by the FAA.</P>
<B><P>9-G-8- </B>Proficiency checks in the flight simulator shall be</P>
<P>given as nearly as possible as an extension of flight simulator</P>
<P>training and shall not be given prior to such training.</P>
<B><P>9-G-9- </B>United Air Lines pilots will normally take precedence</P>
<P>over any outside contract training for the most desirable</P>
<P>training periods. For this purpose, the consideration for</P>
<P>assignments will be in the following order:</P>
<P>1st 0800 to 1800</P>
<P>2nd 1801 to 2400</P>
<P>3rd 0001 to 0759</P>
<B><P>9-G-10- </B>Training time shall not be considered as flight time</P>
<P>for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly or annual flight time</P>
<P>limitations.</P>
<I><P>No record kept for</P>
<P>voluntary training</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-11- </B>Voluntary use of synthetic training devices such as</P>
<P>cockpit procedures trainers and simulators is not included in</P>
<P>the pro-visions of this Section. No record of a pilot's</P>
<P>performance will be maintained by the Company for voluntary</P>
<P>training nor will the log books and records of simulator</P>
<P>utilization indicate the pilot by name..</P>
<B><P>Page 137&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-12 </P>
</B><I><P>Requalification</P>
<P>training available</P>
<P>to pilot at his</P>
<P>option</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-12- </B>A pilot awarded an assignment who has completed</P>
<P>transition training as a Captain in an equipment type other</P>
<P>than a type which he has been flying as a First Officer and is</P>
<P>required by the Company to return to his previous status or</P>
<P>equipment type before being activated in his new assignment</P>
<P>may at his option receive the training he deems necessary,</P>
<P>including a requalification course to requalify in the previous</P>
<P>equipment and/or the new equipment.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13- </B>When training and/or checking is conducted in an</P>
<P>aircraft in flight, such training and checking will be subject to</P>
<P>the following additional restrictions:</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a- </B>Maneuvers requiring a visual horizon:</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(1) </B>Emergency descent.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(2) </B>Simulated engine failure on take off.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(3) </B>Approaches conducted at 50% or less</P>
<P>power available.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(4) </B>Maneuver to land (circling approach).</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(5) </B>Zero degree flap approach.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(6) </B>Approach to stall.</P>
<B><P>9-G-13-a-(7) </B>Intentional Dutch Roll.</P>
<I><P>Route or</P>
<P>equipment</P>
<P>qualifying is an</P>
<P>extension of</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-14- </B>When a pilot is route or equipment qualifying in</P>
<P>conjunction with transition training or as a result of bidding or</P>
<P>bumping such qualifying shall be considered an extension of</P>
<P>training and the provisions of Section 9-F-3-c shall apply.</P>
<B><P>9-G-15- Initial Operating Experience (IOE)</P>
</B><I><P>IOE Check</P>
<P>Airman</P>
<P>compensation</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-15-a- </B>Initial Operating Experience (IOE) for Captains</P>
<P>and First Officers may be conducted by designated line</P>
<P>Captain Check Airmen functioning on their assigned trips.</P>
<P>In any month that the Check Airman is utilized in this</P>
<P>capacity, he shall receive his normal salary plus a Four</P>
<P>Hundred Dollar ($400.00) override to cover up to three (3)</P>
<P>duty periods in which he so functions. For each</P>
<P>subsequent duty period in such capacity, he shall receive</P>
<P>an additional One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) override. In</P>
<P>no case will his pay as an LCA be less than nine percent</P>
<P>(9%) of his hourly pay for the monthly hours performed as</P>
<P>an LCA.</P>
<I><P>Override for</P>
<P>Second Officer</P>
<P>Check Airman</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-15-b- </B>Initial Operating Experience (IOE) for Second</P>
<P>Officers may be conducted by designated line Second</P>
<P>Officer Check Airmen functioning on their assigned trips..</P>
<B><P>Page 138 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-15-c</P>
</B><P>In any month that the Check Airman is utilized in this</P>
<P>capacity, he shall receive his normal salary plus a Three</P>
<P>Hundred Dollar ($300.00) override to cover up to three (3)</P>
<P>duty periods in which he so functions. For each</P>
<P>subsequent duty period in such capacity, he shall receive</P>
<P>an additional Seventy-five ($75.00) override. In no case</P>
<P>will his pay as an LCA be less than nine percent (9%) of</P>
<P>his hourly pay for the monthly hours performed as an LCA.</P>
<I><P>Enroute check</P>
<P>provisions</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-15-c- </B>Captains and Second Officers who have been</P>
<P>designated as line check airmen under this provision may</P>
<P>also perform en route checks as follows:</P>
<B><P>9-G-15-c-(1) </B>The following conditions will apply to the</P>
<P>pilot being checked.</P>
<B><P>(a) </B>He shall be checked on his own trip unless with</P>
<P>pilot concurrence other arrangements are made.</P>
<B><P>(b) </B>In no event will he be scheduled for more duty</P>
<P>periods than were in his original schedule, without his</P>
<P>concurrence.</P>
<B><P>(c) </B>His monthly pay shall not be affected by any</P>
<P>changes made to accommodate an en route check.</P>
<B><P>(d) </B>If a lineholder, he shall not be requested to per-form</P>
<P>as a reserve or to accept standby assignments as</P>
<P>a result of changes made to accommodate an en route</P>
<P>check.</P>
<B><P>(e) </B>All Section 5 limitations shall apply to his</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>9-G-15-c-(2) </B>Further, the following conditions will apply</P>
<P>to check airmen:</P>
<B><P>(a) </B>He shall receive hard hour credit for all hours flown</P>
<P>in conjunction with an en route check.</P>
<B><P>(b) </B>He shall not exceed the number of originally</P>
<P>scheduled duty periods without his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>(c) </B>All Section 5 limitations shall apply.</P>
<B><P>9-G-16- </B>Route qualifying required prior to assignment to</P>
<P>duty as a Captain shall be as specified in the applicable</P>
<P>portion of Flight Regulations-Operational, Series 25-2 and no</P>
<P>other qualifying trips will be required..</P>
<B><P>Page 139&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-17 </P>
<P>9-G-17- </B>When changes or additions are made to the</P>
<P>applicable portion of Flight Regulations-Operational, Series</P>
<P>25-2, as specified in sub-paragraph 9-G-16 above to which</P>
<P>the Association objects, a hearing will be granted by the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations within thirty (30)</P>
<P>days at the request of the Association for the purpose of</P>
<P>determining whether such changes or additions should be</P>
<P>continued.</P>
<I><P>FANS Training </P>
</I><B><P>9-G-18- </B>The Company will provide three (3) hours of pay to</P>
<P>lineholder pilots who participate in the FANS training when</P>
<P>that training is conducted as "stand alone" training at the</P>
<P>pilot's home domicile. This pay will not be banked, but will</P>
<P>instead be paid in addition to the compensation that</P>
<P>otherwise would be paid in the subject month, even when the</P>
<P>pilot's total pay exceeds the normal monthly pay maximum.</P>
<P>Reserve pilots will be assigned FANS training only on reserve</P>
<P>work days and will receive no additional compensation since</P>
<P>reserve work days are already compensated.</P>
<I><P>Home Study</P>
<P>Program</P>
</I><B><P>9-G-19- </B>Should the Company implement a Home Study</P>
<P>program to replace the first part of transition training now</P>
<P>conducted at DENTK, the program shall be administered as</P>
<P>follows:</P>
<B><P>9-G-19-a- </B>The Company may offer a pilot the Home</P>
<P>Study program, however, his participation will be</P>
<P>voluntary.</P>
<B><P>9-G-19-b- </B>Pilots receiving assignments, through bidding</P>
<P>or bumping, in equipment types included in the Home</P>
<P>Study program must indicate their desire to participate in</P>
<P>the program within ten (10) days of receiving such award.</P>
<P>Those pilots who participate will continue in line</P>
<P>operations until commencing their training assignment at</P>
<P>DENTK. Participants will receive 4:10 of pay for each</P>
<P>reduction of one (1) day of training, at their current rate,</P>
<P>over and above their line guarantees or line value,</P>
<P>whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P>9-G-19-c- </B>The pilot must demonstrate satisfactory</P>
<P>completion of the Home Study course by a specified date</P>
<P>to receive this additional pay.</P>
<B><P>9-G-19-d- </B>The Home Study course materials will be sent</P>
<P>to the pilot upon his notifying the Company of his desire to</P>
<P>participate in the program. The same course materials will</P>
<P>be available at each domicile..</P>
<B><P>Page 140 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 9-G-19-e</P>
<P>9-G-19-e- </B>Pilots not participating will receive the full</P>
<P>ground school training as traditionally performed at</P>
<P>DENTK.</P>
<B><P>9-G-19-f- </B>The Home Study program will continue on a</P>
<P>test basis for a period of six (6) months from the</P>
<P>implementation date of the program. The results and</P>
<P>quality will be monitored by the Company and the UAL/</P>
<P>MEC Training Committee to determine its effectiveness,</P>
<P>need for modifications and/or acceptability. If determined</P>
<P>effective the program may be continued by mutual</P>
<P>agreement.</P>
<B><P>9-H-</P>
</B><P>Nothing herein shall restrict deviation from the rules by</P>
<P>mutual agreement between the pilot and the Company where</P>
<P>such deviation will aid or benefit the pilot in completing any</P>
<P>training requirement.</P>
<B><P>9-I-</P>
</B><P>All pilots assigned to equipment domiciles with DSL</P>
<P>scheduled overwater flying shall, at their option, be overwater</P>
<P>and INS qualified within six (6) months. Initial and recurrent</P>
<P>training shall be accomplished under the provisions of this</P>
<P>Section.</P>
<B><P>9-J-</P>
</B><I><P>Second Officer</P>
<P>PAC time</P>
</I><P>In order to continue the mutual objective of providing a pilot</P>
<P>qualified crew concept, each Second Officer transition</P>
<P>training which requires a certification will include at least two</P>
<P>(2) hours of pilot-at-control time in the aircraft or in an FAA</P>
<P>approved simulator with visual projection.</P>
<B><P>9-K-</P>
</B><I><P>New Training </P>
</I><P>Should a new training requirement be instituted which will initially require more than four hours of training and which has a specific, required completion date, the parties will meet to discuss and agree upon (1) whether pilots who participate
should be compensated and, if so (2) what form compensation should take. This commitment to negotiate on compensation under these conditions does not constitute a waiver of the Company's rights to require pilots to participate in such</P>
<P>training under the present provisions of the Agreement prior to reaching agreement on the issue of compensation..</P>
<B><P>Page 141&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 10</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Moving Expenses</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>10-A-</P>
</B><P>Company paid moves, related personal transportation and</P>
<P>travel time, when provided by this Agreement, shall be</P>
<P>subject to the conditions of this Section 10.</P>
<I><P>O-line</P>
<P>transportation to</P>
<P>relocate pilot's</P>
<P>residence due to</P>
<P>domicile transfer</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-1- </B>Any pilot whose domicile has changed as a result of</P>
<P>the application of this Agreement (with or without a related</P>
<P>Company paid move) and who does actually relocate his</P>
<P>primary residence as a result of that domicile transfer, shall</P>
<P>be furnished on-line air transportation from his old residence</P>
<P>to his new residence (or between the nearest on-line cities)</P>
<P>for himself and his immediate family, to the extent permitted</P>
<P>by law. Such transportation shall be available for the purpose</P>
<P>of locating the pilot and his family at his new residence. This</P>
<P>transportation shall also be available (1) to a pilot newly hired</P>
<P>in order to locate at his first assigned domicile and (2) to a</P>
<P>pilot upon recall from furlough to locate at the domicile to</P>
<P>which he is being returned, regardless of whether he is or is</P>
<P>not returned to the domicile from which he was furloughed.</P>
<I><P>Travel time for</P>
<P>domicile transfer</P>
<P>when not moving</P>
<P>household goods</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2- </B>Any pilot whose domicile has changed as a result of</P>
<P>either a lateral or transition vacancy award and who chooses</P>
<P>not to move his household goods will be entitled to the</P>
<P>following:</P>
<B><P>10-A-2-a- </B>Three (3) transfer days to be used after the</P>
<P>posting of the final bid award, but no later than ninety (90)</P>
<P>days after activation. However, if the pilot chooses to drive</P>
<P>one (1) automobile, he will receive the greater of three (3)</P>
<P>transfer days or the number of travel days equal to the</P>
<P>distance between the pilot's old domicile and his new</P>
<P>domicile divided by 400. Remainders over 100 will provide</P>
<P>an extra travel day.</P>
<I><P>Enroute driving</P>
<P>expenses</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-b- </B>Reimbursement of reasonable enroute driving</P>
<P>expenses for mileage, meals (not to exceed $30 per day),</P>
<P>hotel and laundry. With the exception of meals, these</P>
<P>expenses must be supported by receipts. Receipts for</P>
<P>enroute expenses must coincide with the travel days the</P>
<P>pilot has requested from the Company. Mileage will be.</P>
<B><P>Page 142&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-A-2-c</P>
</B><P>reimbursed at the rate of twenty-nine cents ($0.29) per</P>
<P>mile or Company policy, whichever is greater.</P>
<I><P>Shipment of</P>
<P>automobile</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-c- </B>For the pilot who does not choose to drive an</P>
<P>automobile, the Company will ship one (1) automobile to</P>
<P>the pilot's new domicile location from his primary</P>
<P>residence or old domicile location. Shipment of an</P>
<P>automobile will not be available if the mileage between the</P>
<P>pilot's old domicile and his new domicile is less than 500</P>
<P>miles.</P>
<I><P>Freezes for</P>
<P>training of 12</P>
<P>days or more</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-d- </B>Paragraph 10-A-2-a, 10-A-2-b and 10-A-2-c</P>
<P>will not trigger a fourteen (14) month bidding freeze.</P>
<P>However, if a pilot requires training of more than twelve</P>
<P>(12) days as a result of his vacancy award, the</P>
<P>appropriate freeze will be imposed.</P>
<I><P>Notification of</P>
<P>travel time</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-e- </B>As long as the pilot complies with the time limit</P>
<P>stated in Paragraph 10-A-2-a above, the pilot may take</P>
<P>travel or transfer days ("travel time") at his option</P>
<P>provided he informs the Company at least seven (7) days</P>
<P>prior to when he intends to take the time. Notwithstanding</P>
<P>the pilot option provided above, if the travel time desired</P>
<P>results in a trip(s) drop on New Year's Day, Memorial Day,</P>
<P>Easter, Fourth of July, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day or</P>
<P>Christmas or the day on either side, Company</P>
<P>concurrence is required. Entitlement to travel time will be</P>
<P>based solely upon a change in domiciles. The pilot's</P>
<P>monthly salary will not be reduced for such period of</P>
<P>absence from duty.</P>
<I><P>Use of travel time</P>
<P>to cover I.D.'s</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-f- </B>A pilot using travel time will not be required to</P>
<P>use vacation days if the number of travel/transfer days is</P>
<P>insufficient to totally cover all flying being dropped. If the</P>
<P>Company could reasonably deadhead the pilot to work a</P>
<P>portion of a trip I.D. not covered by travel/transfer days,</P>
<P>he may request the use of vacation days and opt out of</P>
<P>working this partial trip I.D.</P>
<I><P>Travel time for</P>
<P>new hire pilots</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-2-g- </B>New Hire pilots and any pilot returning from</P>
<P>furlough shall be entitled to three (3) travel/transfer days if</P>
<P>they are initially assigned to the Denver domicile or five</P>
<P>(5) travel/transfer days if initially assigned to either</P>
<P>Anchorage or Honolulu. If assigned to a domicile other</P>
<P>than Denver, Anchorage or Honolulu, the travel time</P>
<P>entitlement will continue to be determined based on the</P>
<P>distance between DENTK and the domicile to which the</P>
<P>pilot is assigned..</P>
<B><P>Page 143&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-A-3 </P>
</B><I><P>Travel time for</P>
<P>domicile transfer</P>
<P>when moving</P>
<P>household goods</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3- </B>A pilot who is eligible for a paid move and chooses</P>
<P>to move household goods from his old primary residence will</P>
<P>be entitled to the following:</P>
<B><P>10-A-3-a- </B>Three (3) transfer days or, if the pilot chooses</P>
<P>to drive an automobile, he will receive the greater of three</P>
<P>(3) transfer days or the number of travel days equal to the</P>
<P>distance between the pilot's old domicile and his new</P>
<P>domicile divided by 400. Remainders over 100 will provide</P>
<P>an extra travel day.</P>
<I><P>Enroute driving</P>
<P>expenses</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-b- </B>Reimbursement of reasonable enroute driving</P>
<P>expenses (mileage, meals, hotels and laundry) for one</P>
<P>enroute trip. With the exception of meals (reimbursed up</P>
<P>to $30 per day), these expenses must be supported by</P>
<P>receipts. Receipts for enroute expenses must coincide</P>
<P>with the travel days the pilot has requested from the</P>
<P>Company. Mileage will be reimbursed at the rate of</P>
<P>twenty-nine cents ($0.29) per mile or Company policy,</P>
<P>whichever is greater, for up to two (2) automobiles.</P>
<I><P>Shipment of</P>
<P>second</P>
<P>automobile</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-c- </B>The option of driving one (1) automobile from</P>
<P>his old primary residence or old domicile location to a new</P>
<P>residence or his new domicile location and shipping a</P>
<P>second automobile from his old primary residence or his</P>
<P>old domicile location to a new residence or new domicile</P>
<P>location.</P>
<I><P>Shipment of two</P>
<P>automobiles</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-d- </B>In lieu of enroute expenses and travel days,</P>
<P>the pilot has the option of shipping two (2) automobiles</P>
<P>from his old primary residence or old domicile location to</P>
<P>his new residence or he may ship one (1) automobile to</P>
<P>his new residence and another to his new domicile</P>
<P>location. If the pilot ships two (2) automobiles, he is still</P>
<P>entitled to three (3) transfer days.</P>
<I><P>Notification of</P>
<P>travel time</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-e- </B>The pilot may take travel or transfer days</P>
<P>("travel time") provided for in 10-A-3-a above at his option</P>
<P>so long as he informs the Company at least seven (7)</P>
<P>days prior to when he intends to take the time.</P>
<P>Notwithstanding the pilot option provided above, if the</P>
<P>travel time desired results in a trip(s) drop on New Year's</P>
<P>Day, Memorial Day, Easter, Fourth of July, Labor Day,</P>
<P>Thanksgiving Day or Christmas or the day on either side,</P>
<P>Company concurrence is required. Entitlement to travel</P>
<P>time will be based solely upon a change in domiciles. The</P>
<P>pilot's monthly salary will not be reduced for such period</P>
<P>of absence from duty..</P>
<B><P>Page 144 </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp
;</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Section10-A-3-f</P>
</B><I><P>Use of travel time</P>
<P>to cover I.D.'s</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-f- </B>A pilot using travel time will not be required to</P>
<P>use vacation days if the number of travel/transfer days is</P>
<P>insufficient to totally cover all flying being dropped. If the</P>
<P>Company could reasonably deadhead the pilot to work a</P>
<P>portion of a trip I.D. not covered by travel/transfer days,</P>
<P>he may, with his concurrence, request the use of vacation</P>
<P>days and opt out of working this partial trip I.D.</P>
<I><P>Triggering events</P>
<P>for paid move</P>
<P>entitlement and</P>
<P>freeze purposes</P>
</I><B><P>10-A-3-g- </B>When a pilot exercises his paid move</P>
<P>entitlement, he will incur the appropriate freeze. The</P>
<P>phrase "exercises his paid move entitlement" includes the</P>
<P>use of NRPS/NRSA commuting tickets, making</P>
<P>arrangements with a mover, requesting reimbursement for</P>
<P>mortgage maintenance costs, lease termination costs,</P>
<P>temporary living expenses or other covered miscellaneous</P>
<P>expenses associated with the move. The phrase does not</P>
<P>include the use of the applicable authorized travel for the</P>
<P>purpose of house-hunting.</P>
<B><P>10-A-3-h- </B>Pilots transferring from any mainland domicile</P>
<P>or Honolulu domicile to Anchorage or from Anchorage to</P>
<P>any mainland or Honolulu domicile will be entitled to five</P>
<P>(5) travel days.</P>
<B><P>10-B-</P>
</B><P>Moving expenses when provided by this Agreement, shall be</P>
<P>available only:</P>
<I><P>Procedure for</P>
<P>authorization of</P>
<P>moving expenses</P>
</I><B><P>10-B-1- </B>After the pilot has received notice of his activation</P>
<P>in the assignment which entitled him to the paid move; unless</P>
<P>he has requested and received advance permission to move</P>
<P>earlier; and</P>
<B><P>10-B-2- </B>After the pilot has informed the Company of the</P>
<P>location from which his household goods will be picked up by</P>
<P>completing Company Form UFO 4324. This location must be</P>
<P>the pilot's primary residence, and the pilot is required to</P>
<P>coordinate his move arrangements through the United</P>
<P>Purchasing Department. The Company will not provide</P>
<P>reimbursement for expenses incurred with a mover with</P>
<P>whom the pilot has made his own arrangements; and</P>
<I><P>Minimum</P>
<P>requirement for</P>
<P>paid move 50</P>
<P>miles</P>
</I><B><P>10-B-3- </B>If the distance of the move (the distance between</P>
<P>the pilot's old primary residence and his new primary</P>
<P>residence) is at least fifty (50) miles..</P>
<B><P>Page 145&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-C </P>
<P>10-C-</P>
</B><I><P>Company paid</P>
<P>move policy</P>
</I><B><P>10-C-1-</P>
<P>10-C-1-a- </B>Company paid moves, when provided by this</P>
<P>Agreement, shall be subject to Company policy regarding</P>
<P>non-management moves as outlined in the Pilot Transfer</P>
<P>and Moving Handbook dated April 12, 2000. In case of</P>
<P>conflicts between the Pilot Transfer and Moving Handbook</P>
<P>and the Pilot Agreement, the Pilot Agreement shall</P>
<P>govern. No revisions to this booklet will be made without</P>
<P>agreement with ALPA. (Future editions of the pilot move</P>
<P>booklet will be dated for reference.)</P>
<B><P>10-C-1-b- </B>Moves paid under this provision shall be based</P>
<P>upon an entitlement computed on the distance between</P>
<P>the domicile at which the pilot was based, when he</P>
<P>received the assignment which provided him with a paid</P>
<P>move entitlement and the domicile associated with that</P>
<P>new assignment.</P>
<I><P>Paid move</P>
<P>normally</P>
<P>completed within</P>
<P>12 months unless</P>
<P>extenuating</P>
<P>circumstances</P>
</I><B><P>10-C-1-c- </B>A pilot should complete his paid move within</P>
<P>twelve (12) months of his activation. If the pilot is unable</P>
<P>to complete his move within this twelve (12) month period,</P>
<P>he will inform the Company of his need for an extension</P>
<P>and provide a reason for this request.</P>
<I><P>Auto mileage</P>
<P>allowance</P>
</I><B><P>10-C-1-d- </B>The Company shall calculate mileage</P>
<P>reimbursement based on the most direct AAA mileage</P>
<P>from point of origin at former domicile, to point of</P>
<P>destination at the new domicile, or to point of destination</P>
<P>at the new residence location, if less, plus garage storage</P>
<P>expenses while in transit. A pilot is eligible for mileage</P>
<P>reimbursement as provided in Section 10-A-2 and 10-A-3</P>
<P>only if he owned the automobile(s) on the date of</P>
<P>activation at the new domicile and he actually drives the</P>
<P>automobile(s) to the new domicile or residence location.</P>
<B><P>10-C-1-e- </B>While waiting for their car(s) to arrive, the</P>
<P>Company will reimburse the cost of a rental car for pilots</P>
<P>who ship their car(s) to or from either Anchorage or</P>
<P>Honolulu.</P>
<B><P>10-C-1-f- </B>A paid move from Alaska to any point in the 48</P>
<P>contiguous states will be available to any pilot who (1)</P>
<P>retires (including early and medical retirement) while</P>
<P>based in Anchorage and (2) who has an established</P>
<P>residence in Alaska. Notwithstanding the provisions of.</P>
<B><P>Page 146 Section 10-C-2</P>
</B><P>Section 10-C-3 of the Agreement, this move entitlement</P>
<P>shall apply only to a move from Alaska to the mainland.</P>
<B><P>10-C-2- </B>Should a pilot receive a second paid move</P>
<P>entitlement prior to his using an earlier entitlement, he shall</P>
<P>be entitled only to one (1) Company paid move; however, the</P>
<P>paid mileage available for the transportation of automobile(s)</P>
<P>and household goods will be added during the period wherein</P>
<P>the two entitlements overlap.</P>
<I><P>Offset paid move </P>
</I><B><P>10-C-3- </B>In the application of this paid move provision, the</P>
<P>locations of the old and new residences shall not affect the</P>
<P>entitlement, except that the pilot shall bear the added</P>
<P>expense incurred should the actual distance moved exceed</P>
<P>the mileage to which he is entitled. In determining the amount</P>
<P>to be paid by the pilot, the line haul allowance for moving</P>
<P>household goods will be computed by multiplying the "line</P>
<P>haul weight rate" for the move initially acquired by the weight</P>
<P>of the move actually accomplished.</P>
<I><P>Pilot forfeits</P>
<P>unused paid move</P>
<P>if he is awarded a</P>
<P>subsequent</P>
<P>vacancy in his</P>
<P>original domicile</P>
</I><B><P>10-C-4- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of 10-C-2 and 10-C-3</P>
<P>above, should a pilot receive another assignment which is</P>
<P>located at the domicile from which his first entitlement</P>
<P>originated, prior to using the entitlement associated with that</P>
<P>first reassignment, he shall receive no new paid move</P>
<P>entitlement and shall also forfeit the first entitlement.</P>
<P>Example: A pilot who has an unused entitlement between</P>
<P>ORD and DEN as a result of a bid to DEN which was</P>
<P>activated within the paid move entitlement period would lose</P>
<P>that entitlement and would receive no new entitlement if he</P>
<P>bid back to ORD and was activated before the expiration of</P>
<P>the paid move entitlement period associated with the original</P>
<P>ORD-DEN entitlement.</P>
<B><P>10-C-5- </B>In the event a pilot incurs and is reimbursed for</P>
<P>expenses associated with house hunting and he</P>
<P>subsequently does not take his paid move entitlement, he</P>
<P>shall not be required to repay the Company for any expense</P>
<P>money received.</P>
<B><P>10-D-</P>
</B><I><P>Household effects</P>
<P>may be shipped</P>
<P>NRSA freight</P>
</I><P>Pilots entitled to transfer expenses under Paragraph 10-A-2</P>
<P>and 10-A-3 of this Section shall be allowed to ship household</P>
<P>effects via NRSA freight. Shipping items via NRSA freight will</P>
<P>not result in a freeze as stated in 10-A-3-g above..</P>
<B><P>Page 147&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-E </P>
<P>10-E-</P>
</B><P>New hire pilots may ship up to 2000 pounds via NRSA freight.</P>
<B><P>10-F-</P>
</B><I><P>NRPS/NRSA</P>
<P>transportation</P>
</I><P>A pilot shall be allowed NRPS transportation between his</P>
<P>former domicile or on-line residence and his new domicile</P>
<P>until such time that he moves his home to the new location,</P>
<P>not to exceed six (6) months after the effective date of his</P>
<P>new assignment. In addition, if such pilot has not moved his</P>
<P>home to the new location within six (6) months, he shall be</P>
<P>allowed NRSA transportation until he moves, not to exceed</P>
<P>an additional six (6) months. If a pilot has used this NRPS/</P>
<P>NRSA travel entitlement, and he subsequently receives</P>
<P>another assignment which is located at the domicile from</P>
<P>which his first move entitlement originated, the Company will</P>
<P>continue to provide NRPS/NRSA transportation until the pilot</P>
<P>is activated into his subsequent assignment.</P>
<B><P>10-G- Miscellaneous Allowance</P>
</B><I><P>Miscellaneous</P>
<P>moving expenses</P>
</I><P>In order to reimburse employees, who are eligible for a</P>
<P>Company paid move, for miscellaneous expenses not</P>
<P>otherwise covered by the provisions of this Section, an</P>
<P>allowance of up to Three Thousand Dollars ($3,000.00) will</P>
<P>be available, subject to submission of evidence of actual</P>
<P>expenditure.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1- </B>The types of expenses the Company would include</P>
<P>as being reimbursable are as follows:</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-a- </B>Installation of telephone equipment</P>
<P>comparable to old residence.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-b- </B>Unexpired portion of auto registration fees.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-c- </B>Driver's license fees (for all family members).</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-d- </B>Single payment of non-recurring sales, use,</P>
<P>excise or title tax on automobile(s) brought into a State</P>
<P>imposing such taxes.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-e- </B>Baby sitting, when expenses are necessitated by the move.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-f- </B>Alteration and/or installation of drapes and</P>
<P>carpeting to fit the new residence if the drapes or</P>
<P>carpeting were the ones used in the old residence and</P>
<P>they were not included in the Fair Market Value (FMV) of the house..</P>
<B><P>Page 148 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 10-G-1-g</P>
<P>10-G-1-g- </B>Retuning of a piano.</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-h- </B>Commercial shipment of an automobile if</P>
<P>United Air Freight is not available and shipment has been approved by employee's Division (arrange shipment through EXOJF).</P>
<B><P>10-G-1-i- </B>Installation of TV antenna if employee moved it from old residence.</P>
<P>This list is for example purposes only and it is not intended to</P>
<P>exclude other reasonable expenses which an employee might</P>
<P>incur solely as a result of the move.</P>
<B><P>10-H- Federal Income Tax Liability</P>
</B><P>The Company will provide a federal income tax liability</P>
<P>reimbursement as a result of the Company paid transfer and</P>
<P>moving expense.</P>
<P>At the end of each year, the employee will be provided a</P>
<P>facsimile of Federal Form #4782 listing all transfer and</P>
<P>moving expenses paid to or on the employee's behalf. In</P>
<P>addition, EXOPZ will provide an IBM listing of the breakdown</P>
<P>between deductible and non-deductible expenses, showing</P>
<P>the calculation of the tax override on the non-deductible</P>
<P>portion..</P>
<B><P>Page 149&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 11</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Vacations</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>11-A-</P>
</B><P>Newly employed pilots will accrue one and one-sixth (1 1/6)</P>
<P>days of vacation for each full calendar month of continuous</P>
