<P>employment with the Company during the remainder of the</P>
<P>vacation year after date of their initial employment, provided</P>
<P>that the first vacation for pilots initially employed on or after</P>
<P>May 1 of any year will not be due or payable except between</P>
<P>May 1 and April 30 of the next succeeding vacation year.</P>
<B><P>11-B-</P>
</B><I><P>Yearly vacation</P>
<P>accrual</P>
</I><B><P>11-B-1-</P>
<P>11-B-1-a- </B>After the provisions of Paragraph 11-A of this</P>
<P>Section have been complied with, pilots shall receive</P>
<P>sixteen (16) days vacation each year provided</P>
<P>employment has been continuous. Commencing in the</P>
<P>vacation year following the completion of continuous</P>
<P>service shown below, pilots will receive vacation in the</P>
<P>following schedule:</P>
</FONT><B><U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>Years of Service&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vacation Days Each Year</P>
</B></U><P>Five (5) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Twenty-Three (23)</P>
<P>Twelve (12) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Thirty (30)</P>
<P>Twenty (20) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Thirty-Seven (37)</P>
<P>Twenty-Five (25) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Forty-Four (44).</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>11-B-1-b- </B>Pilots on a leave of absence or leaves of</P>
<P>absence in excess of thirty (30) calendar days except in</P>
<P>the case of sickness or injury on the job shall have their</P>
<P>vacation reduced by one-twelfth (1/12) for each full month</P>
<P>that they are on leave of absence in excess of thirty (30)</P>
<P>days.</P>
<B><P>11-B-2-</P>
</B><I><P>2 splits for 16</P>
<P>days vacation</P>
</I><B><P>11-B-2-a- </B>A pilot entitled to sixteen (16) calendar days or</P>
<P>more vacation in a vacation year, (including vacation</P>
<P>credit days applied under the provisions of Section 9-C-2-</P>
<P>d may elect, under Section 11-D or Section 11-E-1, to split</P>
<B><P>Page 150 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-B-2-b</P>
</B><P>his vacation into not more that two (2) periods during a</P>
<P>vacation year, provided that one period is not less than</P>
<P>ten (10) days.</P>
<I><P>3 splits for 30</P>
<P>days vacation</P>
</I><B><P>11-B-2-b- </B>A pilot entitled to thirty (30) calendar days or</P>
<P>more vacation in a vacation year, (including vacation</P>
<P>credit days applied under the provisions of Section 9-C-2-</P>
<P>d may elect, under Section 11-D or Section 11-E-1, to split</P>
<P>his vacation into not more than three (3) periods during a</P>
<P>vacation year, provided that no period is less than ten (10)</P>
<P>days.</P>
<P>For the purpose of awarding vacations, all pilots, in each</P>
<P>status and equipment type at each domicile, shall be afforded</P>
<P>the opportunity to be awarded their primary and secondary</P>
<P>preferences of vacation periods before tertiary vacations are</P>
<P>awarded to those pilots who preference for tertiary vacations.</P>
<I><P>Moving vacation</P>
<P>to fly trip</P>
</I><B><P>11-B-3- </B>Scheduled days off immediately preceding or</P>
<P>following the scheduled vacation may be taken as part of the</P>
<P>vacation if a pilot so desires, however, where a pilot is</P>
<P>entitled to an adjusted vacation due to training days' credit,</P>
<P>this sub-paragraph shall apply after the training days' credit</P>
<P>earned are added to the scheduled vacation as specified in</P>
<P>Paragraph 11-B-1 and 11-B-2 of this Section. It is further</P>
<P>agreed that where a pilot's regular or adjusted vacation starts or ends between a scheduled outbound and return trip said pilot may, at his option, move the period of his vacation either forward or backward in order to fly a said scheduled round trip,
provided that in no case shall a MAC pilot move his vacation period to extend into the following month.</P>
<B><P>11-C-</P>
</B><I><P>Vacation pay </P>
</I><B><P>11-C-1- </B>A pilot assigned to a line of flying shall receive</P>
<P>during his vacation period, his salary, as provided by Section</P>
<P>3. In addition, he shall be considered on vacation for a</P>
<P>scheduled outbound preceding or a scheduled return</P>
<P>following his vacation period.</P>
<B><P>11-C-2- </B>A reserve pilot shall receive during his vacation</P>
<P>period his salary as provided by Section 3.</P>
<B><P>11-D- Vacation Year Preferencing and Assignment of</P>
<P>Vacations</P>
</B><I><P>Annual vacation</P>
<P>allocation</P>
<P>percentages</P>
</I><B><P>11-D-1- </B>Based on pilot assignments shown on the January 1</P>
<P>Domicile Roster and in sufficient time to permit the</P>
<P>preferencing and awarding of vacations prior to February 1.</P>
<B><P>Page 151&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-D-2 </P>
</B><P>for the prospective vacation year, the Company will post the</P>
<P>planned vacation allocation by status, equipment type and</P>
<P>domicile for each month of the vacation year. Such allocation</P>
<P>shall provide not less than seven per cent (7%) per month of</P>
<P>the total vacation liability for the vacation year in each status,</P>
<P>equipment type and domicile for nine (9) months of the</P>
<P>vacation year and not less than six percent (6%) per month of</P>
<P>the total vacation liability for the vacation year in each status,</P>
<P>equipment type and domicile for the remaining three (3)</P>
<P>months of the vacation year.</P>
<I><P>Split vacation</P>
<P>designation</P>
</I><B><P>11-D-2- </B>All pilots will be eligible to preference the above</P>
<P>allocated vacation periods based on their status, equipment</P>
<P>type and domicile assignment as shown on the January 1</P>
<P>Domicile Roster. Notwithstanding this provision, pilots who</P>
<P>are surplussed as a result of an equipment domicile closing</P>
<P>who are awarded a bump but are not on the domicile roster at</P>
<P>their new assignment as of January 1, will be permitted to bid</P>
<P>their annual vacation during the annual vacation bidding</P>
<P>period at their bump assignment.</P>
<P>Pilots who elect to split their vacation will designate their</P>
<P>preference as being for a primary, secondary or tertiary</P>
<P>assignment. Not less than the minimum percent per month of</P>
<P>the total vacation liability for the vacation year in each status</P>
<P>and equipment type at each domicile shall, as of February 1,</P>
<P>be awarded in order of seniority based on the pilot's</P>
<P>preference.</P>
<B><P>11-D-3- </B>Pilots awarded vacation periods in accordance with</P>
<P>sub-paragraph 11-D-1 and 11-D-2 above shall be notified of</P>
<P>their vacation assignment not later than February 1</P>
<P>preceding the vacation year in which the vacation is</P>
<P>assigned.</P>
<B><P>11-D-4- </B>A pilot assigned a vacation period under the</P>
<P>procedures of this Paragraph D shall take such vacation as</P>
<P>assigned unless changed in accordance with the following:</P>
<B><P>11-D-4-a- </B>A pilot preferences and is awarded a different</P>
<P>vacation period in accordance with the vacation</P>
<P>preferencing procedures of Paragraph 11-E-1 below,</P>
<P>which is prior to the vacation period he was awarded</P>
<P>under the procedures of this Paragraph D.</P>
<B><P>11-D-4-b- </B>Prior to taking his assigned vacation period, he</P>
<P>is activated in a different status, equipment type or</P>
<P>domicile than that to which he was assigned on January 1.</P>
<P>Under these circumstances, the Company may cancel the.</P>
<B><P>Page 152 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-E</P>
</B><P>vacation assigned to him under this Paragraph D and</P>
<P>reassign him to a different vacation period in accordance</P>
<P>with Paragraph 11-E below.</P>
<B><P>11-E- Monthly Preferencing and Assignment of Vacations</P>
<P>11-E-1- Voluntary Assignments</P>
</B><I><P>Monthly vacation </P>
</I><B><P>11-E-1-a- </B>Vacation periods allocated in each month shall</P>
<P>become firm sixty (60) days prior to the first (1st) of each</P>
<P>month.</P>
<B><P>11-E-1-b- </B>Eligibility of pilots to preference a vacation</P>
<P>period in a given status and equipment type for the month,</P>
<P>shall be based on their status and equipment type</P>
<P>assignment as shown in the Domicile Roster published for</P>
<P>the month preceding.</P>
<I><P>Seniority controls</P>
<P>vacation</P>
<P>assignments</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-1-c- </B>Preference of vacation periods for the month in</P>
<P>which eligible pilots shall take their vacation shall be</P>
<P>granted in order of seniority in each status and equipment</P>
<P>type at each domicile. Pilots who elect to split their</P>
<P>vacation will designate their preference as being for a</P>
<P>primary, secondary or tertiary assignment.</P>
<P>Pilots desiring to take their entire vacation as one</P>
<P>continuous assignment shall be awarded such vacation</P>
<P>even though the last part of one month and the first part of</P>
<P>the following month are involved, provided unassigned</P>
<P>vacations are allocated in both months, and the pilot is</P>
<P>eligible to be assigned a vacation in both months and the</P>
<P>pilot's seniority entitles him to be assigned a vacation in</P>
<P>the month his vacation starts.</P>
<B><P>11-E-1-d- </B>Each pilot assigned a vacation in accordance</P>
<P>with his preference shall be notified of the date of his</P>
<P>vacation assignment not less than sixty (60) days before</P>
<P>the first (1st) day of the month in which his vacation period</P>
<P>falls. The pilot shall not be required to take his vacation</P>
<P>unless such notice is given. Once a pilot has been</P>
<P>assigned and notified of a vacation period in accordance</P>
<P>with this Paragraph, such vacation assignment shall not</P>
<P>be changed without said pilot's concurrence except when</P>
<P>such pilot changes status, equipment type and/or</P>
<P>domicile, under Section 8, prior to or coincidental with his</P>
<P>assigned vacation period.</P>
<B><P>11-E-1-e- </B>Any vacation periods created and available</P>
<P>within sixty (60) days of the vacation period shall be</P>
<P>offered to eligible pilots in the status and equipment type.</P>
<B><P>Page 153&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-E-2 </P>
</B><P>in order of their seniority and may be assigned with the</P>
<P>pilots' concurrence with less than sixty (60) days notice</P>
<P>required in sub-paragraph d above.</P>
<B><P>11-E-2- Involuntary Assignments</P>
</B><I><P>Involuntary</P>
<P>vacation</P>
<P>assignments</P>
<P>10 days minimum</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-2-a- </B>In the event there are insufficient preferences</P>
<P>submitted for posted vacation periods in a status and</P>
<P>equipment type at a domicile, the Company may assign</P>
<P>pilots to such vacation periods in reverse order of</P>
<P>seniority of the eligible pilots in each status and</P>
<P>equipment type. Involuntarily assigned vacation periods</P>
<P>shall be for ten (10) calendar days or the amount specified</P>
<P>by the pilot unless (1) the balance of a pilot's vacation is</P>
<P>less than ten (10) days, or (2) this period is the final split</P>
<P>available to him under the provisions of Section 11-B-2; in</P>
<P>which cases the balance of his vacation will be assigned.</P>
<P>In no event shall a pilot receive more vacation periods</P>
<P>than available to him under the provisions of Section 11-B-</P>
<P>2. Vacation periods assigned to pilots involuntarily shall</P>
<P>be considered to carry the lowest vacation priority which</P>
<P>the affected pilot has remaining unused in the current</P>
<P>vacation year.</P>
<I><P>Eligibility for</P>
<P>involuntary</P>
<P>vacations</P>
<P>Pilot in last year</P>
<P>will not be given</P>
<P>involuntary</P>
<P>vacation</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-2-b-</P>
<P>11-E-2-b-(1) </B>Eligibility of pilots to be involuntarily</P>
<P>assigned a vacation period in a given status and</P>
<P>equipment type at a domicile in a given month shall be</P>
<P>based on their status and equipment type assigned at</P>
<P>the domicile as shown in the Domicile Roster published</P>
<P>for the month preceding the month in which the</P>
<P>involuntary assignment is to be made. A pilot who has</P>
<P>a vacation (voluntary or involuntary) will be ineligible</P>
<P>for involuntary assignment to a vacation in the same</P>
<P>calendar month. A pilot who has a vacation (voluntary</P>
<P>or involuntary) will be ineligible for involuntary</P>
<P>assignment to a vacation in an adjoining calendar</P>
<P>month unless there are no other pilots eligible for</P>
<P>assignment. These restrictions shall not be applicable</P>
<P>in the last two (2) months of the vacation year. A pilot</P>
<P>will be ineligible for assignment under Section 11-E-2-a</P>
<P>in a given vacation year if his retirement date falls</P>
<P>within that vacation year..</P>
<B><P>Page 154 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section11-E-2-c</P>
</B><I><P>Written notice of</P>
<P>intent to retire</P>
<P>prevents</P>
<P>involuntary</P>
<P>vacation</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-2-b-(2) </B>A pilot who plans to retire on a date that is</P>
<P>not within the vacation year in which he will each</P>
<P>normal retirement age (age 60) may make himself</P>
<P>ineligible for involuntary vacation assignments during</P>
<P>the vacation year in which he plans to retire by giving</P>
<P>the Company written notice of his planned retirement</P>
<P>date. Such notice must be provided to the Company on</P>
<P>or before December 1 of the year which is prior to the</P>
<P>beginning of the vacation year in which he plans to</P>
<P>retire. (e.g. if the pilot plans to retire in the vacation</P>
<P>year that runs from May 1, 2001 through April 30, 2002;</P>
<P>then his notice must be submitted to the Company not</P>
<P>later than December 1, 2000.) In the event the pilot</P>
<P>rescinds his intent to retire, he will do so by notifying</P>
<P>the Company in writing and his unassigned vacation</P>
<P>will be assigned at the discretion of the Company</P>
<I><P>Notification of</P>
<P>involuntary</P>
<P>vacation</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-2-c- </B>Each pilot involuntarily assigned a vacation</P>
<P>shall be notified of the date of his vacation assignment not</P>
<P>less than sixty (60) days before the first of the month in</P>
<P>which the vacation falls, except that any vacation periods</P>
<P>created and available within sixty (60) days of a vacation</P>
<P>period which are not voluntarily accepted by pilots under</P>
<P>the provisions of sub-paragraph 11-E-1-e above, may be</P>
<P>assigned to eligible pilots in inverse order of seniority in</P>
<P>the status and equipment type, provided they are given</P>
<P>not less than forty-five (45) days notice prior to the start of</P>
<P>their vacation periods and provided further that no such</P>
<P>notice shall be provided after schedule preferencing has</P>
<P>closed for the month in which the vacation falls. Once a</P>
<P>pilot has been assigned and notified of a vacation period</P>
<P>in accordance with this Paragraph, such vacation</P>
<P>assignment shall not be changed without said pilot's</P>
<P>concurrence, provided that when a pilot who has been</P>
<P>awarded a vacation assignment changes status,</P>
<P>equipment type and/or domicile, under Section 8, prior to</P>
<P>or coincidental with his assigned vacation period, the</P>
<P>Company may require the pilot to forfeit that vacation</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>11-E-3-</P>
</B><I><P>Vacation conflicts</P>
<P>with transition</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-3-a- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Paragraph</P>
<P>11-D and 11-E of this Section, a pilot awarded a voluntary</P>
<P>or involuntary vacation that conflicts with required</P>
<P>transition training associated with an awarded</P>
<P>assignment, may have the vacation cancelled and</P>
<P>rescheduled in order to attend such training..</P>
<B><P>Page 155&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-E-3-b </P>
</B><I><P>Pilot may agree to</P>
<P>defer vacation</P>
<P>into next year if</P>
<P>his activation is in</P>
<P>last 3 months of</P>
<P>vacation year</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-3-b- </B>In the event that a pilot is planned to be</P>
<P>activated into a new assignment during the last three (3)</P>
<P>months of the vacation year, with pilot concurrence, the</P>
<P>Company may defer any awarded vacation scheduled to</P>
<P>occur after his activation, until the following vacation year.</P>
<B><P>11-E-3-c-</P>
</B><I><P>Pilot ineligible for</P>
<P>vacation for two</P>
<P>months following</P>
<P>training</P>
</I><B><P>11-E-3-c-(1) </B>A pilot who is scheduled to be trained as a</P>
<P>result of an awarded assignment will not be awarded</P>
<P>nor assigned to a monthly vacation that would be</P>
<P>scheduled to begin during either of the next two</P>
<P>schedule months following the month in which the pilot</P>
<P>is scheduled to complete his training at DENTK.</P>
<B><P>11-E-3-c-(2) </B>Should the application of the provisions of</P>
<P>the above paragraph result in the Company being</P>
<P>unable to assign all of a pilot's current year's vacation</P>
<P>within that current vacation year, any unassigned</P>
<P>vacation will be deferred to the following vacation year</P>
<P>and thereafter will be administered under the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 11-F.</P>
<B><P>11-F- Vacation Deferral</P>
</B><I><P>Pilot may defer</P>
<P>vacation from last</P>
<P>two quarters into</P>
<P>next vacation year</P>
<P>at Company</P>
<P>request</P>
</I><B><P>11-F-1- </B>In addition to the preference and assignment</P>
<P>provisions in 11-D and 11-E, above, during the monthly</P>
<P>preferencing for vacations in the last quarter of the vacation</P>
<P>year, a pilot may indicate a preference to defer his remaining</P>
<P>assigned and/or unassigned vacation into the following</P>
<P>vacation year. Deferred vacation must qualify as a full</P>
<P>vacation "split" in the current vacation year. The Company</P>
<P>will determine the domiciles, equipment types and statuses</P>
<P>and the amount (if any) in which deferrals are required.</P>
<P>Successful volunteers will be notified of their deferral at the</P>
<P>time vacations are published for each month of the quarter. In</P>
<P>the event deferrals become available after the vacations are</P>
<P>awarded, volunteers may be offered those deferrals when</P>
<P>they become available.</P>
<B><P>11-F-2- </B>Vacations deferred into the following vacation year</P>
<P>under any of the provisions of this Section 11 shall become</P>
<P>part of the pilot's total vacation due in the following vacation</P>
<P>year and will be preferenced and assigned as regular monthly</P>
<P>vacations. Further, if ten (10) or more days of vacation have</P>
<P>been deferred from any single vacation year, the pilot shall.</P>
<B><P>Page 156 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-G</P>
</B><P>be eligible to be awarded one (1) or more additional vacation</P>
<P>periods ("splits") in the new vacation year, in addition to the</P>
<P>periods already available to him under the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 11-B-2 in the year into which vacation has been</P>
<P>deferred, as follows:</P>
<I><P>Additional split for</P>
<P>deferred vacation</P>
<P>for next year</P>
</I><P>In order to be eligible to be awarded additional vacation</P>
<P>periods during the year into which vacation has been</P>
<P>deferred, the deferred vacation alone must be able to qualify</P>
<P>as one (1) or more legal vacation periods, under either or 11-B-2-b, whichever provision is applicable to the pilot in</P>
<P>question. In order for deferred vacation to qualify for</P>
<P>additional splits, the pilot must have unused vacation that</P>
<P>entitles him to a split opportunity for which he was entitled in</P>
<P>the year from which vacation is being deferred. Additionally,</P>
<P>the deferred vacation must total enough days to comply with</P>
<P>the minimum length requirement for each vacation period.</P>
<P>Due to the advance notice requirements for awarded</P>
<P>vacations, it is recognized that deferred vacation time may</P>
<P>not be available to be preferenced in the first months of the</P>
<P>new vacation year.</P>
<B><P>11-G-</P>
</B><I><P>Company may</P>
<P>offer deferral of</P>
<P>vacation from 1st</P>
<P>and 2nd quarter to</P>
<P>the remaining</P>
<P>months of</P>
<P>vacation year</P>
</I><P>Notwithstanding the provisions of this Section 11, the</P>
<P>Company may offer and individual pilots may accept, on a</P>
<P>voluntary basis, the deferral of assigned vacations in the first</P>
<P>(1st) and second (2nd) vacation quarters to the remaining</P>
<P>months of the vacation year. The acceptance of the Company</P>
<P>offer to the pilots will be recognized in seniority order from</P>
<P>among the pilots affected. Pilots accepting deferral of their</P>
<P>assigned vacation shall be assigned their remaining vacation</P>
<P>entitlement in accordance with their seniority and the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 11-E during the remaining months of</P>
<P>the vacation year.</P>
<B><P>11-H-</P>
</B><P>Any pilot who leaves the service of the Company shall be</P>
<P>paid for all accrued but unused vacation credit for the</P>
<P>preceding vacation year in addition to any other</P>
<P>compensation due him at the date of termination of</P>
<P>employment. In addition, any pilot having a full year or more</P>
<P>of service with the Company at the time of leaving the</P>
<P>Company's service will be paid for all accrued vacation credit</P>
<P>in the current vacation year up to the end of the month</P>
<P>preceding the separation, if:.</P>
<B><P>Page 157&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-H-1 </P>
<P>11-H-1- </B>He gives the Company at least ten (10) calendar</P>
<P>days notice of intent to resign, and</P>
<B><P>11-H-2- </B>He is not discharged for just cause.</P>
<B><P>11-I-</P>
</B><P>Pilots who are furloughed in a reduction in force will be</P>
<P>granted vacation pay for all vacation time accrued to the end</P>
<P>of the month preceding their furlough.</P>
<B><P>11-J- Vacation Trip Drop</P>
</B><P>The Company may also liquidate vacation as follows:</P>
<I><P>Vacation trip drop</P>
<P>Procedures</P>
</I><B><P>11-J-1- </B>At the discretion of the Company, based upon its</P>
<P>evaluation of available manpower, a pilot may be allowed to</P>
<P>drop a trip(s) with pay and reduce his available vacation from</P>
<P>his next year's accrual. Next year's accrual is that vacation</P>
<P>earned in the current year to be taken in the following year;</P>
<P>except that trips dropped between December 1 and May 1</P>
<P>shall be reduced from vacation earned in the following</P>
<P>vacation year.</P>
<B><P>11-J-2- </B>Such trip drop will be requested in the same manner</P>
<P>as ANP is currently administered (see Paragraph 11-J-4 of</P>
<P>this Agreement). The decision to use vacation days for the</P>
<P>trip drop must be made by the pilot at the time the request is</P>
<P>granted.</P>
<B><P>11-J-3- </B>Vacation days used will correspond to trip days</P>
<P>dropped, not to duty periods dropped.</P>
<B><P>11-J-4- </B>Requests will be considered, on a first-come-first-served basis; however, it is recognized that, because of</P>
<P>better ability to forecast on a short-range basis, as well as</P>
<P>changing requirements, later requests may be granted after</P>
<P>earlier requests were denied.</P>
<B><P>11-J-5- </B>A vacation drop(s) may be allowed which exceed the</P>
<P>pilot's vacation accrual as of the time of the drop; however,</P>
<P>should the pilot later leave the Company before earning</P>
<P>enough vacation to cover this drop(s), the value of the</P>
<P>drop(s) will be deducted from his last paycheck and/or from</P>
<P>other monies owed the pilot by the Company..</P>
<B><P>Page 158 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 11-J-5</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 159&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 12-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 12</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Leave of Absence</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>12-A-</P>
</B><I><P>Maximum LOA 3</P>
<P>Years</P>
</I><P>When the requirements of the service will permit, a pilot may</P>
<P>be granted a leave of absence up to a maximum of three (3)</P>
<P>years for any reason deemed adequate by the Company.</P>
<P>When such leave(s) are granted, the pilot shall retain and</P>
<P>continue to accrue seniority during such leave(s), provided,</P>
<P>however, that he shall not accrue any greater seniority nor</P>
<P>shall his relative seniority position be different than it would</P>
<P>have been had he not been granted such leave; and,</P>
<P>provided, further, that the pilot maintains his airline pilot's</P>
<P>certificate or certificates. If, during such leave(s), a pilot shall</P>
<P>permit his certificate or certificates to lapse, his seniority</P>
<P>shall accrue only to the date of lapse. A pilot returning from</P>
<P>an authorized leave or extension thereof shall be permitted to</P>
<P>resume his assignment at the domicile to which he was</P>
<P>based immediately prior to the beginning of such leave or, in</P>
<P>the event his assignment has been moved, to follow the</P>
<P>assignment or, if a pilot while on leave has successfully</P>
<P>exercised bidding rights, he shall assume the new duties</P>
<P>resulting from such award and periods of absence shall not</P>
<P>apply to the time limits prescribed in Section 8-E.</P>
<B><P>12-B-</P>
</B><P>When leaves are granted on account of sickness or injury, a</P>
<P>pilot shall retain and continue to accrue seniority and</P>
<P>longevity, irrespective of whether or not he is able to maintain</P>
<P>his airline pilot's certificate or certificates, until he is able to</P>
<P>return to flight duty or is found to be unfit for such duty for a</P>
<P>continuous period of seven (7) years (ten (10) years, if</P>
<P>extended as provided in Paragraph 6-E-2 of Section 6). A</P>
<P>pilot shall retain full bidding rights while on such leave.</P>
<B><P>12-C-</P>
</B><P>A pilot returning from leave occasioned by sickness or injury</P>
<P>shall be permitted to resume his assignment at the domicile</P>
<P>at which he was based immediately prior to the beginning of</P>
<P>such leave or, in the event his assignment has been moved,</P>
<P>to follow the assignment or, if such pilot while on leave has.</P>
<B><P>Page 160 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 12-D</P>
</B><P>successfully exercised bidding rights, he shall assume the</P>
<P>new duties resulting from such award.</P>
<B><P>12-D-</P>
</B><I><P>Leaves for active</P>
<P>military duty</P>
</I><P>A pilot ordered to enter active military duty during a period of</P>
<P>national emergency or pursuant to law or a pilot classified as</P>
<P>1-A under the Selective Service Act who is unable to obtain a</P>
<P>deferment and chooses to enlist for military duty in the Armed</P>
<P>Forces, shall retain and continue to accrue seniority,</P>
<P>provided, however, that pilots so ordered to enter military</P>
<P>service shall continue to accrue seniority only during the</P>
<P>period in which they are on Armed Forces duty plus ninety</P>
<P>(90) days and in no case will any such pilot accrue seniority</P>
<P>for a period exceeding five (5) years plus ninety (90) days,</P>
<P>unless otherwise provided by law; provided, further that any</P>
<P>such pilot shall not accrue any greater seniority nor shall his</P>
<P>relative seniority position be different than it would have been</P>
<P>had he not entered such military duty.</P>
<B><P>12-E-</P>
</B><P>Any dispute arising hereunder concerning the physical fitness</P>
<P>of a pilot shall be settled in accordance with Section 14.</P>
<B><P>12-F-</P>
</B><I><P>4 year leave for</P>
<P>ALPA position</P>
</I><P>A pilot shall be granted a leave of absence for a period not to</P>
<P>exceed four (4) years to accept a position with the</P>
<P>Association or to perform any duties relating to council</P>
<P>activities and will continue to accrue seniority while on leave</P>
<P>of absence, provided that during such period the pilot</P>
<P>maintains his airline pilot's certificate or certificates and</P>
<P>provided, further, that the Company shall not be obligated to</P>
<P>grant such leave to more than two (2) pilots concurrently.</P>
<B><P>12-G-</P>
</B><P>A pilot shall be granted a leave of absence to accept a</P>
<P>salaried position as an officer with the Association and will</P>
<P>continue to accrue seniority while on such leave of absence,</P>
<P>provided that during such period, the pilot maintains his</P>
<P>airline pilot's certificate or certificates and, provided further,</P>
<P>that the Company shall not be obligated to grant such leave</P>
<P>to more than two (2) pilots concurrently..</P>
<B><P>Page 161&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 12-H </P>
<P>12-H-</P>
</B><I><P>Movement of</P>
<P>vacation under</P>
<P>FMLA policy for</P>
<P>birth or adoption</P>
</I><B><P>12-H-1- </B>When a pilot takes parental leave pursuant to the</P>
<P>terms of the Pilot Family Medical Leave Policy for the Birth or</P>
<P>Adoption of a Child, the pilot will have the ability to choose</P>
<P>current year's vacation or next year's vacation to cover the</P>
<P>absence. Should the pilot chose to move a current year</P>
<P>vacation, he will be allowed to move this vacation from a</P>
<P>month when he ca fly to a period associated with the</P>
<P>upcoming required absence, and the vacation must then be</P>
<P>liquidated during that period. He must notify his Flight Office</P>
<P>in writing at least 45 days prior to the month in which the</P>
<P>vacation is scheduled or the month in which he desires to</P>
<P>take the vacation, whichever is earlier. If the planned</P>
<P>absence unexpectedly becomes unnecessary or otherwise</P>
<P>terminates prior to the liquidation of the deferred vacation,</P>
<P>the remaining deferred vacation will be liquidated per the</P>
<P>Agreement. Vacation as described herein can be deferred</P>
<P>into a subsequent vacation year provided the planned</P>
<P>absence is projected into that period.</P>
<I><P>Returning home</P>
<P>to begin parental</P>
<P>leave</P>
</I><B><P>12-H-2- </B>If a pilot is working a trip and it becomes necessary</P>
<P>for him to return home to begin the planned parental leave,</P>
<P>he will be provided NRPS travel to his home.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>
<P>Interpretations Table of Contents.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 162 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 12-H-2</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 163&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 13-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 13</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Sick Leave</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>13-A-</P>
</B><I><P>No-occupational</P>
<P>sick leave accrual</P>
<P>1,250 hours</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-1- </B>Pilots will be credited, for non-occupational sick</P>
<P>leave purposes, with six (6) hours of sick leave credit for</P>
<P>each month of employment which entitles him to the accrual</P>
<P>of longevity as a pilot up to a maximum of one thousand two</P>
<P>hundred fifty (1,250) hours.</P>
<B><P>13-A-2-</P>
</B><I><P>Negative sick</P>
<P>leave bank for 1st</P>
<P>year pilot</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-2-a- </B>During a pilot's first year of service he may be</P>
<P>paid no more than sixty (60) hours from a negative sick</P>
<P>leave bank. These hours will be debited against sick hours</P>
<P>accrued as stated in paragraph A.1 above.</P>
<I><P>Sick leave</P>
<P>restoration for 1st</P>
<P>year pilot</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-2-b- </B>During a pilot's first year of service, if he</P>
<P>makes up the days missed, if on reserve, or picks up and</P>
<P>performs open flying equivalent to the actual flight hours</P>
<P>lost, if a lineholder, his sick leave account will be restored</P>
<P>by the number of credit hours flown.</P>
<B><P>13-A-3- </B>Sick leave with pay in case of actual sickness will</P>
<P>be granted up to the number of hours of sick leave credited to</P>
<P>the pilot at the time, as follows:</P>
<I><P>Sick leave</P>
<P>account reduced</P>
<P>by actual hours</P>
<P>for lineholders</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-3-a- </B>The accumulated sick leave credit of a pilot</P>
<P>assigned to a line of flying will be charged with the number</P>
<P>of actual flight hours which he missed due to sick leave.</P>
<I><P>Sick leave</P>
<P>reduction for</P>
<P>reserves</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-3-b- </B>The accumulated sick leave credit of a pilot on</P>
<P>reserve will be charged with four hours and ten minutes</P>
<P>(4:10) for each duty day missed due to sick leave; not to</P>
<P>exceed seventy-five (75) hours in any single month. A</P>
<P>reserve pilot will not be charged for the day he calls off</P>
<P>sick leave provided he calls off before twelve (12 noon)</P>
<P>local domicile time. If the reserve is required to obtain</P>
<P>medical clearance and is unable to call off sick prior to 12</P>
<P>noon, he will not be charged for that day..</P>
<B><P>Page 164 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 13-A-4</P>
</B><I><P>Reduced sick</P>
<P>leave for full</P>
<P>month</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-4- </B>A pilot who is granted sick leave with pay for the</P>
<P>entire month, may request payment of 2/3rds salary in lieu of</P>
<P>the amount specified in sub-paragraph 3-a and b above.</P>
<P>Such pilot's accumulated sick leave credit would be reduced</P>
<P>by fifty (50) hours for that month. To exercise this option, a</P>
<P>pilot must notify the Company in writing within one (1) day</P>
<P>after the end of the month in which he was granted the full</P>
<P>month sick leave with pay.</P>
<I><P>Reaccrual of sick</P>
<P>Leave</P>
</I><B><P>13-A-5- </B>A pilot who has two hundred and fifty (250) or more</P>
<P>hours in his sick leave account as of the date of illness, will</P>
<P>reaccrue, at the rate of seven (7) hours per month until such</P>
<P>time as his sick leave account is restored to the level prior to</P>
<P>the illness.</P>
<B><P>13-A-6- </B>Sick leave with pay will be granted only in cases of</P>
<P>actual sickness. The Company may require a doctor's</P>
<P>certificate before paying such sick leave. Dental and doctor</P>
<P>appointments will not be considered as a basis for paid sick</P>
<P>leave unless it can be shown that the dentist or doctor in</P>
<P>question does not maintain office hours outside the pilot's</P>
<P>scheduled work time or on his days off. Sick leave with pay</P>
<P>will not be granted while a pilot is on a leave of absence.</P>
<B><P>13-B- Occupational Illness or Injury Leave</P>
</B><I><P>Occupational 500</P>
<P>Hours</P>
<P>No-</P>
<P>Occupational may</P>
<P>be used if needed</P>
</I><B><P>13-B-1- </B>Pilots with one or more years of active service shall</P>
<P>be credited with sixty (60) hours of occupational illness or</P>
<P>injury leave credit. Thereafter, pilots shall accrue six (6)</P>
<P>hours of occupational illness or injury for each month of</P>
<P>active service to a maximum of five hundred (500) hours.</P>
<P>This accrual will be in addition to non-occupational sick leave</P>
<P>and may be used for absence resulting from occupational</P>
<P>illness or injury only. After exhausting this occupational</P>
<P>illness or injury leave, the pilot may use his non-occupational</P>
<P>sick leave credits. He may not, however, use occupational</P>
<P>illness or injury leave for non-occupational illness or injury</P>
<P>under any circumstances. When a pilot on occupational</P>
<P>illness or injury exhausts his occupational leave and uses</P>
<P>non-occupational leave, his ensuing accrual of occupational</P>
<P>injury leave shall be credited to his non-occupational sick</P>
<P>leave until such time as he has replaced all non-occupational</P>
<P>sick leave which was used for his occupational illness or</P>
<P>injury..</P>
<B><P>Page 165&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 13-B-2 </P>
</B><I><P>Reaccrual of sick</P>
<P>Leave</P>
</I><B><P>13-B-2- </B>A pilot who has two hundred and fifty (250) or more</P>
<P>hours in his occupational sick leave account as of the date of</P>
<P>illness, will reaccrue, at the rate of seven (7) hours per month</P>
<P>until such time as his sick leave account is restored to the</P>
<P>level prior to the illness.</P>
<B><P>13-B-3- </B>When it is necessary for a pilot to be absent from</P>
<P>work because of occupational injury or illness, he must</P>
<P>request payment for occupational illness or injury leave in</P>
<P>writing not later than the pay period following his return to</P>
<P>service on a form provided by the Company. A doctor's</P>
<P>certificate may be required before granting pay for this</P>
<P>purpose. In the event he receives Workmen's Compensation</P>
<P>because of such absence, he shall turn over such</P>
<P>compensation to the Company and shall have his sick leave</P>
<P>or occupational illness or injury credit used in connection with</P>
<P>such injury or illness restored to the extent that the</P>
<P>compensation offsets the pay granted. Credits will be</P>
<P>restored only in units of one (1) hour.</P>
<B><P>13-C-</P>
</B><I><P>Procedure for</P>
<P>receiving</P>
<P>occupational</P>
<P>injury/illness</P>
<P>payments</P>
</I><P>All credit for non-occupational sick leave and for occupational</P>
<P>illness or injury leave will be cancelled if employment ceases</P>
<P>for any purpose, and no payment for any such accumulated</P>
<P>credit will be made at any time. Non-occupational sick leave</P>
<P>and occupational illness or injury leave will not accrue while a</P>
<P>pilot is on leave of absence.</P>
<B><P>13-D-</P>
</B><P>Each pilot's current accrual of occupational and non-</P>
<P>occupational sick leave will be computed and included with</P>
<P>one paycheck each month.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>
<P>Interpretations Table of Contents.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 166 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 13-D</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 167&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 14-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 14</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Physical Examinations</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>14-A-</P>
</B><I><P>Reimbursement of</P>
<P>FAA physical</P>
<P>expenses under</P>
<P>the traditional</P>
<P>medical plan</P>
</I><B><P>14-A-1- </B>A pilot shall be notified in writing as to his failure to</P>
<P>pass such physical examination required by the Company.</P>
<P>The pilot shall, at his request, be furnished with copies of all</P>
<P>medical tests, x-rays and any other documentation or</P>
<P>information which was utilized to determine the pilot's</P>
<P>inability to pass the Company physical examination. The</P>
<P>above shall be provided at no cost to the pilot. Additionally,</P>
<P>two (2) FAA physicals per year for Captains and International</P>
<P>First Officers and one (1) FAA physical per year for all other</P>
<P>pilots will be covered expenses under the Medical Plan.</P>
<P>These FAA physical expenses will be reimbursed at 80% up</P>
<P>to a maximum medical plan reimbursement of $100 per</P>
<P>physical after the pilot has met the medical plan deductible.</P>
<I><P>Availability of</P>
<P>medical records</P>
</I><B><P>14-A-2- </B>All information contained in or related to a pilot's</P>
<P>medical file shall be kept confidential and not released to</P>
<P>anyone except by the pilot's specific written consent. When</P>
<P>required by a court order or other legal requirement to</P>
<P>release information, the pilot will be notified of such action.</P>
<P>Should action be taken under 14-B below, all medical records</P>
<P>pertinent to the case will be made available to the doctors</P>
<P>involved.</P>
<B><P>14-B-</P>
</B><P>Any pilot hereunder who fails to pass a Company physical</P>
<P>may, at his option, have a review of his case in the following</P>
<P>manner:</P>
<I><P>Second opinion</P>
<P>and neutral</P>
<P>evaluation of</P>
<P>medical problems</P>
</I><B><P>14-B-1- </B>He may employ a qualified medical examiner of his</P>
<P>own choosing, at his own expense, for the purpose of</P>
<P>conducting a physical examination for the same purpose as</P>
<P>the physical examination made by the medical examiner</P>
<P>employed by the Company, provided that he communicate, in</P>
<P>writing, to his Flight Manager the name of the medical</P>
<P>examiner he has chosen..</P>
<B><P>Page 168 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 14-B-2</P>
<P>14-B-2- </B>A copy of the findings of the medical examiner</P>
<P>chosen by the pilot, recorded on a pertinent form furnished by</P>
<P>the Company with such supplementary attachments as the</P>
<P>medical examiner may deem pertinent to a true evaluation of</P>
<P>the examinee's physical fitness and qualification for flying</P>
<P>duty, shall be furnished to the Company. In the event that</P>
<P>such findings verify the findings of the medical examiner</P>
<P>employed by the Company, no further medical review of the</P>
<P>case shall be afforded.</P>
<B><P>14-B-3- </B>In the event that the findings of the medical</P>
<P>examiner chosen by the pilot shall disagree with the findings</P>
<P>of the medical examiner employed by the Company, the</P>
<P>Company will, at the written request of the pilot, ask for the</P>
<P>two medical examiners to agree upon and appoint a third</P>
<P>qualified and disinterested medical examiner, preferably a</P>
<P>specialist in Aviation Medicine, for the purpose of making a</P>
<P>further physical examination of the employee.</P>
<B><P>14-B-4- </B>Such three (3) doctors, one representing the</P>
<P>Company, one representing the pilot affected and one the</P>
<P>disinterested doctor approved by the Company doctor and</P>
<P>the pilot's doctor, shall constitute a board of three (3), the</P>
<P>majority opinion of which shall decide whether the pilot is</P>
<P>physically qualified for flying duty.</P>
<B><P>14-B-5- </B>The expenses of the employment of the third</P>
<P>medical examiner shall be borne one-half (1/2) by the pilot</P>
<P>and one-half (1/2) by the Company. Copies of the board's</P>
<P>report shall be furnished to the Company and to the pilot.</P>
<I><P>Return of sick</P>
<P>leave improperly</P>
<P>charged</P>
</I><B><P>14-B-6- </B>In the event a third medical examiner is utilized who</P>
<P>finds the pilot physically qualified for flying duty, he shall be</P>
<P>returned to flying status in the position he left or have the</P>
<P>option of bumping to any position his seniority would have</P>
<P>allowed him to be awarded on any bid that was posted and</P>
<P>awarded subsequent to his failure to pass a Company</P>
<P>physical examination and shall be paid for time lost in an</P>
<P>amount which he would ordinarily have earned had he been</P>
<P>continued in service. Any sick leave reduced from the pilot's</P>
<P>account due to his failure to pass a Company physical shall</P>
<P>be returned to his account if he is returned to flying duty.</P>
<I><P>Procedure for</P>
<P>pilot initiated</P>
<P>medical</P>
<P>evaluation</P>
</I><B><P>14-B-7- </B>This same procedure may be used should there be</P>
<P>disagreement between a pilot and the Company wherein the</P>
<P>pilot believes himself permanently unfit for flight duty and the</P>
<P>Medical Department of the Company does not agree.</P>
<B><P>Page 169&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 14-B-8 </P>
<P>14-B-8- </B>A pilot who has exhausted his non-occupational sick</P>
<P>leave bank and who initiates medical arbitration will be paid</P>
<P>until the arbitration is concluded. The pilot will receive a</P>
<P>monthly salary equal to the monthly lineholder guarantee for</P>
<P>the position (status and equipment type) he holds, provided</P>
<P>this compensation will be refunded if the Company prevails in</P>
<P>the medical arbitration.</P>
<B><P>14-C-</P>
</B><P>In the event a pilot fails to pass a Company physical</P>
<P>examination but is able to pass an FAA 1st class physical</P>
<P>examination, the procedures set forth in Paragraph 14-B may</P>
<P>be initiated by said pilot.</P>
<B><P>14-D-</P>
</B><P>In the event a pilot cannot pass an FAA 1st class physical</P>
<P>examination, but can pass an FAA 2nd class physical</P>
<P>examination and reasonable medical judgment indicated that</P>
<P>he may obtain an FAA 1st class medical certificate in the</P>
<P>future, the Company shall utilize the pilot in the highest</P>
<P>position to which he elects to bid or bump and for which he is</P>
<P>medically qualified to fly. The procedures of Paragraph 14-B</P>
<P>may be initiated by a pilot in the event of any dispute under</P>
<P>this Paragraph D.</P>
<B><P>14-E-</P>
</B><I><P>Pilot physicals at</P>
<P>any UAL medical</P>
<P>facility</P>
</I><P>A pilot may take his Company physical at other than his home</P>
<P>domicile, provided he gives his domicile Medical Department</P>
<P>sufficient notice to have his medical records transferred to</P>
<P>the domicile conducting the Company physical. Any pilot</P>
<P>required to travel out of domicile to take a Company physical,</P>
<P>due to lack of Company medical facilities (or designated</P>
<P>alternate) at his location, will be provided expenses in</P>
<P>accordance with Section 4-A-1 and hotel accommodations, if</P>
<P>necessary. Should the United Corporate Medical Department</P>
<P>permanently cease operations, each United pilot shall be</P>
<P>entitled to up to $50.00 annually for a FAA required EKG.</P>
<B><P>14-F-</P>
</B><I><P>PSA test </I>When taken in conjunction with a Company physical, the Company will offer any pilot age 50 or over an optional PSA test at no charge to the pilot. Should the pilot choose not to request a PSA test as part of his annual company
physical,</P>
<P>an annual PSA test for men age 50 and over will be a.</P>
<B><P>Page 170 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 14-G</P>
</B><P>covered expense under the medical plan. This expense will</P>
<P>be reimbursed at 80% regardless of whether the pilot has met</P>
<P>the deductible.</P>
<B><P>14-G-</P>
</B><I><P>PAP t est </I>An annual cervical cytology screening will be a covered expense under the medical plan. This expense will be</P>
<P>reimbursed at 80%, up to a maximum medical plan</P>
<P>reimbursement of $150, regardless of whether the pilot has</P>
<P>met the deductible.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 171&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 15-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 15</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>15-A-</P>
</B><I><P>Pilots should</P>
<P>apply for</P>
<P>additional sick</P>
<P>leave to qualify</P>
<P>for workman's</P>
<P>comp</P>
</I><P>If a pilot has complied with the provisions of Section 13-B</P>
<P>and it has been determined by the Company, or by the</P>
<P>governing legal requirements, that the pilot is entitled to</P>
<P>Worker's Compensation Benefits, the Company shall provide</P>
<P>such benefits as follows: Without prejudice to any alternative</P>
<P>rights to file a claim which may accrue in another jurisdiction,</P>
<P>the Company and Association have agreed that the Company</P>
<P>will consider all pilots to be eligible to file for Workmen's</P>
<P>Compensation Benefits in the State of Illinois, due to the</P>
<P>Company's headquarters, which is the pilots' base of</P>
<P>employment, being located in Illinois. This provision shall</P>
<P>apply to all pilots, whether scheduled in domestic or</P>
<P>international operations.</P>
<B><P>15-B-</P>
</B><P>The monetary benefits so paid shall be in addition to any</P>
<P>monetary benefits paid pursuant to the provisions of</P>
<P>Paragraph 16-A of Section 16 and will be paid to the</P>
<P>beneficiaries prescribed by the applicable law as herein</P>
<P>provided.</P>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 15-B</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 173&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 16-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 16</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Missing Benefits</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>16-A-</P>
</B><I><P>Pay while missing</P>
<P>Seniority while</P>
<P>Missing</P>
</I><P>When any pilot in the service of the Company becomes</P>
<P>missing or kidnapped while engaged in operations for the</P>
<P>Company, he shall be allowed compensation as set forth in</P>
<P>Section 3-B for a period of one (1) year after the date of</P>
<P>either of the above or until the date that death is established,</P>
<P>whichever first occurs. If, upon expiration of such one (1)</P>
<P>year period, any such pilot is still missing or if prior to that</P>
<P>time death is established, the Company shall pay or cause to</P>
<P>be paid the death benefits provided for in Paragraph 15-A-1</P>
<P>and 2 of Section 15, whichever is applicable. Pilots shall</P>
<P>maintain and continue to accrue seniority and longevity for</P>
<P>pay purposes during the period they are missing.</P>
<B><P>16-B-</P>
</B><P>The monthly compensation allowable under Paragraph 16-A</P>
<P>of this Section to a pilot who is missing or kidnapped shall be</P>
<P>credited to such pilot on the books of the Company and shall</P>
<P>be disbursed by the Company in accordance with written</P>
<P>directions from him. The Company shall require each pilot</P>
<P>hereafter employed by the Company to execute and deliver to</P>
<P>the Company prior to such employment a written direction in</P>
<P>the form set forth herein. The Company shall, within thirty</P>
<P>(30) days after the signing of this Agreement, notify all pilots</P>
<P>of the provisions of this Section of the contract and furnish all</P>
<P>pilots a copy of the form hereinafter set forth to be completed</P>
<P>by the pilot and filed with the Company. Any payments due to</P>
<P>any pilot under this Section which are not covered by a</P>
<P>written direction as herein provided shall be held by the</P>
<P>Company for such pilot and, in the event of his death, shall</P>
<P>be paid to the legal representatives of his estate. The</P>
<P>direction referred to shall be in substantially the following</P>
<P>form:</P>
<P>"To United Air Lines, Inc.</P>
<P>Date:__________________________" "You are herein</P>
<P>directed to pay all monthly compensation allowable to me</P>
<P>under Paragraph A of Section 16 of that certain Agreement</P>
<P>between United Air Lines, Inc., and the Air Line Pilots in the.</P>
<B><P>Page 174 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 16-C</P>
</B><P>service of United Air Lines, Inc., as represented by the Air</P>
<P>Line Pilots Association, International, dated as follows:</P>
<P>$________________per month</P>
<P>to_______________________________________________</P>
<P>_________________________________________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(address)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as long as living, and thereafter to</P>
<P>_________________________________________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(name)</P>
<P>_________________________________________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(address)</P>
<P>as long as living."</P>
<P>"The balance, if any, and any amounts accruing after the</P>
<P>death of all persons named in the above designations shall</P>
<P>be held for me, or in the event of my death before receipt</P>
<P>thereof, shall be paid to the legal representatives of my</P>
<P>estate."</P>
<P>"The foregoing direction may be modified from time to time by</P>
<P>letter signed by the undersigned and any such modification</P>
<P>shall become effective upon receipt of such letter by you."</P>
<P>"Payments made by the Company pursuant to this direction</P>
<P>shall fully release the Company from the obligation of making</P>
<P>any further payment with respect thereto."</P>
<P>_________________________________________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(pilot's signature)</P>
<B><P>16-C-</P>
</B><P>A pilot who is imprisoned in a foreign country for an action</P>
<P>that is related to his duties for the Company shall be eligible</P>
<P>for the compensation set forth in Section 16-A above. In the</P>
<P>event a pilot is kidnapped or wrongfully imprisoned while</P>
<P>engaged in the service of the Company, the Company, in</P>
<P>conjunction with the Association, will diligently work to enlist</P>
<P>the active assistance of governments and governmental</P>
<P>agencies in an effort to gain the release of the pilot(s).</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>If a pilot is not returned home within one year, both the</P>
<P>Company and Association agree to meet and review the.</P>
<B><P>Page 175&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 16-D </P>
</B><P>individual circumstances of the case and review applicable</P>
<P>benefits to the pilot's family..</P>
<B><P>Page 176 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 16-D</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 177&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-A </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 17</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Grievances</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>17-A- Non-Disciplinary Grievances</P>
</B><I><P>180 day limit for</P>
<P>filling no-</P>
<P>discipline</P>
<P>grievance</P>
</I><P>Any pilot or group of pilots, including probationary pilots,</P>
<P>covered by this Agreement who have a grievance concerning</P>
<P>any action of the Company affecting them, except matters</P>
<P>involving discipline or discharge, shall have such grievance</P>
<P>considered in accordance with the following procedures</P>
<P>provided such grievance is filed within one hundred and</P>
<P>eighty (180) days after the pilot(s) reasonably would have</P>
<P>had knowledge of the facts upon which the grievance is</P>
<P>based. This does not preclude claims for adjustment arising</P>
<P>out of bookkeeping errors beyond one hundred and eighty</P>
<P>(180) days.</P>
<B><P>17-A-1- </B>A written request for a hearing setting forth a</P>
<P>detailed statement of the known facts out of which the</P>
<P>grievance arose and a request for relief shall be filed with his</P>
<P>or their Manager/Director of Flight Operations.</P>
<B><P>17-A-2- </B>A hearing shall be held within not less than ten (10)</P>
<P>days nor more than twenty (20) calendar days after receipt of</P>
<P>such written request by the Manager/Director of Flight</P>
<P>Operations or his designee and within fifteen (15) calendar</P>
<P>days after the close of the hearing of the Manager/Director of</P>
<P>Flight Operations or his designee shall announce his decision</P>
<P>in writing. All notices of hearings and decisions reached</P>
<P>therein shall be in writing to the signator of the grievance,</P>
<P>with copies to the grievant(s), to the Legal Department of the</P>
<P>Association (staff attorney), the Local Executive Council</P>
<P>Chairman, Local Grievance Chairman, MEC Grievance</P>
<P>Chairman and the MEC Chairman.</P>
<B><P>17-A-3- </B>If an appeal is desired such appeal shall be made in</P>
<P>writing to the Senior Vice President-Flight Operations, with a</P>
<P>copy to the Manager/Director of Flight Operations provided</P>
<P>such appeal is filed within thirty (30) calendar days after the</P>
<P>date the decision was received by the grievant(s).</P>
<B><P>17-A-4- </B>Such appeal hearing shall be held within fifteen (15)</P>
<P>calendar days after the receipt of the written appeal by the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations. Within fifteen (15)</P>
<P>calendar days after the close of such appeal hearing, the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations or his designee shall.</P>
<B><P>Page 178 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-A-5</P>
</B><P>announce his decision in writing to the grievant(s) and furnish</P>
<P>a copy to the Legal Department of the Association (staff</P>
<P>attorney), the Local Executive Council Chairman, Local</P>
<P>Grievance Chairman, MEC Grievance Chairman and the MEC</P>
<P>Chairman.</P>
<B><P>17-A-5- </B>Further appeal, if made, shall be to the "United Air</P>
<P>Lines Pilots' System Board of Adjustment" as provided for in</P>
<P>Section 18 of this Agreement, provided such appeal is made</P>
<P>within sixty (60) calendar days from the date of receipt by the</P>
<P>Legal Department of the Association (staff attorney) of the</P>
<P>decision of the Senior Vice President-Flight Operations or his</P>
<P>designee, except as provided in 17-A-6 below.</P>
<I><P>Extension of 60</P>
<P>day time limit for</P>
<P>submission of</P>
<P>no-disciplinary</P>
<P>grievance to</P>
<P>System Board to</P>
<P>allow U-MEC</P>
<P>review panel to</P>
<P>review grievance</P>
</I><B><P>17-A-6- </B>The sixty (60) day time period for the submission of</P>
<P>non-disciplinary grievances to the Pilots' System Board of</P>
<P>Adjustment, pursuant to Section 17-A-5 and 18 of the</P>
<P>collective bargaining agreement, will be extended for any</P>
<P>grievance under review by the UAL-MEC Grievance Review</P>
<P>Panel until thirty (30) days after a determination by such</P>
<P>panel on submission of such grievance to the System Board</P>
<P>or until sixty (60) days after entry of a final judgment</P>
<P>(including appeals) in any legal proceedings resulting from a</P>
<P>determination not to submit any such grievance to the</P>
<P>System Board, whichever occurs later.</P>
<P>The Association will advise the Company of a grievance</P>
<P>pending before the UAL-MEC Grievance Review Panel within</P>
<P>the sixty (60) day time period established under Section 17-</P>
<P>A-5 of the agreement and will advise the Company of any</P>
<P>legal proceedings within sixty (60) days after</P>
<P>commencement. Should the disposition of the case result in a</P>
<P>judgment which includes recognition of an accrued liability by</P>
<P>the Company, such liability shall not continue to accrue</P>
<P>during the period from the date the notice of review was filed</P>
<P>until the date the appeal was filed. Furthermore, the</P>
<P>members of the System Board of Adjustment (including the</P>
<P>neutral in five member Board proceedings) shall not be</P>
<P>advised that any such grievance was considered by the UAL-MEC</P>
<P>Grievance Review Panel or of any determination by</P>
<P>such panel or of subsequent legal proceedings and shall not</P>
<P>consider any such matters in hearing and deciding any such</P>
<P>grievance.</P>
<B><P>Page 179&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-A-7 </P>
<P>17-A-7- Grievances Filed By The MEC Chairman</P>
</B><I><P>Right to request</P>
<P>hearing</P>
<P>MEC Chairman</P>
<P>may file for future</P>
<P>relief</P>
</I><P>The MEC Chairman or his designee may by written request</P>
<P>ask for a review by the Senior Vice President-Flight</P>
<P>Operations of any alleged misapplication or misinterpretation</P>
<P>of this Agreement which is not at the time the subject of a</P>
<P>grievance. The relief sought shall be limited to a change in</P>
<P>future application or interpretation of the Agreement. The</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations/designee shall have</P>
<P>twenty (20) days after receipt of the request for review in</P>
<P>which to investigate and issue a decision; unless a hearing is</P>
<P>requested by either party, in which case the decision shall be</P>
<P>due fifteen (15) days after the hearing. If the decision is not</P>
<P>satisfactory, further appeal may be made in writing by the</P>
<P>President of the Association to the "United Air Lines Pilots'</P>
<P>System Board of Adjustment" as provided for in Section 18 of</P>
<P>the Agreement, provided such appeal is made within thirty</P>
<P>(30) calendar days from the receipt by the Legal Department</P>
<P>of the Association (staff attorney) of the decision of the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations. It is understood</P>
<P>such right under this sub-paragraph shall not apply to</P>
<P>hypothetical cases or situations.</P>
<B><P>17-B- Discipline and Discharge</P>
<P>17-B-1-</P>
</B><I><P>Copy of letter of</P>
<P>charge sent to the</P>
<P>Association</P>
</I><B><P>17-B-1-a- </B>Before a pilot is disciplined or discharged,</P>
<P>such pilot shall be notified in writing by the Company of</P>
<P>the precise charge or charges against him. The Letter of</P>
<P>Charge shall include the following statement: "A copy of</P>
<P>this letter has been sent to the Association. If you desire</P>
<P>Association representation, you must contact your local</P>
<P>Association representative."</P>
<P>Such pilot shall be given at least ten (10) days to secure</P>
<P>the presence of witnesses and gather evidence and shall</P>
<P>have the right to be represented by counsel, an employee</P>
<P>of the Company or his duly accredited Association</P>
<P>representative(s). A hearing shall be held by the Manager/</P>
<P>Director of Flight Operations or his designee within fifteen</P>
<P>(15) calendar days after the issuance of the charge;</P>
<P>unless the pilot, through no fault of his own, did not</P>
<P>receive the charge in time to have had the ten (10) days</P>
<P>required above; in which case the hearing will be</P>
<P>rescheduled, if requested, to provide the required ten (10)</P>
<P>days.</P>
<B><P>Page 180 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-B-1-b</P>
<P>17-B-1-b- </B>Within fifteen (15) calendar days after the</P>
<P>close of the hearing, a decision shall be announced in</P>
<P>writing and a copy shall be furnished to the Legal</P>
<P>Department of the Association (staff attorney), the Local</P>
<P>Executive Council Chairman, Local Grievance Chairman,</P>
<P>MEC Grievance Chairman and the MEC Chairman, unless</P>
<P>the grievant specifically requests that such copies not be</P>
<P>sent.</P>
<B><P>17-B-1-c- </B>During the course of the investigation</P>
<P>conducted in accordance with Paragraph 17-B-1 above,</P>
<P>the Company may hold the pilot out of service. While held</P>
<P>out of service, the pilot shall continue to receive pay until</P>
<P>the effective date of the written decision determining the</P>
<P>action to be taken.</P>
<P>Any extension of time limits granted at the request of the</P>
<P>pilot shall be on a without pay basis for the period of the</P>
<P>extension. The pilot shall continue to receive full pay and</P>
<P>benefits during any extension granted at the request of the</P>
<P>Company.</P>
<I><P>Automatic appeal</P>
<P>of termination to</P>
<P>S.V.P. Flight</P>
<P>Operations</P>
</I><B><P>17-B-2- </B>If the pilot is dissatisfied with any discipline</P>
<P>(excluding termination of employment) and desires to appeal,</P>
<P>he shall within thirty (30) calendar days after receiving such</P>
<P>decision make a written appeal to the Senior Vice President-Flight</P>
<P>Operations. If the discipline imposed includes</P>
<P>termination of employment, that discipline will be considered</P>
<P>to be appealed to the Senior Vice President-Flight</P>
<P>Operations, as above, without specific appeal action being</P>
<P>required; unless the affected pilot specifically requests that</P>
<P>such appeal not be made.</P>
<B><P>17-B-3- </B>The Senior Vice President-Flight Operations or his</P>
<P>designee shall hear such appeal within fifteen (15) calendar</P>
<P>days after receipt of the pilot's written request therefor.</P>
<I><P>Decision to</P>
<P>terminate shall be</P>
<P>copied to System</P>
<P>Board and case</P>
<P>will be docketed</P>
<P>for appeal</P>
</I><B><P>17-B-4- </B>Within fifteen (15) calendar days after hearing such</P>
<P>appeal, the Senior Vice President-Flight Operations or his</P>
<P>designee shall announce his decision in writing to the pilot</P>
<P>and, unless otherwise requested, furnish a copy to the Legal</P>
<P>Department of the Association (staff attorney), the Local</P>
<P>Executive Council Chairman, Local Grievance Chairman,</P>
<P>MEC Grievance Chairman and the MEC Chairman. If such</P>
<P>decision involves termination of employment, that decision</P>
<P>shall be copied to the Pilot System Board of Adjustment and</P>
<P>shall be considered by the Board as a request to docket the</P>
<P>case, on appeal; unless the affected pilot specifically</P>
<P>requests that such appeal not be filed.</P>
<B><P>Page 181&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-B-5 </P>
<P>17-B-5- </B>Further appeal by the grievant(s), if made, shall be</P>
<P>to the "United Air Lines Pilots' System Board of Adjustment"</P>
<P>as provided for in Section 18 of this Agreement, provided</P>
<P>such appeal is made within sixty (60) days from the date of</P>
<P>receipt by the grievant(s) of the decision of the Senior Vice</P>
<P>President-Flight Operations or his designee. If the case</P>
<P>involved termination of employment, appeal will be</P>
<P>automatic, as described in B-4 above.</P>
<B><P>17-B-6- </B>Nothing in this Section shall be construed as</P>
<P>extending the rights of this Paragraph B to a pilot during his</P>
<P>probationary period.</P>
<B><P>17-C- General</P>
<P>17-C-1- </B>The time limits set forth in Paragraph 17-A and 17-B</P>
<P>of this Section may be extended by mutual agreement of the</P>
<P>Company and the grievant or the Association.</P>
<B><P>17-C-2- </B>If any decision of the Company under the provisions</P>
<P>of this Section is not appealed by the grievant(s) within the</P>
<P>time limits prescribed herein for such appeal or any extension</P>
<P>mutually agreed upon, the decision of the Company shall be</P>
<P>final and binding. If any hearing or decision required of the</P>
<P>Company under the provisions of this Section is not provided</P>
<P>within the time limits herein, or any extension mutually</P>
<P>agreed upon, the grievant(s) shall consider the request</P>
<P>denied and may appeal it to the next step of the grievance</P>
<P>procedure.</P>
<P>Any grievance appealed to the Senior Vice President-Flight</P>
<P>Operations may not be remanded to the preceding step</P>
<P>without the concurrence of the grievant.</P>
