<B><P>17-C-3- </B>Nothing in this Section shall be construed to prevent</P>
<P>the Company from holding a pilot out of service pending an</P>
<P>investigation and hearing and appeal therefrom.</P>
<B><P>17-C-4-</P>
<P>17-C-4-a- </B>If, as a result of any hearing or appeals</P>
<P>therefrom, a pilot is exonerated, he shall be made whole</P>
<P>for any and all pay and benefits and shall, if he has been</P>
<P>held out of service, be reinstated without loss of seniority.</P>
<B><P>17-C-4-b- </B>If, as a result of any hearing or appeals</P>
<P>therefrom, a pilot is exonerated, all personnel records</P>
<P>shall be cleared of the charges.</P>
<B><P>Page 182 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-C-5</P>
<P>17-C-5- </B>When it is mutually agreed that a stenographic</P>
<P>report is to be taken of a hearing in whole or in part, the cost</P>
<P>will be borne equally by both parties to the dispute. When it is</P>
<P>not mutually agreed that a stenographic report of the</P>
<P>proceedings be taken and such stenographic record of the</P>
<P>hearing is made by either of the parties to the dispute, a copy</P>
<P>shall be furnished to the other party to the dispute upon</P>
<P>request, provided that the cost of such written record so</P>
<P>requested shall be borne equally by both parties to the</P>
<P>dispute.</P>
<I><P>Time limit</P>
<P>determined by</P>
<P>date of postmark</P>
</I><B><P>17-C-6- </B>The filing of all grievances, decisions and appeals</P>
<P>thereof and notification in writing shall be accomplished by</P>
<P>personal delivery or by depositing such notice in the U. S.</P>
<P>Mail, postage prepaid, Certified Mail, addressed to the last</P>
<P>known address of the party to whom the notice is being given</P>
<P>and shall be deemed as being "filed" on the date of personal</P>
<P>delivery or the date of postmark.</P>
<B><P>17-C-7- </B>Grievants, witnesses and representatives who are</P>
<P>employees of the Company shall receive free transportation</P>
<P>over the lines of the Company from the point of residence,</P>
<P>duty or assignment to the point of hearing and return to the</P>
<P>extent permitted by law.</P>
<P>Also, grievants, witnesses and their representatives who are</P>
<P>employees may be granted a leave of absence, subject to the</P>
<P>needs of the service, and the necessary transportation</P>
<P>(NRPS) on the Company line for the purpose of investigating</P>
<P>and gathering evidence associated with the grievance to the</P>
<P>extent permitted by law.</P>
<B><P>17-C-8- </B>When a pilot is chosen to act as representative of or</P>
<P>a witness for another pilot, such pilot shall be given leave of</P>
<P>absence for a time sufficient to permit him to appear as such</P>
<P>representative or witness.</P>
<B><P>17-C-9- </B>If more than one (1) management representative is</P>
<P>present (including the Flight Manager) at an investigation</P>
<P>hearing or conference with a pilot concerning a matter which</P>
<P>may result in disciplinary action, such pilot will be advised by</P>
<P>the Company of his right to have a representative of his</P>
<P>choice present, provided such representative will be</P>
<P>available within a reasonable period of time not to exceed</P>
<P>twenty-four (24) hours. Further, when a pilot is requested to</P>
<P>appear at such investigation hearing or conference, he shall</P>
<P>be advised of the nature of the subject to be discussed..</P>
<B><P>Page 183&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-C-10 </P>
</B><I><P>Clearing record (2</P>
<P>years) (3 years)</P>
</I><B><P>17-C-10- </B>The Company shall consider any disciplinary</P>
<P>action taken against a pilot as cleared from the pilot's record</P>
<P>after a two (2) year period of active service (three (3) years in</P>
<P>the case of discipline resulting from flying proficiency) from</P>
<P>the date of issuance if no further discipline has been imposed</P>
<P>during that period. The pilot's record may be cleared earlier,</P>
<P>when, in the judgment of the Company, his performance</P>
<P>warrants such action.</P>
<I><P>Copy of material</P>
<P>placed in file</P>
</I><B><P>17-C-11- </B>A pilot will be furnished a copy of any information</P>
<P>which is placed in his personnel file that may be used in the</P>
<P>evaluation of his performance and/or employment</P>
<P>relationship.</P>
<I><P>Access to material </P>
</I><B><P>17-C-12- </B>A pilot or his authorized representative shall have</P>
<P>access to all relevant grievance related material at such time</P>
<P>as there is an active grievance on file that could result in</P>
<P>discipline or discharge.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>
<P>Interpretations Table of Contents.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 184 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 17-C-12</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 185&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 18</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>System Board Of Adjustment</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>18-A-</P>
</B><P>In compliance with Section 204, Title II, of the Railway Labor</P>
<P>Act, as amended, there is hereby established a System</P>
<P>Board of Adjustment, and shall be known as the "United Air</P>
<P>Lines Pilots System Board of Adjustment" hereinafter</P>
<P>referred to as the "Board."</P>
<P>The Board's purpose shall be to adjust and decide disputes</P>
<P>which may arise under the terms of the Pilots Agreement</P>
<P>when such disputes have been properly submitted to the</P>
<P>Board.</P>
<B><P>18-B- Composition of the Board</P>
</B><I><P>Composition of</P>
<P>Board</P>
<P>3 alternates</P>
</I><B><P>18-B-1- </B>The Board shall consist of four (4) members, two (2)</P>
<P>of whom shall be selected and appointed by the Association</P>
<P>and two (2) of whom shall be selected and appointed by the</P>
<P>Company, and such appointees shall be known as "Board</P>
<P>Members." In addition, the Association and the Company</P>
<P>shall each designate three (3) alternates, and in the event of</P>
<P>the unavailability of a Board Member, the respective party</P>
<P>shall designate the alternate to act as a Board Member in</P>
<P>place of the absent Board Member.</P>
<B><P>18-B-2- </B>The two (2) Board Members appointed by the</P>
<P>Company, and the two (2) Board Members appointed by the</P>
<P>Association and their alternates shall serve for one year from</P>
<P>the date of their appointment, and, thereafter, until their</P>
<P>successors have been duly appointed. Vacancies shall be</P>
<P>filled in the same manner as is provided herein for the</P>
<P>selection and appointment of the original Board Members and</P>
<P>the original alternates.</P>
<B><P>18-B-3- </B>The Board Members shall select a Chairman and a</P>
<P>Vice Chairman, both of whom shall be members of the Board.</P>
<P>The term of office of Chairman and Vice Chairman shall be</P>
<P>one (1) year. Thereafter, from year to year, the Board shall</P>
<P>designate one of its members to act as Chairman and one to</P>
<P>act as Vice Chairman for one (1) year terms.</P>
<B><P>Page 186 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-B-4</P>
<P>18-B-4- </B>The office of Chairman shall be filled and held</P>
<P>alternately by the Board Member appointed by the</P>
<P>Association and by a Board Member appointed by the</P>
<P>Company. When a Board Member appointed by the</P>
<P>Association is Chairman, a Board Member appointed by the</P>
<P>Company shall be Vice Chairman, and vice versa. Subject to</P>
<P>the provisions of Paragraph 18-F, the aforesaid Chairman, or,</P>
<P>in his absence the Vice Chairman, shall preside at meetings</P>
<P>of the Board and at hearings. Both shall have a vote in</P>
<P>connection with all actions taken by the Board.</P>
<I><P>2 monthly</P>
<P>meetings</P>
</I><B><P>18-B-5- </B>The Board shall meet twice monthly in the city</P>
<P>where the general offices of the Company are maintained,</P>
<P>(unless a different place of meeting is agreed upon by the</P>
<P>Company and the Association) provided that at such times</P>
<P>there are cases filed with the Board for their consideration.</P>
<B><P>18-C- Jurisdiction of the Board</P>
<P>18-C-1- </B>The Board shall have jurisdiction over disputes</P>
<P>between any employee covered by the Pilots Agreement and</P>
<P>the Company growing out of grievances or out of</P>
<P>interpretation or application of any of the terms of the Pilots</P>
<P>Agreement. The jurisdiction of the Board shall not extend to</P>
<P>proposed changes in hours of employment, rates of</P>
<P>compensation or working conditions covered by existing</P>
<P>agreements between the parties hereto, or as subsequently</P>
<P>executed.</P>
<B><P>18-C-2- </B>The Board shall consider any dispute properly</P>
<P>submitted to it by the President of the Association or by the</P>
<P>Senior Vice President-Flight Operations, when such dispute</P>
<P>has not been previously settled in accordance with the terms</P>
<P>provided for in Section 17.</P>
<B><P>18-D- Proceedings Before The Board</P>
<P>18-D-1- </B>All disputes properly submitted to the Board for</P>
<P>consideration shall be addressed to the Members of the</P>
<P>Board, including all papers and exhibits in connection</P>
<P>therewith. Each case submitted shall show:</P>
<B><P>18-D-1-a- </B>Question or questions at issue.</P>
<B><P>18-D-1-b- </B>Statement of facts.</P>
<B><P>18-D-1-c- </B>Position of employee or employees.</P>
<P>When desired, joint submissions may be made, but either</P>
<P>party may submit the dispute and its position to the Board.</P>
<B><P>Page 187&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-D-2 </P>
</B><P>No matter shall be considered by the Board which has not</P>
<P>first been handled in accordance with the provisions of</P>
<P>Section 17 including the rendering of a decision thereon</P>
<P>by the Senior Vice President-Flight Operations.</P>
<B><P>18-D-2- </B>Upon receipt of notice of the submission of a</P>
<P>dispute, the Chairman shall set a date for hearing, which</P>
<P>shall be at the time of the next regular meeting of the Board,</P>
<P>as provided in Paragraph 18-B-5 of this Section, or, if at least</P>
<P>two (2) Board Members consider the matter of sufficient</P>
<P>urgency and importance, then at such earlier date and at</P>
<P>such place as the Chairman and Vice Chairman shall agree</P>
<P>upon, but not more than fifteen (15) days after such request</P>
<P>for meeting is made by at least two (2) of said Board</P>
<P>Members, and the Chairman shall give the necessary notices</P>
<P>in writing of such meeting to the Board Members and to the</P>
<P>parties to the dispute.</P>
<B><P>18-D-3- </B>Employees covered by this Agreement may be</P>
<P>represented at Board hearings by such person or persons as</P>
<P>they may choose and designate, and the Company may be</P>
<P>represented by such person or persons as it may choose and</P>
<P>designate. Evidence may be presented either orally, or in</P>
<P>writing, or both.</P>
<B><P>18-D-4- </B>On request of any individual Board Member, the</P>
<P>Board may, by majority vote, or shall, at the request of the</P>
<P>two (2) Board Members appointed either by the Company or</P>
<P>the Association, summon any witnesses who are employed</P>
<P>by the Company, and who may be deemed necessary by the</P>
<P>parties to the dispute, or by either party, or by the Board</P>
<P>itself, or by the two (2) Board Members appointed either by</P>
<P>the Company or the Association.</P>
<B><P>18-D-5- </B>The number of witnesses summoned at any one</P>
<P>time shall not be greater than the number which can be</P>
<P>spared from the operation without extreme interference with</P>
<P>the services of the Company.</P>
<B><P>18-D-6- </B>Unless and until the provisions of Paragraph 18-F of</P>
<P>this Section become applicable, the Board, composed of two</P>
<P>(2) Board Members appointed by the Company and two (2)</P>
<P>Board Members appointed by the Association, or their</P>
<P>respective alternates, shall be competent to hear the</P>
<P>disputes properly submitted to it and to decide said disputes.</P>
<B><P>Page 188 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-E</P>
</B><P>properly submitted to it and to decide said disputes by</P>
<P>majority vote. Decisions of the Board so composed shall be</P>
<P>final and binding upon the parties hereto and shall be</P>
<P>rendered no later than forty-five (45) days after the close of</P>
<P>the hearing.</P>
<B><P>18-E- The Panel of Referees</P>
</B><I><P>15 referees </P>
</I><B><P>18-E-1- </B>The Company and the Association shall, by mutual</P>
<P>agreement, establish a panel of potential neutral referees</P>
<P>who will serve individually as the neutral and presiding</P>
<P>member of the Board when a referee is either required or</P>
<P>requested under the provisions of Paragraph 18-F of this</P>
<P>Section. The scheduling of these referees shall be by the</P>
<P>mutual agreement of the parties.</P>
<B><P>18-E-2- </B>At as early a date as practicable after the selection</P>
<P>of the panel of referees referred to above, and upon the</P>
<P>request of either party, the first named referee shall meet</P>
<P>with representatives of the Company and representatives of</P>
<P>the Association for the purpose of reviewing and streamlining</P>
<P>the System Board procedures which are not contained within</P>
<P>this Agreement but have been developed by the Board. The</P>
<P>basis for such review and modification shall be simplicity,</P>
<P>expedition and fairness. The referee shall be em-powered to</P>
<P>make the final decision in such review and modification.</P>
<P>In any event, when a referee sits as a member of the Board</P>
<P>pursuant to Paragraph 18-F of this Section, he shall have the</P>
<P>right to modify such procedures for the purpose of that</P>
<P>hearing.</P>
<B><P>18-E-3- </B>Either the Company or the Association by four (4)</P>
<P>month's written notice to the other may, without cause,</P>
<P>remove any of the named referees. In such event, the referee</P>
<P>so removed shall complete matters, if any, pending before</P>
<P>him pursuant to Paragraph 18-F of this Section, and the</P>
<P>remaining referee or referees shall serve in the relative order</P>
<P>as originally designated. When a referee is removed,</P>
<P>pursuant to this Paragraph, the parties shall meet to select a</P>
<P>replacement as soon thereafter as practicable.</P>
<B><P>18-F- Procedure in Event of Deadlock</P>
<P>18-F-1- </B>Within ten (10) days after the submission of a</P>
<P>dispute to the Board pursuant to Paragraph 18-D-1 of this</P>
<P>Section, either the Association or the Company may by</P>
<P>written notice to the other, state its desire that the dispute be.</P>
<B><P>Page 189&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-F-2 </P>
</B><P>heard by a five (5) member Board consisting of the two (2)</P>
<P>Board Members appointed by the Association and two (2)</P>
<P>Board Members appointed by the Company, or their</P>
<P>respective alternates, and a member of the panel of potential</P>
<P>referees established pursuant to Paragraph E of this Section.</P>
<P>In such case, the referee shall be selected in accordance</P>
<P>with Paragraph 18-E of this Section.</P>
<B><P>18-F-2- </B>Where the hearing in a dispute properly submitted to</P>
<P>the Board has commenced before the Board, and where the</P>
<P>Board is then composed solely of the two (2) Board Members</P>
<P>appointed by the Company and the two (2) Board Members</P>
<P>appointed by the Association, or their respective alternates,</P>
<P>and where the Board is unable by majority vote to decide an</P>
<P>issue before it relative to the dispute being heard, the Board</P>
<P>shall declare itself deadlocked and it shall select a referee</P>
<P>from the panel established pursuant to the subject in the</P>
<P>order specified in Paragraph E of this Section. In the event</P>
<P>the Board has failed to decide such issue or declare itself</P>
<P>deadlocked within forty-five (45) days after the issue has</P>
<P>been heard by the Board, then the Board shall be deemed to</P>
<P>be deadlocked for the purpose of this Paragraph and shall</P>
<P>select a referee as herein provided. The referee so selected</P>
<P>shall thereupon join the Board as a member and as the</P>
<P>Chairman thereof in the subsequent consideration and</P>
<P>disposition of the matter over which the Company and</P>
<P>Association Board Members deadlocked and in the</P>
<P>subsequent hearing, consideration and disposition of the</P>
<P>dispute then being heard.</P>
<B><P>18-F-3- </B>When composed of five (5) members as a result of</P>
<P>the procedures set forth in Paragraph 18-F-1 or 18-F-2, the</P>
<P>Board shall be competent to hear the dispute properly</P>
<P>submitted to it and to decide said dispute by majority vote.</P>
<P>Decisions of the Board so composed shall be final and</P>
<P>binding on the parties and shall be rendered no later than</P>
<P>forty-five (45) days after the close of the hearing.</P>
<B><P>18-F-4- </B>Where the hearing in a dispute properly submitted to</P>
<P>the Board has concluded, and where the Board is then</P>
<P>composed solely of the two (2) Board Members appointed by</P>
<P>the Company and two (2) Board Members appointed by the</P>
<P>Association, or their respective alternates, and where the</P>
<P>Board is unable by majority vote to decide the dispute, the</P>
<P>Board shall declare itself deadlocked and it shall select a</P>
<P>referee from the panel established pursuant to Paragraph 18-</P>
<P>E of this Section. In the event the Board has failed to render</P>
<P>a decision or declare itself deadlocked within the forty-five.</P>
<B><P>Page 190 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-F-5</P>
</B><P>(45) day period provided in Paragraph 18-D of this Section,</P>
<P>then the Board shall be deemed to be deadlocked for the</P>
<P>purpose of this Paragraph and shall select a referee as</P>
<P>herein provided. The referee so selected shall thereupon join</P>
<P>the Board as a Board Member and as the Chairman thereof in</P>
<P>the sub-sequent consideration and disposition of the dispute.</P>
<B><P>18-F-5- </B>Within forty-five (45) days after the selection of the</P>
<P>referee as provided in the preceding Paragraph, the five (5)</P>
<P>member Board shall consider and review the prior record in</P>
<P>the dispute, and it may call such witnesses and receive such</P>
<P>evidence as it may deem necessary. Either party may make</P>
<P>written request to the Board for the privilege of presenting</P>
<P>witnesses or documentary evidence, and the Board may in its</P>
<P>discretion permit such presentation.</P>
<B><P>18-F-6- </B>When composed of five (5) members as a result of</P>
<P>the procedure set forth in Paragraph 18-F-4 above, the Board</P>
<P>shall be competent to decide said dispute by majority vote.</P>
<P>Decisions of the Board so composed shall be final and</P>
<P>binding on the parties and shall be rendered no later than</P>
<P>forty-five (45) days after the Board has considered and</P>
<P>reviewed the prior record in the dispute and/or has received</P>
<P>such additional evidence as deemed necessary, whichever is</P>
<P>later.</P>
<B><P>18-G-</P>
</B><P>In the event the Board is unable to comply with the time limits</P>
<P>specified in Paragraph 18-D and 18-F above, the Chairman of</P>
<P>the Board shall prior to the expiration of forty-five (45) days</P>
<P>notify both parties in writing of the reasons the Board is</P>
<P>unable to comply with the time limits, and give a date as to</P>
<P>when a decision will be rendered.</P>
<B><P>18-H- General</P>
<P>18-H-1- </B>The expenses and reasonable compensation of the</P>
<P>referees selected as provided herein shall be borne equally</P>
<P>by the Company and the Association.</P>
<B><P>18-H-2- </B>The time limits specified in this Section may be</P>
<P>extended by mutual agreement of the Company and</P>
<P>Association..</P>
<B><P>Page 191&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-H-3 </P>
<P>18-H-3- </B>Nothing herein shall be construed to limit, restrict or</P>
<P>abridge the rights or privileges accorded either to the</P>
<P>employees or to the employer, or to their duly accredited</P>
<P>representatives, under the provisions of the Railway Labor</P>
<P>Act, as amended.</P>
<B><P>18-H-4- </B>The Board shall for a minimum period of five (5)</P>
<P>years maintain a complete record of all matters submitted to</P>
<P>it for its consideration and of all their findings and decisions.</P>
<B><P>18-H-5- </B>The Company and the Association will assume the</P>
<P>compensation, travel expense and other expenses of the</P>
<P>Board Members selected by them.</P>
<B><P>18-H-6- </B>Each of the parties hereto will assume the</P>
<P>compensation, travel expense and other expenses of the</P>
<P>witnesses called or summoned by it. Grievants, witnesses</P>
<P>and representatives who are employees of the Company</P>
<P>shall receive free transportation (NRPS) over the lines of the</P>
<P>Company from the point of residence, duty or assignment to</P>
<P>the point at which they must appear as witnesses and return,</P>
<P>to the extent permitted by law.</P>
<B><P>18-H-7- </B>The Chairman and the Vice Chairman designated</P>
<P>pursuant to Paragraph 18-B-4, acting jointly, shall have the</P>
<P>authority to incur such other expenses as in their judgment</P>
<P>may be deemed necessary for the proper conduct of the</P>
<P>business of the Board and such expenses shall be borne</P>
<P>one-half by each of the parties hereto. Board Members who</P>
<P>are employees of the Company shall be granted necessary</P>
<P>leaves of absence for the performance of their duties as</P>
<P>Board Members. So far as space is available, Board</P>
<P>Members shall be furnished free transportation over the lines</P>
<P>of the Company, for purpose of attending meetings of the</P>
<P>Board, to the extent permitted by law.</P>
<B><P>18-H-8- </B>It is understood and agreed that each and every</P>
<P>Board Member shall be free to discharge his duty in an</P>
<P>independent manner, without fear that his individual relation</P>
<P>with the Company or with the employees may be affected in</P>
<P>any manner by any action taken by him in good faith in his</P>
<P>capacity as a Board Member.</P>
<B><P>18-H-9- </B>The Board shall have the authority for the</P>
<P>administration and interpretation of this Section of the</P>
<P>Agreement. In the event the Board cannot agree on the</P>
<P>administration or interpretation of this Section, they shall</P>
<P>refer the matter to the first named referee or his designee..</P>
<B><P>Page 192 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 18-H-10</P>
<P>18-H-10- </B>In the event a member of the panel of referees is</P>
<P>more than thirty (30) days overdue beyond the time limits</P>
<P>specified in Paragraph 18-D and 18-F above in the rendering</P>
<P>of a decision, he shall not be considered eligible for</P>
<P>assignment of additional cases until such decision is</P>
<P>rendered (except by mutual agreement between the</P>
<P>Company and the Association).</P>
<B><P>Page 193&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 19-A </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 19</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Crew Complement</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>19-A-</P>
</B><P>The Company agrees that no United Air Lines B-747, DC-10</P>
<P>and B-727 aircraft shall be operated in scheduled commercial</P>
<P>operations, including courtesy, publicity, charter or ferry</P>
<P>flights, unless the minimum crew on such aircraft consists of</P>
<P>three (3) pilots from the Pilots' System Seniority List. The</P>
<P>Second Officer shall possess a currently effective commercial</P>
<P>license and instrument rating and shall have completed the</P>
<P>course of training consistent with the Flight Operations</P>
<P>Administration policy in effect August 22, 1970.</P>
<B><P>19-B-</P>
</B><I><P>Two (2) pilot crew</P>
<P>on specific aircraft</P>
</I><P>The Company agrees that no United Airlines B-747-400, B-777, B-767/757, A-320/319, B737-300/400/500, or B-737</P>
<P>shall be operated in scheduled commercial operation,</P>
<P>including courtesy, publicity, charter, or ferry flights, unless</P>
<P>the minimum crew on such aircraft consists of two (2) pilots</P>
<P>from the Pilot's System Seniority List.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>
<P>Interpretations Table of Contents.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 194 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Section 19-B</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 195&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
20-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 20</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>Allocation, Assignment and Scheduling of Flying</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>20-A-</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>20-A-1- </B>Flight Crew Resources shall be responsible for</P>
<P>allocation of hours, assignment to allocation, construction of</P>
<P>trip pairings, duty period assignment, assignment to</P>
<P>domicile(s) of all trips (including charters) and lines of flying</P>
<P>and all known open flying in accordance with the provisions</P>
<P>of this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>20-A-1-a- </B>No revision of such pairings, duty period</P>
<P>assignment or assignment to domicile(s) of trip(s) may be</P>
<P>made unless approved by Flight Crew Resources and</P>
<P>discussed with the System Schedule Committee.</P>
<B><P>20-A-1-b- </B>No revision of the manpower requirement</P>
<P>levels established in the lines of flying may be made</P>
<P>unless approved by Flight Crew Resources and discussed</P>
<P>with the System Schedule Committee.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2- System Scheduling Committee</P>
</B><I><P>System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee</P>
<P>Composition</P>
<P>SSC duties</P>
<P>Equipment to</P>
<P>seniority and</P>
<P>allocation of flying</P>
</I><P>A System Schedule Committee (SSC) shall be composed of</P>
<P>four (4) pilot representatives, inclusive of one (1) Shuttle</P>
<P>representative, one of which will be designated as Chairman.</P>
<P>These pilots may also be Local Schedule Representatives.</P>
<P>Each month the System Schedule Committee members shall</P>
<P>meet with the designated Company representatives in order</P>
<P>to provide the pilots the opportunity to review and make</P>
<P>recommendations to the Company regarding the DSL's, the</P>
<P>allocation and assignment of flying and the construction of</P>
<P>lines of flying. In addition, a minimum of one (1) scheduling</P>
<P>representative from each domicile will be given the</P>
<P>opportunity to review the construction of lines of flying and to</P>
<P>select the Operating Experience ("OE") lines for that domicile</P>
<P>in accordance with the provisions of Section 20-E of the</P>
<P>Agreement. Each month, the Company shall propose meeting</P>
<P>dates which coincide with the period in the construction of</P>
<P>schedules at which time the pilot recommendations can be</P>
<P>best considered. Meetings may be on different dates for</P>
<P>some or all fleets. Additional meetings may be held by mutual</P>
<P>agreement. It is the intent of the parties of this Agreement</P>
<P>that this System Scheduling Committee shall provide pilots.</P>
<B><P>Page 196 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-A-2-a</P>
</B><P>with the opportunity to consult with and make</P>
<P>recommendations to the Company on the allocation of flying,</P>
<P>assignment and reduction of flying to pilot domiciles in</P>
<P>accordance with the ''equipment to seniority'' concept as</P>
<P>outlined below. ''Equipment to seniority'' shall mean that</P>
<P>within the limits of flying hours available to a domicile by</P>
<P>equipment type, the more senior pilots shall be given the</P>
<P>opportunity to fly equipment in the following order: B-747-</P>
<P>400, B-747, B-777, DC-10, B-767/757, A-320/319, B-727, B-737-300/400/500 and B-737, so long as efficient utilization of</P>
<P>pilots and stability of pilot employment at the domiciles are</P>
<P>achieved and economy of operations and working conditions</P>
<P>are not unreasonably affected.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-a- </B>Pilot Domiciles. The geographical location of a</P>
<P>pilot domicile(s) and designation of equipment type to be</P>
<P>flown from each domicile(s) shall be determined by the</P>
<P>Company after discussions with the System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-b- </B>Allocation of Flying. The "equipment to</P>
<P>seniority" concept shall be used considering the seniority</P>
<P>of those pilots not holding an assignment in the equipment</P>
<P>group as specified in Paragraph 20-A-2 above for which</P>
<P>flying is being allocated, or an assignment in a higher</P>
<P>paying equipment. The seniority of Captains who could</P>
<P>have held an assignment at their domicile in the</P>
<P>equipment group as specified in Paragraph 20-A-2 above</P>
<P>shall not be considered in the allocation.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-c- </B>Reduction of Flying. The "equipment to</P>
<P>seniority" concept shall be used considering those</P>
<P>Captains in the equipment type in which the flying is being</P>
<P>reduced independently of other equipment types.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-d- </B>Assignment or Reassignment of Lines of</P>
<P>Flying to Domicile. The "equipment to seniority" concept</P>
<P>shall be used considering the available Captains</P>
<P>necessary to cover the lines of flying, vacations and a</P>
<P>minimum of seventeen per cent (17%) reserve coverage in</P>
<P>support of those lines of flying in each equipment type</P>
<P>independently of other equipment types.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-e- </B>In the event unforeseen circumstances arise</P>
<P>which would necessitate discussions with the SSC in</P>
<P>compliance with the provisions of this Section, the</P>
<P>Company will communicate with the SSC via conference</P>
<P>call prior to taking any actions..</P>
<B><P>Page 197&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-A-2-f </P>
</B><I><P>Sharing of</P>
<P>Information</P>
</I><B><P>20-A-2-f- </B>All information pertinent to the allocation,</P>
<P>assignment, and scheduling of flying shall be provided to</P>
<P>the System Schedule Committee on a timely basis. It is</P>
<P>understood by the parties that some information may be</P>
<P>identified by the Company as "privileged". The SSC and</P>
<P>the MEC Officers agree to keep this information</P>
<P>confidential until informed otherwise by the Company.</P>
<I><P>SSC and</P>
<P>computer lines of</P>
<P>flying</P>
</I><B><P>20-A-2-g- </B>The Company and the System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee shall continue efforts to develop and improve</P>
<P>computer programs to provide for more efficient</P>
<P>scheduling of pilots. It is agreed and understood that</P>
<P>mutual agreement between the Company and the System</P>
<P>Schedule Committee must be reached prior to the</P>
<P>implementation of any such program.</P>
<I><P>SSC trip drops </P>
</I><B><P>20-A-2-h- </B>When System Schedule Committee Meetings</P>
<P>are held, pilot trip drops required will be on a</P>
<P>displacement basis.</P>
<B><P>20-A-2-i- </B>In the event unresolved scheduling problems</P>
<P>arise, the System Schedule Committee may appeal the</P>
<P>matter to the Senior Vice President-Flight Operations.</P>
<B><P>20-B- Publication of Schedules</P>
<P>20-B-1- </B>Pilots schedules shall be posted for preferencing as</P>
<P>follows:</P>
<I><P>Posting of</P>
<P>monthly</P>
<P>schedules</P>
</I><B><P>20-B-1-a- </B>Unless agreed to otherwise by the Company</P>
<P>and the System Schedule Committee lines of flying will be</P>
<P>posted for preferencing for a minimum of seven (7) days.</P>
<B><P>20-B-1-b- </B>Typical reserve lines, showing patterns of days</P>
<P>off which comply with Section 5, will be posted for the</P>
<P>same period. No reserve lines will be awarded which have</P>
<P>not been posted, except for floater reserves, as provided</P>
<P>below.</P>
<B><P>20-B-1-c- </B>Preferencing will close not later than the 18th</P>
<P>of the month prior to the subject month, unless a later date</P>
<P>is established by mutual agreement with the System</P>
<P>Schedule Committee. Lineholder awards will be published</P>
<P>by the 20th or the end of the 2nd day after closing,</P>
<P>whichever is later, and secondary lines and reserve lines</P>
<P>will be published by the 24th, or the end of the 6th day</P>
<P>after closing, whichever is later.</P>
<B><P>20-B-1-d- </B>All monthly pilot schedules shall be posted for</P>
<P>preferencing and awarded by this process, except that.</P>
<B><P>Page 198 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-B-1-e</P>
</B><P>modification to the process may be made in exceptional</P>
<P>cases by mutual agreement with the System Schedule</P>
<P>Committee.</P>
<I><P>Pilot failing to</P>
<P>preference will be</P>
<P>considered for</P>
<P>mov-ups</P>
</I><B><P>20-B-1-e- </B>Unless otherwise agreed to locally, a pilot who</P>
<P>fails to express a preference for assignment under the</P>
<P>"schedule selection procedure" shall be assigned to the</P>
<P>numerically lowest number schedule line (i.e., one is less</P>
<P>than six) or reserve day off line, as applicable, which</P>
<P>remains unassigned in his status and equipment type after</P>
<P>all pilots senior to him have been assigned.</P>
<B><P>20-B-1-f- </B>After completion of the pilot's schedule</P>
<P>selection procedure, pilots shall be assigned to a</P>
<P>schedule within their status and equipment type in</P>
<P>accordance with their seniority subject to Paragraph 6-A</P>
<P>of Section 6 of this Agreement. Any pilot may preference a</P>
<P>secondary line or reserve assignment for the month.</P>
<I><P>SSC will be</P>
<P>consulted for</P>
<P>recommendation</P>
<P>in handling</P>
<P>changes to</P>
<P>planned flying too</P>
<P>late for inclusion</P>
<P>in pilot's</P>
<P>schedules</P>
</I><B><P>20-B-1-g- </B>In the event changes to the airline's planned</P>
<P>flying occur too late to be included in the pilots' schedules</P>
<P>and such changes result in the need to modify a pilot's</P>
<P>assigned line(s); the Company shall offer the System</P>
<P>Schedule Committee the opportunity to consult with and</P>
<P>make recommendations regarding the appropriate manner</P>
<P>to accomplish the necessary modifications.</P>
<B><P>20-C-</P>
<P>20-C-1- Lines of Flying</P>
</B><I><P>Line construction</P>
<P>Parameters</P>
</I><P>Scheduled lines of flying will consist of a trip pairing repeated</P>
<P>in sequence unless efficient pilot utilization requires mixing of</P>
<P>pairings within a line according to the following guidelines.</P>
<P>The line descriptions listed in sub-paragraphs a through d</P>
<P>below, are intended to be in order of desirability. It is</P>
<P>recognized that it is desirable to build the maximum number</P>
<P>of lines in each consecutive step.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-a- </B>Pure lines (same ID).</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-b- </B>Pure with 1 or 2 fillers of like departure and</P>
<P>layovers.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-c- </B>Pure with 1 or 2 fillers of unlike departure and</P>
<P>layovers.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d- </B>Homogenization.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(1) </B>Like departure and layovers.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(2) </B>Like departure with different layovers.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 199&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-C-1-e </P>
<P>20-C-1-d-(3) </B>Like departure with similar routing and</P>
<P>direction.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(4) </B>Like departure with any routing or</P>
<P>direction.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(5) </B>Departure within 6 hours.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(6) </B>Departure within 8 hours.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(7) </B>Departure within 10 hours.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-d-(8) </B>Departure over 10 hours.</P>
<I><P>Homogenization</P>
</I><B><P>20-C-1-e- </B>It is recognized that a planned schedule</P>
<P>change during a schedule month will result in increased</P>
<P>mixing of pairings in order to maintain a relatively even</P>
<P>distribution of flying in each line for the entire month.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-f- </B>Lines of flying submitted for preferencing shall</P>
<P>provide reasonable expectancy of schedule reliability and</P>
<P>shall comply with FARs and the provisions of this</P>
<P>Agreement and shall be scheduled for not more than</P>
<P>eighty-one (81) pay credit hours (up to eighty-three (83)</P>
<P>pay credit hours in a flex month). Lines of flying will not</P>
<P>reflect hours after 2400 on the last day of the month, for a</P>
<P>trip operating over month end nor the return trips on the</P>
<P>first of a month.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-g- </B>If an individual trip pairing repeated in</P>
<P>sequence will not provide the minimum calendar days off</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-1-d, an additional trip or trips may</P>
<P>be substituted in the line to provide such minimum</P>
<P>calendar days off.</P>
<B><P>20-C-1-h- </B>All night flying will be built into a minimum</P>
<P>number of lines even if this results in some lines being</P>
<P>built under guarantee. Pairings with ANF's will not be used</P>
<P>to fill non all-night primary lines.</P>
<B><P>20-C-2- Secondary Lines</P>
</B><P>Flying which remains open after the awarding of the lines of</P>
<P>flying, due to the planned absence of the lineholder and/or</P>
<P>flying which was not awarded as part of a line, may be</P>
<P>combined into secondary lines. Secondary line construction</P>
<P>shall take into consideration the schedule criteria</P>
<P>preferences submitted by those pilots awarded secondary</P>
<P>lines.</P>
<B><P>Page 200 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-C-3</P>
<P>20-C-3- Reserve Lines</P>
</B><I><P>Reserve lines with</P>
<P>days off patterns</P>
<P>will be available</P>
<P>for preferencing</P>
</I><P>The approximate number of reserve lines needed in each</P>
<P>status, fleet and domicile will be posted for preferencing.</P>
<P>Available reserve lines shall consist of a pattern of available</P>
<P>days on and days off, as specified in Section 5-G-1-e. For</P>
<P>Mainline reserve pilots, these lines will be constructed with a</P>
<P>minimum of twelve (12) days off in a thirty (30) day month</P>
<P>and thirteen (13) days off in a thirty-one (31) day month. For</P>
<P>Shuttle reserve pilots, these lines will be constructed with a</P>
<P>minimum of fourteen (14) days off.</P>
<B><P>20-C-4- Floater Reserve Lines</P>
</B><I><P>Floater reserve</P>
<P>line may be</P>
<P>preferenced, day</P>
<P>off will be</P>
<P>determined</P>
</I><P>Floater reserve lines will have no posted day off pattern, but</P>
<P>will have the minimum of twelve (12) days off in a thirty (30)</P>
<P>day month and thirteen (13) days off in a thirty-one (31) day</P>
<P>month (fourteen (14) days off for Shuttle pilots) determined</P>
<P>by the Company after awarding the lines and evaluating their</P>
<P>coverage requirements. Floater reserve lines will not be</P>
<P>posted, but may be preferenced and awarded, as provided in</P>
<P>Section 20-D-3.</P>
<B><P>20-D- Preferencing and Awarding</P>
</B><I><P>Monthly bid</P>
<P>Awards</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-1- </B>During monthly schedule preferencing, a pilot will</P>
<P>have the opportunity to indicate to the Company which lines</P>
<P>of flying, including secondary lines, and/or reserve lines he</P>
<P>desires. He may also indicate his desire to be awarded a</P>
<P>floater reserve line. A line of flying or reserve line which is</P>
<P>open for a full schedule month due to the planned absence of</P>
<P>the initially assigned pilot, will be assigned to the next</P>
<P>eligible pilot(s) so preferencing who is available for the full</P>
<P>month, as part of the line awarding process. If a pilot</P>
<P>preferences secondary lines, he may also indicate which of</P>
<P>the schedule characteristics he considers most desirable. A</P>
<P>pilot will not be awarded a secondary line if he is not planned</P>
<P>to be available for the full month. "Available for the full</P>
<P>month" as used herein means a pilot who, at the time monthly</P>
<P>line awards are made, is not planned to be absent for any</P>
<P>reason except (1) training of under five (5) days; (2) ALPA</P>
<P>duty; (3) no more than one weekend (or equivalent) military</P>
<P>absence or (4) Company requested absence. Lines of flying</P>
<P>open for the month which are not filled by preferencing may</P>
<P>be filled in inverse order of seniority by assignment of regular</P>
<P>reserve pilots in the status and equipment type involved. A</P>
<P>reserve pilot shall not be eligible to be assigned in inverse.</P>
<B><P>Page 201&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-D-2 </P>
</B><P>seniority order unless he is available for the full month, as</P>
<P>defined above.</P>
<B><P>20-D-2- </B>Preferencing for secondary lines will be</P>
<P>accomplished as follows:</P>
<I><P>Awarding</P>
<P>secondary lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-2-a- </B>Advertised secondary lines shall be</P>
<P>preferenced by specific line number. The seniority of the</P>
<P>pilot awarded a secondary line shall determine the order</P>
<P>of accommodation in the assignment of specific trips to</P>
<P>such line. The Company will initiate a test of posting and</P>
<P>bidding or PBS selection of secondary lines with the B737-200 fleet. The results of this test will be jointly evaluated</P>
<P>to be used in the development of a process to more</P>
<P>efficiently conduct the bidding and awarding of secondary</P>
<P>lines.</P>
<I><P>Preferencing</P>
<P>unadvertised</P>
<P>secondary lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-2-b- </B>Should the amount of open flying available for</P>
<P>secondary lines be sufficient to build more secondary lines</P>
<P>than were available for preferencing, such added</P>
<P>secondary lines will be awarded to pilots who preferenced</P>
<P>unadvertised secondary lines. The "999" preference shall</P>
<P>be used only to indicate a desire to be awarded an</P>
<P>unadvertised secondary line. A "999" preference must be</P>
<P>used along with preferences by number for all advertised</P>
<P>secondary lines in order for a pilot to be eligible for</P>
<P>assignment to all secondary lines. If an insufficient</P>
<P>number of pilots preference these unadvertised</P>
<P>secondaries, those pairings will revert to open flying and</P>
<P>no pilot will be involuntarily assigned to such added</P>
<P>secondary lines.</P>
<I><P>Secondary line</P>
<P>criteria</P>
<P>SSC participation</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-2-c- </B>Each pilot who preferences a secondary line</P>
<P>will be required to submit a list of schedule characteristics</P>
<P>which he considers desirable. Secondary lines will be</P>
<P>constructed for each pilot awarded a secondary line taking</P>
<P>into consideration his prior schedule and the criteria he</P>
<P>has submitted. Lines will be constructed and awarded in</P>
<P>seniority order. The secondary line bidding and awarding</P>
<P>process will be administered with the direct participation</P>
<P>of The System Schedule Committee. In the event the</P>
<P>parties agree that additional pilots are required to assist in</P>
<P>the process, ALPA and the Company will agree to the</P>
<P>number of pilots required and the trip drops which will be</P>
<P>allowed. Additionally, the Company will maintain</P>
<P>administrative control of the process including the</P>
<P>allocation of Crew Management Resources.</P>
<B><P>Page 202 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-D-2-d</P>
<P>20-D-2-d- </B>A pilot will not be awarded a secondary line if</P>
<P>he is not planned to be available for the full month, as</P>
<P>defined above.</P>
<B><P>20-D-2-e- </B>Prior to releasing the content of a secondary</P>
<P>line to the pilot awarded that line, any assignment</P>
<P>revision, necessary to resolve conflicts with his prior</P>
<P>month's flying, will be accomplished.</P>
<I><P>Preference floater</P>
<P>reserve lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-3- </B>Floater reserve lines will be available for</P>
<P>preferencing and may be awarded up to a maximum of twenty</P>
<P>percent (20%) (or six (6) lines, whichever is less) of the</P>
<P>reserves in each domicile, equipment and status.</P>
<P>Notwithstanding the 20% above, in no case will the Company</P>
<P>have less than one (1) floater reserve line in each domicile</P>
<P>equipment and status. Those pilots awarded floater reserve</P>
<P>lines will have the opportunity to request a day off pattern</P>
<P>from the crew desk and where possible their request will be</P>
<P>honored. A pilot initially awarded or assigned to a floater line</P>
<P>shall not be eligible to be moved up to any other line. A pilot</P>
<P>initially assigned to a floater reserve line during the line</P>
<P>award process will be ineligible to be involuntarily assigned</P>
<P>(junior manned) to another open line unless all of the</P>
<P>following conditions are met:</P>
<B><P>20-D-3-a- </B>The open line is a basic line of flying.</P>
<B><P>20-D-3-b- </B>The pilot is available for the entire month, and</P>
<B><P>20-D-3-c- </B>There is an available replacement pilot for the</P>
<P>vacated floater line. Such available replacement must also</P>
<P>be available for the full month.</P>
<B><P>20-D-4- </B>Those pilots not having an awarded line at the</P>
<P>completion of the awarding process will be awarded the</P>
<P>highest numbered reserve line or lines as necessary in</P>
<P>inverse order of seniority.</P>
<I><P>Reserve mov-up</P>
<P>to full lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-5- </B>Full lines which become available after the</P>
<P>completion of the monthly line awarding process may be</P>
<P>assigned to reserve pilots according to their monthly</P>
<P>preferences and seniority; except that any reserve who</P>
<P>desires to remain a reserve may, within forty-eight (48) hours</P>
<P>after the completion of the initial awards, advise the</P>
<P>Company that he desires to keep his reserve assignment; in</P>
<P>which case he shall not be moved up under this provision. To</P>
<P>be eligible to be moved up, a pilot must be available for a full</P>
<P>month, as defined above.</P>
<B><P>Page 203&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-D-6 </P>
</B><I><P>Reserve mov-up</P>
<P>to partial lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-6- </B>If, at any time, a partial line becomes available,</P>
<P>such partial line may be offered to reserve pilots who are</P>
<P>available for all of the flying, in seniority order. Trips</P>
<P>remaining unassigned after following the above procedure</P>
<P>will be assigned in accordance with Section 20-H.</P>
<I><P>Reassignment as</P>
<P>a result of</P>
<P>schedule error</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-7- </B>Should a pilot's schedule be published which</P>
<P>contains an error which results in a pilot losing flying, he may</P>
<P>be given, when the error is discovered, an assignment under</P>
<P>Section 20-F-1. The pilot's scheduled pay credit will be the</P>
<P>greater of his original line of flying or his new line of flying</P>
<P>assigned under this provision.</P>
<B><P>20-D-8-</P>
<P>20-D-8-a- </B>If a pilot is awarded a line of flying which</P>
<P>requires overwater or INS qualifications and he is not so</P>
<P>qualified, he will be assigned the appropriate training so</P>
<P>as to be qualified whenever possible, in sufficient time to</P>
<P>allow him to fly his first trip sequence which requires such</P>
<P>qualification.</P>
<I><P>Reserve will</P>
<P>receive necessary</P>
<P>training to be</P>
<P>qualifier for</P>
<P>overwater and</P>
<P>INS.</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-8-b- </B>A pilot assigned a reserve line in an equipment</P>
<P>type and status and in an equipment domicile which has</P>
<P>trip sequences that require overwater or INS</P>
<P>qualifications, and he is not so qualified, he will be</P>
<P>assigned the appropriate training so as to be qualified</P>
<P>whenever possible.</P>
<I><P>Maintaining</P>
<P>special</P>
<P>qualification</P>
</I><B><P>20-D-8-c- </B>Once a pilot is qualified, he shall be required</P>
<P>to maintain his qualification while holding an assignment</P>
<P>in an equipment domicile in which there are schedules</P>
<P>which require such qualification. Should the pilot be</P>
<P>assigned to an equipment domicile in which there is no</P>
<P>scheduled flying which requires such qualifications, he</P>
<P>may be required to maintain his overwater qualification.</P>
<P>Any pilot who is already qualified may, at his option, retain</P>
<P>his qualification even if the Company does not require it.</P>
<B><P>20-D-9- </B>A pilot's schedule assignment is an individual</P>
<P>assignment. Each pilot will fly his assigned trip sequence</P>
<P>unless deviation is permitted or required by the Company or</P>
<P>the application of this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>20-D-10- </B>Trip segments, round trips or series of trips shall</P>
<P>not be split apart from the configuration shown in the</P>
<P>Domicile Schedule Letter if so doing increases the manpower</P>
<P>requirement unless, the Company deems it necessary to</P>
<P>accomplish coverage.</P>
<B><P>Page 204 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-E</P>
<P>20-E- Operational Experience Lines</P>
</B><P>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 6-A-2 and Section</P>
<P>20-B-1-f, initial Captains and initial First Officers will be</P>
<P>assigned designated Operating Experience ("OE") lines upon</P>
<P>completion of DENTK training. The Local Schedule</P>
<P>Committee(s) at the domicile(s) where such lines of flying will</P>
<P>be assigned will select these designated "OE" lines each</P>
<P>month as part of the schedule preparation process. The "OE"</P>
<P>lines may include Initial Operating Experience (IOE) and</P>
<P>continue for the balance of the month in which training is</P>
<P>completed and for the subsequent month. Such designated</P>
<P>"OE" lines for this subsequent month will be assigned in</P>
<P>Seniority order. Lineholders preferencing such "OE" Lines will</P>
<P>be restricted as follows:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<I><P>LSC Designates</P>
<P>"OE" lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-1- </B>The designated ''OE'' lines will be appropriately</P>
<P>identified by the Local Schedule Committee as to Captain or</P>
<P>First Officer ''OE'' lines at the time of posting or preferencing.</P>
<I><P>Original lineholder</P>
<P>reverts to reserve</P>
<P>when trips are</P>
<P>taken for OE</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-2- </B>A pilot awarded a designated ''OE'' line of a like</P>
<P>status will revert to reserve only on the days he would have</P>
<P>flown in that line, not including shaded days, and will not be</P>
<P>available for involuntary TDY. The original lineholder may be</P>
<P>required to fly such portion of the line not required for OE</P>
<P>training. Such pilots will be given as much notice of their</P>
<P>reserve assignments as practical, with the understanding that</P>
<P>early notice is preferable to strict FIFO compliance. Upon</P>
<P>arriving from a trip or returning from days off, the pilot may, at</P>
<P>his request, be placed at the top of the FIFO list. Additionally,</P>
<P>the following provisions shall apply to those equipment</P>
<P>domiciles that have international lines of flying:</P>
<B><P>20-E-2-a- </B>In equipment domiciles that have only</P>
<P>international trips, pilots originally assigned to OE lines</P>
<P>will be subject to the international rules for reserve</P>
<P>assignments.</P>
<B><P>20-E-2-b- </B>In equipment domiciles which have both</P>
<P>international and domestic trips, 50% of the OE lines in</P>
<P>each pilot status will be identified and advertised as lines</P>
<P>in which the originally assigned pilot will not be subject to</P>
<P>assignments that are scheduled into his days off per</P>
<P>domestic reserve rules. Those pilots originally assigned to</P>
<P>the remaining 50% of the OE lines may be subject to</P>
<P>assignments as reserves into their schedule days off, as</P>
<P>provided under the international reserve rules. The.</P>
<B><P>Page 205&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-E-2-c </P>
</B><P>Company will designate the lines at the time of</P>
<P>preferencing. If an odd number of OE lines exist, the odd</P>
<P>line will be identified as a domestic reserve line for days</P>
<P>off consideration. If only one OE line is available for</P>
<P>preferencing, it will be identified as international for</P>
<P>assignment purposes.</P>
<I><P>Original lineholder</P>
<P>may designate 6/7</P>
<P>HDO's</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-2-c- </B>A pilot who is subject to assignment as a</P>
<P>reserve into his scheduled days off (International rules)</P>
<P>may designate any block of RDO's in this scheduled line</P>
<P>as holy days off (HDO's). This block may be up to a total</P>
<P>of six (6) consecutive days off (seven (7) consecutive</P>
<P>days off in a 31 day month). If the selected block does not</P>
<P>contain six/seven (6/7) HDO's, the pilot may move days</P>
<P>from any other block of RDO's in order to bring the total in</P>
<P>the designated block to six/seven (6/7). The RDO's moved</P>
<P>must come from the front or back of selected block(s) of</P>
<P>RDO's</P>
<B><P>20-E-2-d- </B>A pilot who is subject to assignment as a</P>
<P>reserve into scheduled days off (International rules) but</P>
<P>who may be removed from only part of the OE line, will</P>
<P>still designate a block of six/seven (6/7) days as HDO's as</P>
<P>though he would be on reserve for the entire month. This</P>
<P>designation must be made prior to the beginning of the OE</P>
<P>month. The pilot will fly the published line trips unless</P>
<P>removed, at which point he will pick up the remaining days</P>
<P>off sequence in the line.</P>
<B><P>20-E-2-e- </B>The Company will not assign an international</P>
<P>trip assignment to an OE reserve that disrupts his RDO</P>
<P>unless he is the only reserve available for the assignment.</P>
<B><P>20-E-2-f- </B>If an OE reserve is worked into one or more of</P>
<P>his RDO's, he shall have the days off restored in</P>
<P>accordance with Section 3-E-7 of the International</P>
<P>Supplement.</P>
<B><P>20-E-3- </B>At the time of preferencing, a pilot preferencing an</P>
<P>"OE" line shall have the opportunity to indicate whether he</P>
<P>prefers to fly the line (as opposed to being removed from the</P>
<P>line under this provision). Such preference will be taken into</P>
<P>consideration in seniority order when "OE" lines are assigned</P>
<P>to newly transitioned pilots.</P>
<B><P>Page 206 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section20-E-4</P>
</B><I><P>Pay for giving up</P>
<P>of line</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-4- </B>A Pilot awarded an "OE" line who is removed from</P>
<P>all or part of the line will be paid his line value including legal</P>
<P>inbounds plus three (3) hours override or eighty-four (84)</P>
<P>hours (up to eighty-six (86) hours in a flex month), whichever</P>
<P>is greater, for relinquishing his line. In the event of a full line</P>
<P>move-up only the pilot inconvenienced as per paragraph 20-</P>
<P>E-2 above will receive the pay provisions of this paragraph.</P>
<I><P>Must have 100</P>
<P>hours to be</P>
<P>awarded OE line</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-5- </B>First Officers preferencing a Captain "OE" line and</P>
<P>Captains preferencing a First Officer "OE" line must have</P>
<P>completed a minimum of one hundred (100) hours in that</P>
<P>assignment to be eligible to be awarded such "OE" lines.</P>
<B><P>20-E-6-</P>
<P>20-E-6-a- </B>If a Captain is senior enough to be awarded a</P>
<P>primary line of flying through preferencing upon his</P>
<P>activation into his initial Captain assignment, and if he</P>
<P>does preference and is awarded such a line, that line shall</P>
<P>become his "OE" line.</P>
<B><P>20-E-6-b- </B>If a First Officer is senior enough to be</P>
<P>awarded a primary line of flying through preferencing upon</P>
<P>his activation into his initial First Officer assignment, and if</P>
<P>he does preference and is awarded such a line, that line</P>
<P>shall become his "OE" line providing that the Captain</P>
<P>holding the line has completed a minimum of 100 hours in</P>
<P>that assignment.</P>
<B><P>20-E-7- </B>A pilot who has completed any transition training</P>
<P>may, with his concurrence, for the remainder of the month</P>
<P>and the next full calendar month, be assigned out of reserve</P>
<P>FIFO order open trips with a Captain or First Officer, as</P>
<P>appropriate, who has a minimum of one hundred (100) hours</P>
<P>in type.</P>
<B><P>20-E-8- </B>Whenever a pilot, who has been removed from his</P>
<P>line, is available without disruption to an assignment(s)</P>
<P>already given, the Company will attempt to return the pilot to</P>
<P>the trip(s) in his original line if the trip(s) is not needed for</P>
<P>"OE".</P>
<I><P>Pick-up of flying</P>
<P>by displaced OE</P>
<P>lineholder</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-9- </B>When a pilot is removed from all or part of his line</P>
<P>under this paragraph, the Company will make available to the</P>
<P>pilot, until 28 hours prior to the first day of each reserve</P>
<P>period, known open flying which is available on those days</P>
<P>the pilot converts to reserve status and also flying which</P>
<P>becomes open during the pilot's reserve available days. The</P>
<P>pilot may pick up such open flying as follows:.</P>
<B><P>Page 207&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-E-9-a </P>
<P>20-E-9-a- </B>If the pilot desires to pick up open flying which</P>
<P>would be scheduled during this current period of work</P>
<P>days, or if he is on days off at the time of the transaction</P>
<P>and desires to pick up open flying scheduled during his</P>
<P>next period of work days, he will be allowed to pick up:</P>
<B><P>20-E-9-a-(1) </B>Any trip that begins on the first day of</P>
<P>availability after scheduled days off, or</P>
<B><P>20-E-9-a-(2) </B>Any trip or combination of trips that</P>
<P>completely fills all available work days in that period of</P>
<P>availability, or</P>
<B><P>20-E-9-a-(3) </B>Any trip that ends on the last day of</P>
<P>availability (except that a pilot qualified and available</P>
<P>to be assigned under international reserve rules must</P>
<P>have OPBCM concurrence), or</P>
<B><P>20-E-9-a-(4) </B>With OPBCM concurrence, a combination</P>
<P>of trips, one beginning on the first day of availability</P>
<P>and another ending on the last day which together do</P>
<P>not fill all available work days.</P>
<P>This provision shall not prevent the Company from assigning the pilot a reserve assignment(s) pursuant to paragraph 2 above, on all remaining unassigned reserve work days.</P>
<B><P>20-E-9-b- </B>If the pilot is picking up open flying to place in</P>
<P>a period of available work days that are in the future,</P>
<P>beyond the periods described above, he may fill those</P>
<P>blocks of available work days in any order; however, he</P>
<P>must pick up enough open flying to fill all available work</P>
<P>days in a selected block.</P>
<I><P>Displaced pilot</P>
<P>OE reserve</P>
<P>assignments over</P>
<P>month-end</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-10- </B>The following rules will apply to reserve</P>
<P>assignments over month end whenever an OE reserve pilot is</P>
<P>involved.</P>
<B><P>20-E-10-a- </B>Such assignments will first be given to regular</P>
<P>reserves.</P>
<B><P>20-E-10-b- </B>Such assignment will next be given to eligible</P>
<P>OE reserve pilots for whom the assignment will not cause</P>
<P>a repair in the subsequent month. (It will remain the pilot's</P>
<P>option to exceed the allowable scheduling cap.)</P>
<B><P>20-E-10-c- </B>Such assignments will lastly be given to</P>
<P>eligible OE reserve pilots for whom a repair is required in</P>
<P>the subsequent month. The assignment in this case may</P>
<P>extend into the subsequent month only for a number of</P>
<P>days no greater than the original days of carry over of the</P>
<P>last trip scheduled in the original OE line of flying.</P>
<B><P>Page 208 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-E-11</P>
</B><I><P>Trip trading by</P>
<P>pilots on OE lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-E-11- </B>The following rules will apply to pilots assigned OE</P>
<P>lines when trip trading with open flying.</P>
<B><P>20-E-11-a- </B>A newly qualified pilot who is assigned an OE</P>
<P>line for consolidation of training will not be permitted by</P>
<P>OPBCM to trade, pick-up or drop trips in that line.</P>
<B><P>20-E-11-b- </B>The pilot assigned to the "companion" line;</P>
<P>i.e. the assigned Captain on a First Officer OE line or the</P>
<P>assigned First Officer on a Captain OE line, will not be</P>
<P>subject to any special restrictions on their trading,</P>
<P>dropping or picking up trips.</P>
<B><P>20-E-11-c- </B>If a pilot awarded an OE line is not removed</P>
<P>from his awarded line prior to the beginning of the OE</P>
<P>month, he will be permitted to trade, pick up or drop trips</P>
<P>only if the changes do not affect the line after the date on</P>
<P>which he is planned to be removed from that line. For this</P>
<P>purpose, the pilot will be advised by OPBCM of the date</P>
<P>that he is planned to be removed from the awarded line,</P>
<P>upon his inquiry.</P>
<B><P>20-E-12- </B>If, due to unforeseen circumstances, the</P>
<P>designated "OE" lines for a month are insufficient for all pilots</P>
<P>requiring "OE", those pilots not assigned an "OE" line may be</P>
<P>assigned out of reserve FIFO order open trips with a Captain</P>
<P>or First Officer, as appropriate, who has a minimum of one</P>
<P>hundred (100) hours in type. Each initial assignment made to</P>
<P>reserves under this paragraph will either be (1) a complete</P>
<P>published sequence or (2) a portion of a single published</P>
<P>sequence or (3) any sequence to which a complete crew is</P>
<P>assigned as a unit.</P>
<B><P>20-E-13- </B>A pilot who has completed transition training and</P>
<P>is not senior enough to be awarded a line of flying under</P>
<P>paragraph 20-E-6 above, need not be assigned to an "OE"</P>
<P>line if he has a known absence and/or the pilot has not</P>
<P>completed his IOE on or before the 15th of the month. In</P>
<P>either circumstance, the pilot may be assigned trips as</P>
<P>described in Paragraph 20-E-10, above.</P>
<B><P>20-F- Assignment or Reassignment</P>
</B><P>Assignment limitations contained in this Paragraph are</P>
<P>waivable with pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1- At Home Domicile</P>
</B><P>When a pilot assigned to a line of flying, loses at his home</P>
<P>domicile a trip sequence or originating portion thereof which.</P>
<B><P>Page 209&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-F-1-a </P>
</B><P>appeared in his assigned line of flying due to illegality, being</P>
<P>out of position, cancellation, consolidation or equipment</P>
<P>substitution, he may be assigned or reassigned by the</P>
<P>Company as follows:</P>
<I><P>Loss of</P>
<P>assignment prior</P>
<P>to report at home</P>
<P>domicile</P>
<P>suspension of</P>
<P>UAL operation</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-1-a- </B>If he is advised of the loss of his assigned</P>
<P>flying prior to reporting to the airport for such flying, the</P>
<P>Company shall at that time exercise one of the following;</P>
<P>except that if the loss of his assigned flying is due to the</P>
<P>suspension of United's operations at the domicile the</P>
<P>Company shall exercise one of the following within two (2)</P>
<P>hours after operations are resumed:</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-a-(1) </B>He may be required to deadhead to any</P>
<P>point to connect with the remainder of his scheduled</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<I><P>Telephone</P>
<P>available 4 hours</P>
<P>prior to original</P>
<P>departure</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-1-a-(2) </B>Require him to be telephone available for</P>
<P>a period not to exceed four (4) hours for a potential</P>
<P>flight assignment; such four (4) hour period shall be</P>
<P>subsequent to the legal rest and within the period of</P>
<P>the trip sequence which he lost, except that the period</P>
<P>may start up to four (4) hours prior to the scheduled</P>
<P>departure of the trip lost.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-a-(3) </B>Give him a flight assignment (possibly</P>
<P>including deadheading to accomplish the balance of his</P>
<P>assigned trip) which falls within the limitations</P>
<P>specified in Section 5-G-1-a-(1); including assignment</P>
<P>under Section 8-L-6.</P>
<I><P>Reassignment</P>
<P>cannot depart</P>
<P>prior to 1800 or 3</P>
<P>hours earlier than</P>
<P>original departure</P>
<P>time</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-1-a-(4) </B>Any flight assignment given under this</P>
<P>Paragraph F-1 including deadheading, cannot be</P>
<P>scheduled to depart prior to 1800 or three (3) hours</P>
<P>before the pilot's originally scheduled departure,</P>
<P>whichever is earlier.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-a-(5) </B>Require him to report to the airport for a</P>
<P>four (4) hour standby assignment and potential flight</P>
<P>assignment; such four (4) hour standby assignment to</P>
<P>commence at the scheduled departure time of the trip</P>
<P>sequence he has lost. Any flight assignment given the</P>
<P>pilot during this four (4) hour standby period must fall</P>
<P>within the limitations specified in sub-paragraph 20-F-1-</P>
<P>c below, based on his duty time for the standby</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-a-(6) </B>Relieve him from responsibility for</P>
<P>assignment under the provisions of this Paragraph F.</P>
<B><P>Page 210&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Section 20-F-1-b</P>
</B><I><P>Loss of</P>
<P>assignment after</P>
<P>report to home</P>
<P>domicile</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-1-b- </B>If he is advised of the loss of his assigned</P>
<P>flying after reporting to the airport, the Company shall</P>
<P>exercise one of the following within two (2) hours of the</P>
<P>time he was advised of the loss of his assigned flying;</P>
<P>except that if the loss of his assigned flying is due to the</P>
<P>suspension of United's operations at the domicile, the pilot</P>
<P>may be released from duty and the Company shall</P>
<P>exercise one of the following within two (2) hours after</P>
<P>operations are resumed.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-b-(1) </B>He may be required to deadhead to any</P>
<P>point to connect the remainder of his scheduled</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-b-(2) </B>He may be reassigned other flying within</P>
<P>that duty period which falls within the limitations</P>
<P>specified in sub-paragraph 1-c below (including</P>
<P>deadheading to accomplish the balance of his assigned</P>
<P>trip).</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-b-(3) </B>He may be reassigned other flying which</P>
<P>falls within the limitations specified in Section 5-G-1-a-(</P>
<P>1) after being given a legal rest; including assignment</P>
<P>under Section 8-L-6.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-b-(4) </B>Require him to be telephone available for</P>
<P>a period not to exceed four (4) hours for a potential</P>
<P>flight assignment; such four (4) hour period shall not</P>
<P>commence prior to his receiving a legal rest</P>
<P>subsequent to being released from duty.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-b-(5) </B>Relieve him from responsibility for</P>
<P>assignment under the provisions of this Paragraph F.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-c- </B>Any reassignment given a pilot under the</P>
<P>provisions of sub-paragraph 20-F-1-a or 20-F-1-b above</P>
<P>must comply with all of the following limitations:</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-c-(1) </B>The pilot's total scheduled on duty period</P>
<P>must comply with reassignment provisions of Section</P>
<P>5-G-2-a-(1).</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-c-(2) </B>Any reassignment cannot be scheduled to</P>
<P>interfere with the next scheduled calendar day off</P>
<P>appearing in the pilot's assigned line of flying.</P>
<I><P>Optional hotel</P>
<P>when</P>
<P>reassignment is 2</P>
<P>turnarounds vs.</P>
<P>mult-duty period</P>
<P>assignment</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-1-c-(3) </B>If a reassignment produces an additional</P>
<P>"layover(s)" at the pilot's domicile during the period of</P>
