<P>his original assignment, the pilot shall, upon request,</P>
<P>be provided a local hotel room.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-c-(4) </B>If the reassignment given is scheduled to</P>
<P>interfere with the outbound portion of the next trip.</P>
<B><P>Page 211&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-F-1-d </P>
</B><P>sequence appearing in the pilot's assigned line of</P>
<P>flying, the loss of such next trip sequence shall not</P>
<P>subject him to reassignment under this Paragraph F,</P>
<P>except that the pilot may be positioned to fly a portion</P>
<P>of his scheduled trip.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-c-(5) </B>If the reassignment given was not</P>
<P>scheduled to interfere with the outbound portion of his</P>
<P>next trip sequence, but if the actual operation does</P>
<P>interfere, the loss of such trip sequence shall not</P>
<P>subject him to reassignment under this Paragraph F,</P>
<P>except that the pilot may be positioned to fly a portion</P>
<P>of his scheduled trip.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-d-</P>
<P>20-F-1-d-(1) </B>If a pilot is assigned a telephone</P>
<P>availability or standby period and no assignment is</P>
<P>made, the pilot is relieved of responsibility under this</P>
<P>Paragraph F-1.</P>
<B><P>20-F-1-d-(2) </B>Once a pilot is reassigned flying as</P>
<P>provided in this Paragraph F-1 a subsequent loss of</P>
<P>that flying will not subject him to further assignment</P>
<P>under this Paragraph 20-F-1, except that the pilot may</P>
<P>be required to complete a portion of his original</P>
<P>scheduled trip sequence which is operating and for</P>
<P>which he is legal.</P>
<B><P>20-F-2- Away From Home Domicile</P>
</B><I><P>Loss of</P>
<P>assignment after</P>
<P>leaving home</P>
<P>domicile and</P>
<P>reassignment</P>
<P>provisions</P>
<P>Return home</P>
<P>within 16 hours / 8</P>
<P>hours into day off</P>
<P>Complete original</P>
<P>Schedule</P>
</I><P>When a pilot assigned to a line of flying or a reserve assigned</P>
<P>a trip pairing loses any portion of an assigned trip pairing</P>
<P>beyond the originating segment, he may be reassigned to</P>
<P>other known open flying, including deadheading to such</P>
<P>flying, provided such trip or trips is scheduled to return him to</P>
<P>his home domicile within sixteen (16) hours of his originally</P>
<P>scheduled arrival at his home domicile and provided further</P>
<P>such assignment does not extend more than eight (8) hours</P>
<P>into a pilot's calendar day off. A pilot reassigned other known</P>
<P>open flying due to the loss of a portion of his scheduled flying</P>
<P>may subsequently be required to complete a portion of his</P>
<P>original scheduled trip sequence which is operating and for</P>
<P>which he is legal.</P>
<I><P>Reassignment</P>
<P>away from home</P>
<P>due to weather</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-2-a- </B>In the event, that due to weather, a pilot cannot</P>
<P>return to his domicile at the end of the last scheduled duty</P>
<P>period of a trip sequence and is, therefore, required to</P>
<P>layover at an airport other than an airport serving his</P>
<P>domicile as listed in Section 5-G-1-b-(3); he may.</P>
<B><P>Page 212 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-F-2-b</P>
</B><P>subsequently be assigned to any known open flying which</P>
<P>will expediently return him to his domicile, notwithstanding</P>
<P>the sixteen (16) and eight (8) hour time limits contained in</P>
<P>Section 20-F-2 above. In no case, however, will such pilot</P>
<P>be reassigned flying which would return him to his</P>
<P>domicile more than eighteen (18) hours later than his</P>
<P>scheduled return, without his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>20-F-2-b- </B>A pilot who is required to remain at a non-crew</P>
<P>domicile location to protect equipment that is</P>
<P>unserviceable for mechanical reasons will be assigned to</P>
<P>fly the equipment to the location where it is to be utilized.</P>
<P>Under this provision, return of the pilot to his domicile</P>
<P>must not exceed by more than twenty-four (24) hours the</P>
<P>time which his assignment when he left his home domicile</P>
<P>was scheduled to return him to his home domicile.</P>
<I><P>Cessation of UAL</P>
<P>operations and</P>
<P>reassignment to</P>
<P>expedite return</P>
<P>home</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-2-c- </B>Notwithstanding sub-paragraph 2-b above, a</P>
<P>pilot who has lost all or portion of a trip(s) he was</P>
<P>scheduled to fly and is unable to return to his domicile as</P>
<P>a result of the cessation of United operations, either at his</P>
<P>domicile or at the airport at which he lost his scheduled</P>
<P>flying, may, when operations are resumed, be reassigned</P>
<P>to other known open flying which will expediently return</P>
<P>him to his domicile, otherwise, he may be assigned to</P>
<P>deadhead to his domicile.</P>
<I><P>Charter and ferry</P>
<P>Reassignment</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-2-d- </B>Any pilot assigned a charter or ferry trip</P>
<P>sequence that requires a subsequent revision may be</P>
<P>required to complete the revised itinerary to an on-line</P>
<P>station where relief can be provided. Any such revised</P>
<P>assignment must be scheduled in accordance with the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 5 and must return the pilot to his</P>
<P>home domicile within sixteen (16) hours of his originally</P>
<P>scheduled arrival time and provided further such</P>
<P>assignment does not extend more than eight (8) hours into</P>
<P>a pilot's calendar day off.</P>
<B><P>20-F-2-e- </B>If the reassignment given above interferes with</P>
<P>the pilot's next scheduled trip sequence, the loss of such</P>
<P>next scheduled trip sequence shall not subject him to</P>
<P>reassignment under Paragraph 20-F-1-a or 20-F-1-b,</P>
<P>except that the pilot may be positioned to fly a portion of</P>
<P>his scheduled trip.</P>
<B><P>20-F-3- </B>Trip pairings which are scheduled to operate over a</P>
<P>month-end from "Month A" into "Month B" may be revised at</P>
<P>any time prior to the closing of schedule preferencing for</P>
<P>"Month B".</P>
<B><P>Page 213&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-F-4 </P>
</B><I><P>Notice for trips</P>
<P>over mont-end</P>
</I><P>Complete information on these revisions will be made public</P>
<P>and will be available at all domiciles so that pilots may</P>
<P>consider the effect of the changes when preferencing</P>
<P>schedules for the following month. Any month-end pairing</P>
<P>revisions which are not available at each domicile prior to</P>
<P>1200 noon (local time) on the day before schedules close</P>
<P>must be made under the provisions of Section 20-F-1. (In the</P>
<P>event that a month-end pairing becomes involved in a change</P>
<P>under Section 20-F-4 below, that change shall not be subject</P>
<P>to the provisions of this sub-paragraph, but shall be subject</P>
<P>only to the provisions of Section 20-F-4).</P>
<I><P>Schedule changes</P>
<P>after posting</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of 20-F-1, 20-F-2,</P>
<P>and 20-F-3 above, when a trip sequence(s) is (are) cancelled</P>
<P>or modified as a result of a change made to the applicable</P>
<P>airline system schedule after pilot schedules are posted for</P>
<P>preferencing, the schedules may be awarded as posted and</P>
<P>the affected pilots may be assigned other flying as follows:</P>
<I><P>Changes to</P>
<P>minimum number</P>
<P>of lines</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-a- </B>The changes to lines of flying will be limited to</P>
<P>the fewest number of lines consistent with efficient</P>
<P>scheduling and those affected pilots will be notified as</P>
<P>soon as possible after the changes are made.</P>
<I><P>Same days </P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-b- </B>The primary effort will be to assign the revised</P>
<P>pairing on the same day(s) the pilot(s) was scheduled to</P>
<P>fly. No revised lines may exceed the applicable monthly</P>
<P>flight time cap provided in Section 5.</P>
<I><P>Pilot hotel option</P>
<P>at home domicile</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-c- </B>If a reassignment produces an additional</P>
<P>"layovers" at the pilot's domicile during the period of his</P>
<P>original assignment, the pilot shall, upon request, be</P>
<P>provided a local hotel room.</P>
<I><P>Telephone</P>
<P>Availability</P>
<P>Assigned on work</P>
<P>days not</P>
<P>previously</P>
<P>reassigned</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-d- </B>A pilot who is assigned a line with fewer duty</P>
<P>periods than were contained in his original line may, at the</P>
<P>time of initial notification of the revision, be given Section</P>
<P>20-F-1-a-(2) assignments on days he was originally</P>
<P>scheduled to fly. The Company will make such</P>
<P>assignments available as far in advance as possible.</P>
<I><P>Lineholder</P>
<P>reassigned to</P>
<P>reserve</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-e- </B>Should the schedule change result in a</P>
<P>reduction of flying at the domicile equivalent to one line of</P>
<P>flying or more, any pilot who loses all of his flying may be</P>
<P>assigned a reserve line which will retain the days off he</P>
<P>had in his original line. Such reserve shall be put on the</P>
<P>FIFO list ahead of all other reserves after each day off and.</P>
<B><P>Page 214 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-F-4-f</P>
</B><P>shall be available for assignment during the first</P>
<P>assignment period each day.</P>
<I><P>SSC consultation </P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-f- </B>The System Schedule Committee shall be</P>
<P>afforded the opportunity to consult with and make</P>
<P>recommendations on schedule revisions made under the</P>
<P>provisions of this Paragraph 20-F-4.</P>
<I><P>More than 5% of</P>
<P>the lines changed</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-g- </B>No more than five percent (5%) of pilot</P>
<P>schedules will be subject to reassignment under this</P>
<P>provision in any one month. Should an occasion arise</P>
<P>which requires revision to more than five percent (5%) of</P>
<P>schedules, all reassignments must be made under the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 20-F-1.</P>
<I><P>SSC consultation</P>
</I><B><P>20-F-4-h- </B>Notwithstanding the five percent (5%) limit</P>
<P>above, in the event of a major disruption to service</P>
<P>outside of the Company's control (such as that created by</P>
<P>the 1981 Air Traffic Controller's strike), the Company may</P>
<P>revise schedules to the extent necessary to maintain the</P>
<P>highest level of service possible. In such event, the</P>
<P>Company will work closely with the pilot members of the</P>
<P>System Schedule Committee to insure that passenger</P>
<P>schedule integrity is maintained without imposing</P>
<P>unnecessary disruption on pilots' schedules.</P>
<B><P>20-G- Open Flying</P>
<P>20-G-1- </B>Pilots who desire open flying shall advise the</P>
<P>Company. The following information will be furnished by the</P>
<P>pilot: his status and equipment type, priority rating, days</P>
<P>available for open trip(s), as well as the amount of flight time</P>
<P>desired. A pilot shall request the Company to remove his</P>
<P>name when he no longer desires open flying.</P>
<B><P>20-G-2- </B>Open flying being covered will be described by the</P>
<P>system crew scheduler at the time of assignment. If such</P>
<P>assignment is revised at any time prior to initial scheduled</P>
<P>departure of that assignment, the crew scheduler will notify</P>
<P>the pilot involved as soon as possible.</P>
<I><P>May combine</P>
<P>open trips</P>
<P>assignment</P>
</I><B><P>20-G-3- </B>In the assignment of open flying, trips may be</P>
<P>combined with other open trips at any location at the time of</P>
<P>original assignment..</P>
<B><P>Page 215&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-G-4 </P>
</B><I><P>Open trips</P>
<P>assignment up to</P>
<P>28 hours</P>
<P>Early assignment</P>
</I><B><P>20-G-4- </B>An open trip shall be considered to be still open</P>
<P>until twenty-eight (28) hours before scheduled departure, or</P>
<P>until assigned to a pilot, whichever is later; except that an</P>
<P>open trip may be assigned to a PI at any time. An open trip</P>
<P>may be assigned at any time during the twenty-eight (28)</P>
<P>hour period preceding scheduled departure time, however, it</P>
<P>shall be considered desirable to assign such trips as soon as</P>
<P>practicable. When there is an open trip scheduled to depart,</P>
<P>or be assigned during normal rest hours (in general from</P>
<P>2100-0600 local time), the pilot who will be assigned the trip</P>
<P>shall be assigned twelve (12) hours or more prior to its</P>
<P>scheduled departure, when possible.</P>
<B><P>20-G-4-a- </B>If, because of irregular operations, an</P>
<P>assigned pilot, when away from his home domicile is in</P>
<P>position to fly his regularly scheduled trip after it has been</P>
<P>assigned as an open trip, he will be entitled to return to</P>
<P>that trip, unless he is involved with a conflicting</P>
<P>assignment and such assignment cannot be covered by</P>
<P>the pilot assigned his scheduled trip.</P>
<I><P>Lineholder must</P>
<P>advise crew desk</P>
<P>14 hours prior to</P>
<P>trip departure in</P>
<P>returning from</P>
<P>sick leave</P>
</I><B><P>20-G-4-b- </B>Notwithstanding the twenty-eight (28) hour</P>
<P>provision of this sub-paragraph G-4, a pilot assigned to fly</P>
<P>a schedule who has been on sick leave shall be entitled to</P>
<P>fly his scheduled trip only if he advises the crew desk</P>
<P>fourteen (14) or more hours prior to the scheduled</P>
<P>departure of the trip that he has obtained or plans to</P>
<P>obtain his return to work medical release.</P>
<B><P>20-G-5- </B>If it becomes apparent that an inbound crew cannot</P>
<P>make their connection with time to provide for adequate</P>
<P>preparation, a crew may be called for protection of the trip.</P>
<B><P>20-G-5-a- </B>Once a crew has been called for such</P>
<P>protection, such crew will fly the protected trip if sufficient</P>
<P>time, as outlined below, does not exist. In the event a</P>
<P>sufficient time interval has developed to allow the original</P>
<P>crew to make their connection, it will be the prerogative of</P>
<P>the original crew to fly their scheduled trip, unless a</P>
<P>legality problem has been created.</P>
<B><P>20-G-5-b- </B>Every effort will be made to advise the inbound</P>
<P>crew of the plan regarding protection. (Note: "Sufficient</P>
<P>time" as outlined herein shall mean not less than thirty</P>
<P>(30) minutes.).</P>
<B><P>Page 216 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-G-6</P>
<P>20-G-6- </B>Assignment of pilots to trips will be made based on</P>
<P>the scheduled or planned departure times of the trips at the</P>
<P>time of the assignment. Subsequent changes in departure</P>
<P>time of trips will not change assignments unless additional</P>
<P>irregularities in crew assignments will result.</P>
<B><P>20-G-7- </B>A pilot who is deadheaded to another station to fly a</P>
<P>particular trip, included under Section 8-L-6-a of the Pilots'</P>
<P>Agreement, will be assigned that trip at the time of leaving</P>
<P>his home domicile. A pilot assigned a trip under Section 8-L-6-</P>
<P>b shall be considered assigned upon notification of the</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<I><P>Minimum rest at</P>
<P>home prior to</P>
<P>junior manning</P>
<P>Specific release</P>
<P>from duty to</P>
<P>commence rest</P>
</I><B><P>20-G-8- </B>A pilot may not be given an assignment as junior</P>
<P>man available or as the only reserve available with less than</P>
<P>ten hours and forty-five minutes (10:45) free from duty at his</P>
<P>home domicile; except, a pilot may be given an assignment</P>
<P>as junior man available or as the only reserve available as</P>
<P>part of a previously scheduled duty period, provided such</P>
<P>assignment can be made within the limitations of the</P>
<P>previously scheduled duty period. A pilot who is given an</P>
<P>assignment as the only reserve available as part of a</P>
<P>previously scheduled duty period will not be given a</P>
<P>subsequent assignment under the provisions of this sub-paragraph, without his concurrence, and must be given legal</P>
<P>rest at his home domicile following the assignment. In the</P>
<P>application of this sub-paragraph, a pilot, upon completion of</P>
<P>an assignment, will be specifically advised if he is not</P>
<P>released from duty and is not commencing a rest period.</P>
<B><P>20-G-9- </B>When a trip terminates at other than the scheduled</P>
<P>airport serving a metropolitan area (i.e., JFK/EWR/LGA, BWI/</P>
<P>IAD/ DCA, ORD/MDW, SEA/BFI, SFO/SJC/OAK, LAX/ONT/</P>
<P>BUR, MIA/PBI/FLL) and:</P>
<B><P>20-G-9-a- </B>Movement of the equipment to the scheduled</P>
<P>airport is expected within three (3) hours of arrival at the</P>
<P>alternate or positioning of the equipment at the alternate</P>
<P>airport is desired after unloading, the inbound crew will be</P>
<P>assigned to accomplish such movement or positioning</P>
<P>unless the crew scheduler, knowing that such assignment</P>
<P>will cause the inbound crew to be illegal for their turn trip,</P>
<P>or illegal for their next assigned trip, can specifically</P>
<P>release the inbound crew. Duty time limitations specified</P>
<P>in Section 5-G-2-a-(1) shall not be exceeded.</P>
<B><P>20-G-9-b- </B>Movement of the equipment to the scheduled</P>
<P>airport is expected beyond three (3) hours of arrival at the</P>
<P>alternate airport, the inbound crew will be released as.</P>
<B><P>Page 217&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-G-10 </P>
</B><P>soon as possible after any necessary equipment</P>
<P>positioning at the alternate airport and protection for</P>
<P>moving the airplane to the scheduled airport will be</P>
<P>accomplished in accordance with open trip coverage at</P>
<P>the domicile.</P>
<B><P>20-G-10- </B>Charter Flying</P>
<B><P>20-G-10-a- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 20-</P>
<P>H, a particular pilot(s) may, on a voluntary basis, be</P>
<P>assigned by the Company to a charter in order to comply</P>
<P>with the needs and desires of the charterer.</P>
<I><P>Restoration of</P>
<P>days off</P>
</I><B><P>20-G-10-b- </B>If a pilot assigned a charter under sub-paragraph 20-G-10-a above is a lineholder, and if the</P>
<P>charter assignment results in a loss of days off below the</P>
<P>minimum days off, the number of days needed to restore</P>
<P>the minimum days off will be provided in the current</P>
<P>month, if possible, or if not possible, in the following</P>
<P>month.</P>
<B><P>20-H- Open Trip Coverage At Domiciles</P>
</B><P>All open trips occurring at or assigned to a pilot domicile will</P>
<P>be covered in the following order:</P>
<B><P>20-H-1- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a pilot who has lost</P>
<P>his scheduled flying in accordance with Paragraph 20-F of</P>
<P>this Section.</P>
<I><P>Mak-up of ALPA</P>
<P>flight pay loss</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-2- </B>Open flying will be offered to those pilots who have dropped flying to attend an MEC meeting or a meeting scheduled with the Company which was later cancelled or rescheduled. This provision shall be used to offset billings to the
Association for the dropped trip(s) when the pilot is not returned to the trip originally dropped for ALPA business.</P>
<I><P>Mak-up for ANP</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-3- </B>Open flying will be offered to home assigned pilots</P>
<P>in the status and equipment type involved who have</P>
<P>voluntarily dropped trips for personal reasons or are picking</P>
<P>up time for the application of Section 13-A-2, in the following</P>
<P>manner:</P>
<B><P>20-H-3-a- </B>The flying will be offered in seniority order to</P>
<P>the pilots who request it.</P>
<B><P>20-H-3-b- </B>Such flying will not be offered to a pilot if it will</P>
<P>disrupt his assigned schedule for the current or</P>
<P>succeeding month or project him over eighty-one (81)</P>
<P>actual hours (over to eighty-three (83) actual hours in a.</P>
<B><P>Page 218 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section20-H-4</P>
</B><P>flex month) in either month or reduce him below twelve</P>
<P>(12) days off in a thirty (30) day month or thirteen (13)</P>
<P>days off in a thirty-one (31) day month, (fourteen (14) days</P>
<P>off for Shuttle) in either month.</P>
<B><P>20-H-4-</P>
</B><I><P>Mak-up for</P>
<P>ALPA flight pay</P>
<P>Loss</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-4-a- </B>Open flying will be offered to those pilots who</P>
<P>have dropped flying for ALPA duties. Such open flying</P>
<P>picked up shall be used to offset billings to the</P>
<P>Association.</P>
<I><P>PI open flying </P>
</I><B><P>20-H-4-b- </B>Open flying may be offered to Pilot Instructors</P>
<P>picking up open flying under the provisions of Letter of</P>
<P>Agreement 89-2.</P>
<B><P>20-H-4-c- </B>Open flying will be offered in seniority order to</P>
<P>pilots requesting it under this subparagraph.</P>
<B><P>20-H-5-</P>
</B><I><P>Pic-up of</P>
<P>additional monthly</P>
<P>flying</P>
</I><P>Open flying may be offered to home assigned lineholder</P>
<P>pilots in the status and equipment type involved who have</P>
<P>indicated a desire to volunteer for open flying in order to</P>
<P>increase their pay projection. Flying shall be offered in</P>
<P>seniority order among those requesting it. Assignment under</P>
<P>this provisions shall not project the pilot over eighty-one (81)</P>
<P>actual flight hours (over to eighty-three (83) actual flight</P>
<P>hours in a flex month) in the current or succeeding month nor</P>
<P>reduce him below twelve (12) days off in a thirty (30) day</P>
<P>month or thirteen (13) days off in a thirty-one (31) day month,</P>
<P>(fourteen (14) days off for Shuttle) in either month.</P>
<B><P>20-H-6- </B>Open flying may be offered to flight management</P>
<P>personnel who are on the Pilots' System Seniority List.</P>
<P>Management flying under this provision shall not be on a</P>
<P>displacement basis.</P>
<B><P>20-H-7- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a reserve who is on</P>
<P>standby basis in accordance with Section 5-G-5 of this</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<I><P>--6</P>
<P>reassignment to</P>
<P>prevent double</P>
<P>deadhead</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-8- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a visiting reserve</P>
<P>pilot, in the status and equipment type involved, who is not</P>
<P>assigned to fly a return trip and the assignment is scheduled</P>
<P>to return the pilot to his home domicile without exceeding the</P>
<P>limitations specified in Paragraph 20-F of this Section. Pilots</P>
<P>assigned under Section 8-L-6 may be reassigned under this</P>
<P>priority to prevent a double deadhead.</P>
<B><P>Page 219&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-H-9 </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><I><P>Misconnecting of</P>
<P>inbound crew</P>
<P>reassignment</P>
<P>Return home</P>
<P>within 16 hours or</P>
<P>8 hours into day</P>
<P>off</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-9- </B>If the open trip is created because an inbound crew</P>
<P>will not connect to their assigned sequence because of</P>
<P>delays, illegality or cancellation, coverage of their trip may be</P>
<P>provided by assigning it to another crew for whose flying the</P>
<P>misconnecting crew is legal. The assignment must also</P>
<P>return him to his home domicile within sixteen (16) hours of</P>
<P>his originally scheduled arrival time and must not extend</P>
<P>more than eight (8) hours into his day off, except with pilot</P>
<P>concurrence or as otherwise provided in Paragraph 20-F-2 of</P>
<P>this Section.</P>
<I><P>Misconnected</P>
<P>trade rules</P>
</I><P>Following is the order of consideration under this Paragraph:</P>
<B><P>20-H-9-a- </B>Trade with any crew who can accomplish the</P>
<P>flying without impact on their remaining scheduled trip</P>
<P>sequences.</P>
<B><P>20-H-9-b- </B>Trade with any crew to avoid a delay or further</P>
<P>delay in the departure of the open trip, provided reserve</P>
<P>coverage would cause a greater delay.</P>
<I><P>Home reserve</P>
<P>Assignment</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-10- </B>Open flying will be assigned to home reserve pilots</P>
<P>in the status and equipment type involved.</P>
<I><P>Open flying may</P>
<P>be assigned to</P>
<P>reserves under -</P>
<P>-6</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-11- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a reserve pilot in</P>
<P>equipment type and status from another domicile under the</P>
<P>provisions of Section 8-L-6.</P>
<B><P>20-H-12- </B>Open flying may be assigned to home reserve</P>
<P>pilots in the status and equipment type involved who have</P>
<P>previously been assigned, if the planned departure time of</P>
<P>the open flying being covered is earlier than the planned</P>
<P>departure time of the originally assigned trip. In the</P>
<P>application of this Paragraph, the reserve pilot who is legal</P>
<P>and who is assigned to the latest departure will be moved up</P>
<P>and assigned to the unanticipated earlier departure.</P>
<B><P>20-H-13- </B>Open flying will be assigned to visiting reserve</P>
<P>pilots in the status and equipment type involved who are not</P>
<P>assigned to fly a return trip.</P>
<I><P>Senior/Junior</P>
<P>Manning</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-</P>
<P>20-H-14-a- </B>Open flying may be assigned in the following</P>
<P>order to pilots at the domicile in the status and equipment</P>
<P>type involved who are available and qualified. No pilot will</P>
<P>be obligated to accept any flying offered under this</P>
<P>provision.</P>
<B><P>Page 220 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-H-14-b</P>
<P>20-H-14-a-(1) </B>Trips will be offered in seniority order to</P>
<P>pilots who have indicated to OPBCM that they desire to</P>
<P>be notified of open flying and:</P>
<B><P>20-H-14-a-(1)-(a) </B>Whose schedules will be legal</P>
<P>after the trip is assigned, or</P>
<I><P>Senior manning</P>
<P>schedule</P>
<P>adjustment</P>
<P>Limitation of duty</P>
<P>period plus 1 for</P>
<P>trip drop</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-a-(1)-(b) </B>Whose schedules can be made</P>
<P>legal after the trip is assigned with a trip drop(s)</P>
<P>where the total number of duty periods dropped</P>
<P>does not exceed the number of duty periods added</P>
<P>by more than one. If there is a choice of trips with</P>
<P>an equal number of duty periods that can be</P>
<P>dropped to make the line legal, the trip(s) to be</P>
<P>dropped will be mutually agreed upon by the pilot</P>
<P>and the crew scheduler. If agreement cannot be</P>
<P>reached, the offer of open flying will be withdrawn.</P>
<I><P>Junior manning</P>
<P>schedule</P>
<P>adjustment</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-a-(2) </B>Trips will be offered, in inverse order of</P>
<P>seniority, to pilots whose schedules are legal, or can be</P>
<P>made legal, in accordance with the provisions of sub-paragraphs</P>
<P>(1)-(a) and (b) above.</P>
<I><P>Mutual agreement</P>
<P>for senior</P>
<P>manning drop</P>
<P>No limitation on</P>
<P>duty period for trip</P>
<P>drop</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-a-(3) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of sub-paragraphs</P>
<P>(1)-(a) and (b) above, trips will be offered</P>
<P>in seniority order to pilots who have indicated to</P>
<P>OPBCM that they desire to be notified of open flying</P>
<P>and whose schedules can be made legal after the trip</P>
<P>is assigned. If there is a choice of trips that can be</P>
<P>dropped to make the line legal, the trip(s) to be</P>
<P>dropped will be mutually agreed upon by the pilot and</P>
<P>the crew scheduler. If agreement cannot be reached,</P>
<P>the offer of open flying will be withdrawn.</P>
<B><P>20-H-14-a-(4) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of sub-paragraph</P>
<P>20-H-14-a-(1)-(a) and 20-H-14-a-(1)-(b)</P>
<P>above, trips will be offered in inverse order of seniority</P>
<P>to pilots whose schedules can be made legal after the</P>
<P>trip is assigned.</P>
<I><P>Sr/Jr manning pay</P>
<P>credit</P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-b- </B>The flight pay credit projection of a pilot's line</P>
<P>of flying who accepts a trip under this provision will be the</P>
<P>value of his line immediately before or immediately</P>
<P>following the trip assignment and repair of his line, if any,</P>
<P>whichever is greater. Additionally, the pilot's actual</P>
<P>projection will be adjusted to reflect the value of his actual</P>
<P>hours flown.</P>
<B><P>Page 221&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-H-14-c </P>
</B><I><P>Incentive Pay </P>
</I><B><P>20-H-14-c- </B>A pilot who accepts and actually departs on</P>
<P>an assignment under this provision will receive incentive</P>
<P>pay in accordance with Section 3-B-7-c of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>20-H-14-d- </B>A pilot who is assigned a trip with a planned</P>
<P>departure time within nine (9) hours of the planned</P>
<P>departure time of the trip to be covered shall not be</P>
<P>considered to be available under this provision. If no pilots</P>
<P>are available in this category, the assignment will be made</P>
<P>to the most junior pilot in the status and equipment type</P>
<P>involved regardless of the planned departure time of his</P>
<P>next scheduled trip.</P>
<P>NOTE: A pilot is not available if his monthly projection</P>
<P>cannot be reduced below eighty-one (81) actual hours</P>
<P>(below eighty-three (83) actual hours in a flex month) (or</P>
<P>his projection, if higher) or his monthly minimum days off</P>
<P>cannot be restored. Additionally, a Shuttle pilot is not</P>
<P>available if his schedule cannot be restored to at least 14</P>
<P>days off.</P>
<B><P>20-H-15- </B>With pilot concurrence, open flying may be</P>
<P>assigned to a pilot who is legal, qualified and in position, or</P>
<P>who can be positioned, to accomplish the desired operation</P>
<P>in a timely manner.</P>
<B><P>20-H-16- </B>Should a lineholder be required to take sick leave</P>
<P>for a trip which he has been assigned under the provisions of</P>
<P>this Section 20-H, he shall be eligible for paid sick leave for</P>
<P>that trip under the same provisions and conditions as if the</P>
<P>trip were part of his scheduled line at the time it was</P>
<P>awarded.</P>
<B><P>20-I- Open Trip Coverage At Non-Domiciles</P>
</B><P>All open trips at non-domiciles will be covered in the following</P>
<P>order:</P>
<B><P>20-I-1- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a pilot who has lost</P>
<P>his scheduled or assigned flight(s), providing such</P>
<P>assignment will position him to continue his assigned</P>
<P>scheduled sequence of trips or return him to his home</P>
<P>domicile within the limitations of Paragraph 20-F-2 of this</P>
<P>Section.</P>
<B><P>Page 222 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-I-2</P>
<P>20-I-2- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a pilot at that</P>
<P>location or at some other location who was not assigned to fly</P>
<P>a return trip, if the assignment is scheduled to return the pilot</P>
<P>to his home domicile without exceeding the limitations of</P>
<P>Paragraph 20-F-2 of this Section. Home domicile for a</P>
<P>Section 8-L-6 assigned pilot is his actual domicile and not the</P>
<P>domicile from which the trip sequence was scheduled to</P>
<P>originate.</P>
<I><P>Open trip</P>
<P>coverage at no-</P>
<P>domicile</P>
</I><B><P>20-I-3- </B>If the open trip is created because an inbound crew</P>
<P>will not connect their assigned sequence because of delays,</P>
<P>illegality or cancellation, coverage of their trip may be</P>
<P>provided by assigning it to another crew, for whose flying the</P>
<P>misconnecting crew is legal. Any assignment under this</P>
<P>provision must not interfere with either crew's next scheduled</P>
<P>sequence of trips out of their home domicile and must return</P>
<P>the pilots involved to their home domicile within sixteen (16)</P>
<P>hours of their originally scheduled arrival time and must not</P>
<P>extend more than eight (8) hours into a scheduled day off</P>
<P>except as provided in Paragraph 20-F-2 of this Section.</P>
<P>Following is the order of consideration under this Paragraph:</P>
<B><P>20-I-3-a- </B>Trade with a crew from the same domicile as</P>
<P>the misconnecting crew.</P>
<B><P>20-I-3-b- </B>Trade with a crew from some other domicile.</P>
<B><P>20-I-4- </B>If time permits deadheading on-line, assign the open</P>
<P>trip to a domicile for coverage.</P>
<B><P>20-I-5- </B>Assign the open flying to a pilot who can accomplish</P>
<P>the operation without any disruption of his assigned flying</P>
<P>sequence other than deadheading or rest periods.</P>
<I><P>Only man</P>
<P>qualified at no-</P>
<P>domiciles</P>
</I><B><P>20-I-6- </B>Open flying may be assigned to a pilot who is the</P>
<P>only man legal, qualified and in position, or who can be</P>
<P>positioned, to accomplish the desired operation. Without pilot</P>
<P>concurrence, assignment under this sub-paragraph 6 must</P>
<P>not delay the pilot's return to his home domicile more than</P>
<P>sixteen (16) hours beyond the time his assignment when he</P>
<P>left his home domicile would normally return him to his home</P>
<P>domicile or more than eight (8) hours into his next scheduled</P>
<P>day off except as provided in Paragraph 20-F-2 of this</P>
<P>Section.</P>
<B><P>20-J- Scheduling of Reserve Crews</P>
<P>20-J-1- General.</P>
<P>Page 223&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-1-b </P>
<P>20-J-1-a- Standby Lists</P>
<P>20-J-1-a-(1) </B>Reserves shall be placed on a one (1) day,</P>
<P>two (2) day, three (3) day, or four (4) or more day</P>
<P>availability list in accordance with the number of days</P>
<P>available for reserve assignment remaining before their</P>
<P>next scheduled unavailable days.</P>
<I><P>Legal rest for</P>
<P>reserve who</P>
<P>reports but does</P>
<P>not fly</P>
<P>Option to remain</P>
<P>at top or bottom of</P>
<P>list</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-a-(2) </B>A reserve who reports for an assignment</P>
<P>but does not fly and is released will be entitled to a</P>
<P>legal rest and may at his option remain at the top or</P>
<P>revert to the bottom of the appropriate list.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-b-</P>
<P>20-J-1-b-(1) </B>Reserve crew members will be assigned</P>
<P>open flying or standby on a first-in first-out rotation with</P>
<P>other reserves in their status and equipment type in the</P>
<P>following manner:</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>Duty Period &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Periods Available</P>
<U><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 or more</P>
</B></U><P>1 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O</P>
<P>2 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O</P>
<P>3 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O</P>
<P>4 or more&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X</P>
</FONT><I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Position a reserve</P>
<P>to fly his line</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-b-(2) </B>If reserve coverage is available, reserve</P>
<P>rotation will be modified to permit a pilot currently</P>
<P>assigned as a reserve to be in position to legally fly the</P>
<P>initial trip in his awarded line, unless such positioning</P>
<P>will cause interruption of a lineholder's schedule or a</P>
<P>reserve's time off pattern.</P>
<I><P>Reserve route</P>
<P>check and FIFO</P>
<P>modification</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-b-(3) </B>Provided the pilot receives at least forty-eight (48) hours notice, reserve rotation may be</P>
<P>modified to enable a reserve pilot to accomplish an en</P>
<P>route check by a check airman. With pilot concurrence,</P>
<P>the forty-eight (48) hour notice requirement may be</P>
<P>waived.</P>
<I><P>Reserve on TDY</P>
<P>may request top</P>
<P>of FIFO list</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-b-(4) </B>Reserve rotation may be modified to allow</P>
<P>a reserve pilot assigned under Section 8-L-5 to</P>
<P>voluntarily be placed at the top of the appropriate FIFO</P>
<P>list upon reporting for his temporary duty assignment</P>
<P>and upon returning from any flight assignment during</P>
<P>the temporary duty period.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 224 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-1-c</P>
</B><I><P>Procedure for</P>
<P>assigning reserve</P>
<P>as PC fil-ins</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-b-(5) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of</P>
<P>Paragraph 20-J-1-b-(1) above, when a line reserve fill-in for PC/PT's is required, such fill-in will be selected</P>
<P>as follows:</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-b-(5)-(a) </B>A reserve will be sent from the</P>
<P>same domicile as the rest of the crew, if available,</P>
<P>without jeopardizing other coverage. Otherwise, a</P>
<P>reserve will be sent from any other domicile where</P>
<P>adequate coverage is available, giving</P>
<P>consideration to maintaining an equitable</P>
<P>distribution among domiciles.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-b-(5)-(b) </B>No reserve will be assigned to</P>
<P>more than one (1) fill-in during any single month,</P>
<P>unless all other available reserves at that domicile</P>
<P>have already received one or more such</P>
<P>assignments.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-b-(5)-(c) </B>No reserve will be given more than</P>
<P>three (3) fill-in assignments during any consecutive</P>
<P>six (6) month period, if the reserve advises the</P>
<P>Company of this fact at the time of assignment;</P>
<P>unless no other reserve with fewer assignments is</P>
<P>available on the system.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-c- </B>In the event that a reserve pilot deadheads to</P>
<P>his home domicile on a trip being flown by another reserve</P>
<P>pilot of the same domicile who has the same number of</P>
<P>days available, the deadheading pilot shall take his</P>
<P>position on the first-in, first-out list ahead of the pilot flying</P>
<P>the trip.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-c-(1) </B>When a pilot returns to reserve</P>
<P>assignment from a schedule assignment, he shall, for</P>
<P>the purpose of determining his first-in, first-out</P>
<P>position, be considered to have arrived exactly at</P>
<P>midnight beginning the day when the reserve</P>
<P>assignment began and will be available for duty. In the</P>
<P>event more than one pilot becomes available for</P>
<P>reserve at the same time, their relative position on the</P>
<P>first-in, first-out list shall be determined by their arrival</P>
<P>time at home after their last flying assignment. In any</P>
<P>case, a pilot beginning a reserve assignment will take a</P>
<P>position on the appropriate first-in, first-out list behind</P>
<P>any continuing reserve who is already positioned.</P>
<B><P>Page 225&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-1-d </P>
</B><I><P>0600 departure</P>
<P>following</P>
<P>vacation, leave or</P>
<P>training</P>
<P>Return from sick</P>
<P>leave training of 4</P>
<P>days or less</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-1-c-(2) </B>A pilot on reserve shall not be required to</P>
<P>report for duty to fly or deadhead on a trip which is</P>
<P>scheduled to depart from his home domicile prior to</P>
<P>0600 local domicile time on the day following his</P>
<P>vacation, leave or training of five (5) days or more. A</P>
<P>reserve returning from sick leave will resume his</P>
<P>reserve assignment upon release for duty by the</P>
<P>Medical Department. A reserve involved in training</P>
<P>assignments of four (4) days or less will be available</P>
<P>after any required rest periods.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-d- </B>A reserve will progress normally through the</P>
<P>first-in, first-out rotation until he reaches first-up on the</P>
<P>appropriate list, at which point he will remain until he</P>
<P>reports for a flying assignment or a standby protection</P>
<P>assignment or goes on a days-off period. A reserve pilot</P>
<P>returning from a days-off, sick leave, training or vacation</P>
<P>or a reserve returning from a line assignment or</P>
<P>Association business, will enter the appropriate list behind</P>
<P>other available reserves already on that list.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-e- </B>A reserve pilot who has been assigned a trip</P>
<P>may be removed at any time prior to three (3) hours before</P>
<P>the scheduled departure of the trip for the assignment of a</P>
<P>pilot under the provisions of Paragraph 20-F-1.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-f- </B>A reserve pilot may maintain his position on the</P>
<P>first-in, first-out list, or at his option, revert to the bottom</P>
<P>of the first-in, first-out list when:</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-f-(1) </B>He is displaced.</P>
<B><P>20-J-1-f-(2) </B>He is a reserve covered by Section 5-G-5-</P>
<P>c</P>
<B><P>20-J-2- Reserve System Options:</P>
</B><P>The following options will be available to a pilot while on</P>
<P>reserve status:</P>
<I><P>Traditional - FIFO </P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-a- </B>Traditional Option: A reserve who does not</P>
<P>contact OPBCM to elect one of the other options available</P>
<P>under this Paragraph 2 will be a Traditional reserve. A</P>
<P>Traditional reserve will progress normally through the first-in, first-out list until he receives an assignment in</P>
<P>accordance with the provisions of sub-paragraph 20-J-1-d</P>
<P>above.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-b- Active Option</P>
<P>Page 226 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-2-c</P>
</B><I><P>Active - top of list </P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-b-(1) </B>A reserve may volunteer to go to the top</P>
<P>of the FIFO list. A reserve who elects this option will be</P>
<P>given an assignment just as though he had progressed</P>
<P>through the FIFO list in accordance with Paragraph 20-J-1-d above.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-b-(2) </B>A reserve's position on the FIFO list under</P>
<P>this option will be determined by the time the reserve</P>
<P>blocked in from his last assignment, i.e., a reserve who</P>
<P>blocked in at 1700 will go ahead of a reserve who</P>
<P>blocked in at 1800 regardless of when the individual</P>
<P>pilots volunteer to go to the top of the FIFO list. This</P>
<P>block in time rule (block in time of last flight</P>
<P>assignment) also applies to a reserve coming off days</P>
<P>off.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-b-(3) </B>A reserve who volunteers to go to the top</P>
<P>of the FIFO list under this provision and who</P>
<P>subsequently does not receive an assignment by 2359</P>
<P>of the day before his last day of availability shall revert</P>
<P>to the position on the FIFO list he would have been if</P>
<P>he had not volunteered to go to the top of the list.</P>
<I><P>Aggressive -</P>
<P>pick-up</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c- </B>Aggressive Option: A reserve may volunteer for</P>
<P>an assignment on a first-come first-served basis pursuant</P>
<P>to the following provisions:</P>
<I><P>28/24 window </P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c-(1) </B>All flying that is known to be open more</P>
<P>than twenty-eight (28) hours before the scheduled</P>
<P>departure time of the trip will be available for pick-up</P>
<P>between twenty-eight (28) hours and twenty-four (24)</P>
<P>hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<I><P>28 and 12 - 4 hour</P>
<P>window</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c-(2) </B>Flying that becomes open between</P>
<P>twenty-eight (28) hours and twelve (12) hours before</P>
<P>the scheduled departure time of the trip will be</P>
<P>available for pick-up for a period of four (4) hours after</P>
<P>the trip opened up or until twelve (12) hours before</P>
<P>scheduled departure time, whichever is earlier.</P>
<I><P>Pick-up resulting</P>
<P>from sick leave</P>
<P>between 14 and</P>
<P>12 hours</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c-(3) </B>Trips that become open as a result of</P>
<P>short term sick leave will be available for pick-up as</P>
<P>follows:</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-c-(3)-(a) </B>The initial trip for which a lineholder</P>
<P>places himself on sick leave will be available for</P>
<P>pick-up for a period of up to four (4) hours beginning</P>
<P>at the time the trip becomes open but ending not</P>
<P>later than twelve (12) hours before the scheduled.</P>
<B><P>Page 227&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-2-c </P>
</B><P>departure time of the trip.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-c-(3)-(b) </B>Any subsequent trip(s) for which</P>
<P>the lineholder remains on sick leave will be</P>
<P>available for pick-up not earlier than fourteen (14)</P>
<P>hours and not later than twelve (12) hours before</P>
<P>the scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<I><P>Silo concept</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c-(4) </B>A reserve may pick up a trip that has the</P>
<P>same number of days, or the same number minus one,</P>
<P>as the number of days of availability before his next</P>
<P>scheduled unavailable days (Silo concept - length of</P>
<P>assigned ID must be not less than days of availability</P>
<P>minus one). With OPBCM concurrence, a reserve may</P>
<P>pick up a trip that is not within his silo.</P>
<I><P>Subsequent</P>
<P>illegal projection</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-c-(5) </B>A reserve may pick up a trip for which he</P>
<P>is projected to be legal while he is flying a current</P>
<P>assignment. If he subsequently is projected to become</P>
<P>illegal for the trip that he picked up, the trip will be</P>
<P>placed back in open flying and will be picked up by or</P>
<P>assigned to another pilot in accordance with the</P>
<P>provisions of this Paragraph J-2.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-c-(6) </B>A reserve may, with OPBCM concurrence,</P>
<P>move an RDO(s) to pick up a trip.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-d- Voluntary Short Call Out Option</P>
</B><I><P>Short call for trips</P>
<P>within 5 hours</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-d-(1) </B>A reserve may volunteer to go on a Short</P>
<P>Call Out List, on a duty period by duty period basis, for</P>
<P>assignment to trips that become open five (5) hours or</P>
<P>less before the scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-d-(2) </B>Notwithstanding their relative positions on</P>
<P>the FIFO list, a reserve on the Voluntary Short Call Out</P>
<P>list will be assigned to a trip that opens up five (5)</P>
<P>hours or less before the scheduled departure time of</P>
<P>the trip ahead of pilots who have elected the Active or</P>
<P>Traditional options.</P>
<I><P>Remain on short</P>
<P>call list until</P>
<P>midnight or end of</P>
<P>rest period</P>
<P>Reversion to</P>
<P>traditional option</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-d-(3) </B>A reserve who volunteers to be on the</P>
<P>Short Call Out list will remain on that list until midnight</P>
<P>of the day on which he volunteered or at the end of his</P>
<P>designated rest period, whichever is earlier, at which</P>
<P>time he will revert to the Traditional option.</P>
<B><P>20-J-2-d-(4) </B>A reserve will remain in his original</P>
<P>position on the FIFO list during the time he is a Short.</P>
<B><P>Page 228 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-3</P>
</B><P>Call Out reserve and after he falls off the Short Call</P>
<P>Out list unless he has elected the Active option.</P>
<I><P>Short call reserve</P>
<P>remains on</P>
<P>traditional FIFO</P>
<P>for trips grater</P>
<P>than 5 hours out</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-2-d-(5) </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of this sub-paragraph J-2-d, the Company may assign a trip to a</P>
<P>Short Call Out reserve more than five (5) hours before</P>
<P>the scheduled departure time of the trip in accordance</P>
<P>with the provisions of sub-paragraph 20-J-1-d above.</P>
<B><P>20-J-3- Reserve Rest</P>
</B><P>Designated rest periods will be determined as follows:</P>
<I><P>Base rest period</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-3-a- </B>The company may designate up to four (4)</P>
<P>base rest periods per day in each fleet/seat/domicile for</P>
<P>monthly preferencing. Reserves will be awarded a base</P>
<P>rest period which will continue on a day by day basis</P>
<P>unless changed as a result of the application of the</P>
<P>provisions of sub-paragraph 20-J-3-b, paragraph 20-J-3-d</P>
<P>and paragraph 20-J-3-e below.</P>
<B><P>20-J-3-b- </B>A reserve shall return to his original base rest</P>
<P>period following an assignment, RDOs and other known</P>
<P>absences except sick leave where the following provisions</P>
<P>shall apply:</P>
<B><P>20-J-3-b-(1) </B>Returning from sick leave not requiring a</P>
<P>medical clearance - the nine (9) hours immediately</P>
<P>preceding the time the reserve calls off sick leave shall</P>
<P>be considered to be his designated rest period. If the</P>
<P>reserve is not assigned to an ID that day with a</P>
<P>scheduled departure time prior to the start of his base</P>
<P>rest period then he will return to his base rest period.</P>
<B><P>20-J-3-b-(2) </B>Returning from sick leave requiring a</P>
<P>medical clearance - the reserve shall have a default</P>
<P>designated rest period from 1800 of the day he</P>
<P>received his medical clearance until 0300 of the</P>
<P>following day.</P>
<B><P>20-J-3-c- </B>A reserve shall also return to his original base</P>
<P>rest period following an assignment unless he receives a</P>
<P>subsequent assignment that has a check in time before</P>
<P>the beginning of his base rest period. Notwithstanding</P>
<P>this provision, however, a pilot may pick up a trip under</P>
<P>the provisions of Section 20-J-2-c that has a check in time</P>
<P>after the beginning of his base rest period.</P>
<B><P>Page 229&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-3-d </P>
</B><I><P>Last 9 hours prior</P>
<P>to checking in is</P>
<P>designated rest</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-3-d- </B>When given a flight assignment the last nine</P>
<P>(9) hours in the period following the receipt of the</P>
<P>assignment prior to check in time will be the reserve's</P>
<P>designated rest period.</P>
<I><P>Last 9 hours of</P>
<P>contractual rest</P>
<P>will be designated</P>
<P>rest</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-3-e- </B>A reserve returning from an assignment may,</P>
<P>within four (4) hours after his scheduled arrival time,</P>
<P>designate the last nine (9) hours of his contractual rest to</P>
<P>be his FAA required rest period for the purpose of being a</P>
<P>voluntary short call-out reserve under Section 20-J-2-d</P>
<P>following his rest period.</P>
<B><P>20-J-4- Reserve Assignments</P>
</B><P>Reserves shall be assigned known open flying in accordance</P>
<P>with the following:</P>
<P>Note: As contained herein, "Available for assignment" is that</P>
<P>time following the Aggressive Pick-up window under</P>
<P>Paragraph 20-J-2-c-(1), Paragraph 20-J-2-c-(2), and</P>
<P>Paragraph 20-J-2-c-(3) above.</P>
<I><P>0700- 2300</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-4-a- </B>Trips that becomes available for assignment</P>
<P>between the hours of 0700 and 2300:</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-a-(1) </B>A trip that becomes available for</P>
<P>assignment twenty-four (24) hours before the</P>
<P>scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned at</P>
<P>that time.</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-a-(2) </B>A trip that becomes available for</P>
<P>assignment between twenty-four (24) hours and twelve</P>
<P>(12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip will be assigned as soon as it is available.</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-a-(3) </B>A trip that becomes open less than twelve</P>
<P>(12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip will be assigned as soon as it is known to be open.</P>
<I><P>2301 - 0659 </P>
</I><B><P>20-J-4-b- </B>Trips that becomes available for assignment</P>
<P>between the hours of 2301 and 0659:</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-b-(1) </B>A trip that becomes available for</P>
<P>assignment twenty-four (24) hours before the</P>
<P>scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned at</P>
<P>that time but the reserve will not be notified of the</P>
<P>assignment until 0700.</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-b-(2) </B>A trip that becomes available for</P>
<P>assignment between twenty-four (24) hours and twelve</P>
<P>(12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip will be assigned twelve (12) hours before the.</P>
<B><P>Page 230 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-4-c</P>
</B><P>scheduled departure time of the trip or at 0700,</P>
<P>whichever is earlier.</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-b-(3) </B>A trip that becomes open less than twelve</P>
<P>(12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip will be assigned so as to provide the reserve with a</P>
<P>reasonable amount of time to report for the trip or at</P>
<P>0700, whichever is earlier, unless waiting to make the</P>
<P>assignment would cause an otherwise available</P>
<P>reserve to become illegal for the assignment</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-c- </B>In the application of sub-paragraph 20-J-4-a</P>
<P>and paragraph 20-J-4-b above the following shall apply:</P>
<B><P>20-J-4-c-(1) </B>Assignments will be made to the first</P>
<P>reserve, in first-in, first-out order, who is legal for the</P>
<P>assignment notwithstanding the fact that waiting to</P>
<P>make the assignment would result in assigning the trip</P>
<P>to a reserve who is closer to the top of the list.</P>
<I><P>If no reserves are</P>
<P>available,</P>
<P>Company may</P>
<P>wait to assign</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-4-c-(2) </B>If no reserves are legal for an assignment</P>
<P>at the time a trip becomes open or available for</P>
<P>assignment (including those reserves on required rest)</P>
<P>the Company may wait to make the assignment to a</P>
<P>reserve who subsequently will become legal for the</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<I><P>Company call</P>
<P>during designated</P>
<P>rest period</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-5- </B>The Company will not call a reserve during his</P>
<P>designated rest period unless no other reserves are available</P>
<P>for the assignment. A reserve will not be required to answer</P>
<P>his phone or accept any assignment offered during his</P>
<P>designated rest period.</P>
<I><P>Non-augmented</P>
<P>international</P>
<P>flying under</P>
<P>domestic rules</P>
<P>treated as</P>
<P>domestic</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-6- </B>All non-augmented international flying operated</P>
<P>under domestic contract rules, except that flying conducted</P>
<P>under Section 5-H of the Agreement, will, for the purposes of</P>
<P>the required rest rule, be treated as domestic flying.</P>
<I><P>Conversion of</P>
<P>reserve to</P>
<P>international</P>
<P>standby</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-7- </B>In those domicile/fleets that operate both domestic</P>
<P>and augmented international flights, the Company may</P>
<P>convert a reserve to a twenty-four (24) hour international</P>
<P>standby if that reserve is the only reserve available to cover</P>
<P>an anticipated open international trip in his domicile. In this</P>
<P>case the reserve will not be assigned to any domestic trips. If</P>
<P>an international assignment is not made, and he is no longer</P>
<P>the only reserve available, he will be returned to his normal</P>
<P>designated rest period.</P>
<B><P>Page 231&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-8 </P>
<P>20-J-8-</P>
</B><I><P>No double all-nighter</P>
<P>without</P>
<P>pilot concurrence</P>
</I><B><P>20-J-8-a- </B>A reserve returning on a trip which contains a</P>
<P>last segment that is scheduled to arrive at his home</P>
<P>domicile between the hours of 0045 and 0600 will not be</P>
<P>assigned to another trip the last segment of which is</P>
<P>scheduled to arrive between the hours of 0045 and 0600</P>
<P>the following day, without his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>20-J-8-b- </B>Should a pilot be assigned an all nighter (a</P>
<P>segment within the first duty period of a trip pairing that</P>
<P>arrives between 0200 and 0600 local domicile time) and</P>
<P>said pilot does not receive his original awarded rest period</P>
<P>between the time the trip pairing is assigned and check-in</P>
<P>of the trip; this pilot will immediately return to his original</P>
<P>awarded rest period upon completion of the trip pairing.</P>
<B><P>20-J-9- </B>The Company will make known reserves' base and</P>
<P>designated rest periods in UNIMATIC and on the VRU. Any</P>
<P>change to a reserve's designated rest period will be</P>
<P>communicated to the reserve by OPBCM by telephone.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 232 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 20-J-9</P>
</B></FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>This Page Intentionally Left Blank.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 233&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 21-A </P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P>Section 21</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P>General</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>21-A-</P>
</B><P>A pilot shall not be required to pay for the use of any</P>
<P>Company equipment used in personnel training required by</P>
<P>the Company.</P>
<B><P>21-B-</P>
</B><P>A single master personnel file shall be maintained on each</P>
<P>pilot in the employ of the Company in his Flight Manager's</P>
<P>office and shall contain all progress reports, all written orders</P>
<P>issued to him affecting a change of station or status, copies</P>
<P>of all reports and orders issued concerning his pilot status, all</P>
<P>summary records of practice, training and flight checks, and</P>
<P>any other supervisory reports involving said pilot. A single</P>
<P>training file may be maintained on each pilot at the Denver</P>
<P>Training Center and shall contain all records associated with</P>
<P>training and flight checks, including grades received on all</P>
<P>examinations and instructor evaluations involving said pilot.</P>
<P>All orders to pilots assigning them to special duties or to</P>
<P>different stations shall be in writing. A pilot's personnel file</P>
<P>and training file shall be open on request for inspection by</P>
<P>said pilot. Nothing herein shall prevent the Company from</P>
<P>maintaining duplicate files.</P>
<B><P>21-C-</P>
</B><P>Any change or alteration to the pilot uniform must be with the</P>
<P>concurrence of the Uniform Committee.</P>
<B><P>21-D-</P>
</B><I><P>Publishing of the</P>
<P>Contract</P>
</I><P>A convenient booklet containing this Agreement and all</P>
<P>associated documents including Letters of Agreement will be</P>
<P>furnished to the pilots by the Company no later than ninety</P>
<P>(90) days after the signing of this Agreement. Copies of all</P>
<P>additional supplemental amendments or agreements, on the</P>
<P>same paper size and format as the Basic Agreement, will be</P>
<P>furnished to all pilots within forty-five (45) days after signing.</P>
<P>The revisions and additions will be numbered and dated for</P>
<P>record keeping.</P>
<B><P>Page 234 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 21-E</P>
<P>21-E-</P>
</B><I><P>Maintaining</P>
<P>present pass</P>
<P>policy</P>
<P>Additional pass</P>
<P>privileges</P>
<P>extended to other</P>
<P>employees, pilots</P>
<P>also obtain</P>
</I><B><P>21-E-1- </B>It is agreed that the pass transportation regulations</P>
<P>as established by Company policy, in effect as of April 12,</P>
<P>2000, will apply to pilots and will not be changed or</P>
<P>discontinued during the term of this Agreement without first</P>
<P>advising the Association the reason therefor and affording</P>
<P>the Association an opportunity to confer with the Company. It</P>
<P>is further understood that any additional pass entitlements</P>
<P>extended to other employees during the term of this</P>
<P>Agreement will also be extended to pilots, widows and/or</P>
<P>their dependents.</P>
<B><P>21-E-2- </B>A pilot who has ten (10) years of service with the</P>
<P>Company prior to being permanently grounded will be</P>
<P>considered as a retired employee for pass travel privileges.</P>
<B><P>21-F-</P>
</B><P>If requested by the pilot, a UAL pilot representative of ALPA</P>
<P>may be present in the cockpit as an observer on any check</P>
<P>other than a routine check.</P>
<B><P>21-G-</P>
</B><P>With adequate notice, the Company shall honor all requests</P>
<P>from the President's Department of the Association for</P>
<P>release of MEC members and MEC standing committee</P>
<P>members. Other pilots, with adequate notice, will be released</P>
<P>for Association business consistent with the needs of the</P>
<P>service.</P>
<B><P>21-H-</P>
</B><P>There shall be no discrimination between employees covered</P>
<P>by the Agreement because of race, creed, color, sex or</P>
<P>national origin.</P>
<B><P>21-I-</P>
</B><I><P>Parking at no-</P>
<P>pilot domiciles</P>
</I><B><P>21-I-1- </B>In the event parking facilities are not available for</P>
<P>employees at the airport location, the Company will assume</P>
<P>the monthly parking charges up to a maximum of thirty-five</P>
<P>Dollars ($35.00) per month. This provision does not apply to</P>
<P>original or replacement charges for employees for parking</P>
<P>decals, stickers, gate keys or similar items. It is understood</P>
<P>that a pilot may park his car at either his domicile or some</P>
<P>other Company station location, if parking space is available,</P>
<B><P>Page 235&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 21-I-2 </P>
</B><P>in which case the Company shall be obligated to assume only</P>
<P>the expense of one location.</P>
<B><P>21-I-2- </B>If a pilot is scheduled to fly or deadhead from an</P>
<P>airport serving his domicile and parking is not provided for his</P>
<P>automobile, public facilities may be used and charges will be</P>
<P>paid by the Company. Such charges shall be submitted within</P>
<P>ten (10) days on the Company expense forms and will be</P>
<P>supported by a receipt.</P>
<B><P>21-J-</P>
</B><P>The Company shall indemnify a pilot or his estate and</P>
<P>provide defense against any claims, whether by third parties</P>
<P>or by fellow employees, arising out of such pilot's</P>
<P>performance of his duties with the Company as a pilot unless</P>
<P>such claims arise from the willful misconduct of the pilot.</P>
<B><P>21-K-</P>
</B><I><P>Cockpit jumpseat</P>
</I><B><P>21-K-1- </B>The parties agree that the Company will maintain</P>
<P>the new cockpit jumpseat policy established June 15, 1989</P>
<P>which provides that the United cockpit jumpseat may be</P>
<P>granted to other Part 121 air carrier pilots where a reciprocal</P>
<P>cockpit jumpseat agreement is in effect. The Company has</P>
<P>sole discretion in establishing reasonable procedures to</P>
<P>administer this policy.</P>
<B><P>21-K-2- </B>The Company will install a second jumpseat on B-737-300/500 and B-757 aircraft when the aircraft go through</P>
<P>heavy maintenance.</P>
<B><P>21-K-3- </B>Provided seats are available in the cabin, a United</P>
<P>Airlines pilot may travel on OMC authority even if the cockpit</P>
<P>jumpseat(s) are occupied. The pilot will be boarded in the</P>
<P>cabin on OMC authority only after all other stand-by</P>
<P>passengers (revenue and non-revenue) have been boarded.</P>
<P>In the event the Company implements a policy of service-charge-waived employee pass travel, this provision will</P>
<P>expire.</P>
<I><P>Weight restricted</P>
<P>Flight</P>
</I><B><P>21-K-4- </B>A United Airlines pilot will be allowed to travel on</P>
<P>OMC authority and occupy the cockpit jumpseat(s) on a</P>
<P>weight restricted flight.</P>
<B><P>21-L- Mailing of Paychecks</P>
<P>21-L-1- </B>The Company will mail paychecks in accordance</P>
<P>with the following procedures:</P>
<B><P>Page 236 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 21-L-1-a</P>
<P>21-L-1-a- </B>The paychecks will be mailed the day before</P>
<P>their due date.</P>
<B><P>21-L-1-b- </B>The paychecks will be mailed to the pilot's UG-100 address.</P>
<B><P>21-L-1-c- </B>Each pilot may elect four times a year, during a</P>
<P>designated sign-up period, to have his paycheck sent to</P>
<P>his UG-100 address. Once having selected the mailing</P>
<P>option, the service will continue until the pilot requests</P>
<P>that it be terminated. If a pilot fails to select paycheck</P>
<P>mailing, his check will be sent to his domicile office for</P>
<P>pick-up. A pilot may discontinue this check-mailing service</P>
<P>at any time by having his Manager notify EXOPZ.</P>
<B><P>21-L-1-d- </B>The Company shall charge a fee of $6.00 per</P>
<P>year to cover the cost of this service. The service year</P>
<P>shall run from April 1 to March 31.</P>
<B><P>21-L-2- </B>In the event the Company incurs additional</P>
<P>administrative costs due to increased requests for stop</P>
<P>payments, incorrect addresses, etc., the Company may</P>
<P>terminate this procedure, after discussion with the</P>
<P>Association.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold" SIZE=1><P>Contract Admin Home</P>
<P>Instruction Page</P>
<P>Agreement Table of Contents</P>

</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>22-A-</P>
<P>22-A-1- </B>This Agreement shall cancel all Agreements,</P>
<P>Supplemental Agreements, Amendments, Letters of</P>
<P>Understanding and similar related documents executed</P>
<P>between the Company and the Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>prior to the signing of this Agreement with the exception of</P>
<P>those listed in sub-paragraph 2 below and:</P>
<U><P>Letter Number</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>22-C- </B>The Agreement shall become effective as of April 12,</P>
<P>2000, except as provided in Letter 00-XX (Implementation</P>
<P>Schedule).</P>
<B><P>22-D- </B>This Agreement shall continue in full force and effect</P>
<P>until September 1, 2004 and shall renew itself without change</P>
<P>each succeeding September 1 thereafter, unless written notice</P>
<P>of intended change is served in accordance with Section 6, Title</P>
<P>I, of the Railway Labor Act, as amended (the "Act"), by either</P>
<P>party at least two hundred seventy (270) days prior to</P>
<P>September 1, 2004 or any year thereafter upon written notice of</P>
<P>either party thereto. In the event a new tentative collective</P>
<P>bargaining agreement has not been concluded by June 1, 2004</P>
<P>(or June 1 of any year thereafter if applicable), and the services</P>
<P>of the National Mediation Board (the "Board") have not</P>
<P>previously been invoked, the parties will no later than June 1,</P>
<P>2004 (or June 1 of any year thereafter if applicable) jointly</P>
<P>invoke the services of the Board under Section 5 of the Act and</P>
<P>jointly request that the Board release the parties no later than</P>
<P>September 1, 2004 (or September 1 of any year thereafter if</P>
<P>applicable).</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Agreement this</P>
<P>26th day of October, 2000.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

<I><P>ALPA-PAC</P></I></FONT>
