<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">AGREEMENT</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">between</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">and</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="13%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with the provisions</P>
<P>of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED AIR LINES,INC.</P>
<P>(hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>It is mutually agreed:</P>
<B><P>A. </B>The Company agrees to deduct a monthly contribution to the Air Line Pilots</P>
<P>Association Political Action Committee (referred to herein as "ALPA-PAC") from </P>
<P>the pay of each pilot who voluntarily authorizes such contributions on the forms </P>
<P>provided for that purpose by ALPA-PAC (referred to herein as "Check-Off </P>
<P>Forms").</P>
<B><P>B. </B>The language of those forms shall be as follows:</P>
<P>TO: United Air Lines, Inc.</P>
<P>I hereby authorize and direct the Company named above to deduct</P>
<P>$_______________of my gross earnings per month and to remit that amount to </P>
<P>the Air Line Pilots Association Political Action Committee (ALPA-PAC).</P>
<P>This authorization is voluntarily made based on my specific understanding that:</P>
<P>The signing of this authorization card and the making of these voluntary </P>
<P>contributions are not conditions of membership in the Union or of employment by </P>
<P>my employer;</P>
<P>Any guideline amount suggested by ALPA-PAC or its representatives is only a</P>
<P>suggestion and I may contribute more or less and will not be favored or </P>
<P>disadvantaged by the Union for doing so;</P>
<P>I may refuse to contribute without reprisal; and</P>
<B><P>Page 55</P>
</B><P>ALPA-PAC, which is connected with the Air Line Pilots Association, International, </P>
<P>Use the money it receives solely for making contributions to and expenditures for</P>
<P>candidates for federal elected offices.</P>
<P>This authorization shall remain in full force and effect until revoked in writing by </P>
<P>me, pursuant to the provisions of the Agreement between United Air Lines, Inc. </P>
<P>and the Air Line Pilots Association, International.</P>
<P>I further certify that I am either a United States citizen or a foreign national </P>
<P>lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence as defined by </P>
<P>section 101(s) (20) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(s) (20)).</P>
<P>Name __________________________</P>
<P>File Number _____________________</P>
<P>Signature _______________________</P>
<P>Date____________________________</P>
<B><P>C. </B>All Check-Off Forms will be submitted through the Chairman of the Master</P>
<P>Executive Council of the Association who will forward the original signed copy to </P>
<P>the Payroll Accounting Manager, Executive Offices, Chicago, Illinois. A properly </P>
<P>executed Check-Off Form, filed before the 15th of any month, will become </P>
<P>effective the 1st of the month following its receipt by the Payroll Section of the </P>
<P>Accounting Department, Chicago, Illinois. Illegible or improperly executed forms </P>
<P>will be returned to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council of the </P>
<P>Association.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>Any notice of revocation as set forth in the Check-Off Form must be in writing,</P>
<P>signed by the employee and delivered by certified mail, addressed to the Payroll</P>
<P>Accounting Manager, United Air Lines, Inc., P.O. Box 66100, Chicago, Illinois </P>
<P>60666, with a copy to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council as soon as </P>
<P>processed through Company payroll procedures. Check-Off Form and notices so </P>
<P>received by the Company will be stamp-dated on the date received and will </P>
<P>constitute notice to the Company of the date received and not when mailed.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Deduction of a pilot's contribution shall be made each month provided there is </P>
<P>a sufficient balance due the pilot at the time after all other deductions authorized </P>
<P>by the pilot or required by law (including money claims of the Company and the </P>
<P>Credit Union) have been satisfied. Within a reasonable time after the second </P>
<P>regular paycheck issued each month, the Company will remit to ALPA-PAC a </P>
<P>check in payment of all contributions collected for that month pursuant to </P>
<P>outstanding and unrevoked Check-Off Forms, together with a list of the names of </P>
<P>those pilots for whom contributions were deducted and the amount deducted for </P>
<P>each such pilot.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 56</P>
<P>F. </B>A pilot who has executed a Check-Off Form and (1) who resigns from the </P>
<P>Company; (2) who is laid off; or is (3) otherwise terminated from the employ of </P>
<P>the Company shall be deemed to have automatically revoked his assignment as </P>
<P>of the date of such action and if he (1) is rehired; (2) is recalled; or (3) </P>
<P>reemployed, further deductions of ALPA-PAC contributions will be made only </P>
<P>upon execution and receipt of another Check-Off Form.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>It will be the Association's responsibility to verify apparent errors in deduction </P>
<P>of ALPA-PAC contributions before contacting the Company Payroll Accounting </P>
<P>Manager.</P>
<B><P>H. </B>United Air Lines, Inc. shall be held harmless and indemnified by the </P>
<P>Association for any claims which may be made by the pilot or pilots by virtue of </P>
<P>the wrongful application and misapplication of any of the terms of this Section.</P>
<B><P>I. </B>The Association shall pay the Company the reasonable costs incurred in</P>
<P>implementing and maintaining this Section.</P>
<B><P>J. </B>The Association hereby certifies to the Company that:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;J-1- </B>No assignment and authorization will be transmitted to the Company</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hereunder which was obtained by the Association under the twice-yearly</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;solicitation provisions of Section 441b.(b)(4)(B) of Title 2 of the United States</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code;</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;J-2- </B>All funds transmitted to the League hereunder shall be used solely in</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;connection with federal elections.</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Agreement this 8th day of </P>
<P>June, 1983.</P></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP" HEIGHT=22>

<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP" HEIGHT=22>
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>WITNESS:</P>
<U><P>/s/ C.W. Thomson</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ D. L. Pringle</P>
</U><P>David L. Pringle</P>
<P>Vice President Industrial Relations</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP" HEIGHT=8><P></P></TD>

<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP">

<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ J.R. Brace</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ W.C. Brashear</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP" HEIGHT=8>
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ D.A. Clark</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP" HEIGHT=8>
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR THE AIR LINE PILOTS IN THE SERVICE</P>
<P>OF UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>

<TR><TD WIDTH="37%" VALIGN="TOP">

<P>/s/ John P. Ferg</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ Henry A. Duffy</P>
</U><P>Henry A. Duffy, President</P>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 57 </P>
</B><I><P>Voluntary Contributions UAL Pilots Charitable Foundation, Inc.</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with the provisions </P>
<P>of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED AIR LINES, </P>
<P>INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">It is mutually agreed:</P>
<P>During the life of this Pilot Agreement, the Company will deduct from the pay </P>
<P>of each pilot the dollar amount authorized by the pilot and such deduction shall</P>
<P>constitute a contribution to the United Airlines Pilot's Charitable Foundation, Inc.</P>
<P>provided that such pilot voluntarily executes the following agreed upon form </P>
<P>which will be prepared and furnished by the Association and will be known as the </P>
<P>United Airlines Pilots' Charitable Foundation "Check-Off Form":</P>
<P>ASSIGNMENT AND AUTHORIZATION FOR VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTIONS </P>
<P>TO THE UNITED AIR LINES PILOTS' CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, INC.</P>
<P>I, ________________________________, hereby authorize and direct United Air</P>
<P>Lines, Inc. to deduct $________per month of my gross earnings as a contribution </P>
<P>To the United Airlines Pilots' Charitable Foundation, Inc. Such amount so </P>
<P>deducted is hereby assigned to the United Airlines Pilots' Charitable Foundation, </P>
<P>Inc. This assignment and authorization may be revoked by me in writing at any </P>
<P>time. A copy of any such revocation will be sent to the Chairman of the Master </P>
<P>Executive Council.</P>
<P>Signature of Employee _______________________________________</P>
<P>Street Address _____________________________________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 58</P>
</B><P>City ______________________________________________________</P>
<P>File Number ________________________________________________</P>
<P>Organization (Domicile)_______________________________________</P>
<B><P>B. </B>All Check-Off Forms will be submitted through the Chairman of the Master</P>
<P>Executive Council who will forward the original signed copy to the Payroll </P>
<P>Accounting Manager, Executive Offices, Chicago, Illinois. A properly executed </P>
<P>Check-Off Form, filed before the 15th of the month, will become effective the 1st </P>
<P>of the month following its receipt by the Payroll Section of the Accounting </P>
<P>Department, Chicago, Illinois. Illegible or improperly executed forms will be </P>
<P>returned to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council of the Association.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>Any notice of revocation as set forth in the Check-Off Form must be in writing,</P>
<P>signed by the employee, and delivered by certified mail, addressed to the Payroll</P>
<P>Accounting Manager, United Air Lines, Inc., P. O. Box 66100, Chicago, Illinois </P>
<P>60666, with a copy to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council as soon as </P>
<P>processed through Company payroll procedures. Check-Off Form and notices so </P>
<P>received by the Company will be stamp-dated on the date received and will </P>
<P>constitute notice to the Company of the date received and not when mailed.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>Deduction of the contributions shall be made from all paychecks issued each </P>
<P>Month provided there is a sufficient balance due the employee at the time after </P>
<P>all other deductions authorized by the employee or required by law (including </P>
<P>money claims of the Company and the Credit Union) have been satisfied. Within </P>
<P>a reasonable time after the second regular paycheck issued each month, the </P>
<P>Company will remit to the United Airlines Pilots' Charitable Foundation, Inc. a </P>
<P>check in payment of contributions collected for that month pursuant to </P>
<P>outstanding and unrevoked Check-Off Forms. </P>
<B><P>E. </B>An employee who has executed a Check-Off Form and who has been (1)</P>
<P>transferred or promoted to a job not covered by the Agreement; (2) who resigns </P>
<P>from the Company; (3) who is laid off; or is (4) otherwise terminated from the </P>
<P>employ of the Company shall be deemed to have automatically revoked his </P>
<P>assignment as of the date of such action and if he (1) transfers back or returns to </P>
<P>a job covered by the Agreement; (2) is rehired; (3) is recalled; or (4) reemployed, </P>
<P>further deductions of Association dues will be made only upon execution and </P>
<P>receipt of another Check-Off Form.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>United Air Lines, Inc. shall be held harmless and indemnified by the </P>
<P>Association for any claims which may be made by the employee or employees by </P>
<P>virtue of the wrongful application and misapplication of any of the terms of this </P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>This Agreement shall become effective as of the date of signing and shall be</P>
<P>subject to changes in the same manner as specified in Section 22 of the Pilots'</P>
<P>Employment Agreement.</P>
<B><P>Page 59</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Agreement this 12th day </P>
<P>of July, 1983.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>WITNESS:</P></FONT>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 60</P>
</B><I><P>Age 60</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with </P>
<P>the provisions of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED </P>
<P>AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE </P>
<P>PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">It is mutually agreed:</P>
<P>In accordance with the provisions of the Letter of Agreement, dated June 27, </P>
<P>1979, which appears on pages 157-158 of the 1981 Pilot Agreement, and as </P>
<P>directed by order of the United States District Court, dated May 31, 1983, the </P>
<P>parties have met and have agreed upon the following modifications to the </P>
<P>Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement replaced the Letter of Agreement, dated January </P>
<P>19, 1983.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>Second Officers shall be permitted to work beyond age 60.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>Any Captain or First Officer or International Relief Pilot shall be eligible </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to bump, in accordance with his seniority, a Second Officer assignment which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he intends to assume upon reaching age 60. This bump must be made not </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;less than ninety (90) days prior to his 60th birthday.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3- </B>Captains or First Officers or International Relief Pilots exercising a bump </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in accordance with Paragraph A-2 above, must first provide the Company with</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;evidence that he possesses a valid Flight Engineer's certificate or that he has</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;satisfactorily passed the written portion of the FAA Flight Engineer Turbojet </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exam prior to or at the time he exercises his bump.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-4- </B>Pilots who bump into an assignment under the provisions of Paragraph </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2 above, shall not be activated into a Second Officer's assignment prior to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reaching age 60.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 61</P>
<P>A-5- </B>One (1) year prior to age 60, all active pilots shall be required to sign a </P>
<P>statement of intent to inform the Company of his retirement or non-retirement </P>
<P>plan upon reaching the normal retirement age. Any pilot who fails to submit a </P>
<P>statement of intent will be treated as if he intends to continue working beyond </P>
<P>age 60.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such pilot shall be eligible for involuntary vacation assignments under </P>
<P>the provisions of Section 11-E-1 of the Agreement. A pilot who has indicated the </P>
<P>intention of retiring at age 60 and who, within the year prior to reaching age 60, </P>
<P>changes his mind, shall have any accrued vacation due in the current vacation </P>
<P>year liquidated under the provisions of Section 11 of the Agreement to the extent </P>
<P>possible in that vacation year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such pilot shall be eligible for the application of </P>
<P>this provision of Section 11-E-3 of the Agreement even if it increases the amount </P>
<P>of unliquidated vacation.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any vacation not liquidated shall be paid to him at his </P>
<P>current rates at the end of that vacation year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once a pilot reaches age 60, he </P>
<P>shall no longer be entitled to defer liquidation of accrued vacation.</P>
<B><P>A-6- </B>Any flight officer utilizing the provisions of this Letter of Agreement shall be</P>
<P>paid at the rate of pay associated with the assignment held at age 60 until the </P>
<P>first of the scheduled month following his 60th birthday, or upon activation of a </P>
<P>Second Officer assignment whichever occurs first.&nbsp;&nbsp;Thereafter, he shall be paid </P>
<P>at the appropriate Second Officer rate as specified in Section of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6-a- </B>Any Captain who is receiving B-747 or DC-10 Captain pay under the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provisions of the Letter of Agreement, dated August 14, 1981, which appears </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on page 167-169 of the 1981 Pilot Agreement, shall become ineligible for such </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pay upon being activated into an assignment awarded under the provisions of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Paragraph A-2 (effective 9/23/89 B-747-400 added to this paragraph).</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6-b- </B>Any pilot receiving B-737 Captain pay under the provisions of the TCA</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Letter of Agreement, dated June 23, 1982, shall lose such pay should he</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;become ineligible to hold a Captain or First Officer assignment.</P>
<B><P>A-7- </B>Should a reduction in force become necessary, any flight officer who is</P>
<P>surplusage under the provisions of Section 8 of the Agreement who cannot </P>
<P>qualify for another assignment under the provisions of Section 8-K-2-a shall be</P>
<P>furloughed, notwithstanding the provisions of Section 7 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>A-8- </B>Two official Flight Officer Seniority Lists shall be published annually. One</P>
<P>shall be called the Pilot Eligibility Seniority List and shall contain the names of all</P>
<P>flight officers who are eligible to be awarded Captain and First Officer</P>
<P>assignments.&nbsp;&nbsp;The second list shall be called the Second Officer Eligibility </P>
<P>Seniority List and shall contain the names of all flight officers who are eligible to </P>
<P>be awarded Second Officer assignments.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 62</P>
</B><P>The Second Officer Eligibility Seniority List shall recognize the special rights of</P>
<P>those who have been designated "Career Second Officers" under the Letter of Agreement, dated June 11, 1963.</P>
<B><P>A-9- </B>The provisions of this Letter of Agreement were implemented by </P>
<P>Agreement on June 10, 1983 and shall, thereafter, run concurrently with the 1981 </P>
<P>Pilot Agreement; however, should the FAA establish a retirement age </P>
<P>requirement for Second Officers or should the jury decision in the Age 60 suit be </P>
<P>reversed upon appeal, the provisions of this Letter of Agreement shall terminate </P>
<P>and the parties shall meet immediately to determine the appropriate </P>
<P>action.</P>
<B><P>A-10- </B>Should any government action alter the age requirements for continued</P>
<P>employment as a flight deck crew member, the parties will meet promptly to </P>
<P>modify the Agreement to conform to said action.</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement this </P>
<P>1<SUP>st</SUP> day of March, 1984.</P></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH=590>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Revised as of this 36<SUP>th</SUP> day of October, 2000.</P>
<U><P>/s/ William P. Hobgood</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>William P. Hobgood</P>
<P>Senior Vice President</P>
<P>People</P>
</FONT><U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ F.C. Dubinsky</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>Captain F.C. Dubinsky</P>
<P>Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 63</P>
</B><I><P>Charter Operation</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">CHARTER</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THIS SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance </P>
<P>With the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and </P>
<P>between UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as </P>
<P>represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL </P>
<P>(hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>WHEREAS, the Company and the Association desire to supplement their Pilots'</P>
<P>Employment Agreement, June 15, 1985 (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Agreement") by providing certain rates of compensation, rules and working </P>
<P>conditions with respect to the Company's Charter Operation.</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, is understood and agreed that:</P>
<P>Domestic Charters</P>
<P>Due to operational and pilot scheduling problems associated with domestic </P>
<P>charters, pilots involved in the domestic charter operation shall be scheduled in </P>
<P>accordance with the provisions of Section 5 of the Agreement with the exception </P>
<P>of Section 5-G-1- a, 5-G-2-a and 5-H-5.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>For scheduling purposes, an on-duty period of thirteen hours and thirty</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;minutes (13:30) will be the maximum.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>Pilots in the actual performance of their assignment will have a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;maximum on-duty period of fifteen (15) hours, which may be exceeded with </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 64</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3- </B>The provisions of Paragraphs A-1 and A-2 above shall apply only to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;those duty periods which contain a domestic charter segment. A duty period </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which contains both a domestic charter segment and a regularly scheduled </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;line segment shall be scheduled under the provisions of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-4- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph A-1 above, the provisions of Section 5-G-1-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a-(1)-(b) of the Agreement are applicable to any duty period scheduled under </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this Supplemental Agreement when such application will provide a greater </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-5- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph 5-B-3 of the Agreement, Mainland-Hawaii-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mainland or Hawaii-Mainland-Hawaii charter flights may be scheduled in one </P>
<P>duty period.</P>
<P>International Charters</P>
<P>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 5-B-2, 5-B-3, 5-B-4 and 5-B-8, 5-G-1-a</P>
<P>and 5-G-2-a and 20-J, operations which involve an international charter segment </P>
<P>may be conducted under the following provisions.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-1- </B>Trip sequences which include an international charter segment(s) may </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Be scheduled under the provisions of Paragraph A above at Company option.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2- </B>Duty periods which include an international charter segment(s) shall not </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be scheduled to exceed fourteen (14) hours on duty, and in the actual </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;operation, may not exceed sixteen (16) hours without pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3- </B>Duty periods which include an international flight segment(s) may be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled with up to twelve (12) hours of flight time, as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3-a- </B>One (1) flight segment may be scheduled up to twelve (12) flight </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3-b- </B>Two (2) flight segments may be scheduled up to a total of eleven </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(11) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3-c- </B>Three (3) flight segments may be scheduled up to a total of ten (10)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-4- </B>Duty periods composed of deadhead and/or ferry segments only, </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which immediately precede or follow a duty period containing an </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;international charter segment(s) may be scheduled in accordance with </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Paragraphs B-2 and B-3 above.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 65</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph B-2 above, the provisions of Section 5-G-1-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a-(1)-(b) of the Agreement are applicable to any duty period scheduled under </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this Supplemental Agreement when such application will provide a greater </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6- </B>A pilot shall be considered to be on duty from one (1) hour before the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled departure of his trip until fifteen (15) minutes after the actual </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;termination of his trip unless a customs check is involved at the end of the duty </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;period, in which case he shall be on duty until thirty (30) minutes after the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;actual termination of the last flight segment in that duty period. If the required </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reporting time exceeds one (1) hour, such time shall be considered as duty </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;time. This Paragraph shall not apply in the application of Paragraph 5-G-1-b-</P>
<P>of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7- </B>Duty periods scheduled under Paragraph B of this Supplemental </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement and which contain eight (8) or fewer hours of flight time shall </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide rest breaks in accordance with Section 5-G-1-c and 5-G-2-c of the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-8- </B>Duty periods scheduled under Paragraph B of this Supplemental </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement and which contain more than eight (8) hours of flight time shall </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide a minimum of twelve hours and forty-five minutes (12:45) free from </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-9- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraphs 7 and 8 above, a pilot who has flown </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;twenty (20) or more hours during any consecutive forty-eight (48) hours or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;twenty-four (24) or more hours during any seventy-two (72) consecutive hours </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will be provided eighteen (18) hours free from duty.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-10- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraphs B-2, B-3 and B-4 above, if a duty period</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;contains a regularly scheduled line segment, then Section 5 of the Agreement </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shall apply to that duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-11- </B>The Company may designate certain equipment domiciles to which it</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;expects to assign international charter flying. Pilots at these domiciles will be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;advised of the potential existence of charter assignments and may indicate </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;their availability for such assignments. Those pilots who have volunteered and </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;who are on reserve will be required to maintain current passports, other </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;documents and inoculations as required by the Company. The Company will </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not limit the number of volunteers in a designated equipment domicile, </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;however, should insufficient pilots volunteer, the Company may designate </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;additional pilots, as required, in inverse seniority order.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 66</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-12- </B>Open international charter pairings may be assigned to qualified </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reserve pilots as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-12-a- </B>Assign to first (1st) available reserve in FIFO, without interference </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with day(s) off.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-12-b- </B>Offer to available reserves who would require a day off change, in</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;seniority order.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-12-c- </B>Assign to an available reserve who requires the fewest number of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;days off changed, in inverse seniority order.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the application of this </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provision, days off will be restored in the current month, if possible, but may </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be restored in a following month, if necessary. Such day off restoration will </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not be deferred beyond the first month in which it is possible to restore the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;day(s) off.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>Non-Critical MAC Operations</P>
<P>Non-critical MAC may be flown under the applicable section of this Supplement</P>
<P>Agreement or under the provisions of the Agreement if they can be so scheduled.</P>
<B><P>D.</B> Charter Line of Flying</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1- </B>Pairings containing Domestic Charter flying and/or Domestic Non-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Critical MAC flying which are subject to the provisions of the Supplemental </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement, may be placed in lines of flying when sufficient flying time exists to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;construct lines.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1-a- </B>Such lines of flying will be constructed to the monthly maximum of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;credited time in effect for the equipment type for that schedule month.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1-b- </B>One scheduled DSL pairing may be inserted into such line of flying </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for the purpose of maximizing the time within the line.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1-c- </B>Lines of flying constructed under this paragraph shall comply with </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all applicable provisions of Section 20 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2- </B>Pairings containing International Charter flying and/or International Non-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Critical MAC flying will be placed in lines of flying when sufficient flying time </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exists to construct lines under the provisions of Section 20 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2-a- </B>Such lines of flying will be constructed to the monthly maximum of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;credited time in effect for the equipment type for that schedule month.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 67</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2-b- </B>One Domestic Charter pairing or one scheduled DSL pairing may </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be inserted in this line(s) for the purpose of maximizing the time within the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;line.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2-c- </B>Lines of flying constructed under the provisions of this paragraph D-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2 may contain "buffer" days, in addition to the trip pairings and days off. </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Such buffer days shall be used to protect the charter assignment, as </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; described below.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D-2-c-(1)- </B>Buffer days may be scheduled between trip days and days off for the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; purpose of allowing the trip pairing scheduled within that period to depart or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; arrive earlier or later than originally shown without impacting upon the assigned </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; flight officer's obligation to fly the trip.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2-c-(2)- </B>Lines will be constructed to the monthly maximum of credited</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;time in effect for that schedule month in the assigned equipment type.</P>
<B><P>D-3- </B>Lines of flying constructed under this provision shall be clearly identified </P>
<P>and made available for preferencing in accordance with Paragraph 20-D of the</P>
<P>Agreement at the same time as other lines of flying for the equipment type and</P>
<P>domicile involved.</P>
<B><P>D-4- </B>Line(s) of flying constructed under these provisions shall be awarded in</P>
<P>accordance with Section 20-D of the Agreement, except that the flying contained </P>
<P>in a line which is not awarded during the initial award process shall revert to open</P>
<P>flying.</P>
<B><P>D-5- </B>A pilot awarded a line of Domestic Charter and/or Domestic Non-Critical</P>
<P>MAC flying shall be treated as a lineholder in accordance with the applicable</P>
<P>paragraphs of Section 20 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>D-6- </B>A pilot awarded a line of International Charter and/or International Non-</P>
<P>Critical MAC flying will be treated as a lineholder during the assigned schedule</P>
<P>month with the following exceptions:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-a- </B>Any change in departure or arrival times of the trip segments in the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assigned pairings which changes the day(s) on which the pairing operates </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shall not affect the pilot's responsibility to fly the pairings, provided the change </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;does not extend the trip into the pilot's day-off pattern.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-b- </B>If a pilot is relieved of responsibility for a pairing that was in his</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assigned line of flying as a result of a cancellation, or a change which now</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;projects the trip into the pilot's day-off pattern, or a consolidation of two or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;more changed pairings, the pilot may be assigned to open flying or reserve </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty during the period of days between the day-off periods associated with the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cancelled pairing in the following order:</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold"><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 68</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-b-(1)- </B>An International Charter and/or International Non-Critical MAC</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pairing.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-b-(2)- </B>A Domestic Charter and/or Domestic Non-Critical MAC pairing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-b-(3)- </B>A regular scheduled pairing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-b-(4)- </B>Reserve standby.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-c- </B>To insure pilot notification of any changes to his scheduled flying, the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;lineholders awarded this International line(s) of flying will be required to be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;telephone available between 1800 and 2000 CST (CDT) on the evening of the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;last day off prior to each assignment period. The pilot will also be responsible</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for keeping System Crew Scheduling advised of his whereabouts during the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;days between his day-off pattern when he is not scheduled to fly.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-6-d- </B>If a pilot is assigned training of less than five (5) days on days-off, or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on buffer days, he will be governed by the provisions of Paragraph 9-C of the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Should unusual circumstances require, charter assignments which comply </P>
<P>only with the appropriate FARs, may be made to pilots who volunteer for the </P>
<P>specific assignment. When any such assignments are contemplated, the MEC </P>
<P>Chairman will be advised.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>Qualified lineholder pilots may be assigned domestic charter or international</P>
<P>charter pairings under the provisions of Section 20-G-10 and Section 20-H of the</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>It is understood that, at the Company's option, the provisions of this </P>
<P>Supplemental Agreement may be used to schedule pilots for any domestic or </P>
<P>international charter operations, notwithstanding the provisions of the Basic </P>
<P>Agreement, the International Supplement and the U2 Supplement. In the event </P>
<P>an international operation scheduled under the provisions of this Supplement </P>
<P>produces a "Sunrise Service" schedule, the provisions of the Settlement Letter </P>
<P>for SB 93-9, dated July 30, 1993 shall be implemented.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 69</P>
</B><P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Supplemental Agreement </P>
<P>this 15th day of June, 1985.</P>
<P>WITNESS:</P></FONT>

<B><P>Page 70</P>
</B><I><P>Resolution of Cockpit Conflicts</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">Dear Fellow Pilots:</P>
<P>In the interest of providing the highest standards of professionalism and safety </P>
<P>among the pilots of United Airlines...and to insure that all pilots are treated fairly, </P>
<P>consistently and effectively...the Company and the Association have agreed to </P>
<P>the following procedure for the resolution of cockpit conflicts.&nbsp;&nbsp;United Airlines </P>
<P>traditional authority and responsibilities regarding proficiency and air safety shall not in any way be altered by the terms of this letter.</P>
<B><P>1. </B>When a professional standards problem arises, whatever the source, which</P>
<P>precipitates a cockpit conflict, and is brought to the attention of the Association </P>
<P>by a pilot, the Association will act as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-a- </B>The individuals involved will be encouraged to discuss the matter</P>
<P>privately in a forthright and reasoned manner, in an attempt to settle their </P>
<P>dispute.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-b- </B>Failing this, the local Professional Standards Committee members will </P>
<P>elicit both sides of the story, generally by telephone, and counsel both parties at </P>
<P>a peer level; (e.g.) a Captain committee member will call a Captain involved, a </P>
<P>First Officer committee member will call a First Officer involved, and a Second </P>
<P>Officer member will call a Second Officer involved. Again, agreement to resolve </P>
<P>the dispute will be sought.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-c- </B>Should this fail, the pilots involved will be invited to a Local Professional</P>
<P>Standards Committee meeting.&nbsp;&nbsp;After each pilot has had the opportunity to </P>
<P>present his or her view of the matter, the committee will seek a commitment from </P>
<P>the parties to end the conflict and work together in the future constructively and</P>
<P>without dissension.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-d- </B>Should one of the pilots refuse to participate the Association will advise </P>
<P>the Company of the conflict and request the Company to encourage all involved </P>
<P>parties to attend the Professional Standards Committee meeting.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>When a Professional Standards problem (as defined above) is brought to the</P>
<P>attention of the Company in the first instance, at management's discretion, the</P>
<P>Company will refer that issue and the parties involved to the Local Professional</P>
<P>Standards Committee.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each pilot will be encouraged to attend the committee's</P>
<P>meeting to settle their dispute in a reasoned, no-fault manner.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 71</P>
</B><P>Successful resolution of a problem will produce a committee report to the </P>
<P>Company that states the matter is resolved. Lack of successful resolution will </P>
<P>produce a report to the Company that the Local Professional Standards </P>
<P>Committee is unable to be of assistance.&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Complete confidentiality</U> regarding the </P>
<P>committee's meeting will be maintained and further, the Company agrees not to </P>
<P>cite a pilot's involvement with the Professional Standards Committee in any </P>
<P>subsequent disciplinary proceeding.</P>
<P>Should successful resolution of a problem not be attained within 30-day time </P>
<P>period, the Company will then be free to take whatever action it deems </P>
<P>necessary to resolve the issue within the framework of the agreement.</P>
<P>Either party to this agreement reserves the right to cancel it upon giving a 30 </P>
<P>Days written notice.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accepted and agreed to this 3rd day of August, 1987.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<U><P>/s/ L. W. Barry</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>/s/
F.C. Dubinsky</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>Lloyd W. Barry&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F.C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>Senior Vice President&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;Master Executive Council</P>
<P>Flight Operations&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>United Airlines, Inc.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>

</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 72</P>
</B><I><P>Unimatic Terminal</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>August 4, 1987</P>
<P>Captain F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</P>
<P>10700 W. Higgins Road, Suite 200</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>Dear Captain Dubinsky:</P>
<P>Recent discussion between the parties have resulted in the following </P>
<P>understanding:</P>
<P>United will install a Unimatic terminal with an associated printer in the MEC </P>
<P>office for the use of MEC representatives and staff. This terminal will be </P>
<P>authorized Mode 41 access and will be used in the same manner and for the </P>
<P>same purpose as the "public" pilot sets located at each domicile.</P>
<P>This terminal is being provided to the UAL-MEC by the Company in </P>
<P>recognition of the mutual benefits which it can provide; however it may be </P>
<P>removed if the Company concludes that the presence of an Unimatic terminal in </P>
<P>the MEC office may compromise United's computer and/or Corporate security or </P>
<P>for any other reason may no longer be mutually beneficial.</P>
<P>The direct cost of operating this terminal will be borne by the Association, </P>
<P>however the Company will retain ownership and perform all required </P>
<P>maintenance of the equipment.</P>
<P>It is understood that this agreement shall establish no precedent and will not </P>
<P>be cited in the future for any purpose.&nbsp;&nbsp;If this accurately reflects our </P>
<P>understanding, please sign and return two (2) copies of this letter for our files.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">Very truly yours,</P>
<U><P ALIGN="CENTER">/s/ S. E. Tallent</P>
</U><P ALIGN="CENTER">Stephen E. Tallent</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">Special Labor Counsel</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>4th day of August, 1987.</P>
<U><P>/s/ F. C. Dubinsky</P>
</U><P>F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 73</P>
</B><I><P>Pilot Instructors</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with </P>
<P>the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between </P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR </P>
<P>LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as represented by the </P>
<P>AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as </P>
<P>the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>WHEREAS, for the purpose of improving the training environment and the </P>
<P>efficiency of operation while maintaining the highest quality training, the training </P>
<P>staff organization will be revised and the training related responsibilities will be </P>
<P>assigned to the new management position of Standards Captain and the new </P>
<P>non-management position of Pilot Instructor, and</P>
<P>WHEREAS, it is the intent of the parties that the position of Training Check </P>
<P>Airman (TCA) be phased out and those duties will be assumed by the new </P>
<P>positions of Standards Captains and Pilot Instructors, and</P>
<P>WHEREAS, the Association represents the interest of the line pilots who will </P>
<P>Function as Pilot Instructors,</P>
<P>THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, it is mutually agreed:</P>
<P>The Pilot Instructors will be pilots represented by the Association with line </P>
<P>seniority numbers.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-a- </B>Pilots selected must have the highest qualifications.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-b- </B>The Association will be advised of and have an opportunity to make</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;recommendations concerning the required qualifications and the selection </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;process.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 74</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-c- </B>A pilot selected to be a Pilot Instructor will be required to complete the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;following minimum actual line experience which may consist of either First </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer or Second Officer flying, as appropriate:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-c-1- </B>Initial PI (new hire pilot):</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The pilot will be required to have 3 months line experience on the airplane </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on which he will instruct, prior to serving as a PI.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-c-2- </B>Initial PI (current line pilot):</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3-b-(1)- </B>If the pilot will be a PI on the same airplane on which he is</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;serving on the line, no additional line experience is required prior to his</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;serving as a PI.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3-b-(2)- </B>If the pilot will be a PI on an airplane different from the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;airplane on which he is serving on the line, he will be required to have 75 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours (including IOE) on the airplane on which he will instruct, prior to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;serving as a PI.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-c-3- </B>Current or former PI:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A-3-c-(1)- </B>If the equipment change for the PI is from a 3-pilot airplane to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a 2-pilot glass cockpit airplane and the PI has no previous glass cockpit</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;experience, he will be required to have 75 hours (including IOE) on the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;airplane on which he will be instructing, prior to serving as a PI on that</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;airplane.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A-3-c-(2)- </B>If the equipment change for the PI is from a 3-pilot airplane to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; a 2-pilot non-glass cockpit and the Pi has no previous 2-pilot crew </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; experience, he will be required to have 50 hours (including IOE) on the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; airplane on which he will be instructing, prior to serving as a PI on that </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; airplane.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A-3-c-(3)- </B>If the equipment change for the PI is from a non-international</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; airplane to an international airplane and the PI has no previous </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; international experience, he will be required to have 75 hours (including </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; IOE) on the airplane on which he will be instructing, prior to serving as a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; PI on that airplane.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This line of flying under sub-paragraph (1), (2), and (3) above will be in the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; aircraft in which the individual will be initially instructing. Such flying shall </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; be performed as a reserve (at the Pilot Instructor's request, he may </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; remain number one (1) on the FIFO list) or, should the Company desire </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; the individual to fly specific trips during this three (3) month period, such </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; flying shall be on a displacement basis.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 75</P>
<P>2.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-a- </B>The Pilot Instructor will perform the following duties and assignments:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-a-1- </B>Conduct instruction in the simulator for Captains, First Officers, </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Officers and International Relief Pilots. This instruction will include </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;transition training, Proficiency Check warm-up and requalification training.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-a-2- </B>Conduct First Officer certification checks.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-a-3- </B>Conduct Second Officer certification checks.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-a-4- </B>Conduct BIRC instruction.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b- </B>Additionally, a Pilot Instructor may perform the following duties and</P>
<P>assignments in his assigned equipment:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-1- </B>Serve as a fill-in crew member for transition training.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-2- </B>Serve as a fill-in crew member for Proficiency Check warm-up (2nd</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;day).</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-3- </B>Serve as a fill-in crew member for Proficiency checks when he is the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;only pilot available.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-4- </B>Serve as a Second Officer in the aircraft under the following </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;conditions:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-d-(1)- </B>Only Pilot Instructors who volunteer for such assignments will </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be eligible to be assigned to line Second Officer flying.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-d-(2)- </B>Prior to performing the assignment, the Pilot Instructor will</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;receive whatever refresher training he deems necessary.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-d-(3)- </B>Such line flying as a Second Officer will not replace nor offset</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the line flying required under the terms of this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B-2-d-(4)- </B>No action will be taken against a Pilot Instructor who declines </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; a Second Officer flight assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-5- </B>Perform Ground School instruction as assigned.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-b-6- </B>Be assigned special projects as needed.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>Pilot Instructors will be required to bid and hold a line assignment in addition to</P>
<P>their TK assignment.</P>
<B><P>4.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-a- </B>Pilot Instructors will maintain line familiarity in the equipment to which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;they are assigned as a P.I. through annual open flying on the line as a First </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer for a minimum of 24 duty periods and up to 36 duty periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Open </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flying will be offered to Pilot Instructors who request it under Section . </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, Pilot Instructors may trade into and pick up open Shuttle and </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mainline trips immediately after all pilots are accommodated as the result of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the trip trade monthly rundown.&nbsp;&nbsp;They may not be assigned or pick up </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;additional flying until 1200 on the day prior to departure.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pilot Instructors who </P>
<B><P>Page 76</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;request additional flying beyond the open flying maximum, above, may on their </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled days off be scheduled for unlimited line flying on a displacement </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;basis.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b- </B>To effect an efficient policy for Pilot Instructor pick up of open flying that</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provides for a wide range of experience by flying from various domiciles and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;minimizes the overuse of the Denver domicile assigned open flying, the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;following guidelines have been established:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b-1- </B>P.I.'s in conjunction with Crew Management (CM) will to the extent</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;possible be assigned open flying from all domiciles.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b-2- </B>On P.I. work days open flying in Denver may be picked up by P.I.'s </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on a pro-rata basis as the assigned Denver flying relates to system flying in </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the fleet. Notwithstanding the above limitation, if there is no Denver pilot in </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that particular fleet and seat requesting 20-H-3 12 hours or less prior to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled departure of an I.D., a P.I. may pick up this open flying as an </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exception to the proportional limitation.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b-3- </B>P.I. deadheading to and from a domicile will not be considered a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty period as defined by the 36 duty period annual limitation.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b-4- </B>Duty periods which consist entirely of deadheading will not count </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;toward satisfying the minimum 24 duty period requirement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4-b-5- </B>Any combination of P.I. duties and flying duties performed within a</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;single duty period must conform to the Section 5-G duty period time </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;limitations.&nbsp;&nbsp;For scheduling purposes, this requirement is not waivable.</P>
<P>5. The rate of pay for pilot instructors shall be determined as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-a- </B>The rate of pay for a pilot in years 1 through 5 of pilot longevity who is</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;permanently assigned as a pilot instructor shall be not less than the 81 hour </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;salary for the line assignment which he holds, plus 15%; but not more than the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;81 hour salary for B-747 First Officer at the 6th year of longevity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Company may determine that the override percentage for all pilot instructors in </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;years 1 through 5 will be greater than 15%, but in no case will it produce </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;greater earnings than the 81 hour salary for B-747 First Officer at the 6th year </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of longevity.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A pilot instructor beyond the 5th year of pilot longevity shall be paid the 81 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hour salary for his line assignment or the 81 hour salary for 747 First Officer at </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the 6<SUP>th</SUP> year, whichever is less.</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 77</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-b- </B>Pilot Instructors shall begin receiving PI pay in accordance with the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;following:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-b-1- </B>Pilots who will be instructing as PIs in the equipment type for which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;they are currently trained will begin receiving Pilot Instructor pay upon </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reporting to the Flight Center.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-b-2- </B>Pilots who require transition training for the equipment in which they </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will be instructing will begin receiving PI pay upon beginning their IOE after</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;completing the required transition training, or 45 days after reporting to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DENTK, whichever is earlier, provided they successfully complete the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;training necessary to become a PIlot Instructor.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-c- </B>When a Pilot Instructor leaves the Flight Center to return to his line of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flying assignment his Pilot Instructor pay shall continue until he begins IOE for </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his line assignment, at which time he shall be paid at the rate associated with </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his line assignment.</P>
<B><P>6</B>. Pilot Instructor schedules shall have a minimum of twelve (12) calendar days </P>
<P>free of duty per month. For trainee/instructor continuity, Pilot Instructors shall be </P>
<P>allowed, at their option, to trade their days off; however, in no event shall a Pilot </P>
<P>Instructor receive less than twelve (12) actual calendar days free of duty during </P>
<P>the month.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>Pilot Instructors will accrue, preference and liquidate vacations as per Section </P>
<P>11 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>8. </B>When a pilot transfers from and to his Pilot Instructor assignment he will be </P>
<P>entitled to a pilot paid move, in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 of </P>
<P>the Agreement, except when the line assignment is DENFO.</P>
<B><P>9. </B>The provisions of Section 1, 2, 4, 6, 7, 8, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 21 </P>
<P>and 22 of the Agreement shall apply to Pilot Instructors. The provisions of </P>
<P>Section 9 shall apply when the Pilot Instructor is functioning as a trainee.&nbsp;&nbsp;The </P>
<P>provisions of Section 5 and 20 shall apply during any line flying. All pilot benefits </P>
<P>shall apply to Pilot Instructors.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 78</P>
<P>10. </B>Vacations</P>
<P>Vacations for PI's will be bid and awarded according to Section 11 of the </P>
<P>Agreement between ALPA and United Airlines. The vacation year PI's is from </P>
<P>May 1 to April 30.&nbsp;&nbsp;Newly employed PI's accrue one day of vacation for each full </P>
<P>calendar month of continuous employment with the Company during the </P>
<P>remainder of the vacation year after the date of their initial employment, provided </P>
<P>that the first vacation for PI's initially employed on or after May 1 of any year will </P>
<P>not be due or payable except between May 1 and April 30 of the succeeding </P>
<P>vacation year. After these provisions have been complied with, a PI will receive </P>
<P>sixteen vacation days each year, provided his/her employment has been </P>
<P>continuous.&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning in the vacation year following the year in which a PI </P>
<P>completes the continuous service shown below, s/he will be entitled</P>
<P>to the following number of vacation days:</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;______________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Years of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vacation</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Service&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Days</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;_______________________</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 23</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
12&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;30</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;37</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
25&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;44</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>_______________________</P>

<P>that approximates what a line pilot could expect, the following maximum number </P>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="CENTER">12</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>This maximum number of RDO's which can be assigned to a PI's vacation period</P>
<P>applies to all vacation awards, including annual awards, monthly awards, and</P>
<P>involuntary assignments.</P>
<P>In addition, a PI may request specific days off prior to or following a vacation </P>
<P>period, up to and including the full allocation of monthly RDO's remaining.&nbsp;&nbsp;The </P>
<P>DENTK Scheduling Office will honor that request if at all possible.&nbsp;&nbsp;PI requests </P>
<P>will be honored based on line pilot seniority.</P>
<U><P>Annual Preferencing</U>: Vacation bid books are located in the Scheduling Office </P>
<P>and are arranged in order of seniority. Vacations are awarded in order of </P>
<P>seniority within each fleet based on the PI's preference.</P>
<P>All PI's will be eligible to preference the allocated vacation periods for the </P>
<P>following year based on their equipment type as of January 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;If you're entitled to </P>
<P>16 calendar says or more of vacation, you may elect to split your vacation into </P>
<P>not more than two periods during the vacation year, provided that no period is </P>
<P>less than 10 days. if you elect to split your vacation, you'll need to designate your </P>
<P>preference as being for a primary, secondary, or tertiary assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;You'll be </P>
<P>afforded the opportunity to be awarded your primary and secondary vacation </P>
<P>periods before and tertiary vacations are awarded.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 80</P>
</B><U><P>Monthly Preferencing</U>: PI's may elect to bid for vacation periods on a monthly </P>
<P>basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Vacations are awarded in seniority order within each Fleet.&nbsp;&nbsp;PI's awarded </P>
<P>a vacation will be notified of the award not less than 60 days before the first day </P>
<P>of the month in which the vacation period falls.&nbsp;&nbsp;If you don't receive this notice, </P>
<P>you won't be required to take this vacation award.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any vacation periods created </P>
<P>and available within 60 days of the vacation period will be offered in order of </P>
<P>seniority and may be assigned with your concurrence with less than 60 days </P>
<P>notice.</P>
<U><P>Involuntary Assignments</U>: In the event that there are insufficient preferences</P>
<P>submitted for posted vacation periods, involuntary vacations may be assigned in</P>
<P>reverse order of seniority.&nbsp;&nbsp;Involuntary assignment vacations shall be for a </P>
<P>minimum of ten days or the balance of your vacation credit (if less than ten days). </P>
<P>You must be notified of the date of the involuntary assignment at least 60 days </P>
<P>before the first day of the month in which the vacation period falls, except that </P>
<P>any vacation periods created and available within 60 days of a vacation periods </P>
<P>which are not voluntarily accepted may be assigned in reverse order of seniority </P>
<P>(provided you're given at least 45 days notice prior to the start of the vacation </P>
<P>period).</P>
<B><P>11. </B>Pilot Instructors will receive expense reimbursement according to the </P>
<P>provisions of Section 4-E-1 of the Agreement when conducting training </P>
<P>assignments at any location other than Denver.</P>
<B><P>12. </B>The parties will be guided by the terms of the PI guidelines, and these </P>
<P>guidelines will be changed only by mutual agreement of the parties.</P>
<B><P>13. </B>This Letter of Agreement shall be effective upon signing and shall run </P>
<P>concurrently with the current Basic Pilot Agreement.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 81</P>
</B><P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement this </P>
<P>20<SUP>th</SUP> day of November, 1989.</P></FONT>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 82</P>
</B><I><P>Drug and Alcohol Testing</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P ALIGN="CENTER">January 3, 1990</P>
<P>Captain F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA MAster Executive Council</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</P>
<P>10700 West Higgins Road, Suite 200</P>
<P>Rosemont, Illinois 60018</P>
<P>Dear Captain Dubinsky:</P>
<P>As the result of discussions between the parties, it has been agreed that:</P>
<P>When a pilot is required to provide a urine or breath specimen at the conclusion </P>
<P>of his assigned trip sequence in order to comply with the Federally mandated </P>
<P>random drug testing program, his duty period just completed shall be extended </P>
<P>by 15 minutes beyond the duty time provided by the application of Section 5-G of </P>
<P>the Agreement or of Section 3-N of the International Supplement, whichever is </P>
<P>applicable.</P>
<P>Such duty time credit shall be included in the computation of each pilot's pay </P>
<P>credit for that trip sequence; however, this 15 minutes credit shall not preclude a </P>
<P>pilot from being tested.</P>
<P>It is understood that the 15 minutes of duty time credit provided above shall </P>
<P>Constitute full compensation for participation in the drug testing program </P>
<P>regardless of variations in the actual amount of time spent by each pilot in </P>
<P>accomplishing this procedure.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sincerely,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
</U><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;John R. Samolis</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vice President Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>3rd day of January, 1990.</P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 84</P>
</B><I><P>International</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">PREAMBLE</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">WHEREAS, the Company and the Association desire to supplement their Pilots'</P>
<P>Employment Agreement, signed October 26, 2000 (hereinafter referred to as the</P>
<P>''Agreement'') by providing certain rules and working conditions with respect to </P>
<P>the Company's international flying to and within the Pacific Basin, Europe and the </P>
<P>British Isles, Central and South America and India.</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed and understood by and between the </P>
<P>Parties to this Supplemental Agreement that the rules and working conditions </P>
<P>stipulated herein shall be in full force and effect on the Company's international </P>
<P>flying to and within the Pacific Basin, Europe, and the British Isles, Mexico, </P>
<P>Central and South America and India provided that all provisions of the </P>
<P>Agreement, except as specifically modified or excepted by this Supplemental </P>
<P>Agreement, shall be applicable also to this flying.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION </B>1- DEFINITIONS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">A. International Flight Segments</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>International Atlantic flight segment for the purpose of this Supplemental</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement means (1) any flight segment which is operated between any point </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the United States or Canada on the one hand and any point in Europe or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the British Isles on the other hand, and (2) any flight segment which is </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;operated between points within Europe and/or the British Isles.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>International Pacific flight segment for the purpose of this Supplemental</P>
