<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement means (1) any flight segment which is operated between any point </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the United States or Canada on the one hand and any point in the Pacific </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Basin on the other hand, and (2) any flight segment which is operated between </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;points within the Pacific Basin.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3- </B>International Central and South American flight segments for the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;purpose of this Supplemental Agreement means (1) any flight segment which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is operated between any point in the United States or Canada on the one hand </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and any point in Central America, Mexico and South America on the other </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hand, and (2) any flight segment which is operated between points within </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Central America, Mexico and South America.</P>
<B><P>B</B>. An international trip pairing is any trip pairing which contains an international </P>
<P>segment.</P>
<P>Basic Crew</P>
<B><P>C-1- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft:</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 85</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A ''Basic Crew'' on a three (3) pilot aircraft shall consist of a Captain, a First</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer, and a Second Officer.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-2- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft:</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A ''Basic Crew'' on a two (2) pilot aircraft shall consist of a Captain and a First</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer.</P>
<B><P>D</B>. Augmented Crew</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An ''Augmented Crew'' shall consist of a Captain, a First Officer with an ATP </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and type rating in the aircraft, a Second Officer, and an International relief </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pilot.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An ''Augmented Crew'' shall consist of a Captain, and (2) First Officers with </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AT's and type ratings in the aircraft.</P>
<B><P>E</B>. Double Augmented Crew</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Two Pilot Aircraft</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A ''Double Augmented Crew'' shall consist of a Captain and three (3) First </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officers with ATP's and type ratings in the aircraft.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>Augmented Trip</P>
<P>An ''Augmented Trip'' shall mean any trip sequence which includes at least one </P>
<P>duty period scheduled with an augmented or double augmented crew.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>International Relief Pilot (IRP)</P>
<P>An International relief Pilot shall be qualified to provide relief, on those flights on</P>
<P>which he is required, at the Captain, First Officer and Second Officer stations. </P>
<P>Such qualifications shall be established by the Company to permit him to </P>
<P>accomplish:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G-1- </B>Pre-flight, post-flight and enroute First Officer duties, not including take-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;off or landing of the aircraft.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G-2- </B>All Second Officer duties.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G-3- </B>Any other duties assigned to him by the Company or the pilot in </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;command.</P>
<B><P>Page 86</P>
<P>H. </B>Flight Deck Duty</P>
<P>''Flight Deck Duty'' shall mean the flight time spent at an FAA required or </P>
<P>contractually required operating station in the cockpit, which does not include any </P>
<P>time spent in a cockpit observer seat(s) below FL 180.</P>
<B><P>I</B>. Pacific Crossing</P>
<P>A "Pacific Crossing" is any flight segment across the Pacific Ocean that exceeds </P>
<P>Eight (8) hours scheduled flight time.</P>
<B><P>J. </B>Atlantic Crossing</P>
<P>An ''Atlantic Crossing'' is any international flight segment operated across the North Atlantic to or from Europe or the British Isles.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, any flight </P>
<P>segment to or from Anchorage into the Pacific Basin is considered an Atlantic </P>
<P>Crossing.</P>
<B><P>K. </B>Pacific Basin</P>
<P>All current and future route authority, including all of the PAA acquisition, used or</P>
<P>unused, served by United Airlines in the Pacific; not to include route authority</P>
<P>between mainland United States and Hawaii.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION </B>2- EXPENSES AND TRANSPORTATION</P>
<B><P>A. </B>Expenses for International flying will be as provided in Section 4-A of the</P>
<P>Agreement, except that pilots assigned to International flying shall receive, in </P>
<P>addition to the expenses provided for in Section 4-A, fifty cents ($0.50) for each </P>
<P>hour away from home.</P>
<B><P>B.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-1- </B>Transportation of pilots on United Airlines will be booked in First Class, if</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;available. If First Class is unavailable, Business Class will be booked. If both </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;First and Business Class are unavailable, coach may be booked.&nbsp;&nbsp;Regardless </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of class of service reserved, pilots may be upgraded to First Class, if available </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;at departure time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2- </B>All NRPS pilot reservations will be booked as non-smoking. Upon check-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in a pilot who requests smoking will be accommodated in the smoking section </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on the same basis as revenue passengers.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 87</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3- </B>Transportation of pilots on any airline other than United Airlines will be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;booked in Business Class, if available. If Business Class is unavailable, First </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Class will be booked. If both First and Business Class are unavailable, coach </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;may be booked for any single segment which is scheduled for three (3) hours </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or more, non-stop.&nbsp;&nbsp;All other offline transportation shall be Coach.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-4- </B>Upon request, the parties will meet to consider information and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;recommendations which ALPA may have regarding the suitability of a foreign</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;carrier for deadheading crews.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5- </B>The Company will provide ground transportation to layover hotels at all</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;international layover locations. Transportation to and from the hotel will be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provided in a full sized air-conditioned vehicle exclusively for cabin and cockpit</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;crew use. Additionally, if the cockpit crew is at the pickup location, </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;transportation will leave no later than thirty (30) minutes after actual arrival of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the trip unless a later departure is agreed to. Hotel pickup times will be </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;arranged to have the pilots arrive at the airport in sufficient time to report for </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty at their assigned report time.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon request, the parties will meet to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;consider information and recommendations which ALPA may have regarding </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the suitability of ground transportation at specific international layover </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;locations.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6- </B>If a room at the scheduled layover hotel is not available within thirty (30)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;minutes of scheduled check-in time, the affected pilots may seek other</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;accommodations and will be reimbursed by the Company.</P>
<B><P>C</B>. Should isolated cases of unusual expenses be encountered by a pilot which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the expense allowance will not normally cover, the Company will reimburse the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pilot for such expenses upon receipt of a documented Company expense </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;form.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION </B>3- HOURS OF SERVICE</P>
<P>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 5-B-7, 5-B-8, 5-B-9 and 5-B-10, 5-D-4, </P>
<P>5-G-1-a, 5-G-1-b-(1) and 5-G-1-b-(2), 5-G-1-c-(1), 5-G-1-c-(2), 5-G-1-c-(3), 5-G-</P>
<P>1-c-(4) and 5-G-1-c-(5), 5-G-2-a, 5-G-2-b-(1), 5-G-2-b-(2) and 5-G-2-b-(3), 5-G-2-</P>
<P>c-(1), 5-G-2-c-(2) and ) of the Agreement, the following shall apply to </P>
<P>international trip pairings:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 88</P>
<P>A</B>. Pacific Operations</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1-a- </B>Duty time limits of Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) and 5-G-1-a-(1)-(b), 5-G-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1-b-(3), 5-G-2-a-(1), 5-G-2-a-(2) and 5-G-2-a-(3) shall apply to all duty </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;periods that do not contain a Pacific crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed eight (8) hours of scheduled </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flight time in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Augmented Crew, Single Segment</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall not exceed thirteen and one </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;half (13 1/2) hours. Actual duty time shall not exceed fifteen and one half </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(15 1/2) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed twelve (12) hours of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled flight time in any single duty period and no pilot will be required </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to exceed eight (8) hours flight deck duty in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Double Augmented Crew Single Segment</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be seventeen and one half (17 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1/2) hours. Actual duty time shall not exceed nineteen and one half (19 1/2) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed sixteen (16) hours of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled flight time in any single duty period and no pilot will be required to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exceed eight (8) hours flight deck duty in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-4- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Double Augmented Crew, Two (2) Segments</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-4-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be fifteen and one half (15 1/2)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours. Actual duty time shall not exceed seventeen and one half (17 1/2) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A-4-b</B> - Maximum flight time shall not exceed twelve and one-half (12 1/2)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours of scheduled flight time in any two (2) flight segment duty periods and </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;no pilot will be required to exceed eight (8) hours flight deck duty in any </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-4-c- </B>In the application of 3-A-4-a and 3-A-4-b above, the first segment </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;must be scheduled to depart between 0800 and 1500 per 3-A-8 below.&nbsp;&nbsp;In </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the event the Company desires to schedule departures outside this 0800-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1500 window, Association concurrence will be required.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 89</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-5- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-5-a- </B>Duty limits of Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) and 5-G-1-a-(1)-(b), 5-G-1-b-</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3),5-G-2-a-(1), 5-G-2-a-(2) and 5-G-2-a-(3) shall apply to all duty periods </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that do not contain a Pacific Crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-5-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed eight (8) hours of scheduled </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flight time in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew, Single Segment, Pacific Crossing:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be twelve (12) hours. Actual </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty time shall not exceed fourteen (14) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6-b- </B>Maximum Flight Time</P>
<P>A single flight segment of up to ten and one-half (10 1/2) hours may be</P>
<P>scheduled.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A-6-c- </B>Notwithstanding the limits of sub-paragraphs a and b above, if a</P>
<P>Single flight segment consisting of a Pacific crossing of up to twelve (12) </P>
<P>Hours maximum flight time is scheduled in a duty period, that duty period </P>
<P>may be scheduled for one and one-half (1 1/2) hours more than the </P>
<P>scheduled actual flight time of the segment, but will not be scheduled to </P>
<P>exceed thirteen and one-half (13 1/2) hours. The actual duty time limits in </P>
<P>these instances will be two (2) hours more than the scheduled duty time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6-d- </B>Notwithstanding the crew complement requirements above, if a</P>
<P>segment in a pairing is scheduled to depart after 1500 and before 0800, as</P>
<P>defined in paragraph 3-A-8 below, and contains more than 10 hours of flight</P>
<P>time, an augmenting crew member will be required and the operation will</P>
<P>become subject to the provisions of 3-A-7 below. Further, no augmenting </P>
<P>crew member will be required on the last Pacific crossing in a pairing as a </P>
<P>result of the application of this sub-paragraph.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-7- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Augmented Crew, Pacific Crossing, Single Segment</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-7-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall not exceed sixteen (16) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-7-b- </B>Maximum actual duty time shall not exceed eighteen (18) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-7-c- </B>Notwithstanding the limits of sub-paragraphs a &amp; b above, if a single</P>
<P>flight segment consisting of a Pacific Crossing of up to sixteen (16) hours</P>
<P>maximum flight time is scheduled in a duty period that duty period may be</P>
<P>scheduled for one and one-half (1 1/2) hours more than the scheduled</P>
<P>actual flight time of the segment, but will not be scheduled to exceed</P>
<B><P>PAGE 90</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>seventeen and.one-half (17 1/2) hours. The actual duty time in these</P>
<P>instances will be two (2) hours more than the scheduled limit.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-7-d- </B>Notwithstanding the single segment limitation above, two (2) flight</P>
<P>segments may be scheduled in excess of eight (8) hours and up to twelve </P>
<P>and one-half (12 1/2) flight hours. In the event the Company intends to </P>
<P>schedule flying under this provision which exceeds eight (8) hours, </P>
<P>Association concurrence will be required.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-8- </B>The first two (2) duty periods in an international Pacific trip pairing which</P>
<P>include international flying shall be based on the pilot's home domicile time.</P>
<P>Subsequent duty periods in an International trip pairing shall be based on </P>
<P>the local time which is in effect at the point of origin of the duty period. </P>
<P>Applicability of duty period length and on-duty credit provisions shall be </P>
<P>based on the time which is in effect at the point of origin of the duty period </P>
<P>as defined above.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>Atlantic Operations</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-1- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-1-a- </B>Maximum duty time </P>
<P>Duty time limits of Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) and </P>
<P>5-G-1-a-(1)-(b), 5-G-1-b-(3), 5-G- 2-a-(1), 5-G-2-a-(2) and 5-G-2-a-(3) shall </P>
<P>apply to all duty periods that do not contain an Atlantic crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-1-b- </B>Maximum flight time</P>
<P>Eight (8) hours of scheduled flight time shall be the maximum scheduled in </P>
<P>any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Augmented Crew, Single Segment Atlantic Crossing:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall not exceed thirteen and one </P>
<P>Half (13 1/2) hours. Actual duty time shall not exceed fifteen and one half </P>
<P>(15 1/2) hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed twelve (12) hours of </P>
<P>Scheduled flight time in any single duty period and no pilot will be required </P>
<P>to exceed eight (8) hours flight deck duty in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-c- </B>A pilot may be scheduled, in the final duty period of a trip pairing, to</P>
<P>operate a one (1) stop westbound flight scheduled to depart at or after 0800</P>
<B><P>PAGE 91</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>local time from points in Europe and scheduled to arrive by 1700 local time </P>
<P>at a point in North America.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-2-d- </B>Notwithstanding the single segment limitation above, a pilot may be</P>
<P>scheduled to fly one additional segment in a duty period after an Eastbound</P>
<P>Atlantic crossing which is scheduled to depart from his domicile after 0800,</P>
<P>provided the scheduled arrival time of that second segment is not later than</P>
<P>2100 home domicile time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3- </B>Two Pilot Aircraft, Double Augmented Crew, Single Segment, Atlantic</P>
<P>Crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3-a- </B>Maximum duty time</P>
<P>Fifteen (15) hours scheduled, seventeen (17) hours actual.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-3-b- </B>Maximum flight time</P>
<P>Thirteen and one-half (13 1/2) hours scheduled and no pilot will be required </P>
<P>to exceed eight (8) hours of flight deck duty in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-4- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-4-a- </B>Duty time limits of Section 5-G-1-a-(1)-(a) and 5-G-1-a-(1)-(b), 5-G</P>
<P>-1-b-(3), 5-G-2-a-(1), 5-G-2-a-(2) and 5-G-2-a-(3) shall apply to all duty </P>
<P>periods that do not contain an Atlantic Crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-4-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed eight (8) hours of scheduled </P>
<P>Flight time in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Basic Crew, Single Segment, Atlantic Crossing:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be twelve and one half (12 1/2)</P>
<P>hours, actual duty time shall not exceed fourteen and one half (14 1/2) </P>
<P>hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5-b- </B>Maximum Flight Time: A single flight segment of up to eleven (11) </P>
<P>Hours may be scheduled.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5-c- </B>Notwithstanding the limits of Paragraphs 3-B-5-a and 3-A-5-b </P>
<P>above, if a single flight segment of more than eleven (11) hours and up to </P>
<P>twelve (12) hours is scheduled in a duty period, that duty period may be </P>
<P>scheduled for one and one-half (1 1/2) hours more than the scheduled </P>
<P>actual flight time of the segment, but will not be scheduled to exceed </P>
<P>thirteen and one-half (13 1/2) hours. The actual duty time in these instances </P>
<P>will be two (2) hours more than the scheduled duty time.</P>
<B><P>PAGE 92</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-5-d- </B>Notwithstanding the crew complement requirements above, if a</P>
<P>segment in a pairing is scheduled to depart after 1500 and before 0800, as</P>
<P>defined in paragraph 3-B-11 below, and contains more than ten (10) hours </P>
<P>of flight time, an augmenting crew member will be required and the </P>
<P>operation will become subject to the provisions of 3-B-6 below. Further, no </P>
<P>augmenting crew member will be required on the last Atlantic crossing in a </P>
<P>pairing as a result of the application of this sub-paragraph.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Augmented Crew, Single Segment, Atlantic </P>
<P>Crossing:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be fourteen and one half (14 </P>
<P>1/2) hours, actual duty time shall not exceed sixteen and one half (16 1/2) </P>
<P>hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6-b- </B>Maximum Flight Time: A single flight segment of up to twelve (12) </P>
<P>Hours may be scheduled.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-6-c- </B>Notwithstanding the limits of Paragraphs 3-B-6-a and 3-B-6-b </P>
<P>above, if a single flight segment consisting of an Atlantic Crossing is </P>
<P>scheduled in a duty period that duty period may be scheduled for one and </P>
<P>one-half (1 1/2) hours more than the scheduled actual flight time of the </P>
<P>segment, but will not be scheduled to exceed fifteen and one-half (15 1/2) </P>
<P>hours. The actual duty time in these instances will be two (2) hours more </P>
<P>than the scheduled duty time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7- </B>Three Pilot Aircraft, Augmented Crew, Atlantic Crossing, Two Segments:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7-a- </B>Maximum scheduled duty time shall be thirteen and one half (13</P>
<P>1/2) hours, actual duty time shall not exceed fifteen and one half (15 1/2) </P>
<P>hours.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7-b- </B>Maximum flight time shall not exceed twelve (12) hours of </P>
<P>Scheduled flight time in any single duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7-c- </B>A pilot may be scheduled, in the final trip pairing, to operate a one</P>
<P>(1) stop westbound flight scheduled to depart at or after 0800 local time</P>
<P>from points in Europe and scheduled to arrive by 1700 local time at a point </P>
<P>in North America.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-7-d- </B>A pilot may be scheduled to fly one additional segment in a duty </P>
<P>Period after an Eastbound Atlantic crossing which is scheduled to depart </P>
<P>from his domicile after 0800, provided the scheduled arrival time of that </P>
<B><P>PAGE 93</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>second segment is not later than 2100 home domicile time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-8- </B>For the purpose of schedule preparation no other flying will be </P>
<P>scheduled in a duty period which contains an Atlantic crossing except as </P>
<P>provided in Section 3-B-2-c, and 3-B-2-d, and 3-B-7-c and 3-B-7-d, above. </P>
<P>Notwithstanding the segment limitations above, an additional segment may </P>
<P>be assigned in the actual operation as a result of diversions due to fuel, </P>
<P>mechanical, or weather as long as the assignment conforms to the flight </P>
<P>time and duty time limits of the original assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-9- </B>A pilot shall not be scheduled to fly an Atlantic crossing scheduled in </P>
<P>Excess of eight (8) hours, in either direction, within sixteen (16) hours of </P>
<P>completing such a crossing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-10- </B>International Atlantic trip pairings shall not be scheduled in excess of </P>
<P>Six (6) duty periods nor include more than four (4) Atlantic crossings.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B-11- </B>The first two (2) duty periods in an international Atlantic trip pairing </P>
<P>Which include international flying shall be based on the pilot's home domicile </P>
<P>time.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent duty periods in an international trip pairing shall be based</P>
<P>on the local time which is in effect at the point of origin of the duty period.</P>
<P>Applicability of duty period length and on-duty credit provisions shall be based </P>
<P>on the time which is in effect at the point of origin of the duty period as defined </P>
<P>above.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>Central and South America</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-1- </B>Service to and from Central and South America will be scheduled and </P>
<P>Flown under the provisions of this International Supplemental Agreement </P>
<P>whenever the trip pairing contains any segment which exceeds eight hour </P>
<P>flight time and/or any segment which operates south of 15 degrees south</P>
<P>latitude.&nbsp;&nbsp;All other flying will be done under the basic agreement. Further, all </P>
<P>operations conducted to or within Central and/or South America in all series of</P>
<P>B-737, B-727, A319/A320 and B-757 aircraft will be conducted exclusively</P>
<P>under the terms of the ''basic'' Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-2- </B>When operated under this International Supplement, the flight and duty</P>
<P>time limitations contained in Section 3-B (ATLANTIC OPERATIONS) of the</P>
<P>International Supplement shall be considered applicable to Central and South</P>
<P>American.<B> </B>operations and all other provisions of the International Supplement </P>
<P>Currently applicable to Atlantic (or European) operations shall also be</P>
<P>considered applicable to Central and South America. No pairing shall operate </P>
<P>between cities outside of North, Central and South America; including the </P>
<P>Caribbean Islands.</P>
<B><P>PAGE 94</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-3- </B>The term ''Atlantic Crossing'' when applied to South American service as</P>
<P>described above, shall be understood to mean any flight segment over eight </P>
<P>hours operated between the North American and the South American</P>
<P>continents.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, ''eastbound'' and ''westbound'' shall be understood to</P>
<P>mean ''away from the U.S.'' and ''returning toward the U.S.'', respectively.</P>
<P>Other references, if any, intended to differentiate between the U.S. and Europe </P>
<P>in the International Supplement shall be understood to mean the U.S. and</P>
<P>South America in the same context.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-4- </B>In addition to the provisions of Section 3-K-6 of this International</P>
<P>Supplement, upon completion of a trip sequence which includes more than</P>
<P>four (4) duty periods, but which does not also include a South American</P>
<P>crossing (''an Atlantic Crossing'', as described above), a pilot shall receive a</P>
<P>rest at his home domicile of not less than 36 hours. Further, whenever the last </P>
<P>segment in a trip sequence is scheduled to originate in one of the following</P>
<P>listed cities in South America and terminate at any point in the United States,</P>
<P>the pilot will be scheduled to receive no less than twenty (20) hours free from </P>
<P>duty upon completion of the sequence: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Sao Paulo,</P>
<P>Brazil; Montevideo, Uruguay; Buenos Aires, Argentina; Santiago, Chile. With </P>
<P>SSC concurrence on a monthly basis, this scheduled twenty (20) hour</P>
<P>minimum may be reduced to eighteen (18) hours. (18 hours is to be </P>
<P>considered the actual minimum.)</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C-5- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 5-G-1-e-(8), 5-G-2-c-(2) and </P>
<P>20-G-8, upon completion of any trip sequence which operates through Central </P>
<P>or South America, all pilots will be scheduled for not less than 14 hours and 45 </P>
<P>minutes free from duty. With SSC concurrence on a monthly basis, this </P>
<P>scheduled 14 hours and 45 minutes minimum may be reduced to 12 hours and </P>
<P>45 minutes. (12 hours 45 minutes is to be considered the actual minimum.)</P>
<B><P>D. </B>Other Regions</P>
<P>For new routes or flying to new markets, the crew make-up and duty limits shall </P>
<P>be the same as for existing international flying of comparable flight segments. At least ninety (90) days prior to initiating such new flying, representatives of the </P>
<P>Company and the Association will meet to resolve operational issues. If the </P>
<P>representatives are unable to reach agreement on any operational issue (s), the </P>
<P>issue (s) will be referred to the Senior Vice-President of Flight Operations and the </P>
<P>MEC Chairman for resolution.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Reserve Coverage</P>
<P>The reserve provisions of Section 5 and 20 of the Agreement apply to</P>
<P>International reserve assignments unless excepted in this International </P>
<B><P>PAGE 95</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Supplement. Section 5-G-1- e-(1) and Section 5-G-1-e-(2) are specifically </P>
<P>excepted. The following international reserve system options will be available to </P>
<P>a pilot on reserve status:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-1- </B>Traditional Option</P>
<P>A reserve who does not contact OPBCM to elect one of the other options </P>
<P>Available under this Paragraph 1 will be a Traditional reserve. A Traditional </P>
<P>reserve will progress normally through the first-in first-out list ("FIFO") until </P>
<P>he receives an assignment in accordance with the provisions of sub-</P>
<P>paragraph 1-a or 1-b below.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-1-a- </B>Assign to first available reserve on FIFO who can perform the</P>
<P>assignment as scheduled without interference with any scheduled days off.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-1-b- </B>If unable to make the assignment under "a" above, assign to the </P>
<P>First available reserve on FIFO who requires the fewest number of days off </P>
<P>changed. In the application of this provision, assignments may not begin on a scheduled day off.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-2- </B>Active Option</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-2-a- </B>A reserve may volunteer to go to the top of the FIFO list. A reserve </P>
<P>Who elects this option will be given an assignment just as though he had </P>
<P>Progressed through the FIFO list in accordance with paragraph 3-E-1-a and </P>
<P>3-E-1-b above.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; E-2-b- </B>A reserve's position on the FIFO list under this option will be</P>
<P>determined by the time the reserve blocked in from his last assignment, i.e., </P>
<P>a reserve who blocked in at 1700 will go ahead of a reserve who blocked in </P>
<P>at 1800 regardless of when the individual pilots volunteer to go to the top of </P>
<P>the FIFO list. This block in time rule (block in time of last flight assignment) </P>
<P>also applies to a reserve coming off days off.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-2-c- </B>A reserve who volunteers to go to the top of the FIFO list under this</P>
<P>provision and who subsequently does not receive an assignment by 2359 of </P>
<P>the day before his last day of availability shall revert to the position on the </P>
<P>FIFO list he would have been if he had not volunteered to go to the top of </P>
<P>the list.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3- </B>Aggressive Option: A reserve may volunteer for an assignment on a </P>
<P>first-come first-served basis pursuant to the following provisions:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-a- </B>All flying that is known to be open more than forty-eight (48) hours</P>
<B><P>PAGE 96</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>before the scheduled departure time of the trip will be available for pick-up</P>
<P>between forty-eight (48) hours and forty-four (44) hours before the </P>
<P>scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-b- </B>Flying that becomes open between forty-eight (48) hours and twelve</P>
<P>(12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip will be available </P>
<P>for pick-up for a period of four (4) hours after the trip opened up or until </P>
<P>twelve (12) hours before scheduled departure time, whichever is earlier.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-c- </B>Trips that become open as a result of short term sick leave will be</P>
<P>available for pick-up as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-c-(1)- </B>The initial trip for which a lineholder places himself on sick leave</P>
<P>will be available for pick-up for a period of up to four (4) hours beginning at</P>
<P>the time the trip becomes open but ending not later than twelve (12) hours</P>
<P>before the scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-c-(2)- </B>Any subsequent trip(s) for which the lineholder remains on sick</P>
<P>leave will be available for pick-up not earlier than fourteen (14) hours and</P>
<P>not later than twelve (12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-d- </B>A reserve may pick up a trip equal to or less than his number of </P>
<P>days of availability including Non-Holy Days off before his next scheduled </P>
<P>unavailable days. However, the length of the assigned ID must be not less </P>
<P>than his total days of availability minus one unless he receives OPBCM </P>
<P>concurrence.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-3-e- </B>A reserve may pick up a trip for which he is projected to be legal </P>
<P>While he is flying a current assignment. If he subsequently is projected to </P>
<P>Become illegal for the trip that he picked up, the trip will be placed back in </P>
<P>open flying and will be picked up by or assigned to another pilot in </P>
<P>accordance with the provisions of this Paragraph E.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4- </B>Voluntary Short Call Out Option</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4-a- </B>A reserve may volunteer to go on a Short Call Out List, on a duty </P>
<P>Period by duty period basis, for assignment to trips that become open five </P>
<P>(5) hours or less before the scheduled departure time of the trip.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4-b- </B>Notwithstanding their relative positions on the FIFO list, a reserve </P>
<P>On the Voluntary Short Call Out list will be assigned to a trip that opens up </P>
<P>five&nbsp;&nbsp;(5) hours or less before the scheduled departure time of the trip ahead </P>
<P>of pilots who have elected the Active or Traditional options.</P>
<B><P>PAGE 97</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4-c- </B>A reserve who volunteers to be on the Short Call Out list will remain </P>
<P>On that list until midnight of the day on which he volunteered at which time </P>
<P>he will revert to the Traditional option.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4-d- </B>A reserve will remain in his original position on the FIFO list during </P>
<P>The time he is a Short Call Out reserve and after he falls off the Short Call </P>
<P>Out list unless he has elected the Active option.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-4-e- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of this sub-paragraph E-4, the </P>
<P>Company may assign a trip to a Short Call Out reserve more than five (5) </P>
<P>hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip in accordance with the </P>
<P>provisions of sub-paragraph 3-E-1 above.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5- </B>Reserve Assignments</P>
<P>Reserves shall be assigned known open flying in accordance with the </P>
<P>following with the understanding that the term "available for assignment" is </P>
<P>that time following the aggressive pick-up window under paragraph 3-E-3.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-a- </B>Trips that become available for assignment between the hours of </P>
<P>0700 and 2300:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-a-(1)- </B>A trip that becomes available for assignment forty-four (44) </P>
<P>Hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned at </P>
<P>that time.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-a-(2)- </B>A trip that becomes available for assignment between forty-four</P>
<P>(44) and twelve (12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip</P>
<P>will be assigned as soon as it is available.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-a-(3)- </B>A trip that becomes open less than twelve (12) hours before the</P>
<P>scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned as soon as it is known</P>
<P>to be open.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-b- </B>Trips that become available for assignment between the hours of </P>
<P>2301 and 0659:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-b-(1)- </B>A trip that becomes available for assignment forty-four (44) </P>
<P>Hours before the scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned at </P>
<P>that time but the reserve will not be notified of the assignment until 0700.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-b-(2)- </B>A trip that becomes available for assignment between forty-four</P>
<P>(44) hours and twelve (12) hours before the scheduled departure time of the</P>
<P>trip will be assigned twelve (12) hours before the scheduled departure time</P>
<B><P>PAGE 98</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>of the trip or at 0700, whichever is earlier.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-b-(3)- </B>A trip that becomes open less than twelve (12) hours before the</P>
<P>scheduled departure time of the trip will be assigned so as to provide the</P>
<P>reserve with a reasonable amount of time to report for the trip or at 0700,</P>
<P>whichever is earlier, unless waiting to make the assignment would cause an</P>
<P>otherwise available reserve to become illegal for the assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-c- </B>In the application of sub-paragraphs 3-E-5-a and 3-E-5-b above the</P>
<P>following shall apply:</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="TimesNewRoman,Bold"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-c-(1)- </B>Assignments will be made to the first reserve, in first-in, first-out order,</P>
<P>who is legal for the assignment notwithstanding the fact that waiting to make the</P>
<P>assignment would result in assigning the trip to a reserve who is closer to the top of</P>
<P>the list.</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-5-c-(2)- </B>If no reserves are legal for an assignment at the time a trip</P>
<P>becomes open or available for assignment, the Company may wait to make</P>
<P>the assignment to a reserve who subsequently will become legal for the</P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-6- </B>All non-augmented international flying operated under domestic contract</P>
<P>rules of the Agreement, will, for the purposes of the required rest rule, be </P>
<P>treated as domestic flying.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-7- </B>Reserve Days Off</P>
<P>At equipment domiciles where scheduled international flying is assigned, all</P>
<P>international reserve lines available for monthly preferencing shall include </P>
<P>one period of six (6) consecutive days off in a 30 day month and seven (7) </P>
<P>consecutive days off in a 31 day month which may not be disrupted without </P>
<P>pilot concurrence by an assignment made under the provisions of sub-</P>
<P>paragraph 3-E-1 above. If in the actual operation, a pilot is worked into one </P>
<P>or more of these day(s), such day(s) shall be restored to the pilot in </P>
<P>conjunction with the remaining days off and will not be disrupted without his </P>
<P>concurrence. In addition to this period of six (6) or seven (7) days off, these </P>
<P>international reserve lines will contain either two (2) periods of three (3) </P>
<P>days off or three (3) periods of two (2) days off. Except for the one six (6)</P>
<P>or seven (7) day off period, all other day off periods may be disrupted only </P>
<P>by an international assignment under sub-paragraph 3-E-1 above, or to </P>
<P>correct a month-end legality problem. When such disruption occurs, the </P>
<P>days off lost will be restored in the current month, if possible, but may be </P>
<P>restored in the following month, if necessary. Restoration of days off will not </P>
<P>be deferred beyond the following month unless further deferral is required </P>
<P>due to a conflict with (1) scheduled vacation, (2) training, (3) other schedule </P>
<B><P>PAGE 99</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>unavailability or (4) the inability to restore the days off owed without splitting </P>
<P>scheduled trip sequences. Days off will be in minimum groups of two days </P>
<P>provided the Company owes the pilot two or more days off. Single days off </P>
<P>may be restored or added to the pilot's vacation with his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-8- </B>At domiciles where no international flying is assigned, a reserve will not </P>
<P>Be assigned an involuntary 8-L-6 assignment to perform international flying </P>
<P>at another domicile. When a new international domicile is established, the </P>
<P>parties will meet to determine the scheduling process necessary to insure </P>
<P>that the pilots who are assigned international flying meet the required </P>
<P>qualifications and necessary experience levels.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-9- </B>In the event the scheduled pilot becomes available after a reserve is</P>
<P>assigned and the reserve is no longer needed, the reserve assignment may </P>
<P>be canceled. When assigned to cover for a pilot on sick leave, reserves </P>
<P>shall call OPBCM within eight (8) hours of departure to verify the </P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-10- </B>When released from duty upon completion of an international </P>
<P>assignment, a reserve will receive a minimum of twenty-four (24) hours free </P>
<P>from duty unless a greater rest is required by other provisions of this </P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E-11- </B>In those international equipment domiciles that have both scheduled </P>
<P>Pacific and Atlantic DSL flying no reserve pilot will be assigned a trip pairing </P>
<P>containing an international Pacific flight segment within forty-eight (48) </P>
<P>hours of completion of a trip pairing containing an international Atlantic flight </P>
<P>segment. No reserve pilot will be assigned a trip pairing containing an </P>
<P>international Atlantic flight segment within sixty (60) hours of completion of a </P>
<P>trip pairing containing an international Pacific flight segment. No reserve will </P>
<P>be assigned or reassigned to fly in the European and Pacific operation in </P>
<P>any single trip pairing.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>The Company will not construct lines of flying which contain both one or more</P>
<P>international Atlantic flight segments and one or more international Pacific flight</P>
<P>segments except where full lines of flying cannot be constructed using </P>
<P>exclusively Atlantic or Pacific flying. In the event that both Atlantic and Pacific </P>
<P>flying is scheduled in the same line of flying the time between pairings will not be </P>
<P>less than sixty (60) hours between a pairing containing an international Atlantic </P>
<P>flight segment and a pairing containing an international Pacific flight segment, </P>
<P>and seventy-two (72) hours between a pairing containing an international Pacific </P>
<P>flight segment and a pairing containing an international Atlantic flight segment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>PAGE 100</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>G. </B>The actual duty time limits of Paragraph A &amp; B above may be extended with </P>
<P>Pilot concurrence.</P>
<B><P>H. </B>On Basic and Augmented Crews, a Captain may be assigned as a First </P>
<P>Officer subject to the provisions of paragraph of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>I. </B>If an augmenting crew member is required on any flight segment in a duty </P>
<P>period, he shall be required on all flight segments in that duty period. If the </P>
<P>scheduled flight time between any two (2) stations is such as to require </P>
<P>augmentation in one direction, then augmentation at the same level shall be </P>
<P>required on that segment when flown in the opposite direction. Notwithstanding, if </P>
<P>a flight requires augmentation due only to the application of 3-A-6-d, or 3-B-5-d, </P>
<P>the augmenting pilot shall be initially assigned to fly a comparable return flight, </P>
<P>but may be reassigned if required by the operation. The augmenting First Officer </P>
<P>who is displaced for any reason will not be assigned to another First officer </P>
<P>position on the trip from which he was displaced, or any other trip, without his </P>
<P>concurrence.</P>
<B><P>J. </B>Fuel Stops</P>
<P>A fuel stop required for operational reasons on any international trip segment, </P>
<P>Even though pre-planned on a recurring basis, shall not be considered as a </P>
<P>scheduled stop for any reason.</P>
<P>Should a fuel stop occur on any international segment, all pilots assigned to fly </P>
<P>That segment will receive an additional one (1) hour pay in addition to all other</P>
<P>compensation provided upon completion of fueling the crew continues flying </P>
<P>toward their original destination. Fuel stops will not be planned for less than forty </P>
<P>(40) minutes block-to-block. Further, when Dispatch forecasts a fuel stop on any</P>
<P>unaugmented Pacific crossing which was initially scheduled in excess of ten and </P>
<P>one-half (10 1/2) hours flight time, an augmenting crew member will be assigned </P>
<P>provided OPBCM receives at least six (6) hours notice.</P>
<B><P>K. </B>All flight time, duty time and segment limitations which are applicable to flying</P>
<P>under this Supplemental Agreement shall also apply to deadheading on the </P>
<P>same basis as if it were flying. In the actual operation, assignments which include </P>
<P>a duty period which consists solely of deadheading shall contain no more than </P>
<P>three (3) deadhead segments in that deadhead duty period.</P>
<B><P>L. </B>International lines of flying may be constructed which contain up to eighty-five </P>
<P>(85) credit hours. Additionally, no pilot will be scheduled or reassigned to perform </P>
<P>more than 4 Pacific or Atlantic crossings in a single trip pairing, or more than 2 </P>
<P>Pacific or Atlantic crossings of more than 10 hours in a single trip pairing. The </P>
<B><P>PAGE 101</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Local Schedule Committee, with the concurrence of the SSC and the Company, </P>
<P>may authorize the construction of lines of flying in any equipment domicile to </P>
<P>exceed the applicable monthly schedule limit by up to one (1) hour, provided the extended monthly schedule limit improves the quality of the affected lines. </P>
<P>(Should the monthly schedule limits be increased the actual performance limits </P>
<P>will be increased by an equal amount).</P>
<B><P>M. </B>Legal Rest Minimums.</P>
<B><P>M-1- </B>Duty periods which contain eight (8) or fewer hours of flight time shall</P>
<P>provide rest breaks in accordance with Section 5-G-1-c and 5-G-2-c of the</P>
<P>Agreement. Further, in the application of this provision, the occurrence of rest</P>
<P>breaks of 11:30 or less immediately following duty periods in excess of 12:00 will</P>
<P>be limited to one per pairing.</P>
<B><P>M-2- </B>Duty periods which contain more than eight (8) hours but twelve (12) hours</P>
<P>or less of scheduled flight time shall provide at least eighteen (18) hours free </P>
<P>from duty.&nbsp;&nbsp;With SSC concurrence on a monthly basis, this scheduled eighteen </P>
<P>(18) hour minimum may be reduced to sixteen (16) hours. (16:00 is to be </P>
<P>considered an actual minimum).</P>
<B><P>M-3- </B>Duty periods which contain more than twelve (12) hours of scheduled flight</P>
<P>time shall provide at least twenty (20) hours free from duty. With SSC </P>
<P>concurrence on a monthly basis, this scheduled twenty (20) hour minimum may </P>
<P>be reduced to eighteen (18) hours. (18:00 is to be considered an actual </P>
<P>minimum).</P>
<B><P>M-4- </B>If a trip pairing includes duty periods which are scheduled to contain more</P>
<P>than eight (8) hours of actual flight time for a basic crew or more than twelve (12)</P>
<P>hours of actual flight time for an augmented crew, there must be scheduled within</P>
<P>the pairing a crew layover of at least twenty-four (24) hours, block-to-block, at or</P>
<P>before the end of each second long duty period as defined herein.</P>
<B><P>M-5- </B>In addition to the above, at least sixteen (16) hours free from duty will be</P>
<P>scheduled prior to any duty period which is scheduled to contain more than eight</P>
<P>(8) hours of flight time or deadhead. With SSC concurrence on a monthly basis,</P>
<P>this scheduled sixteen (16) hour minimum may reduced to fourteen (14) hours.</P>
<P>(14:00 is to be considered an actual minimum).</P>
<B><P>M-6- </B>Upon completion of a trip pairing containing an Atlantic crossing(s) a pilot</P>
<P>shall receive a rest at home scheduled for no less than 24 hours (22 hours shall </P>
<P>be considered an actual minimum which may be further decreased to 21 hours </P>
<P>with pilot concurrence) which shall increase to 36 hours if the trip pairing contains </P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 102</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;more than two duty periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, after completing a pairing containing a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pacific crossing, a pilot will receive a rest at home of no less than 48 hours, </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which shall be extended to 72 hours after a trip pairing containing more than 6 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, upon completion of a Pacific trip sequence which </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;originates and terminates on the mainland and which includes four (4) or more </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty periods, but which does not include a ''Pacific Crossing'', a pilot shall </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;receive a rest at his home domicile of no less than 48 hours, which shall be </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;extended to 72 hours after a trip pairing containing more than six (6) duty </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;periods.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;M-7- </B>Pilots flying international trip pairings shall be scheduled for one (1) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;twenty-four (24) hour period off in each seven (7) twenty-four (24) hour period </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;on duty.&nbsp;&nbsp;This time off, if given at an away from domicile point, shall not count </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;toward minimum days off.</P>
<B><P>N. </B>Report and Debrief Times</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;N-1- </B>In order to assist in giving longer notice to reserves and to improve </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Schedule integrity, each scheduled pilot shall be required to verify his intention </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to fly his next scheduled trip by: (1) following the trip verification procedure in </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CMS, which is accessible through Unimatic terminals and may be available </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;through private PCs via MODEM; or (2) by calling OPBCM on a toll free </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;number provided by the Company. One of these two actions must be </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;accomplished not later than 24 hours before the scheduled departure of each </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;international trip, or upon termination of the pilot's prior trip, if later.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;N-2- </B>When the originating segment of a trip sequence is known to be </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;delayed, the Company will advise the scheduled crew prior to their check in.&nbsp;&nbsp;If </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;such contact is attempted four (4) or more hours before the original scheduled </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;departure (or before the last planned departure time of which the pilot(s) was </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;aware), the pilots on-duty period will not begin until one and one half (1 1/2) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hour before the revised departure. Further, if a delay develops within four (4) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours of scheduled departure and the pilot(s) is advised of the planned delay </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;prior to his checking in at the airport, the start of his on duty period may also </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be adjusted as above.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the application of this provision, OPBCM will </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;maintain alternate phone numbers and will follow all reasonable instructions </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provided by the pilot to facilitate reaching him.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;N-3- </B>Duty time, on a scheduled or actual basis, shall include flight and ground</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;time. A pilot shall be considered to be on duty one and one-half (1 1/2) hour </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;before the scheduled departure of his trip until thirty (30) minutes after the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled or actual termination of his trip, whichever is later. If the required </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reporting time exceeds one and one-half (1 1/2) hours, such time shall be </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;considered as duty time.&nbsp;&nbsp;This paragraph shall not apply in the application of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Paragraph 5-G-1-b-(3) of the Agreement. If in the actual operation at certain </P>
<B><P>Page 103</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;airport locations the thirty (30) minutes debrief time is continually less than </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;required, the parties agree to meet to discuss increasing the thirty (30) minutes </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to a more reasonable amount of time.&nbsp;&nbsp;The schedule and actual duty limits </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specified in 3-A, 3-B, 3-C and 3-D above may be increased up to thirty (30) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;minutes to accommodate the increased report time under this sub-paragraph </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;when necessary to accommodate the scheduled flight time of the trip in that </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duty period.</P>
<B><P>O. </B>Minimum Scheduling Provisions and Actual Credit Provisions</P>
<P>Pilots flying international trip pairings shall be covered by the flight time credit</P>
<P>provisions and actual credit provisions of Section 5-G-3 of the Agreement. </P>
<P>Section 5- G-3-g of the Agreement shall not apply.</P>
<B><P>P. </B>Construction of International Lines &amp; Pairings</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;P-1- </B>An international trip pairing ID may contain a domestic segment(s).</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;P-2- </B>An international line of flying may contain no more than two (2) domestic </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;trip pairings.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, if the total time in the domestic pairings exceeds that of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the international pairings, the total line value will be limited to the applicable </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;domestic maximum line value. A domestic line of flying may contain </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;international trip pairings.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>P-3- </B>For the purpose of this agreement, the international domicile airports </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;are: SFO, LAX, IAD, JFK, ORD, HNL, MIA, ANC and SEA. If in the future, DSL</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scheduled international flying is assigned to domestic domicile airports other </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;than listed here, those domiciles shall also be considered international </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;domicile airports for the purposes of this paragraph 3-P-3. In the event a pilot </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is assigned an international pairing which originates at an airport listed in ) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which is not also an international domicile airport listed in this sub-paragraph </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3, the Company shall provide round trip transportation at the pilot's option </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;between the international domicile airport and the airport at which the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assignment originates.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION 4</B>- INTERNATIONAL RELIEF PILOT</P>
<B><P>A. </B>For the purpose of staffing the Pacific operation, IRP's shall be assigned as</P>
<P>follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>The position of IRP shall be established as a fourth pilot status on a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;three (3) pilot aircraft and shall be bid according to the provisions of Section 8 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 104</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>Eligibility to be Awarded Vacancies </P>
<P>Notwithstanding Section 8-D of the Agreement, the following requirements must be met for a pilot to be awarded an IRP vacancy.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2-a- </B>He must hold a valid flight engineer's certificate and a valid </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;commercial pilot's license which he is qualified to use under FAR 121.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2-b- </B>He must hold an activated Second Officer assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2-c- </B>The provisions of Section 8-B-5 shall apply to any Second Officer </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;who bids and is awarded an IRP vacancy, except for a Second Officer who </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is currently assigned to the same equipment type as the IRP assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;In </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this situation, the Second Officer will carry over any remaining freeze to the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IRP assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A-2-d- </B>Notwithstanding Paragraph A-2-b above, a pilot who holds an </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Activated assignment as a B-767/757, B-727, B-737, or B-737-300/400/500 </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; First Officer shall also be eligible to be awarded an IRP assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Further, a pilot holding an activated assignment as a DC-10 First Officer or </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; DC-10 IRP shall be eligible to be awarded a B-747 IRP assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;A First </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Officer awarded an IRP vacancy or a DC-10 IRP awarded a B-747 IRP </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; vacancy may be required to fill such assignment for a period of twenty-four </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(24) months from the first day of the month following the month he was </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;awarded his bid.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A-3- </B>Lines of flying available for preference and awarded to IRP's shall be</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;constructed solely of IRP flying.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A-4- </B>IRP's assigned to reserve shall be available for assignment to either IRP</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flying or Second Officer positions.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-5- </B>The IRP's monthly salary will be equal to the basic Second Officer's </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;salary for the equipment and year of longevity plus twenty-five percent (25%) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the difference between the First Officer's salary and the Second Officer's </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;salary for that equipment at twelfth (12th) year rates.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-6- </B>At B-747 domiciles where no flying is assigned which requires IRP</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;augmentation, the Company may offer training to Second Officers who </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;volunteer for the training as IRP's.&nbsp;&nbsp;These IRP-trained B-747 Second Officers </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will be used to augment B-747 crews in irregular operations or whenever </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;occasional, unscheduled IRP coverage is required. When an IRP qualified </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Officer is assigned to augment a B-747 crew, he shall perform as an </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IRP and receive IRP pay for that assignment unless the scheduled Second </P>
<B><P>Page 105</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer is both senior and IRP qualified.&nbsp;&nbsp;In this case, the scheduled Second </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer shall have his choice of functioning as an IRP or as a Second Officer.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION 5</B>- FIRST OFFICER ON AUGMENTED CREWS</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">A. </B>First Officers in equipment domiciles where flying is scheduled which requires</P>
<P>staffing with First Officers who require an ATP and type rating under the </P>
<P>provisions of this Supplemental Agreement and First Officers at all B-747 and B-</P>
<P>747-400 domiciles shall be required to have an ATP rating in the equipment to </P>
<P>which assigned and will be provided training by the Company as follows:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>Incumbent First Officers shall be provided the training normally required </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to obtain an ATP rating including, if necessary the training associated with the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;written portion.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A-2- </B>In a domicile that becomes an International equipment domicile, all First</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officers who meet the FAR requirements for an ATP will be provided the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;required training to fly international trips.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-3- </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraphs A-1 and 2 above, a pilot </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will not be denied a B-767 First Officer bid at a domicile where such flying </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exists because he has insufficient flight time to qualify for an ATP and type </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rating.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, during the first eighteen (18) months after the start of </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;international flying requiring an augmented crew at that equipment domicile, a </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;non-rated internationally qualified B-767 First Officer may serve as augmenting </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pilot until he accumulates sufficient flight time to qualify for an ATP and type </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rating.</P>
<P>During any month in which a First Officer flies a trip with an augmented or </P>
<P>double augmented crew, he shall receive, in addition to his regular salary, the </P>
<P>appropriate First Officer Override or International Override in Section 3 of the </P>
<P>Agreement, whichever is greater.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION 6</B>- FOREIGN TEMPORARY DUTY ASSIGNMENTS</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">A. </B>The Company may designate TDY assignments at Tokyo, Osaka, Sydney,</P>
<P>Auckland, Frankfurt, Paris, London, and Dublin. Prior to the Company </P>
<P>Implementing any temporary duty assignments in the above locations or at any </P>
<P>other mutually agreed to location, the parties will meet to discuss any problems </P>
<P>associated with the filling of the vacancies required for the TDY domicile, </P>
<P>adequate lodging, expenses, and any other relevant issues.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>Temporary duty assignments will be filled by a preferencing procedure at the</P>
<P>domicile(s) designated by the Company. The number of TDY assignments available</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 106</P>
</B><P>from each domestic domicile shall be posted prior to preferencing. Volunteers </P>
<P>from any domicile may be considered, should insufficient pilots preference at the</P>
<P>designated domicile(s).</P>
<B><P>C</B>. Temporary duty assignments will be posted, preferenced and awarded prior to</P>
<P>the posting of monthly lines of flying for domestic domiciles.&nbsp;&nbsp;All pilots assigned to </P>
<P>a temporary duty domicile shall preference monthly schedules for that temporary</P>
<P>domicile.</P>
<B><P>D</B>. Should there be insufficient bidders for the TDY assignment, pilots will be </P>
<P>assigned in inverse order of seniority from those pilots at the designated domicile </P>
<P>who have spent the fewest number of months in TDY assignments in the last </P>
<P>twelve (12) months.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under this provision, no pilot will be involuntarily assigned to </P>
<P>a TDY assignment more than two (2) months in any twelve (12) consecutive </P>
<P>months, nor will a pilot be involuntarily assigned to a TDY assignment in </P>
<P>consecutive months without his concurrence.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Pilots who have been awarded or involuntarily assigned a temporary duty</P>
<P>assignment will have the option to remain at the TDY assignment for an </P>
<P>additional one (1) or two (2) months if the assignment is still available.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>Pilots who indicate a desire to remain at the assignment for two (2) months or </P>
<P>more will be entitled to:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F-1- </B>Have his spouse and dependents accompany him to the assignment.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dependents eligible for pass travel under this provision will be those </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dependents eligible for any pass travel as defined under Company policy</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;regulation Series 15-9.&nbsp;&nbsp;Dependents of college age who have limited pass </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;travel eligibility will be eligible for pass travel under this Section.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F-2- </B>Positive space transportation to and from the assignment for his spouse </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and dependents.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F-3- </B>When the pilot remains at a TDY assignment in excess of two (2) </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;months as defined in Section 2-O, the Company will provide one (1) additional </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BP-3 transportation for a pilot's spouse and eligible dependents.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>Pilots who have been awarded a TDY assignment will receive expenses as</P>
<P>provided in Section 4-E of the Agreement and Section 2-A of this Supplemental</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>H. </B>A pilot will be provided suitable hotel accommodations as specified in the</P>
<P>Agreement. Additionally, if a pilot qualifies for a spouse and/or dependents to be </P>
<P>at the TDY location and he does transport two (2) or more members of his family </P>
<B><P>Page 107</P>
</B><P>to the TDY location, he shall be provided, at a cost to him not to exceed the rate </P>
<P>paid by the Company, an additional bedroom.</P>
<B><P>I. </B>The following provisions will be applicable to pilots assigned to temporary duty</P>
<P>(TDY):</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-1- </B>Pilots volunteering for and being awarded a full month or months of TDY </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;must position themselves to fly the first trip or to be available for the first </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reserve availability day in their TDY line.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-2- </B>To accomplish this, lineholders may have to travel to and from the TDY</P>
<P>assignment outside of their TDY month on days that have previously been</P>
<P>scheduled as vacation days and/or regular days off and Reserves may have to</P>
<P>travel on their vacation days. Further, if a lineholder has a trip in the month prior</P>
<P>to the initial TDY month that would prevent him from positioning himself for his </P>
<P>first scheduled assignment in his TDY line, he shall have his prior month's line</P>
<P>repaired in order to provide the necessary time. In that event, he will be "pay </P>
<P>protected" in that month if the repair would otherwise reduce his pay in that</P>
<P>month. A Reserve who has days off in the prior month that would prevent him </P>
<P>from traveling to and from the TDY assignment to be in position for his first TDY </P>
<P>assignment will have his days off moved so that the necessary travel day(s) will </P>
<P>be reserve work (available) days instead of days off, unless he volunteers to</P>
<P>travel on his days off, in which case he shall have all such lost days off restored </P>
<P>under the provisions of I-4, below. Every reasonable effort will be made to</P>
<P>comply with the reserve pilot's request regarding the rescheduling of his reserve </P>
<P>days off.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3- </B>The pilot's travel to and from the TDY assignment shall be subject to the</P>
<P>following:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3-a- </B>In order to travel to an initial month's TDY assignment, if the time is</P>
<P>Not already available in the pilot's schedule, he shall be provided enough time so</P>
<P>that he has the opportunity to schedule himself for (1) rest between any duty at</P>
<P>his domestic domicile and the departure time of his flight from his domicile to</P>
<P>the TDY assignment equal to that required by Section 3-M-1 of this International</P>
<P>Supplement, (2) online transportation from his domicile to the TDY assignment</P>
<P>and (3) at least 18 hours off between his scheduled arrival at the TDY </P>
<P>assignment and his first duty. In satisfying the requirements of this sub</P>
<P>paragraph "a" and sub paragraph "b", below, the pilot may be required to travel</P>
<P>on a continuous multi-segment itinerary so long as the en route time of these</P>
<P>flights is not scheduled to exceed eighteen and one-half (18-1/2) hours. If the</P>
<P>pilot schedules himself to arrive at the TDY assignment on a flight that would</P>
<P>provide at least 18 hours off; then, in the actual operation, 16 hours off will be</P>
<P>the applicable minimum.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3-b- </B>If the time is not already available in the pilot's schedule to travel to </P>
<P>His home domicile from the final month of the TDY assignment, he shall have his</P>
<P>following month's schedule modified under the month-end conflict provisions of</P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">PAGE 108</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 5 of the Agreement in order to have enough time to schedule himself </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for (1) rest between his last TDY flight assignment and the start of his travel to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his home domicile equal to that required by Section 3-M-1 of this International</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Supplement, (2) online transportation to his domicile from the TDY assignment</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and (3) at least 36 hours off between his scheduled arrival at his domicile and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his first duty at his domicile. If the pilot has scheduled himself to arrive at his.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;domicile on a flight that is scheduled to provide him with at least thirty-six (36)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hours off, 24 hours off shall be the minimum requirement in the actual </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;operation prior to any assignment at his home domicile.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3-c- </B>It is understood that the provisions of "I-3-a" and "I-3-b", above, when</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;applied in conjunction with the Company's current passenger timetable, will</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;produce a schedule of rest periods and fight itineraries which may not reflect</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the actual arrangements that the pilot elects to use; nonetheless these rests</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and flight itineraries will be used (1) to determine what, if any, adjustments are</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;required to the pilot's line or reserve days off in the months adjoining his TDY</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assignment and (2) to determine how many, if any, vacation days or regular</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;days off need to be restored under paragraph I-4, below. In determining the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;number of days lost due to positioning, the departure time of the flight</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;established in "I-3-a", above, and the arrival time of the flight established in</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"I-3-b", above, shall be used to define which days have been lost.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3-d- </B>It is further understood that each pilot is required to make his own </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;travel arrangements and is free to travel during any time that is available to </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;him without impacting his schedule, after any adjustments that are required </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;above.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the pilot chooses to travel from or return to a US point other than his </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;domicile, he will be responsible for his own domestic transportation to and </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;from the gateway city.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-3-e- </B>The pilot shall be entitled to expense reimbursement for the period of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TDY under the provisions of Section 4-E-1 of the Agreement and Section 2-A </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of this International Supplement, and for the travel time necessary between the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pilots domicile and the TDY assignment and any required en route stopover</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;during positioning travel between his domicile and the TDY assignment.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, if the pilot actually arrives at the TDY assignment early, the Company</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will reimburse expenses for up to two (2) calendar days prior to his first flight</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assignment or from the first day of the TDY month, whichever is earlier.</P>
<B><P>I-4- </B>Restoration of days off and vacation days lost due to positioning will be</P>
<P>subject to the following:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-a- </B>Should the pilot lose a vacation day or days outside his TDY period as </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a result of positioning himself, the Company will restore the lost vacation </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;day(s) to the pilot.</P>
<B><P>Page 109</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-b- </B>If a lineholder pilot loses no more than one day off outside the TDY</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;month due to outbound positioning and/or one day off outside the TDY month</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;due to return positioning, there will be no restoration of that (those) lost day(s)</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;off.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any additional days off lost due to positioning will be restored to the pilot,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as described below.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-c- </B>Lost vacation and regular days off will be added to either the pilot's</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;vacation in the following year or to any remaining subsequent vacation in the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;current year, at the pilot's option.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-d- </B>Any restoration of vacation days or regular days off will not entitle the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;pilot to any additional vacation splits beyond what the pilot was originally</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;entitled to under the provisions of Section and 11-G-2-b of the </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-e- </B>If a pilot volunteers for the TDY assignment for two or more </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consecutive months, restoration of any lost vacation days or regular days off </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will be provided only for those days necessarily lost as a result of positioning </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;immediately prior to the first month of the TDY period and immediately </P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;subsequent to the last month of the TDY period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I-4-f- </B>The pilot will be required to advise the Company within 48 hours of the</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;publication of any schedule which generates days owed if he has a preference</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;regarding when those days owed will be restored.</P>
<B><P>I-5- </B>Pilots who are involuntarily assigned to a TDY assignment will not be </P>
<P>required to position themselves on either regular days off or on vacation days </P>
<P>outside of the month of the TDY, but may do so voluntarily. If they lose vacation </P>
<P>days or days off as a result of volunteering, they will be entitled to schedule </P>
<P>adjustments and/or to restoration of lost days as provided above for volunteers.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="CENTER">SECTION </B>7- DELHI PROVISIONS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">The following provisions will apply when operating to and from Delhi, India:</P>
<B><P>A</B>. These provisions shall apply only to operations conducted in B-747-400, B-</P>
<P>777 and B-767 aircraft. Prior to implementing operations in another equipment </P>
<P>type, or to any cities in India except Delhi, the parties will meet to review the </P>
<P>experience gained in the operation and reach agreement on any changes, if </P>
<P>necessary, to initiate such flying.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>Section 3-B above (Atlantic Operations) shall apply to non-stop London-Delhi</P>
<P>operations, except for paragraph 3-B-2-c and 3-B-2-d. "Atlantic Crossing", as it</P>
<P>applies to operations conducted under this Section, will mean any operation </P>
<B><P ALIGN="RIGHT">Page 110</P>
</B><P>between London and Delhi. Section 3-D above will apply to all non-stop </P>
