<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Cessation of work</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with </P>
<P>the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between </P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR </P>
<P>LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as represented by the </P>
<P>AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as </P>
<P>the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>WHEREAS, there are occasions when the Company is confronted with the </P>
<P>cessation of work by other Company employees of indefinite duration, and</P>
<P>WHEREAS, it is to the mutual interest of the parties to discuss and review the</P>
<P>alternatives available and problems generated by such cessation of work.</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed that:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 143</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>The Association will be advised as events develop that could lead to a </P>
<P>cessation of work by other employees of the Company.</P>
<P>The Association will be apprised of the Company's plan of action as it affects </P>
<P>pilots in the event of such cessation of work.</P>
<P>The Company will afford the Association the opportunity to consult with and </P>
<P>make recommendations as to any pilot problems associated with such cessation </P>
<P>of work, other than those specifically agreed to in the attached Notice.</P>
<P>This Letter of Agreement shall be effective as of the date of signing and shall </P>
<P>Run concurrently with the duration of the 1991 Pilot Agreement.</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement this </P>
<P>9<SUP>th</SUP> day of May, 1991.</P>
</FONT><U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>WITNESS:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ G.L. Andrews</P>
<P>/s/ T.A. McClone</P>
<P>/s/ R.W. Rosinia</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ J.R. Samolis</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>John R. Samolis</P>
<P>Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>WITNESS</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1>:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>FOR THE AIR LINE PILOTS IN THE SERVICE OF</P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ T.P. Austin</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ C.A. Rine</P>
<P>/s/ L.J. Balestra</P>
<P>/s/ H.E. Stepinsky</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ J. Randolph Babbit</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>J. Randolph Babbitt, President</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 144</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>TO: ALL FLIGHT OFFICERS AFFECTED BY TEMPORARY CESSATION OF </P>
<P>WORK</P>
<P>The purpose of this notice is to outline your status with regard to compensation </P>
<P>and benefits during this period of work cessation. You will be returned to service </P>
<P>as soon as possible after our services have been restored and work becomes </P>
<P>available.</P>
<P>If the____________________________strikes, you will be continued on pay </P>
<P>status through the___________day after the cessation of work. This period of </P>
<P>pay status may be extended if, after discussion with the Association, it is </P>
<P>determined that a longer period is operationally necessary. Pilots will be returned </P>
<P>to their home domicile or UA station nearest their home at no expense to </P>
<P>themselves. Pilots may be required to fly crew ferries to accomplish this </P>
<P>requirement. It is understood that a pilot who is not returned to his domicile will </P>
<P>continue to be on pay status until he is actually returned to his domicile or on the </P>
<P>basis of planned arrival time at this domicile, if the pilot requests to remain at an </P>
<P>outer station for personal reasons.</P>
<B><P>1. </B><U>Address and Telephone Number</P>
</U><P>You should be sure your Flight Office has your present address and telephone </P>
<P>number and you should keep them advised of any change during this period.</P>
<B><P>2. </B><U>Company and Classification Seniority</P>
</U><P>Your Company seniority, pilot seniority and pilot longevity will continue to accrue.</P>
<B><P>3. </B><U>Compensation</P>
</U><P>Each pilot will be paid the portion of his salary based on the application of </P>
<P>Section 3-C-1 and 3-C-2 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>4. </B><U>Bids and Preferencing</P>
</U><P>Although the strike may require changes in the planned activations, activations </P>
<P>Will continue for pilots who are qualified to assume their new assignment and </P>
<P>who possess a notice of activation which has not been cancelled. All other pilots </P>
<P>will be retained in their equipment, status and domicile assignment as of the date </P>
<P>of the cessation of work. For the purpose of line assignment upon resumption of </P>
<P>service, the Company shall continue to post schedules, comprised of the </P>
<P>Company's planned operation, for pilot preferencing during the period of the </P>
<P>strike. Pilots will not be required to cross a picket line in order to preference </P>
<B><P>Page 145</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>schedules.</P>
<B><P>5. </B><U>Vacation Status</P>
</U><P>All pilots who were on vacation status at the commencement of the strike will </P>
<P>remain on that status through the duration of the scheduled vacation period. </P>
<P>Pilots scheduled for a vacation during the work stoppage, will be certified for </P>
<P>vacation pay as scheduled. Vacations may not be deferred.</P>
<B><P>6. </B><U>Sick Leave</P>
</U><P>Our sick leave pay policy is to compensate employees for potential lost earnings </P>
<P>due to illness during their normal working hours. If you are ill during the cessation </P>
<P>of work, you are not entitled to either occupational or non-occupational sick leave </P>
<P>pay. However, pilots exhausting sick leave prior to permanent grounding will </P>
<P>continue to receive the remainder of their accrued sick leave during the cessation </P>
<P>of work. Also, continuation of occupational or non-occupational sick leave pay for </P>
<P>hardship cases will be considered jointly by the Company and the Association on </P>
<P>an individual basis.</P>
<B><P>7. </B><U>Insurance</P>
</U><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-a- </B>United realizes that your Group Insurance protection will afford you</P>
<P>considerable peace of mind during this emergency. Consequently, your Basic</P>
<P>Group Life Insurance, Supplemental Contributory Life Insurance, Accidental </P>
<P>Death and Dismemberment Insurance, the Accident-Sickness and Dental Plan </P>
<P>and the Health Maintenance Organization Plan will remain in effect until:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-a-1- </B>Notice of termination of insurance is mailed to you at your last </P>
<P>known address.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-a-2- </B>You resign or begin permanent active employment with a company </P>
<P>other than United.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-b- </B>The contribution you would have been required to pay to maintain the</P>
<P>Supplemental Contributory Life Insurance and 24-Hour Personal Accident</P>
<P>Insurance protection will be deducted from your pay following your resumption of</P>
<P>active employment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-c- </B>Accident-Sickness-Dental Insurance claims can be filed in the normal</P>
<P>manner during this emergency.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7-d- </B>In the event you do not wish to have your insurance continued, contact </P>
<P>your Flight Office for the form letter which you must complete, sign and return to </P>
<P>EXOIN within ten (10) days following the date of the work stoppage.</P>
<B><P>Page 146</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>8. </B><U>Retirement Income Plan</P>
</U><P>Participation and contributions are discontinued during any period in which no </P>
<P>pay is received. Any monthly earnings, at less than full compensation due to the </P>
<P>strike, will be excluded from consideration in final earnings for pension or </P>
<P>disability benefits under the Fixed Plan. In determining the annual average of the </P>
<P>participant's earnings, the denominator shall not include those months for which </P>
<P>earnings have been disregarded in accordance with this provision.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>9. </B><U>Unemployment Compensation</P>
</U><P>You are eligible to apply for unemployment compensation. Eligibility for benefits </P>
<P>Is determined by the particular State Unemployment Compensation Bureau.</P>
<B><P>10. </B><U>Credit Union</P>
</U><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10-a- </B>Existing Loans</P>
<P>Employees are expected to continue making loan repayments, unless the </P>
<P>Credit Union declares a general suspension of loan repayments. Hardship </P>
<P>cases are reviewable on an individual basis.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10-b- </B>Savings</P>
<P>Withdrawal by mail will be permitted.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10-c- </B>New Loans</P>
<P>New loans will be considered on an emergency basis only.</P>
<B><P>11. </B>All time periods set forth in Section 6-C, 8, 17 and 18 of the Pilot Agreement </P>
<P>will be extended to reflect the period of cessation of work, except as specified in</P>
<P>Paragraph 5 above.</P>
<B><P>12. </B><U>Return To Service</P>
</U><P>When the cessation of work is over and work again becomes available, your </P>
<P>Flight Office or OPBCM will get in touch with you as quickly as possible. All pilots </P>
<P>will return to service simultaneously on a date determined by the Company.</P>
<P>We hope for an early resumption of service.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 147</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">/s/ John R. Samolis</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">John R. Samolis</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">Vice President</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>9th day of May, 1991.</P>
<P>/s/ F. C. Dubinsky</P>
<P>F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman.</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Master Executive Council.</P>
</FONT><I><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>UP-PAC</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with </P>
<P>the provisions of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED </P>
<P>AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE </P>
<P>PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as represented by the AIR </P>
<P>LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>It is mutually agreed:</P>
<P>The Company agrees to deduct a monthly contribution to the United Pilots </P>
<P>Political Action Committee (referred to herein as "UP-PAC") from the pay of each </P>
<P>pilot who voluntarily authorizes such contributions on the forms provided for that </P>
<P>purpose by UP-PAC (referred to herein as "Check-Off Forms").</P>
<B><P>B. </B>The language of those forms shall be as follows:</P>
<P>TO: United Air Lines, Inc.</P>
<B><P>Page 148</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>I hereby authorize and direct the Company named above to deduct </P>
<P>$__________ of my gross earnings per month and to remit that amount to the </P>
<P>United Pilots Political Action Committee, Air Line Pilots Association (UP-PAC, </P>
<P>ALPA).</P>
<P>This authorization is made based on my specific understanding that:</P>
<P>The signing of this authorization card and the making of these voluntary</P>
<P>contributions are not conditions of membership in the Union or of my </P>
<P>employment by my employer;</P>
<P>Any guideline amount suggest by UP-PAC, ALPA or its representatives is only </P>
<P>a suggestion and I may contribute more or less and will not be favored or</P>
<P>disadvantaged by the Union for doing so; I may refuse to contribute without </P>
<P>reprisal; and.<B> </B>UP-PAC, ALPA, which is connected with the United Pilots </P>
<P>Master Executive Council of the Air Line Pilots Association, International, and </P>
<P>which is affiliated with the Air Line Pilots Association Political Action </P>
<P>Committee, may use the money it receives solely for making contributions to </P>
<P>and expenditure for candidates for elected offices and for other political </P>
<P>activities at the federal, state, and/or local level consistent with applicable laws </P>
<P>relating to such activities.</P>
<P>This authorization shall remain in full force and effect </P>
<P>until revoked in writing by me, pursuant to the provisions of the Agreement </P>
<P>between United Air Lines, Inc. and the Air Line Pilots Association, </P>
<P>International.</P>
<P>I further certify that I am either a United States citizen or a foreign national </P>
<P>Lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence as defined by </P>
<P>section 101(s) (20) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(s) </P>
<P>(20)).</P>
<P>Name:__________________________________________________</P>
<P>File Number:_____________________________________________</P>
<P>Residence:______________________________________________</P>
<P>Address:________________________________________________</P>
<P>Signature:_______________________________________________</P>
<P>Date:___________________________________________________</P>
<B><P>Page 149</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Authorized by the United Pilots Master Executive Council of the Air Line Pilots</P>
<P>Association, International on behalf of a fundraising effort for United Pilots </P>
<P>Political Action Committee.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>All Check-Off Forms will be submitted through the Chairman of the Master</P>
<P>Executive Council of the Association who will forward the original signed copy to </P>
<P>the Payroll Accounting Manager, Executive Offices, Chicago, Illinois. A properly </P>
<P>executed Check-Off Form, filed before the 15th of any month, will become </P>
<P>effective the 1st of the month following its receipt by the Payroll Section of the </P>
<P>Accounting Department, Chicago, Illinois. Illegible or improperly executed forms </P>
<P>will be returned to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council of the </P>
<P>Association.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>Any notice of revocation as set forth in the Check-Off Form must be in writing,</P>
<P>signed by the employee, and delivered by certified mail, addressed to the Payroll</P>
<P>Accounting Manager, United Air Lines, Inc., P. O. Box 66100, Chicago, Illinois </P>
<P>60666, with a copy to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council as soon as </P>
<P>processed through Company payroll procedures. Check-Off Form and notices so </P>
<P>received by the Company will be stamp-dated on the date received and will </P>
<P>constitute notice to the Company of the date received and not when </P>
<P>mailed.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Deduction of a pilot's contributions shall be made each month provided there </P>
<P>is a sufficient balance due the pilot at the time after all other deductions </P>
<P>authorized by the pilot or required by law (including money claims of the </P>
<P>Company and the Credit Union) have been satisfied. Within a reasonable time </P>
<P>after the second regular paycheck issued each month, the Company will remit to </P>
<P>the UP-PAC a check in payment of contributions collected for that month </P>
<P>pursuant to outstanding and unrevoked Check-Off Forms, together with a list of </P>
<P>the names of those pilots for whom contributions were deducted and the amount </P>
<P>deducted for each such pilot.</P>
<P>A pilot who has executed a Check-Off Form and (1) who resigns from the </P>
<P>Company; (2) who is laid off; or is (3) otherwise terminated from the employ of </P>
<P>the Company shall be deemed to have automatically revoked his assignment as </P>
<P>of the date of such action and if he (1) is rehired; (2) is recalled; or (3) </P>
<P>reemployed, further deductions of UP-PAC contributions will be made only upon </P>
<P>execution and receipt of another Check-Off Form.</P>
<P>It will be the Association's responsibility to verify apparent errors in deduction </P>
<P>of UP-PAC contributions before contacting the Company Payroll Accounting </P>
<P>Manager.</P>
<P>United Air Lines, Inc. shall be held harmless and indemnified by the </P>
<B><P>Page 150</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Association for any claims which may be made by the pilot or pilots by virtue of </P>
<P>the wrongful application and misapplication of any of the terms of this Section. </P>
<P>The Company shall also be held harmless and indemnified by the Association for </P>
<P>any claims, expenses, and judgements (including reasonable attorney fees) </P>
<P>which may arise out of the use of the Company's payroll deduction process for </P>
<P>funds transmitted to UP-PAC for making contributions to and expenditures for </P>
<P>candidates for state and local offices.</P>
<P>The Association shall pay the Company the reasonable costs incurred in</P>
<P>implementing and maintaining this Section.</P>
<B><P>J. </B>The Association hereby certifies to the Company that:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; J-1- </B>No assignment and authorization will be transmitted to the Company</P>
<P>hereunder which was obtained by the Association under the twice-yearly</P>
<P>solicitation provisions of Section 441b.(b) (4) (B) of Title 2 of the United States</P>
<P>Code;</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;J-2- </B>All funds transmitted to the UP-PAC hereunder shall be used solely in</P>
<P>connection with federal, state and local elections.</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Agreement this 9th day of </P>
<P>May, 1991.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>WITNESS:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ G.L. Andrews</P>
<P>/s/ T.A. McClone</P>
<P>/s/ R.W. Rosinia</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ J.R. Samolis</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>John R. Samolis</P>

<P>Employee Relations</FONT></TD>

<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>WITNESS</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1>:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>FOR THE AIR LINE PILOTS IN THE SERVICE OF</P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>

<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ T.P. Austin</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">

</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>/s/ C.A. Rine</P>
<P>/s/ L.J. Balestra</P>
<P>/s/ H.E. Stepinsky</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<U><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>/s/ J. Randolph Babbit</P>
</U></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>J. Randolph Babbitt, President</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</FONT></TD>

</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 151</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><I><P>CLR</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>May 9, 1991</P>
<P>Captain F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</P>
<P>10700 W. Higgins Road, Suite 200</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>Dear Captain Dubinsky:</P>
<P>Because the Command/Leadership/Resource Management Seminar Training </P>
<P>Program is a new concept in the airline industry, it is necessary to have an </P>
<P>understanding of the application of some provisions of the Agreement. This </P>
<P>Letter of Understanding outlines these provisions and other stipulations as they </P>
<P>apply to pilots involved in C/L/ R seminar training.</P>
<B><P>1. </B>Compensation - Compensation will be paid in accordance with Section 9 of the</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>Expenses - Meal expense in accordance with Section 4-A-1 of the Agreement </P>
<P>will be paid, minus the actual expense incurred by the Company for meals </P>
<P>provided during the training session. Reasonable actual ground transportation </P>
<P>expenses will be paid between the airport and the location of the C/L/R seminar </P>
<P>training. Lodging will be provided by the Company.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>Duty Day - In order for training to be effective, long duty days are a basic</P>
<P>requirement for the C/L/R seminar program. The normal contractual training </P>
<P>schedule requirements of the Basic and Supplemental Agreements will not apply. </P>
<P>In any event, no duty day shall exceed 14:15 hours except by consent of the </P>
<P>participants.</P>
<B><P>4. </B>Assignment to Training - Notification and assignment to seminar training will </P>
<P>be prior to pilot schedule preferencing whenever practical, but in no case less </P>
<P>than seven (7) days prior to commencement of Command/Leadership/Resource </P>
<P>Management Seminar Training. Short notice scheduling will be limited to cases </P>
<P>where a previously scheduled pilot has had to cancel his/her training for any </P>
<P>reason.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 152</P>
<P>5. </B>Completion of Training - Upon completion of C/L/R seminar training, a pilot will </P>
<P>be given not less than one (1) calendar day free of all duty at his home domicile, </P>
<P>provided he is not scheduled for such time off in his line of flying or as a reserve. </P>
<P>The pilot will be given pay and flight time credit for any trip(s) he must drop to </P>
<P>provide such calendar day off.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>Alternates for Seminars - Alternates will be scheduled for each seminar. Pilots </P>
<P>who are designated as alternates will be scheduled for two seminars, </P>
<P>approximately two weeks apart. Designated alternates will stand by for the first of </P>
<P>these seminars, and if they are released to return to their domicile, will attend </P>
<P>and participate as a scheduled attendee in the second seminar approximately </P>
<P>two weeks later. Alternates will be given pay and flight time credit for any trip(s) </P>
<P>they must drop for their regularly scheduled seminar and for the preceding </P>
<P>seminar for which they are designated as an alternate. Pilots who are scheduled </P>
<P>but do not attend, and are replaced by an alternate, will be scheduled </P>
<P>approximately two weeks later in the seminar for which the alternate was </P>
<P>scheduled as a regular participant</P>
<B><P>7. </B>Modifications to C/L/R Seminar Training - to retain ALPA support for the </P>
<P>program, the Company and ALPA must agree on any subsequent modifications.</P>
<B><P>8. </B>Disciplinary Action - No information resulting from a pilot's participation in a </P>
<P>C/L/R seminar may be used in any disciplinary action nor may be used in any </P>
<P>way to the detriment of any United pilot.</P>
<B><P>9. </B>Record Keeping - No records of pilot performance during C/L/R seminar </P>
<P>training will be kept by anyone inside or outside the Company.</P>
<B><P>10. </B>Additional Phases of C/L/R Training - Development of any additional phases </P>
<P>of C/L/R training will be with full participation by ALPA representatives and will </P>
<P>not be implemented without review by the United MEC, or its Officers.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<U><P>/s/ H. A. Langer</P>
</U><P>Hart A. Langer</P>
<P>Senior Vice President</P>
<P>Flight Operations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>9th day of May, 1991.</P>
<U><P>/s/ F. C. Dubinsky</P>
</U><P>F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<B><P>Page 153</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Dues Check-Off</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with the provisions </P>
<P>of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED AIR LINES, </P>
<P>INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>It is mutually agreed:</P>
<P>During the life of the 1991 Pilot Agreement, the Company will deduct from the </P>
<P>pay of the members of the Association the appropriate amounts described in </P>
<P>sub-paragraph A-1 and A-2 below provided such member of the Association </P>
<P>voluntarily executes one of the following agreed upon forms which will be </P>
<P>prepared and furnished by the Association as a "Check-Off Form."</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>ASSIGNMENT AND AUTHORIZATION FOR VOLUNTARY CHECK-</P>
<P>OFF OF ASSOCIATION DUES</P>
<P>I, _____________________________, hereby authorize and direct United Air</P>
<P>Lines, Inc. to deduct 1.35% of my gross earnings as standard membership </P>
<P>dues (or such standard monthly membership dues as may hereafter be </P>
<P>established by the Association). Such amount so deducted is hereby assigned </P>
<P>to the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL, subject to all the </P>
<P>terms and provisions of the applicable collective bargaining agreement. This </P>
<P>assignment and authorization may be revoked by me in writing after the </P>
<P>expiration of one (1) year from the date hereof, or the time this is signed, </P>
<P>whichever occurs sooner. A copy of any such revocation will be sent to the </P>
<P>Chairman of the Master Executive Council.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 154</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Signature of Employees _____________________________________</P>
<P>Street Address ____________________________________________</P>
<P>City _____________________________________________________</P>
<P>File Number_________________ </P>
<P>Domicile________________________</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>ASSIGNMENT AND AUTHORIZATION FOR VOLUNTARY CHECK-</P>
<P>OFF OF PAST ASSOCIATION DUES OBLIGATIONS</P>
<P>I,______________________________, hereby authorize and direct United Air</P>
<P>Lines, Inc. to deduct $_________ of my monthly gross earnings up to a total </P>
<P>dollar amount of $_______, to pay for back dues owed to the Association. </P>
<P>Such amount so deducted is hereby assigned to the AIR LINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL, subject to all the terms and conditions of </P>
<P>the Railway Labor Act, as amended, and the provisions of the applicable </P>
<P>collective bargaining agreement. This assignment and authorization may be </P>
<P>revoked by me in writing after the expiration of one (1) year from the date </P>
<P>hereof, or upon the renewable date of the Pilots' Agreement in effect at the </P>
<P>time this is signed, whichever occurs sooner. A copy of any such revocation </P>
<P>will be sent to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council.</P>
<P>Signature of Employees _____________________________________</P>
<P>Street Address ____________________________________________</P>
<P>City _____________________________________________________</P>
<P>File Number_________________ Domicile_______________________</P>
<B><P>B. </B>All Check-Off Forms will be submitted through the Chairman of the Master</P>
<P>Executive Council who will forward the original signed copy to the Payroll </P>
<P>Accounting Manager, Executive Offices, Chicago, Illinois. A properly executed </P>
<P>Check-Off Form, filed before the 15th of any month, will become effective the 1st </P>
<P>of the month following its receipt by the Payroll Section of the Accounting </P>
<P>Department, Chicago, Illinois. Illegible or improperly executed forms will be </P>
<P>returned to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council of the Association.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>Any notice of revocation as set forth in the Check-Off Form must be in writing,</P>
<P>signed by the employee and delivered by certified mail, addressed to the Payroll</P>
<P>Accounting Manager, United Air Lines, Inc., P. O. Box 66100, Chicago, Illinois </P>
<P>60666, with a copy to the Chairman of the Master Executive Council as soon as </P>
<P>processed through Company payroll procedures. Check-Off Form and notices so </P>
<P>received by the Company will be stamp-dated on the date received and will </P>
<P>constitute notice to the Company of the date received and not when mailed.</P>
<B><P>Page 155</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>D. </B>Deduction of total members' total obligations shall be made from all </P>
<P>paychecks issued each month provided there is a sufficient balance due the </P>
<P>employee at the time after all other deductions authorized by the employee or </P>
<P>required by law (including money claims of the Company and the Credit Union) </P>
<P>have been satisfied. Within a reasonable time after the second regular paycheck </P>
<P>issued each month, the Company will remit to the Association a check in </P>
<P>payment of all dues collected for that month pursuant to outstanding and </P>
<P>unrevoked Check-Off Forms.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>An employee who has executed a Check-Off Form and who has been (1)</P>
<P>transferred or promoted to a job outside of the Flight Operations Division; (2) who</P>
<P>resigns from the Company; (3) who is laid off; or is (4) otherwise terminated from </P>
<P>the employ of the Company shall be deemed to have automatically revoked his</P>
<P>assignment as of the date of such action and if he (1) transfers back or returns to </P>
<P>a job covered by the Agreement; (2) is rehired; (3) is recalled; or (4) reemployed, </P>
<P>further deductions of Association dues will be made only upon execution and </P>
<P>receipt of another Check-Off Form.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>It will be the Association's responsibility to verify apparent errors or back dues</P>
<P>owed by an individual Association member before contacting the Company </P>
<P>Payroll Accounting Manager or payroll deduction of such missed collections.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>In cases where a deduction is made which duplicates a payment already </P>
<P>made to the Association by an employee and where a deduction is not in </P>
<P>conformity with the provisions of the Association Constitution and Bylaws, </P>
<P>refunds to the employee will be made by the Association.</P>
<B><P>H. </B>United Air Lines, Inc. shall be held harmless and indemnified by the </P>
<P>Association for any claims which may be made by the employee or employees by </P>
<P>virtue of the wrongful application and misapplication of any of the terms of this </P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>I. </B>This Agreement shall become effective as of the date of signing and shall be </P>
<P>subject to changes in the same manner as specified in Section 22 of the 1991 </P>
<P>Pilots' Employment Agreement.</P>
<B><P>J. </B>The terms of this Letter of Agreement 91-27 do not provide for the automatic</P>
<P>revocation of the pilot's assignment under such circumstances. The Company </P>
<P>will therefore make the appropriate changes to the payroll process that recognize </P>
<P>the revocation of the pilot's dues check-off assignment only under the </P>
<P>circumstances expressly stated in Letter of Agreement 91-27 Section A-1, </P>
<P>Section A-2 and Section E.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 156</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Agreement this 9th day of </P>
<P>May, 1991.</P>

</U><P>William P. Hobgood</P>

<P>Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council.</P>
<I><P ALIGN="CENTER">MEC Officer displacement</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<B><P>Page 157</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with </P>
<P>the provisions of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED </P>
<P>AIRLINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE </P>
<P>PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIRLINES, INC., as represented by the AIR </P>
<P>LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed:</P>
<B><P>1. </B>The MEC Officers shall be paid, at the appropriate hourly pay rates, for eighty-</P>
<P>one (81) hours, or eighty-five (85) hours if holding an international assignment, </P>
<P>plus the value of any legal inbound each month during their terms. During such </P>
<P>term of office, the Company will not assign specific vacation periods to the </P>
<P>Officers with the understanding that it is the responsibility of each MEC Officer to </P>
<P>arrange for the vacation time off which he is due. At the beginning of each </P>
<P>vacation year, Officers will be provided written notification of their responsibilities </P>
<P>under this provision. Upon returning to line flying at the end of his term of office, </P>
<P>all vacation due to each Officer in the current and prior vacation years will be </P>
<P>considered to have been assigned and taken. Full time National Officers also </P>
<P>shall be subject to this vacation procedure.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>The pilot members of the ALPA Negotiating Committee shall be displaced from </P>
<P>their scheduled trips when meeting with the Company during the term of this </P>
<P>Agreement. During Section 6 negotiations, or during other negotiations that are </P>
<P>anticipated to cover a monthly bid period, the pilot members of the Negotiating </P>
<P>Committee shall be paid, at the appropriate hourly pay rates, for eighty-one (81) </P>
<P>hours, or eighty-five (85) hours if holding an international assignment, plus the </P>
<P>value of any legal inbound for the duration of those negotiations.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>When required to attend formal meetings with the Company in their capacity </P>
<P>as MEC Committee Members, the pilot members of the System Schedule </P>
<P>Committee, the Central Air Safety Committee, the Retirement and Insurance </P>
<P>Committee, the Hotel Committee (not including hotel inspections) and the </P>
<P>Employee Assistance Committee shall be displaced from their schedules in order </P>
<P>to attend such meetings.</P>
<B><P>4. </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 20-H, any LEC Officer shall be </P>
<P>permitted to trade a trip from his line of flying for any other trip which is in "open </P>
<P>flying" in order to make himself available to conduct ALPA business.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 158</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>5. </B>Any LEC Officer may request to be displaced from his trip(s) for the purpose of</P>
<P>conducting Association business. His Flight Manager will determine if such</P>
<P>displacement(s) is possible, based upon the availability of management pilots </P>
<P>who have a need to perform such flying. Trips which are not covered by </P>
<P>management pilots on a displacement basis are subject to the existing procedure </P>
<P>covering dropped trips for Association business.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>When pilots are removed from schedule at ALPA request, except when</P>
<P>displacement is provided by this Letter of Agreement, the Company shall pay </P>
<P>each such pilot as if he had performed his scheduled duties and will then bill </P>
<P>ALPA for the amount of flight pay associated with those dropped trips, including </P>
<P>the actual cost of fringe benefits.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>When a special MEC meeting is held for the purpose of conducting business </P>
<P>at the Company's request, the Company will pay all flight pay loss incurred as a </P>
<P>result of that meeting.</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement this </P>
<P>9<SUP>th</SUP> day of May, 1991.</P>

</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Age 59 By Pass</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">SUPPLEMENTAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS SUPPLEMENTAL LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in</P>
<P>accordance with the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, </P>
<P>by and between UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, </P>
<P>INC. as represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL </P>
<P>(hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>WHEREAS, the Company and the Association desire to supplement the 1991 </P>
<P>Pilot Agreement, dated May 9, 1991, as it relates to the B-747-400, B-747, B777 </P>
<P>and DC-10 Captain vacancies;</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed and understood as follows:</P>
<B><P>Page 160</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>A. </B>Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 8-D, any pilot who is awarded a B-</P>
<P>747- 400, B-747. B-777 or DC-10 Captain vacancy shall not be assigned to B-</P>
<P>747-400, B-747, B-777 or DC-10 transition training (training which, if performed </P>
<P>as scheduled, would produce a twenty-four (24) month freeze), if the planned </P>
<P>activation date of the vacancy is within one (1) year prior to his normal retirement </P>
<P>date.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-1- </B>Such pilot shall be paid based on B-747-400, B-747, B-777 or DC-10 </P>
<P>Captain rates of pay, as applicable, from the date he would have assumed the </P>
<P>awarded vacancy on a "man-for-man" systemwide seniority basis, until his </P>
<P>actual retirement, provided he continues to remain qualified in his regular </P>
<P>assignment.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A-2- </B>The period of entitlement for "man-for-man passover" pay to the </P>
<P>applicable pilot shall be determined on the awarding of each affected vacancy.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"
SIZE=2>Age at Planned</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For Example&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activation Date&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entitlement</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captain A&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;59 yrs. 10 mos.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 months</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captain B&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;59 yrs. 6 mos.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 months</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captain C&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;59 yrs. 2 mos.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 months</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captain D&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;58 yrs. 1 mo.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Trained</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</FONT><B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>B. </B>A pilot receiving Captain pay under the provisions of Paragraph A-1 above, </P>
<P>may not bid and be awarded a higher paying Captain vacancy under this </P>
<P>provision which has an advertised effective date prior to twelve (12) months </P>
<P>following the date he commenced receiving passover pay.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>The fact that a pilot is receiving DC-10, B-747 or B-747-400 pay under the</P>
<P>provisions of Paragraph A above, does not prevent him from exercising bidding </P>
<P>rights under Section 8-D to other than DC-10, B-747 or B-747-400 assignments.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>It shall be the responsibility of a pilot who receives an "alternate" vacancy </P>
<P>under the provisions of Paragraph A-1 and A-2 above to keep his BIDREQ </P>
<P>updated if he wants to be considered for the awarding of subsequent pay-only </P>
<P>vacancies.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Notwithstanding any bid restriction ("freeze") which a pilot may have incurred </P>
<P>by the application of paragraph 8-D-6-a resulting from his bidding and being </P>
<P>awarded a vacancy that is not subject to the provisions of this letter, the pilot </P>
<P>shall not be restricted from bidding and being awarded an assignment for which </P>
<B><P>Page 161</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>he will receive by-pass pay under the terms of this Letter.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>This Supplemental Letter of Agreement shall continue in full force and effect</P>
<P>concurrently with Section 22-C of the Pilot Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Supplemental Letter of</P>
<P>Agreement this 9th day of May, 1991. </P>

<U><P>/s/ John R. Samolis</P>

<P>Senior Vice President</P>
<P>People</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 162</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<U><P>/s/ F.C. Dubinsky</P>
</U><P>Captain F.C. Dubinsky</P>
<P>Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<I><P>Agency Shop</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance </P>
<P>with the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between UNITED AIR LINES, </P>
<P>INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS in the </P>
<P>service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS </P>
<P>ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as the "Association").</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>It is hereby mutually agreed:</P>
<B><P>A. </B>Each pilot of the Company on the United Air Lines Pilots' System Seniority List </P>
<P>or the Second Officer Eligibility Seniority List shall be required, as a condition of</P>
<P>employment, beginning sixty (60) days after the completion of his probationary </P>
<P>period: (1) to be or become a member of the Association; or (2) to pay to the </P>
<P>Association a monthly service charge for the administration of this Agreement </P>
<P>and representation of the pilot. Such monthly service charge shall be equal to the </P>
<P>Association's regular monthly dues, initiation fee and periodic assessments, </P>
<P>including MEC assessments, which would be required to be paid by such pilot if </P>
<P>a member; provided that neither membership nor the payment of a service </P>
<P>charge shall be required in respect to any such pilot: (a) for whom membership is </P>
<P>not available upon the same terms and conditions generally applicable to any </P>
<P>other member; or (b) as to whom membership was denied or terminated for any </P>
<P>reason other than the failure to tender periodic dues, initiation fees and </P>
<P>assessments uniformly required by the Association or the United</P>
<P>Air Lines MEC as a condition of acquiring or retaining membership. The </P>
<B><P>Page 163</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Association shall treat members and non-members alike in calculating the </P>
<P>amounts due, in establishing the due date of payments and in determining </P>
<P>whether a pilot's account is delinquent.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>If any pilot of the Company on the United Air Lines Pilots' System Seniority </P>
<P>List or the Second Officer Eligibility Seniority List who is required under this </P>
<P>Agreement to make payment of a service charge, [and/or membership dues, </P>
<P>and/or initiation fees, and/or periodic assessments (as defined in Paragraph A)] </P>
<P>becomes delinquent in accordance with the Association's Constitution and By-</P>
<P>Laws in the making of such payments, the Association shall notify such pilot by </P>
<P>Registered Mail, Return Receipt Requested, copy to the Senior Vice President-</P>
<P>Human Resources of the Company, his successor or designee, that he is </P>
<P>delinquent in the payments specified above, and the total amount of money due </P>
<P>and the period for which he is delinquent and that he is subject to discharge as </P>
<P>an employee of the Company. Such letter shall also notify the pilot that he must </P>
<P>remit the required payment within a period of fifteen (15) days or be</P>
<P>discharged. The notice of delinquency required under this Paragraph shall be </P>
<P>deemed to be received by the pilot, whether or not it is personally received by </P>
<P>him, when mailed by the Treasurer of the Association by Registered Mail, Return </P>
<P>Receipt Requested, postage prepaid to the pilot's last known address or to any </P>
<P>other address which has been designated by the pilot. It shall be the duty of </P>
<P>every pilot covered by this Agreement to notify the Association's Membership </P>
<P>Services Department of every change in his home address or of an address </P>
<P>where the notice required by this paragraph can be sent and received by the </P>
<P>pilot, if the pilot's home address is at any time unacceptable for this purpose.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>.If, upon the expiration of the fifteen (15) day period provided in Paragraph B</P>
<P>above, the pilot still remains delinquent, the Association shall certify in writing to </P>
<P>the Senior Vice President - Human Resources of the Company, his successor or</P>
<P>designee, copy to the pilot, both by Registered Mail, Return Receipt Requested, </P>
<P>that the pilot has failed to make payment within the grace period allowed and is, </P>
<P>therefore, to be discharged. The Senior Vice President - Human Resources, his </P>
<P>successor or designee, shall thereupon take proper steps to discharge such pilot </P>
<P>from the service of the Company as soon as possible and in any event within </P>
<P>twenty-one (21) days after receipt of the notice provided for herein, shall advise </P>
<P>the pilot of his termination.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>A protest by a pilot who is to be discharged as the result of an interpretation or</P>
<P>application of the provisions of this Agreement shall be subject to the following</P>
<P>procedures:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-1- </B>A pilot who believes that the said provisions have not been properly</P>
<P>interpreted or applied as they pertain to him, may submit his request for review </P>
<P>in writing within ten (10) days after receipt of the notification from the Senior </P>
<B><P>Page 164</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Vice President - Human Resources, as provided in Paragraph C above. The </P>
<P>request must be sent by Registered Mail, Return Receipt Requested, to the </P>
<P>Senior Vice President - Human Resources or his designee, who will review the </P>
<P>protest and render a decision in writing, not later than ten (10) days following </P>
<P>receipt of the protest.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-2- </B>The Senior Vice President - Human Resources or his designee shall </P>
<P>forward his decision to the pilot, with a copy to the Association, both by </P>
<P>Registered Mail, Return Receipt Requested. Said decision shall be final and </P>
<P>binding on all interested parties, unless appealed as hereinafter provided. If </P>
<P>the decision is not satisfactory to either the pilot or the Association, then either </P>
<P>may appeal within ten (10) days from the receipt of the decision, by filing a </P>
<P>notice of appeal. Such notice shall be sent to the other party and to the </P>
<P>Company, by Registered Mail, Return Receipt Requested. Appeal shall be </P>
<P>directed to a Neutral Referee who shall be agreed upon by the pilot and the </P>
<P>Association within ten (10) days after receipt of the notice of appeal. In the </P>
<P>event the parties fail to agree upon a Neutral Referee within the specified </P>
<P>period, either the pilot or the Association may request the National Mediation </P>
<P>Board to name such Neutral Referee. The hearing before the Neutral Referee </P>
<P>shall be held as soon as possible and the decision of the Neutral</P>
<P>Referee shall be requested within thirty (30) days after the hearing. The </P>
<P>decision of the Neutral Referee shall be final and binding on all parties to the </P>
<P>dispute. The fees and charges of such Neutral Referee shall be borne equally </P>
<P>by the pilot and the Association.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>During the period a protest is being handled, as herein provided, and until final</P>
<P>decision is rendered by the Senior Vice President - Human Resources, his </P>
<P>designee or the Neutral Referee, the pilot shall not be discharged from the </P>
<P>Company nor lose any seniority rights because of non-compliance with the terms </P>
<P>and provisions herein.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>A pilot discharged by the Company under the provisions herein shall be </P>
<P>deemed to have been "discharged for cause" within the meaning of the terms </P>
<P>and provisions of the Pilot Employment Agreement.</P>
<B><P>G. </B>The Company shall be held harmless and indemnified by the Association for </P>
<P>any and all claims, awards or judgments, including court costs, which may result </P>
<P>from action by any pilot or pilots by virtue of the wrongful application or </P>
<P>misinterpretation of any of the terms of this Agreement.</P>
<B><P>H. </B>It is understood that the requirements of Paragraph A above shall not apply to </P>
<P>any pilot during periods of time he holds a management position.</P>
<B><P>I. </B>This Supplemental Agreement shall become effective as of the date of signing </P>
<B><P>Page 165</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>and shall be subject to changes in the same manner as specified in Section 22 of </P>
<P>the Pilots Employment Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Supplemental Agreement </P>
<P>this 9th day of May, 1991.</P></FONT>

<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><I><P>LAX 737-300 and 757/767 domicile</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>May 9, 1991</P>
<P>Captain F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Dear Captain Dubinsky:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>During the current negotiations pursuant to Section 6 of the Railway Labor Act, </P>
<P>the parties agreed to execute this Agreement and immediately implement the </P>
<P>following provisions in conjunction with the Company announced opening of a </P>
<P>new B-737-300 equipment domicile at LAX.</P>
<B><P>Page 166</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Effective upon the opening of the LAX B-737-300 equipment domicile the SNA </P>
<P>and LGB airports shall be considered "airports serving" the LAX domicile only for </P>
<P>LAX B-737- 300 pilots. The following stations and times are to be considered as </P>
<P>added to Section 5-G-1-b-(3) of the Agreement and shall only be applicable in </P>
<P>the scheduling of LAX B-737-300 pilots:</P>
<P>LAX - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>LAX - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>BUR - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:15</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>BUR - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:30</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>ONT - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>ONT - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>LGB - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>It is further agreed that the provisions of Section 4-D-3 of the Agreement shall </P>
<P>apply to LAX B-737-300 pilots scheduled in and out of LGB or SNA.</P>
<P>Additionally, for the scheduling of LAX based B-757/767 pilots the SNA airport </P>
<P>shall be considered as an airport "serving" the LAX B-757/767 equipment </P>
<P>domicile. The following station and time are to be considered as added to Section </P>
<P>5-G-1-b-(3) of the Agreement and shall be applicable in the scheduling of LAX B-</P>
<P>757/767 pilots:</P>
<P>LAX - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>LAX - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>BUR - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:15</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>BUR - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:30</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>ONT - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>ONT - LGB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>2:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>LGB - SNA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2>1:00</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 167</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><P>The provisions of Section 4-D-3 of the Agreement shall apply to LAX B-757/767 </P>
<P>pilots scheduled into and out of SNA. B-757/767 pilots assigned to domiciles </P>
<P>other than LAX shall not be scheduled to cross-town between SNA and L.A. </P>
<P>basin airports.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<U><P>/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
</U><P>John R. Samolis</P>
<P>Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>9th day of May, 1991.</P>
<U><P>/s/ F. C. Dubinsky</P>
</U><P>Captain F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Revised as of this 26th day of October, 2000.</P>

</U><P>William P. Hobgood</P>

</I><B><P>Page 168</P>
</B><I><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Company Personnel Policies</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>May 9, 1991</P>
<P>Captain T. P. Austin, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Negotiating Committee</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, Int'l.</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Dear Captain Austin:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>During the negotiations leading to the 1991 Agreement, the Company committed </P>
<P>that company personnel policy which affect pilots would not be changed without </P>
<P>giving advance notice to the Association and affording them the opportunity to </P>
<P>comment.</P>
<P>Further, no change will be made to any Company personnel policy </P>
<P>which is contrary to any of the terms of the collective bargaining agreement </P>
<P>between the parties.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<U><P>/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
</U><P>John R. Samolis</P>
<P>Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</P>
<I><P>Notice of Pending Furlough</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">SUPPLEMENTAL</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">in the service of</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">as represented by</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">INTERNATIONAL</P>
<B><P>Page 169</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>THIS SUPPLEMENTAL LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in</P>
<P>accordance with the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, </P>
<P>by and between UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the </P>
<P>"Company") and the AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, </P>
<P>INC. as represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, </P>
<P>INTERNATIONAL.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>WHEREAS, there are occasions when the Company may find it necessary to</P>
<P>implement the provisions of Section 7, Reduction in Personnel, of the </P>
<P>Agreement, and</P>
<P>WHEREAS, it is mutually beneficial to discuss creative and mutually </P>
<P>advantageous solutions to meet the above circumstances.</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed:</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1. </B>The Association will be advised of a pending furlough.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2. </B>The parties will attempt to achieve solutions consistent with the Company's </P>
<P>needs and the interest of the pilot group.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3. </B>Should these efforts fail to produce results, the provisions of the Agreement </P>
<P>shall prevail.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Supplemental Letter of</P>
<P>Agreement this 9th day of May, 1991.</P></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH=590>

<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR><TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP">

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 170</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><I><P>Definition of Activation Date</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>October 8, 1991</P>
<P>Captain F.C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL-ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Dear Rick:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>As a result of a recent grievance, the parties were made aware that it would be </P>
<P>useful to have a mutually agreed-to definition of the activation date of a pilot who </P>
<P>changes equipment and/or status. In discussions between the ALPA and </P>
<P>Company Negotiating Committees, it has been agreed that, for all purposes </P>
<P>related to the administration of the Collective Bargaining Agreement, a pilot shall </P>
<P>be considered activated in his new assignment at the beginning of the first </P>
<P>segment of his IOE. It is recognized that the pilot's pay may be changed prior to </P>
<P>activation as the result of the application of other provisions of the Agreement.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>If the pilot's activation is delayed and he becomes entitled to a bump, his </P>
<P>Entitlement to bump shall expire if his bump is not received by the Company prior </P>
<P>to his first segment of IOE. In the event the pilot does not successfully complete </P>
<P>his IOE, his activation shall be cancelled; however any expired bump entitlement </P>
<P>will not be reinstated.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<U><P>/s/ G. L. Andrews</P>
</U><P>Gerald L. Andrews</P>
<P>Director of</P>
<P>Employee Relations - Flight</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>6th day of November, 1991.</P>
<U><P>/s/ F. C. Dubinsky</P>
</U><P>F. C. Dubinsky, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<B><P>Page 171</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
</B><I><P>PAA Retiree Medical</P>
</I><B><P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>May 14, 1992</P>
<P>Mr. Roger D. Hall</P>
<P>UAL/MEC Chairman</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Dear Roger:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>This is to confirm the agreement reached between United Airlines, Inc. ("United") </P>
<P>and the Air Line Pilots Association, International (the "Association") regarding </P>
<P>post-retirement medical insurance for former Pan American World Airways ("Pan </P>
<P>Am") pilots hired in connection with the Pacific and London route acquisitions, </P>
<P>Including such pilots who have already retired (the "Former Pan Am Pilots").</P>
<P>In lieu of any contrary provisions in the purchase agreements between United </P>
<P>and Pan Am or in other agreements between United and the Association, the </P>
<P>following rules shall apply to the Former Pan Am Pilots effective as of date of </P>
<P>signing.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1. </B>Former Pan Am Pilots who have or had ten or more years of active service </P>
<P>with United at the time of actual retirement shall be eligible for retiree medical </P>
<P>insurance coverage in the same manner as all other United pilots who have </P>
<P>also satisfied the normal ten year service requirement, provided that, for the </P>
<P>sole purpose of determining the percentage of annual cost to be paid by the </P>
<P>retiree, as set forth in Letter 91-1 at paragraph A-2-I, such Former Pan Am </P>
<P>Pilots will be deemed to have length of service equal to their combined Pan </P>
<P>Am and United active service.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2. </B>Former Pan Am Pilots who have or had less than ten years of active service </P>
<P>with United at the time of actual retirement shall be eligible to purchase retiree </P>
<P>medical insurance coverage at the actual cost of the insurance, as determined by </P>
<P>United's average cost of providing the same benefit to other pilots who have </P>
<P>satisfied the service requirement.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 172</P>
</B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Kindly indicate your agreement with the foregoing by signing in the space </P>
<P>Provided below.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<U><P>/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
</U><P>John R. Samolis</P>
<P>Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>20th day of May, 1992.</P>
<U><P>/s/ R. D. Hall</P>
</U><P>Roger D. Hall, Chairman</P>
<P>UA/ALPA Master Executive Council</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
