<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Page 176</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>&nbsp;</P>
</B></FONT><I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Grievance Mediation</P>
</I><P ALIGN="CENTER">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">between</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">and</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Letter 92-5 Page 70 </P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=1><P>Letter 92-5</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Grievance Mediation</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=2><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, IN</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;And</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the service of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as represented by</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR
LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INTERNATIONAL</P>
</B></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with</P>
<P>the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between </P>
<P>UNITED AIRLINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and the AIR </P>
<P>LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIRLINES, INC., as represented by the </P>
<P>AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to as</P>
<P>the "Association").</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;W I T N E S S E T H:</P>
<P>WHEREAS, there currently exists a substantial backlog of grievances pending a</P>
<P>hearing before the Five Member System Board of Adjustment, pursuant to</P>
<P>Section 18 of the current Basic Pilot Agreement, and;</P>
<P>WHEREAS, the Association and the Company are desirous of implementing an</P>
<P>alternate method of dispute resolution which will afford the parties an opportunity</P>
<P>to more expeditiously and efficiently resolve pending grievances;</P>
<P>NOW THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed that voluntary grievance mediation, as</P>
<P>An alternate method of dispute resolution, will be established on the following</P>
<P>basis:</P>
<B><P>1. </B>The grievance mediation process, hereinafter referred to as the "Mediation</P>
<P>Conference" will be scheduled by mutual agreement of parties. The "Mediation</P>
<P>Conference" will be scheduled for three consecutive days of a single week.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>The Association of the Company agree that only grievances which have been</P>
<P>submitted to the System Board of Adjustment in accordance with Section 18 of</P>
<P>the Basic Pilot Agreement, will be scheduled for a Mediation Conference. </P>
<P>Grievances will be selected for mediation only on a voluntary and mutual basis between the representatives of both parties.</P>
<B><P>Page 71 Letter 92-5</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>3. </B>The grievant shall have the right to be present at the Mediation Conference.</P>
<P>Attendance at the Mediation Conference will be limited to those people actually</P>
<P>involved in the Mediation Conference.</P>
<B><P>4. </B>The Company and the Association shall each appoint a principal</P>
<P>spokesperson, who may be an attorney, for the Mediation Conference.</P>
<B><P>5. </B>The representative of the parties will, no later than five days prior to the</P>
<P>scheduled date of Mediation Conference, present the mediator with a brief</P>
<P>written statement of the facts, the issue, and the arguments in support of their</P>
<P>position. If such a statement is not presented in written form, it may be</P>
<P>presented orally at the beginning of the Mediation Conference. However, such</P>
<P>oral statements will be limited to twenty (20) minutes in duration.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>Proceeding before the mediator will be informal in nature and the rules of</P>
<P>evidence will not apply. The presentation of evidence will not be limited to that</P>
<P>which was presented at the prior stages of the grievance procedure.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>No record of the Mediation Conference will be made. Any written material that</P>
<P>is presented to the mediator will be returned to the party presenting that material </P>
<P>at the termination of the Mediation Conference.</P>
<B><P>8. </B>The mediator will have the authority to meet separately with either the</P>
<P>Association or the Company in the Mediation Conference, but will not have the</P>
<P>authority to compel the resolution of the grievance.</P>
<B><P>9. </B>If no settlement is reached during the Mediation Conference, the mediator will</P>
<P>provide the parties with an immediate oral advisory decision, unless the</P>
<P>Association and the Company mutually agree that no decision will be provided.</P>
<P>When rendering an oral advisory decision, the mediator will state the grounds for</P>
<P>such decision.</P>
<B><P>10. </B>Grievances settled during a Mediation Conference will not constitute a</P>
<P>precedent, unless the Association and the Company otherwise mutually agree;</P>
<P>in which case the parties will document the precedents understanding.</P>
<B><P>11. </B>If no settlement is reached during the Mediation Conference, the grievance</P>
<P>may be heard by the System Board of Adjustment pursuant to Section 18 of the</P>
<P>Basic Pilot Agreement and in the normal course of the System Board's schedule.</P>
<B><P>12. </B>In the event a grievance which has been the subject of a Mediation</P>
<P>Conference, is subsequently heard before the System Board of Adjustment, no</P>
<B><P>Letter 92-5 Page 72</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>mediator may serve as the arbitrator. During the System Board proceeding on</P>
<P>such a grievance, no reference will be made to the fact that the grievance was</P>
<P>the subject of a Mediation Conference; nor will there be any reference to</P>
<P>statements made, documents provided, or actions taken by either the mediator</P>
<P>or the participants during the course of a Mediation Conference, unless the party</P>
<P>offering such statements, documents or actions would have had access or</P>
<P>entitlement to them outside of the Mediation Conference.</P>
<B><P>13. </B>The Association and the Company agree to schedule no more than three</P>
<P>grievances for Mediation Conference per day. The mediation day will commence</P>
<P>at 9:30 a.m. and it is anticipated that each mediation conference will last no</P>
<P>more than two and one-half hours.</P>
<B><P>14. </B>The selection of the mediator will be by mutual agreement between parties.</P>
<P>The fee and expenses for the mediator and conference facilities will be shared</P>
<P>equally by the Association and the Company.</P>
<B><P>15. </B>This Letter of Agreement will become effective as of the date of signing and</P>
<P>will remain in full force and effect and shall run concurrently with the Agreement</P>
<P>signed May 9, 1991.</P>
<P>IN WITNESSETH WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement</P>
<P>this 12th day of August, 1992.</P>
<P>WITNESS: FOR UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>/s/ G. L. Andrews /s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
<P>/s/ Richard Rosinia John R. Samolis</P>
<P>/s/ Peter R. Davis Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</P>
<P>WITNESS: FOR THE AIR LINE PILOTS IN THE </P>
<P>/S/ C. R. Waxlax SERVICE OF UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>/s/ J. S. Smith</P>
<P>/s/ R. D. Hall /s/ J. R. Babbitt</P>
<P>/s/ Hal Stepinsky J. Randolph Babbitt, President</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 73&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Letter 92-7 </P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Reserve Standby Lines</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>Captain Roger D. Hall</P>
<P>UAL-MEC Chairman</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>Dear Roger,</P>
<P>The Company and the Association engaged in a cooperative experiment to find a</P>
<P>way to assign field standby assignments more often to the reserve pilots who</P>
<P>desired such assignments. The parties have now successfully concluded that</P>
<P>experiment and herein agree to the following provisions to formalize the process.</P>
<B><P>1. </B>Reserve standby lines will be identified and posted at the regular preferencing</P>
<P>time, showing day on / day off patterns (minimum 12 days off). The number of</P>
<P>standby lines will be determined by the Company and may be between zero and</P>
<P>a maximum of three for each status, equipment and domicile. The standby lines</P>
<P>will not be counted as part of the number of reserve lines referred to in 5-G-1-e.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>Awards to standby lines will be strictly voluntary and will occur after all other</P>
<P>preferencing activity. Reserves who are available for the full month will have</P>
<P>priority, by seniority, for standby lines. Volunteer reserve pilots with absences</P>
<P>will be awarded an unfilled standby reserve line for the period of the month for</P>
<P>which they are available. The portion of the standby reserve line for which the</P>
<P>reserve is unavailable due to his absence will remain unassigned.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>A scheduled standby assignment will be subject to the provisions of 5-G-5 and</P>
<P>shall be treated as a scheduled reserve day for the purpose of absence</P>
<P>accounting; specifically:</P>
<B><P>3-a- </B>Five hours actual time and pay credit will be credited, if no trip is assigned.</P>
<B><P>3-b- </B>If a standby pilot is assigned a trip, the actual flight time of the completed</P>
<P>trip will be credited.</P>
<B><P>3-c- </B>Four hours ten minutes (4:10) will be reduced from the pilot's available</P>
<P>monthly maximum flight time for each scheduled standby day for which the pilot</P>
<P>is absent (sick, vacation, military, etc.)</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 75&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Letter 92-7 </P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>4. </B>Standby times following a day off will start at 16:00 local time. Standby times</P>
<P>for the day preceding a scheduled day off will be at 07:00, except if legalities</P>
<P>require a later start time. If the pilot cannot start before 12:00, he will be free from</P>
<P>duty for that last day.</P>
<B><P>5. </B>Standby reserves can be "converted" to regular reserves if no other reserve is</P>
<P>available for an assignment. The Company can make a trip assignment which</P>
<P>begins prior to a field standby period with pilot concurrence. The Company has the right to make an assignment which begins later than the scheduled field standby period, if the pilot is contacted prior to reporting for the standby period.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>Fourteen hours will be scheduled between standby assignments. A twelve</P>
<P>hour minimum from block in to standby report time will be provided in the actual</P>
<P>operation. If one flight assignment makes a pilot illegal for the next scheduled</P>
<P>field standby assignment, that next standby time can be delayed to provide a</P>
<P>legal rest.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>Up to five days of open flying can be added to each standby line</P>
<P>after preferencing on scheduled standby days only. Such assignments will be</P>
<P>offered in seniority order, taking into consideration each pilot's available standby</P>
<P>days. Preassigned open flying under this paragraph will normally be conducted</P>
<P>during the first period of available days in the month and no standby pilot will be</P>
<P>required to perform a preassinged trip which departs prior to 16:00 on his first</P>
<P>scheduled available day of the month.</P>
<B><P>8. </B>The assignment of open flying under 7, above, and the publication of the field</P>
<P>standby times will be completed by the 28th of the prior month. The CMS</P>
<P>"DSPREC" display will not indicate times for field standbys until the 28th of the</P>
<P>prior month.</P>
<B><P>9. </B>A standby reserve assignment can be converted into an additional day off,</P>
<P>provided the Company provides notice to the pilot at or prior to the end of the</P>
<P>immediately preceding assignment. At the end of each assignment, each pilot</P>
<P>will be obligated to check his "CALREC" display to determine if he has been</P>
<P>released from his next standby assignment.</P>
<B><P>10. </B>Regular reserves can continue to be called out at any time for standby</P>
<P>assignments, as provided by the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>11. </B>If this letter is ratified prior to November 1, 1992, it is anticipated that this</P>
<P>system can be implemented as part of the regular preferencing system by</P>
<P>January, 1993, for the schedule month of February, 1993.</P>
<B><P>Letter 92-7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Page 76</P></B></FONT>

</TR>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>If this accurately reflects our understanding, please sign and return 2 copies for our files.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Trip Trade with Open Flying</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>Captain Roger D. Hall</P>
<P>UAL-MEC Chairman</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>Dear Roger,</P>
<P>As a result of discussions between the ALPA and Company Negotiating</P>
<P>Committees, it has been agreed that a pilot will be permitted to trade trips from</P>
<P>his awarded schedule with trips which are in "open flying", as follows:</P>
<B><P>1.</B> A pilot will be permitted to trade a trip(s), for which he is available in his</P>
<P>awarded schedule, with a trip(s) from open flying once per month. That single</P>
<P>trade transaction can include a single trip or multiple trip pairings from his</P>
<P>line, so long as they are contiguous (i.e., include no intervening days off). He</P>
<P>may trade that trip or series of "back-to-back" trips from his line with open</P>
<P>flying for a single trip or multiple trips.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>A pilot will not be permitted to trade for a trip which would create an illegality in</P>
<P>his remaining scheduled line in any month for which the schedule has been</P>
<P>awarded. Further, a trade will not be permitted if it projects a pilot above</P>
<P>81/83/85 actual flight hours (whichever is applicable to him under the</P>
<P>Agreement) or above 85 pay credit hours, unless he is already projected above</P>
<P>85 pay credit hours due to the month-end operation of a legal inbound trip from</P>
<P>the prior month. If the pilot is projected for more than 85 pay credit hours, he</P>
<P>may make a trade which will also project him to that established higher value.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>Automated trades can be processed through any Unimatic terminal or through</P>
<P>Unimatic access by home computers. Automated trades will be accepted only for</P>
<P>transactions which are outside of the "current period", i.e., for trips which are</P>
<P>scheduled to depart more than 28 hours in the future.</P>
<B><P>4. </B>Automated trades will be accepted or rejected by the CMS system at the time</P>
<P>the request is made and, if accepted, the pilot will be considered to be on notice</P>
<P>that his schedule has been changed and he has accepted responsibility for his</P>
<P>revised schedule.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 78 Letter 93-2</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>5. </B>A pilot will not be permitted to trade out of any trip in his awarded line (1) which</P>
<P>is scheduled to depart within the first five days of the schedule month or, (2)</P>
<P>which is scheduled to operate during any of the holidays recognized by the</P>
<P>Agreement or, (3) which is scheduled to operate during any of the other days</P>
<P>which may be "embargoed" by the Company. Embargoes may be declared by</P>
<P>the Company for specific days by status, domicile and equipment type and</P>
<P>notice of such embargoes will be noted on designated CMS "Display Pages". As</P>
<P>coverage availability changes during theoperating month, embargo changes</P>
<P>may also be made by the Company - both to impose additional embargoes and</P>
<P>to lift existing embargoes. None of the restrictions in this paragraph 5 will limit</P>
<P>which trips, scheduled on an embargoed day, a pilot will be permitted to trade</P>
<P>into.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>A pilot will not be permitted to trade out of any trip in his OE line, nor out of any</P>
<P>trip on which he is scheduled for an en route check or for any training.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>A "first come, first served" trip trade process, described in Paragraph 3 &amp; 4</P>
<P>above will be implemented no later than September 1, 1993. This "first come,</P>
<P>first served" system will cease when the "Seniority Concept" trip trade system is</P>
<P>implemented.</P>
<P>The Company will, immediately upon MEC ratification of this</P>
<P>Agreement, begin the computer programming necessary to implement the ALPA</P>
<P>"Seniority Concept". This seniority based trip trade process, described in</P>
<P>alternate paragraphs paragraph 3 &amp; 4 below, will be implemented no later than</P>
<P>February 1, 1994 (at which time paragraph 3 and 4 above, will cease).</P>
<B><P>3. </B>Trade requests will be processed through any Unimatic terminal or through</P>
<P>Unimatic access by home computers. Trades will be accepted only for</P>
<P>Transactions which affect trips that are scheduled to depart more than 48 hours</P>
<P>after the next daily "rundown" is conducted. A pilot will not be permitted to trade</P>
<P>out of a trip which is scheduled to depart less than 48 hours after the next daily</P>
<P>"rundown" is conducted.</P>
<B><P>4.a. </B>A "rundown" is the daily process during which trip trades on file are</P>
<P>programmatically processed. A "rundown" of trade requests will be conducted</P>
<P>daily at a fixed time; currently planned to be 1300 Central Time. All trade</P>
<P>requests not awarded will remain in the computer until awarded or removed by</P>
<P>the pilot.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Letter 93-2 Page 79</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>4.b. </B>Trade requests must include the specific I.D.(s) and date(s) the pilot</P>
<P>wishes to trade out of. Requests may include any of the following criteria for</P>
<P>I.D.(s) the pilot wishes to trade into:</P>
<P>"Any" available I.D. on a specific date.</P>
<P>A specified I.D. on a specific date.</P>
<P>Any legal I.D. on any date.</P>
<B><P>4.c. </B>Pilots must use "VERID" within 23 hours after the "rundown" time to confirm</P>
<P>knowledge of the trade and to "lock" it in. If a pilot fails to "VERID", the trade will</P>
<P>be canceled and that pilot's single trade transaction will be considered used for</P>
<P>that month. When a pilot transmits "VERID" the I.D. he is trading out of will.</P>
<P>immediately be listed in "OPNID". Each pilot who requests a trade will bear full</P>
<P>responsibility for knowing his/her schedule.</P>
<B><P>8. </B>This letter shall become effective for the schedule month of September, 1993. It will remain in effect for the duration of the 1991 Agreement. This letter may be suspended or cancelled with 30 days notice by either party.If this accurately
reflects our understanding, please sign and return 2 copies for our files.</P>
<P>Sincerely,</P>
<P>/s/ John R. Samolis</P>
<P>John R. Samolis</P>
<P>Vice President</P>
<P>Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>29th day of April, 1993.</P>
<P>/s/ R. D. Hall</P>
<P>R. D. Hall, Chairman</P>
<P>UAL/ALPA Master Executive Council.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Letter 93-2 Page 80</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Non-Disclosure Letter</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>August 23, 1993</P>
<P>Captain Roger D. Hall</P>
<P>UAL-MEC Chairman</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>6400 Shafer Court, Suite 700</P>
<P>Rosemont, IL 60018</P>
<P>Re: Non-Disclosure Letter</P>
<P>Dear Roger:</P>
<P>By this letter ("Non-Disclosure Letter"), United and ALPA hereby agree that any</P>
<P>information provided to ALPA ("Confidential Insider Information"), pursuant to</P>
<P>Paragraph 4 (a) of Letter 91-14, shall be treated, for all purposes and at all times,</P>
<P>asconfidential, and shall not be disclosed or communicated except in accordance</P>
<P>with the terms hereof. Said Confidential Insider Information includes, but shall</P>
<P>not be limited to, all information regarding plans, schedules, and decisions</P>
<P>concerning flying by United or United Express carriers on particular routes, and</P>
<P>all economic data or other data which explains, reveals, describes or</P>
<P>substantiates any and all such plans, schedules, and decisions.</P>
<P>As a precondition to receiving Confidential Information pursuant to Paragraph 4</P>
<P>of Letter 91-14, a pilot designed by ALPA in accordance with Paragraph 4 (a)</P>
<P>of Letter 91-14 (a "Designated Pilot"), shall sign a confidentiality statement in</P>
<P>the form attached hereto. A designated Pilot may disclose the Confidential</P>
<P>Insider Information only to the elected officers and members of the United</P>
<P>Airlines-ALPA Master Executive Council and to legal and financial advisors</P>
<P>who need to know the Confidential Insider Information for purposes of</P>
<P>providing professional advise to ALPA with respect to the subject of the</P>
<P>Confidential Insider Information ("Recipients"); prior to such disclosure, the</P>
<P>Recipients shall also be required to sign the confidentiality statement</P>
<P>attached hereto. ALPA shall not be required to treat as confidential any</P>
<P>information or data which (i) is or becomes generally available to the public</P>
<P>other than as a result of disclosure by ALPA or its representatives in</P>
<P>violation of this Non-Disclosure Letter, or (ii) was available to ALPA or any of</P>
<P>its representatives on a non-confidential basis prior to its disclosure to them</P>
<P>by United, or (iii) is or becomes known or available to ALPA or its representatives</P>
<P>on a non-confidential basis from a source (other than United) who, insofar as is</P>
<B><P>Letter 93-4 Page 81</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>known to ALPA or its representatives after due inquiry (including to the Senior</P>
<P>Vice President - Human Resources at United), is not prohibited from transmitting</P>
<P>the information to ALPA or its representatives by a contractual, legal or fiduciary</P>
<P>duty.</P>
<P>If ALPA, a Designated Pilot, or any Recipient is served with a subpoena or other</P>
<P>process requiring the production or disclosure of Confidential Insider Information,</P>
<P>before complying with such subpoena or other process, ALPA, the Designated</P>
<P>Pilot, or the Recipient shall immediately notify United of same in writing and</P>
<P>permit United a reasonable period of time to intervene and contest disclosure or</P>
<P>production. The duration of this Non-Disclosure Letter shall run concurrently</P>
<P>with the 1994 United-ALPA collective bargaining agreement.</P>
<P>Please indicate your agreement with each and every term of this letter by signing in the space provided below.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sincerely,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;John R. Samolis</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vice President Employee Relations</P>
<P>Accepted and agreed to this</P>
<P>23th day of August, 1993.</P>
<P>/s/ R. D. Hall</P>
<P>Roger D. Hall,</P>
<P>UAL-MEC Chairman</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association, International.</P>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>CONFIDENTIALITY STATEMENT</P>
<P>1.I have read and am familiar with the terms of the Non-Disclosure Letter</P>
<P>between United and the Air Line Pilots Association, International ("ALPA"), a </P>
<P>copy of which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.</P>
<P>2.I agreed to be bound by and to comply with all provisions contained in such</P>
<P>Non-Disclosure</P>
<P>Letter.</P>
<P>3. In particular, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, I agree that I shall</P>
<P>not disclose Confidential Insider Information to anyone who is not authorized to</P>
<P>receive such information by the terms of the Non-Disclosure Letter and who has</P>
<P>not himself/herself signed a Confidential Statement</P>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Job Security Protection</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UAL CORP.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>July 12, 1994</P>
<P>J. Randolph Babbitt, President</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>1625 Massachusetts Avenue, N.W.</P>
<P>Washington, D. C. 20036</P>
<P>Re: Job Security Protection</P>
<P>Dear Captain Babbitt:</P>
<P>We write to confirm the following agreement made between the Air Line Pilots</P>
<P>Association, International ("ALPA") and the UAL Corporation ("UAL") and</P>
<P>Between ALPA and United Air Lines, Inc. ("United") in the negotiations leading to</P>
<P>the 1994 ALPA-United collective bargaining agreement (the "Agreement").</P>
<P>Unless otherwise specified, all capitalized terms in this letter are defined in</P>
<P>Section 1 of the Agreement.</P>
<P>UAL agrees that it is an Affiliate of United and that it is bound by Section 1 of the</P>
<P>Agreement in the same manner as United so that every reference to the</P>
<P>"Company" in Section 1 expressly refers to and binds UAL. United and UAL further agree that they will not conclude, facilitate or permit any agreement or arrangement that establishes any Affiliate, other than a Feeder Carrier, that is, Controls or is
under the Control of an air carrier unless the Affiliate agrees in writing to be bound by Section 1 of the Agreement in the same manner as UAL and United.</P>
<P>Any disputes among ALPA, United and/or UAL that arise out of grievances or that concern the interpretation or application of this letter or Section 1 of the </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 84 Letter 94-1</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Agreement will be determined through final and binding arbitration before the</P>
<P>ALPA-United System Board of Adjustment pursuant to Section 1-K of the</P>
<P>Agreement. UAL expressly agrees to be subject to Section 1-K in all respects.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Very truly yours,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UAL
CORP.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/s/
P. G. George</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Paul G. George</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Human Resources</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vice

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Dispute Resolution and Hiring Standards</P>
</I><B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIRLINES</P>
</B><P>July 12, 1994</P>
<P>J. Randolph Babbitt, President</P>
<P>Air Line Pilots Association</P>
<P>1625 Massachusetts Avenue, N. W.</P>
<P>Washington, D. C. 20036</P>
<P>Dear Captain Babbitt:</P>
<P>I write to confirm the following agreement made between the Air Line Pilots</P>
<P>Association, International ("ALPA") and United Air Lines, Inc. ("United") in the</P>
<P>negotiations leading to the 1994 ALPA-United collective bargaining agreement</P>
<P>(the "Agreement"). Unless otherwise specified, all capitalized terms in this letter are defined in Section 1 of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>1. </B>Subject to the corporate governance provisions established in the Company's</P>
<P>Charter and By-Laws, a process or means will be established that will permit</P>
<P>ALPA and the new management to resolve issues creating disharmony between</P>
<P>pilots and management on a basis that will not reduce the value of the pilot</P>
<P>investment in the 1994 Employee Stock Ownership Transaction.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>Subject to other legal obligations, the Company will make reasonable efforts to</P>
<P>fill pilot vacancies with the individuals who satisfy United's hiring standards, who</P>
<P>have, previously worked for carriers represented by ALPA, and who are no</P>
<P>longer working for those carriers for economic reasons such as lay-offs or the</P>
<P>shutdown of that carrier.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Very truly yours,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/s/ J. R. Samolis</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;John R. Samolis</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Vice President</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee Relations</P>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Shuttle</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the service of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as represented by</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION
,</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance with</P>
<P>the provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and between</P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the ''Company'') and the</P>
<P>AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. as represented by</P>
<P>the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL (hereinafter referred to</P>
<P>as the ''Association''). </P>
<P>W I T N E S SE T H:</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed that the Company may conduct a</P>
<P>separate Shuttle-type operation subject to the following terms and conditions:</P>
<P>The Company is authorized to establish the Shuttle Operation, and it may, at</P>
<P>the Company's option, operate Shuttle as a distinct corporate division of</P>
<P>United Airlines provided that the Company, including both the Shuttle</P>
<P>Operation and the Company's other (''Mainline'') operations, remains a single</P>
<P>carrier for all purposes of both the Federal Aviation Act and the Railway</P>
<P>Labor Act.</P>
<B><P>2. </B>All pilots who perform services in the Shuttle Operation will be United pilot</P>
<P>employees pursuant to Section 2-A or 2-X of the Agreement and will be</P>
<P>represented by the Association as part of a single craft or class of United flight</P>
<P>crew members that includes all United pilots.</P>
<B><P>3. </B>All pilots in the employ of the Company, including pilots in the Shuttle</P>
<P>Operation, shall be included on the Pilots' Eligibility Seniority List and/or the</P>
<P>Second Officer Eligibility Seniority List pursuant to the applicable seniority</P>
<P>provisions of the Agreement.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 87 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>4. </B>All pilots who hold or are awarded Shuttle assignments pursuant to Section 8</P>
<P>of the Agreement will receive the same benefits as pilots in the Mainline</P>
<P>Operation (including without limitation the same retirement (A-Plan and PDAP),</P>
<P>medical/dental, insurance, long-term disability, sick leave, vacation accrual,</P>
<P>workers compensation and other welfare benefits) and will be governed by the</P>
<P>Agreement in all respects except as the Agreement is specifically modified in</P>
<P>this Shuttle Supplement.</P>
<B><P>5. </B>The Company may operate the aircraft identified in Paragraph 11 below in</P>
<P>both shuttle and non-shuttle-type operations.</P>
<B><P>5-a- </B>Those aircraft utilized in a shuttle-type operation will be operated in a SWA</P>
<P>type style, which may include but is not limited to quick turns, high frequency,</P>
<P>highaircraft utilization, few crew changes, minimal aircraft changes, and pairings</P>
<P>that keep the pilots and flight attendants together.</P>
<B><P>5-b- </B>The operation of all other aircraft not utilized in a shuttle-type operation</P>
<P>shall be referred to herein as Mainline.</P>
<B><P>6. </B>The monthly schedule and actual caps for shuttle pilots shall be the same as</P>
<P>the Mainline caps.</P>
<B><P>7. </B>Mainline bank concepts shall apply to the shuttle fleet(s).</P>
<B><P>8. </B>There will be separate bid positions for Captains and First Officers in the</P>
<P>shuttle operation. All pilots holding shuttle bids will receive enculturization</P>
<P>training in the shuttle-type operation prior to operating on the shuttle.</P>
<B><P>9. </B>The shuttle and Mainline minimum guarantee will be the same.</P>
<B><P>10. </B>Work rules for the shuttle operation shall be as follows:</P>
<B><P>10-a- </B>Schedules shall contain a minimum of five and one-half (1/2) hours of</P>
<P>flight time credit, averaged, for each on-duty period in multiple duty period trip</P>
<P>sequences or five and one-half (51/2) hours for one (1) duty period.</P>
<B><P>10-b- </B>Each schedule line for a full month that is submitted for the schedule</P>
<P>selection procedure, as provided in Section 20-B and 20-C shall contain a</P>
<P>minimum of fourteen (14) days free of all duty at the home domicile.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 89 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>10-c- </B>Pilots functioning as reserves shall be scheduled for a minimum of</P>
<P>fourteen (14) calendar days free of duty with the Company each month.</P>
<B><P>10-d- </B>Reserve pilots who are awarded shuttle bid positions may be assigned to</P>
<P>fly trips in Mainline operations and vice-versa. Mainline reserves may be</P>
<P>assigned to fly shuttle trips only if there are no shuttle reserves available and</P>
<P>they have received the appropriate enculturization training. If a Shuttle trip would</P>
<P>be canceled because there is no reserve available who has received</P>
<P>enculturization training, the reserve will receive an interim enculturization briefing</P>
<P>prior to departure.</P>
<B><P>11. </B>Rules for determining shuttle DSL quality are as follows:</P>
<B><P>11-a- </B>The pairings will be ranked on a scale of 1 to 4 as described below. Not</P>
<P>more than 30% of the pairings at any shuttle domicile, weighted on a duty period/</P>
<P>month basis, can be ranked as 3 or 4. Not more than 25% of the pairings on the</P>
<P>shuttle system, weighted on a duty period/month basis, can be ranked as 3 or 4.</P>
<P>Not more than 10% of the pairings at any shuttle domicile, weighted on a duty</P>
<P>period/month basis, can be ranked 4.</P>
<B><P>11-b- </B>At least 30% of the system pairings, on an occurrence/month basis will be</P>
<P>composed of 1 and 2 duty periods, unless this obligation prevents compliance</P>
<P>with this paragraph 11 and/or Paragraph 12 below.</P>
<B><P>11-c- </B>Pairings will be ranked from 1 - 4 based on the following:</P>
<P>A pairing having no deficiencies will be ranked a 1,</P>
<P>A pairing having 1 deficiency will be ranked a 2,</P>
<P>A pairing having 2 deficiencies will be ranked a 3, and</P>
<P>A pairing having 3 or more deficiencies will be ranked a 4.</P>
<B><P>11-d- </B>The deficiencies will be cumulative and each occurrence will count as a</P>
<P>deficiency.</P>
<B><P>11-e- </B>The following items are deficiencies for the purpose of ranking the</P>
<P>pairings.</P>
<B><P>11-e-1- </B>Cross-town (Arriving at an airport different from the departure airport</P>
<P>at the end of a pairing or following a layover).</P>
<B><P>Page 90 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>11-e-2- </B>Deadhead.</P>
<B><P>11-e-3- </B>A layover of more than 22 hours.</P>
<B><P>11-e-4- </B>Any break of more than 2 hours, or more than one break of more than</P>
<P>1 hour in a single duty period.</P>
<B><P>11-e-5- </B>An aircraft change during a duty period</P>
<B><P>11-e-6- </B>A field layover before or after a duty period of 7:00 actual or greater.</P>
<B><P>11-e-7- </B>A duty period in excess of 12:00 on duty.</P>
<B><P>12. </B>Rules for shuttle line construction.</P>
<P>The following rules shall govern the construction of the monthly lines of flying for</P>
<P>shuttle pilots.</P>
<B><P>12-a- </B>All lines will be constructed on a 7 day pattern, i.e. the base pairing will</P>
<P>originate on the same day(s) of the week. The lines will have the same days off</P>
<P>each week to the extent possible.</P>
<B><P>12-b- </B>Filler pairings will be tacked to the base pairing. The filler pairings should</P>
<P>be arranged to make a 5 day work pattern to the maximum extent possible.</P>
<B><P>13. </B>Shuttle lines will not be published for preferencing in any domicile if they are not in compliance with the provisions of Paragraph 11 and Paragraph 12 above.</P>
<B><P>14. </B>The Company will construct secondary lines in the shuttle operation to the</P>
<P>extent possible.</P>
<B><P>15. </B>Trip Trade With Open Flying on the Shuttle will be conducted under the same</P>
<P>rules as Trip Trade With Open Flying on the Mainline. Notwithstanding the</P>
<P>foregoing, on a domicile basis, three (3) additional trades each day Monday</P>
<P>through Thursday and one (1) additional trade each day Friday through Sunday</P>
<P>will be allowed.</P>
<B><P>16. </B>The Company is authorized to utilize A-320 "family" aircraft or smaller in the</P>
<P>shuttle operation. The Company may operate such aircraft as a separate shuttle</P>
<P>fleet(s) or as part of the Mainline fleet. Any fleet operated in the shuttle will be a</P>
<P>separate bid position. No aircraft will be operated in shuttle unless at least ten</P>
<B><P>Page 91 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>(10) such aircraft are so utilized. Prior to the Company initiating use of a new</P>
<P>fleet in shuttle operations, the parties will agree upon procedures for transition</P>
<P>staffing.</P>
<B><P>17. </B>Shuttle IOE</P>
<P>Shuttle IOE will be conducted in accordance with the following provisions:</P>
<B><P>17-a- </B>OE lines will not be designated in the Shuttle operation. The following</P>
<P>rules for initial pilots will apply:</P>
<B><P>17-a-1- </B>A pilot can bid and be awarded a line of flying using his own</P>
<P>seniority.A F/O may have a potential line denied if it is already held by an</P>
<P>initial or transition captain.</P>
<B><P>17-a-2- </B>An initial or transition pilot will be prevented from trading into flying</P>
<P>that is already assigned to another initial or transition pilot.</P>
<B><P>17-a-3- </B>An initial pilot who is not senior enough to hold a line will be</P>
<P>assigned trips as a reserve and always be placed at the top of the FIFO list</P>
<P>after returning from a trip or days off. Such pilot shall receive 15 hours free</P>
<P>of duty after each assignment, unless the pilot is the only reserve available,</P>
<P>in which case the normal provisions of the Agreement shall apply. If</P>
<P>multiple initial pilots are on reserve, they will return to the top of the FIFO</P>
<P>list in FIFO order. A pilot may be passed over on the FIFO list to avoid an</P>
<P>assignment with another initial or transition crew member.</P>
<B><P>17-b- </B>A pilot holding a Captain or a First Officer Shuttle bid will initially be</P>
<P>assigned to a Mainline trip(s) in order to accomplish the majority of his</P>
<P>IOE; however, in no case will a Shuttle pilot receive less than 7 Shuttle</P>
<P>landings during his IOE. A pilot holding a Captain or a First Officer Mainline</P>
<P>bid will never be assigned to a Shuttle trip(s) for IOE.</P>
<B><P>17-c- </B>A Shuttle pilot's IOE shall consist of no less than twenty-five (25)</P>
<P>hard hours except for transitioning B737-200 pilots who will require a</P>
<P>minimum of segments.</P>
<B><P>17-d- </B>When a Shuttle pilot's IOE is completed prior to the conclusion of a</P>
<P>multi-day duty period trip, the pilot may be removed from the I.D. only at</P>
<P>the end of a duty period.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 92 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;17-e- </B>A pilot who is qualified as a B737-300/500 or A320/319 LCA may</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;perform IOE for Shuttle pilots on both the Mainline and Shuttle.</P>
<B><P>17-f- </B>In order to provide maximum continuity for a Shuttle pilot during his&nbsp;IOE,</P>
<P>the Company will make every reasonable effort to keep the same LCA with the</P>
<P>pilot during his entire IOE, including both the Mainline and Shuttle&nbsp;&nbsp;portions of</P>
<P>the IOE. It is recognized that it may become necessary to&nbsp;substitute LCA's</P>
<P>during an IOE, but in no case will a Shuttle pilot have more than two LCA's for</P>
<P>the duration of an IOE, without the concurrence of the ALPA Training</P>
<P>Committee.</P>
<B><P>17-g- </B>Shuttle IOE will be performed by LCA's no less qualified than current</P>
<P>LCA's providing IOE for Mainline pilots. Additionally, Shuttle IOE will be</P>
<P>performed predominately by line LCA's.</P>
<B><P>17-h- </B>The Company will solicit LCAs in an effort to maintain a balance</P>
<P>between Shuttle and Mainline LCAs consistent with the forecast activations in</P>
<P>each category on a semi annual basis. Shuttle LCAs will be permitted to</P>
<P>perform Mainline IOE if no Mainline LCA is available, up to a maximum of one</P>
<P>Mainline IOE per month per Shuttle LCA.</P>
<B><P>18. </B>The Company will conduct a new analysis of the value of a Shuttle vacation</P>
<P>day. The value determined by this analysis will be applied to the Preferential</P>
<P>Bidding System.</P>
<B><P>19. </B>The Company may operate all other aircraft types on markets served by</P>
<P>shuttle.</P>
<B><P>20. </B>The Company will maintain a Shuttle specific crew desk.</P>
<B><P>21. </B>The Company and ALPA will maintain and update the Shuttle play book.</P>
<B><P>22. </B>Except as otherwise provided, Mainline contract provisions apply to Shuttle</P>
<P>operations.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have signed this Letter of Agreement this</P>
<P>19<SUP>th</SUP> day of August, 1994.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 92 Letter 94-11</P></B></FONT>

<I><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>Flight/Data Recorders</P>
</I><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">LETTER OF AGREEMENT</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;between</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the service of</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNITED AIR LINES, INC.</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as represented by</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>THIS LETTER OF AGREEMENT is made and entered into in accordance wit the</P>
<P>provisions of Title II of the Railway Labor Act, as amended, by and betweet</P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC. (hereinafter referred to as "the Company" or "United"</P>
<P>and the AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED AIR LINES, INC. a</P>
<P>represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION, INTERNATIONAL</P>
<P>(hereinafter referred to as "the Association" or "ALPA").</P>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WITNESSETH:</P>
<P>WHEREAS technological advancements in the aircraft data collection systems</P>
<P>present new problems and concerns for both ALPA and the Company,</P>
<P>NOW, THEREFORE, it is mutually agreed that the 1994 AGREEMENT between</P>
<P>UNITED AIR LINES, INC. and THE AIR LINE PILOTS in the service of UNITED</P>
<P>AIR LINES, INC. as represented by the AIR LINE PILOTS ASSOCIATION,</P>
<P>INTERNATIONAL is amended as follows:</P>
<B><P>DEFINITIONS:</P>
<P>A. </B>"Flight data recorder" shall include any device, equipment or system which</P>
<P>transmits and/or records and/or collects inflight data, whether installed to monitor</P>
<P>pilot, aircraft component, or aircraft performance.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>"Cockpit voice recorder" shall include any device, equipment or system which</P>
<P>monitors or records a pilot's voice while he is on an aircraft.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>"Information" shall include any data transmitted, recorded or collected by using</P>
<P>a flight data recorder, cockpit voice recorder or any other recording device. The</P>
<P>term "information" shall further include tapes, transcripts, reports, papers,</P>
<P>memos, statements, studies, charts, graphs or any other description, analysis or</P>
<P>compilation of data collected by a cockpit voice recorder or flight data recorder.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Page 93 Letter 94-12</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;II. COCKPIT
VOICE RECORDERS</P>
<P>A. </B>Cockpit voice recorder information will not be used for any purpose except</P>
<P>accident/incident investigation and only in those instances where the legal criteria</P>
<P>of an NTSB definable accident/incident have been met.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>No later than twenty-four hours after removal, the Company will notify the</P>
<P>flight crew involved or, if unable, an MEC officer that the voice recorder was</P>
<P>removed for analysis by the Company, a government agency or other third party.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>The pilot shall be allowed to review a cockpit voice recording removed from</P>
<P>his trip which is in the possession of the Company after a formal request has</P>
<P>been filed with the Director of Safety and Security.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>Voice recordings which have been removed from the aircraft and</P>
<P>transcriptions thereof shall not be retained in an identifiable form for more than</P>
<P>seven days unless (1) required by statute, (2) by mutual consent of the parties or</P>
<P>(3) an active safety investigation is in progress.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Only the Senior Vice President Flight Operations, Vice President of Flight</P>
<P>Standards and Training, Director of Flight Domicile Operations or, if a pilot, the</P>
<P>Director of Corporate Safety and Security may authorize the removal and/or</P>
<P>review of the cockpit voice recorder.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>The Company will not provide copies of transcripts or actual cockpit recorder</P>
<P>Audio recordings to the Association, its members or any third parties, except as</P>
<P>required by law or by mutual consent of (1) the Director of Corporate Safety and</P>
<P>Security (if a pilot) or the Senior Vice President of Flight Operations, (2) the MEC</P>
<P>Chairman and (3) all pilots directly involved in the incident.</P>
<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;III. DIGITAL FLIGHT DATA RECORDERS</P>
<P>A. </B>Operational data recorded or transmitted during flight operations shall be used</P>
<P>strictly (1) for engineering analysis, (2) in conjunction with an accident or incident</P>
<P>investigation or (3) as authorized by the Flight Operations Quality Assurance</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>Digital flight data recorder information may only be collected at the direction of</P>
<P>the Senior Vice President of Flight Operations, the Vice President of Flight</P>
<P>Standards and Training, the Director of Flight Domicile Operations, the Director</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<B><P>Page 94 Letter 94-12</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P>of Corporate Safety and Security (if a pilot), or for engineering analysis at the</P>
<P>direction of a Vice President of Maintenance or General Manager of Engineering.</P>
<P>The authority to authorize the collection of data shall not be delegated.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>The Company will notify the Captain involved or, if he is unavailable, an MEC</P>
<P>officer within forty-eight hours, if flight data recorder information has been</P>
<P>retrieved from his flight for any reason diner man routine engineering analysis or</P>
<P>as part of a Flight Operations Quality Assurance Program.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>A pilot, and/or his representative, if desired, shall be allowed to review data</P>
<P>retrieved by the Company from his flight unless restricted by statute. The</P>
<P>Company shall provide a Flight Safety staff member with appropriate expertise to</P>
<P>explain the meaning of the recorded data.</P>
<B><P>E. </B>Flight data information retrieved will not be used in favor of or against a pilot in</P>
<P>the grievance process or a system board hearing if the pilot has filed a detailed</P>
<P>Flight Safety Awareness Report of the incident within twenty-four hours after the</P>
<P>completion of the pilot's ID in which the event occurred and the event was not the</P>
<P>result of a deliberate violation of FAR or negligent disregard of Standard</P>
<P>Operating Procedure.</P>
<B><P>F. </B>All flight data information retrieved for engineering analysis or investigation will be de-identified or destroyed within seven days unless prohibited by statute, mutual agreement of the parties, or part of a current safety investigation.</P>

<B><P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IV. GENERAL</P>
</B><P>A. The Company shall notify the Association within 90 days of the signing of this</P>
<P>letter of all known data acquisition and recording devices presently known to be</P>
<P>installed in their aircraft and no later than 90 days prior to any future installations.</P>
<B><P>B. </B>Except as required by foreign, federal or state government regulation, neither</P>
<P>the Company nor the Association shall release any information derived from flight</P>
<P>data or cockpit voice acquisition units to a third party without the express written</P>
<P>consent of the other party.</P>
<B><P>C. </B>Information obtained from a flight data recorder or cockpit voice recorder shall not be used for individual Pilot Enroute Checks.</P>
<B><P>D. </B>All protective provisions of this agreement shall apply to all data collection devices installed in Flight Simulators.</P>
<B><P>Page 95 Letter 94-12</P></B></FONT>
<TABLE CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 CELLPADDING=9 WIDTH=590>
<TR><TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5>&#9;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P>E. </B>This letter shall become effective and will be applicable to all United aircraft upon tentative agreement by the parties to adopt a mutually agreeable "Flight Operations Quality Assurance Program" developed by the Air Line
Pilots Association and the Company. Upon implementation, this letter will run concurrent with the 1994</P>
<P>Agreement.</P>
