<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<center>
<p><u><font size=+0>UAL Corporation and Subsidiary Companies</font></u>
<p><u><font size=+0>Computation of Ratio of Earnings to Fixed Charges</font></u></center>

<p><br>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<table BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH="604" >
<tr>
<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="44%">&nbsp;</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP COLSPAN="5" WIDTH="56%">
<center><u><font size=-1>Year Ended December 31</font></u></center>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="44%">&nbsp;</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="11%">
<center><u><font size=-1>2000</font></u></center>
</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="11%">
<center><u><font size=-1>1999</font></u></center>
</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="11%">
<center><u><font size=-1>1998</font></u></center>
</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="11%">
<center><u><font size=-1>1997</font></u></center>
</td>

<td VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="11%">
<center><u><font size=-1>1996</font></u></center>
</td>
</tr>

<div align=right><font size=-1>$ 1,209&nbsp;</font></div>
</td>
</tr>

<br><font size=-1>&lt;HTML></font>
<div align=right><font size=+0>Exhibit 23</font></div>

<br>&nbsp;
<center>
<p><u><font size=+0>Consent of Independent Public Accountants</font></u></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><font size=+0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
As independent public accountants, we hereby consent to the incorporation
of our report included in the UAL Corporation Form 10-K for the year ended
December 31, 2000, into the Company's previously filed Post-Effective Amendment
No. 1 to Form S-8 (File No. 2-67368), Post-Effective Amendment No. 2 to
Form S-8 (File No. 33-37613), Post-Effective Amendment No. 1 to Form S-8
(File No. 33-38613), Form S-8 (File No. 333-63185), Post-Effective Amendment
No. 1 to Form S-8 (File No. 33-44552), Form S-8 (File No. 33-57331), Form
S-8 (File No. 333-03041), Form S-8 (File No. 333-63181), Post-Effective
Amendment No. 1 to Form S-8 (File No. 33-44553), Form S-8 (File No. 33-62749),
Form S-8 (File No. 333-52249), Form S-8 (File No. 333-63179), Post-Effective
Amendment No. 1 to Form S-8 (File No. 33-59950), Form S-8 (File No. 333-03039),
Form S-8 (File No. 333-47444), Form S-8 and Post-Effective Amendment No.
1 to Form S-8 (File No. 33-60675), and Form S-8 (File No. 333-52276).</font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<u>
/s/ Arthur Andersen LLP</u>
<br><font size=+0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Arthur Andersen LLP</font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><font size=+0>Chicago, Illinois</font>
<p><u><font size=+0>March 15, 2001</font></u>
<br><font size=+0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (date)</font>

<TYPE>EX-99
<SEQUENCE>22
<FILENAME>last.htm
<TEXT>

<!doctype html public "-//w3c//dtd html 4.0 transitional//en">
<HTML>
<head>
   <meta name="Generator" content="Microsoft Word 97">
   <meta name="GENERATOR" content="Mozilla/4.74 [en]C-CCK-MCD   (Win95; U) [Netscape]">
   <TITLE>		</TITLE>
</head>
<body>
<font size=-1>&lt;DOCUMENT></font>
<br><font size=-1>&lt;TYPE> EX-99</font>
<br><font size=-1>&lt;TEXT></font>
<br><font size=-1>&lt;HTML></font>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<div align=right>EXHIBIT 99</div>

<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<center>
<p>SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
<p>Washington, D.C.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>FORM 11-K
<p>ANNUAL REPORT
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>Pursuant to Section 15(d) of the
<p>Securities Exchange Act of 1934
<p>For the Fiscal Year Ended December 31, 2000
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>Employees' Stock Purchase Plan of UAL Corporation</u>
<p>(Full title of the Plan)
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>UAL Corporation</u>
<p>(Employer sponsoring the Plan, issuer of the
<p>participations in the Plan and issuer of
<p>the shares held pursuant to the Plan)
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>1200 Algonquin Road, Elk Grove Township, Illinois
<p>Mailing Address:
<p><u>UAL Corporation, P.O. Box 66919, Chicago, Illinois&nbsp; 60666</u>
<p>(Address of principal executive offices)</center>

<p><br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<p><b>REPORT OF INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS</b>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>To UAL Corporation:
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>We have audited the accompanying statements of financial position of
the Employees' Stock Purchase Plan of UAL Corporation (the "Plan") as of
December 31, 2000 and 1999 and the related statements of changes in participants'
equity for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2000.&nbsp;
These financial statements are the responsibility of the Plan's administrator.&nbsp;
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements
based on our audits.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>We conducted our audits in accordance with auditing standards generally
accepted in the United States.&nbsp; Those standards require that we plan
and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free of material misstatement.&nbsp; An audit
includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and
disclosures in the financial statements.&nbsp; An audit also includes assessing
the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by the Plan's
administrator, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.&nbsp;
We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly,
in all material respects, the financial position of the Plan as of December
31, 2000 and 1999 and the changes in its participants' equity for each
of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2000, in conformity
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>/s/&nbsp; Arthur Andersen LLP
<br>Arthur Andersen LLP
<br>&nbsp;
<p>Chicago, Illinois
<br>March 15, 2001
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>Signature</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
the sponsor and issuer of the participants of the Plan, UAL Corporation
has duly caused this Annual Report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned
thereunto duly authorized.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<u>UAL Corporation Administrator</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p>Dated March 15, 2001&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
By&nbsp; <u>/s/&nbsp; Douglas A. Hacker</u>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Douglas A. Hacker
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Executive Vice President and
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Chief Financial Officer
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<center>
<p><u>EMPLOYEES' STOCK PURCHASE PLAN</u>
<p><u>OF UAL CORPORATION</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION</u>
<p>(In thousands, except number of shares)</center>

<p><br>

<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>EMPLOYEES' STOCK PURCHASE PLAN</u>
<p><u>OF UAL CORPORATION</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</u></center>

<p><br>
<br>
<p><u>(1)&nbsp; The Plan</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Employees' Stock
Purchase Plan of UAL Corporation (the "Plan") is sponsored by UAL Corporation
("UAL").&nbsp; UAL offers participation in the Plan to eligible employees
of UAL and its subsidiaries.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(2)&nbsp; Purchase and Distribution of Stock</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Purchases are made
by the Plan monthly, and the shares purchased are credited to the accounts
of each participant on the basis of the ratio of the participant's contribution
to total participants' contributions for the month.&nbsp; The cost of common
stock purchased for the Plan includes all brokerage charges involved in
the purchase.
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; When shares of stock
are distributed to the individual participants pursuant to the terms of
the Plan, the market value of such shares is removed from the investment
account of the Plan.
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Terminating participants
receive a certificate for the full number of shares, plus cash for the
fractional shares, held for their accounts.&nbsp; Partially withdrawing
participants receive certificates for the full number of shares withdrawn.&nbsp;
There are no forfeiture provisions under the Plan with respect to participants'
contributions.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(3)&nbsp; Investment in Common Stock of UAL</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The investment in common
stock of UAL is valued at year-end published market prices as reported
by the New York Stock Exchange.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(4)&nbsp; Realized Gain on Stock Distributed to Participants</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Gains on stock distributed
to participants are realized to the extent of the difference between the
weighted average cost of shares distributed and the market value at the
date of distribution.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(5)&nbsp; Unrealized Appreciation (Depreciation) in Value of Investment</u>
<br>&nbsp;
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The unrealized appreciation
(depreciation) in the value of investment is the change from the prior
year-end to the current year-end in the difference between the market value
and the cost of the investment.&nbsp; The following is a summary of unrealized
appreciation (depreciation):
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<table BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=7 WIDTH="638" >

<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(6)&nbsp; Administrative Expenses of the Plan</u>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All administrative
expenses of the Plan are paid by UAL.
<br>&nbsp;
<br>&nbsp;
<p><u>(7)&nbsp; Federal Income Tax</u>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Under existing federal
income tax laws, the Plan is not subject to federal income tax.&nbsp; Any
dividend income is taxable to the participants upon distribution and receipt.&nbsp;
When any shares of stock or rights acquired under the Plan are sold by
or for a participant, any gain or loss must be recognized by that participant.
<br>&nbsp;
